description:
Miette is one of my favorite bakeries and shops in the country but getting to their flagship location in Hayes Valley can be challenging when I'm only in SF for a few days for work each year with very little downtime. However, this Ferry Building outpost is convenient to the Yelp office and our hotel which makes it an easy stop to stock up on candies and baked goods, even if I only have a sliver of time. They're a small location so they don't quite have the same imported candy stock as Hayes Valley but if you want their house-made treats and sweets, it's the perfect place to pop in for a bit. 

Must tries: the chocolate sea-salt caramels, the lavender shortbread (my husband's favorite), the cupcakes (any will do, they're all great!), and the chocolate wafer cookies (my absolutely favorite. I make them often at home since the recipe is in their cookbook but nothing beats the ones they make themselves). 

There's also plenty in the Ferry Building to peruse so come here for a meal and enjoy some dessert or take home treats from Miette!
author: Annette J.

description:
A must stop for a sweet tooth. Divine shortbread and gingersnap cookies. How they get that perfect balance of flavors and crisp in their gingersnaps is beyond my baking knowledge. A delicious treat for ginger lovers. 

Picked up several adorable types of creative gummies and sour gummies for gifts. 

Didn't try their cupcakes or macarons, but can only guess they are also worth a splurge. 

Not inexpensive, but great for thoughtful yummy treat for a special friend or family member. 

My stepdaughter said the chocolate shortbread gift was  the best cookie she has ever had.
author: Lisa D.

description:
A true dessert highlight within the Ferry Building.  French style pastries, decadent cakes and tons of cute little candies.  Perfect for that afternoon sweet tooth.

Eclair: Firm and chewy choux pastry shell.  Rich vanilla custard inside.  Just the right ratio so there's enough but not so much it squirts everywhere.  And a bitter chocolate glaze to contrast the choux and the custard.

Scharffen Berger Mini-Cake: It's basically like eating a mound of chocolate ganache that happens to have a little cake underneath.  Like 3x richer than normal chocolate frosting.  The chocolate cake underneath is not bad either.  Kinda of the devils food variety.  Super indulgent.

Chocolate Cupcake w/ Italian Meringue: The meringue frosting looks mesmerizing.  Like it's some sort of huge marshmallow, but with a less sticky mouthfeel.  A generous heap to pair with the normal sized chocolate cupcake underneath.  Feels so much more decadent than the common buttercream frosting alternative.

Walnut Brownie: Just as brownie should be.  Crispy edges on all sides.  Chewy and gooey on the inside.  A very thin flaky top layer.  And just enough walnuts to add texture but not overwhelm; the small chop was perfect.

Pot De Crème: Like pudding but thicker and $5 for 3 small spoonfuls.  All the other desserts I tried seemed more satisfying.  I mean, it was good, just such a small portion.  Wonder if you're paying a premium for the cute little glass jar you can take home...
author: Adam B.

description:
First-time visit, very aesthetically pleasing.

Pricey but everything is well packaged & pretty. My friend bought the cake (pic below) covered with pink buttercream (and a buttercream rose), and it was delicious. However, still thinks it's a bit overpriced for the size and taste.
author: Jess W.

description: Holy cow this may have been the best slice of cheesecake I've ever had. They only offered the classic flavor, but they made it perfectly Not too sweet, not too dense. There's a graham crust layer on the top AND bottom, which frankly should be the new standard. One slice was $6.50 but more than enough to share between 2, maybe 3 people. Definitely will come back to try some of their other stuff!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Pros: I've bought multiple cakes from here before and they've always been a big hit. My favorite is the Tomboy cake. The cream on the cake is AMAZING! Not too sweet, smooth and creamy The cake texture is moist and i love the simple cake design.

Cons: Can be a bit pricey but you're getting a top notch desserts.

Ordered: Vanilla Tomboy Cake ($35), earl gray ice cream sandwich is the best (the banana one was a miss for me)

Would I recommend: Yes! They have multiple locations throughout the Bay Area. I've been to the Jack London location and both are so designed so pretty. Grab a cupcake or an ice cream sandwich to munch on as you stroll through the Ferry Building.
author: Terry N.

description:
Cute bakery located inside the Ferry Building Marketplace.

They offer all sorts of delicious goodies here. Cakes, cupcakes, chocolates, cookies, macarons, caramels, brittle, marshmallows, meringues, Turkish delight, licorice, gummies, etc. If you have a sweet tooth, this is where it's at. 

We tried some of their macarons, chocolates, and gummies. They were made with quality ingredients and had a nice consistency. The macarons weren't overly sweet, had a lightly crisp outer shell and was soft within. The filling was flavorful. Their chocolates were smooth and not overly sweet. B loved the sweet and sour gummies. 

If you're in the area, it's a nice shop to visit.
author: Kimberly J.

description: I thought the ice cream looked good, but it just ends there.... the cookie is too hard, the ice cream isnt smooth... it felt like hard cookie with icing...
author: Jason C.

description:
Great macaroons! Reasonably priced and filling to macaroon ratio was on point. LOL

Great service too!
author: Inna A.

description:
Most folks associate Miette with their delicate macarons. But I'm head over heels in lust with their fluffy housemade vanilla bean marshmallows. 

My kids love Miette's adorable seasonal treats. The marzipan gingerbread boys and girls are imported from Germany and make perfect stocking stuffers... If you can hold off that long! LOL
author: Geminyna J.

description:
Had a macaron here, it was one of the Rose-Geranium flavor ones and it was quite good. The macaron itself was delicate on the outside but contained a rich and amazing core, that had just the right notes of rose, without it being too overbearing or sweet.

The whole place is quite nice with a range of baked goods. Will have to come back some time to try more stuff!
author: Tyler T.

description:
Note: this review is just for their macarons

I'm a sucker for macaron, and Miette does them quite well! I love that the shells aren't super smooth and you can see some of the ground almond skin. I've been there several times now, and a box of assorted macrons are my goto hostess gift.
The flavors are also spot on. My favorites: strawberry and rose-germanium. The strawberry is tasted oh-so-fresh and incredibly flavorful. Floral flavors are a hit or miss for me, and this one was a hit. It's very delicate. On the other hand, my friends have complained it felt artificial. However, I'm not so keen on the dulce de leche flavor. It was far too sweet for me.
All in all, a very solid macaron place. Is it my favorite ever? No. Will I indulge in one every time I visit the Ferry building? Oh yes.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
Their gummy bears and chocolate covered gummy bears are a tasty treat!

Their mini bears have better fruity flavor and are less  sweet than Haribo.  They have a satisfying chewy texture without overworking your jaws. 

The chocolate covered mini bears were well coated with chocolate and not overly sweet. 

All in all a pretty satisfying experience.
author: Cindy G.

description: Must get the gingerbread cupcake! It is moist (sorry moist word haters), not too sweet, and balanced with the amazing cream cheese frosting. Just delicious! The macaroons we ordered were good, just a little on the dense side (which is why I have a 4). The pistachio clearly uses fresh ingredients, but could have packed a bigger nutty flavor as well. Overall, get the gingerbread cupcake!
author: Jennifer A.

description: All of their treats are delicious, but I don't care for their cakes: the buttercream in the Tomboy is as fresh as it gets, but the actual cake is pretty hard and stiff. I like my cakes moist. And as other reviewers have said, their cakes are extremely overpriced for the size and taste. Unless you enjoy serving miniature slices to people, of course. For cake taste and more bang for your buck, go elsewhere. Everything else they sell is solid, though.
author: Maurice R.

description: Miette at the Ferry Building is a super cute pop-up station decorated like a French patisserie. I personally like this location because it's easy for me to grab desserts for company birthdays/events! The cupcakes & cakes, in general, are very rich and worth it. I enjoy the old-fashioned cupcakes (the frosting tastes like marshmallow fluff) They can be taken to any event since they are decorated very elegantly!
author: Angella G.

description:
Overall rating: C

Belated review! I really wanted to like this place. It looks super cute. I love supporting local businesses. However, most of their candies and treats are imported from abroad. Not really the place to go if you're looking for authentic San Francisco souvenirs like I was. At least they tell you the origins of most of their stuff on their labels. I think the fresh baked treats are made there but I was looking for something that would be packable in my luggage. I just got 2 sea salt caramels, which I think are made by them as gifts.
author: D D.

description:
It's so pink and cute! Exactly what you'd expect from a little SF inspired French bakery. I'd never walked down the length of the ferry building before. Lots of sweet treats on the left side! Humphrey Slocombe's ice cream (with its line) plus a soft serve place right next door.

I opted for an 8 piece box of macarons. No artificial colorings whatsoever, not even a tint of green for pistachio. All natural ingredients. How does one differentiate between flavors? 8 flavors available on the daily. I took photos of the glass jars and the employee put them into the box in that order. So far I've tried hazelnut, strawberry, and vanilla. The former was just right. Soft, coarsely ground nutty shell for texture, and a simple smattering of thickened hazelnut cream. I didn't realize a majority of the macarons would be filled with buttercream, as was the case with the latter treats. Picking up the strawberry Macaron from the box caused the two shells to slide a bit. No pink tinge there. The vanilla was chewier than the other two! Pleasantly surprised.

Flavors available on 6/24/17:

Chocolate
Vanilla
Hazelnut
Strawberry
Rose-geranium
Chocolate Lavender
Dulce de Leche
Pistachio

Found palm sized bags of strawberry Turkish delight to take home. I'll try one soon! Various candies, cupcakes, cakes, shortbread cookies for sale.
author: Kristine F.

description: The macarons were soft and not too sweet. The hazelnut cream inside was too thick for my liking. My favorite was the rose one. I also got their walnut and lavender cookies and they were lovely. The meringues were also not too sweet. I would definitely come back for the macarons.
author: Sarah C.

description: Awesome macarons! They were $2 per I believe and we're very tasty. Outside was perfectly crisp, and the inside was nice and soft. Strongly recommend, however, because it is located in the ferry building, it is super crowded. Five out of five! :)
author: Caitlin H.

description:
When I want cake for dinner, I eats cake for dinner.  

My friend discovered the Strawberry cake and immediately fell in love. I like strawberry cakes too but my favorite would have to be chocolate.  The Scharffen Berger is all cake and mousse and I'm all about a balanced ratio of the two but I prefer more cake.  When I cut through this baby, it was mostly cake! =)  It's very light and not as rich but it was still enjoyable.
author: Linda N.

description:
Pretty pricey but delicious everything.  I haven't tried anything at Miette that I didn't like.  However, if you're buying macaroons, make sure you eat them right away. If you keep them in the box more than one day, they get hard and stale fairly fast.  Other than that, their cake slices are really yummy.  

My husband and I wanted them to make our wedding cake back in 2012, but they didn't do those types of orders at the time.  I think they make wedding cakes now, so if you can afford it, I highly recommend the Scharffen Berger; it is absolutely delicious.  

Bonus - since they're located in the Ferry building, this is a great place to grab dessert to-go and then walk around and check out the other shops.
author: Belle A.

description:
For the love of candy!!! They have so many different types of candies to pick from, and they are the perfect size for a little gift. They have a lot of different types of gummies which I like and noticed they are harder to find at a lot of places. I tried the Halloween scary face berry flavored gummies and they were perfect! They also have Turkish delight which is so hard to find most especially where I live so I was happy to try it. I found it to be a little too sweet for my liking, but was very happy the lady working let me try a piece before buying a bag then not liking it.  
Another item I really loved was the lemon shortbread cookies. They are so good and have a lovely crunch and just melt in your mouth. I wish I would have bought more of these to bring home, and give them as little gifts as well.
I really enjoyed this patisserie and will shop here again when I'm back in San Francisco. I love that they let you try an item before you buy it just to be sure you will like it. I can't wait to come back.
author: Kate D.

description: Great place ! Worth the price . Got the carrot cupcake, and the other two chocolate options
author: Waheto W.

description: My daughter grabbed a couple macarons from here which she loved and I got a bag of non pareils.  This is a very nice little pastry and candy shop.  Stop in if you visit the Ferry Building.
author: Zen D.

description: On a whim, I ordered a chocolate cupcake with Italian Meringue. From a strictly aesthetic standpoint, their cupcakes are impressive. In terms of texture and flavor, I didn't care for the cupcake much. The cake itself was unpleasantly spongy and the meringue was reminiscent of the iconic, overly sweet white filling of a Hostess chocolate cupcake.
author: Merica S.

description: Delicious ice cream sandwiches ($5), but the cookies are too crisp. They should make them softer, so eating the ice cream sandwiches is more enjoyable. This visit, they had Creme Fraiche, Chocolate and Banana. We tried the first two.
author: Cece Y.

description:
This cute little store front full of sweet delights is always a stop when I visit the Ferry Building. They always have a great choice of Macarons and cakes. My very favorite dessert that they make is the Buttermilk-Vanilla Bean Pana cotta topped with fresh strawberries. It is the absolute BEST dessert I have had. It isn't very sweet which I love. It also doesn't have a yogurt tang that you would expect from a buttermilk. It's perfectly textured, you can see and taste the vanilla beans and the fresh strawberries are the perfect compliment. 

Today I chose the Panna cotta and three slices of cake. One slice was a strawberry mousse cake and it tasted like the memory of what the strawberry in a neopolitan ice cream tasted like. The texture was light and fluffy, the cake was perfect and buttery, everything about it was lovely. The second slice was coconut, it had a few additional layers of coconut pastry cream and it was surprisingly subtle and luscious. The third slice that I had was their plain cheesecake and that was truly yummy. Graham cracker buttery crust and a generous layer of cream cheese filling with light layer of whipped cream on top. 

Such a treat to eat these treats!
author: Kelly T.

description: I love the ferry building because there are so many options for sweet and savory. I ordered a hazelnut macaron, pistachio macaron, and raspberry Turkish delight candy. The macarons were large! They were chewier than most macarons and seemed a little doughy. They didn't crack when you bite into one. Only $2 each though.
author: Jenni K.

description:
I stumbled upon this place after Yelping where to get macarons as a gift. I opted to go to the Ferry Location vs the Hayes Valley one since it was closer to where I work. I did hear that the Hayes location does Happy Hour where macarons are on sale for $1 a piece (def need to check that out later). 

Being in SF and all I expected the prices to be more expensive, but $2/each is higher than I thought it would be. I ended up getting a box of 8 (no discounts for boxes). 

The macarons are placed in cute glass jars so you can see the assortment. I thought it as weird that they all looked the same/didn't have food coloring because it made it hard for me to differentiate the flavors once they were in the box. 

I would def recommend the pistachio & rose flavors! The other ones were alright, but didn't really stand out to me. The consistency was just right for a macaron but the inside is def more whipped than what I'm used to. You can also taste the crushed almonds they use for the batter in each bite as well. 

They have tons of other sweets at the shop too that looked great to try. Be warned that things are usually min of $7 for a bag before you go crazy!
author: Keizzel C.

description:
It's a cute little candy/bakery shop in the Ferry Building, and the only one of its kind, so it's definitely popular. The baked goods in their cases are picture-perfect and probably all rich and decadent, so if you're on a diet, I don't suggest looking into them.

They have an aptly-named tip jar labeled "dentist fund," which you'll probably need to take from after indulging in some of the things they have here. I grabbed a gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting and it was 1. the cutest thing I've seen in my life and 2. damn delicious. The cake had a nice crumb and was really moist, and the frosting had a really strong cream cheese flavor to it, which is hard to find in most store-bought cream cheese frostings. I could probably eat a bucket of their frosting in and of itself. 

I didn't get the chance to taste any of their other sweets, but the pretty cellophane bags of Turkish delight (come on, who didn't read Chronicles of Narnia?) and their macarons were tempting. They really know how to market them! Their staff seemed ready to rush people through the line at the bakery counter, which was kind of annoying, but I suppose understandable because that line grew fast.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Miette was a real delight to stumble upon inside the infamous Ferry Building. Cute little patisserie with a beautiful selection of cakes, chocolates, fleur de sel caramels, gummy bears, beverages and drum roll please....

MACARONS!

There are 8 extraordinary flavors ranging from Rose to Lemon but what really caught my attention was the lack of color that I'm use to when macaroon binging. We see Pistachio and expect green right? Nope, not these all organic delicacies. When the young lady explained the lack of color I was sold. This was more than a pretty bakery, they are conscious of their product and opt for a more natural way of producing goodies we just can't seem to deny ourselves.

Well, I ordered one of each and they pack perfect flavor, moist texture and sweet creamy filling. I also enjoyed a chocolate fleur de sel caramel and bought a tiny bag of gummy bears for my friend. Customer service was A1, all super knowledgeable, personable and pleasing. The display case & decor of the small space was done right;  delicate & inviting.

~Christy
author: Christy A.

description:
Their chocolate hazelnut macarons are life-changing. 

My daughter and I are both in agreement that these are the best macarons either of us have ever tried. Her favorite flavor is plain chocolate. 

Both the inside and outside components of the macaron are always super fresh. The texture of the cookie is perfectly light, fluffy, and crunchy, all at once. They're also a bit larger than most.  

Definitely worth the $2 each.
author: Jennifer S.

description: This raspberry macaroon was by far my fav fav favorite. I actually ordered one raspberry and one chocolate macaroon to walk around and eat. But then after I had the raspberry macaroon, I turned right back around to the store and had to get another one. The price was reasonable and the macaroon was very fresh. It was one of the best tasting macaroons I've had in my life!!!!! It's has a perfect flavor and taste without being overly sweet or tasting like it was full of fake powdered from the box flavors.
author: Ciara N.

description:
Got stuck at the office this past week so our two awesome secretaries have been trying to cheer us up by bringing by goodies. One day this past week, we got macarons!

A box of them sat, pristine and uncrumbled on the counter. I had had them in the past, but didn't recall them being mindblowing. Sadly, my memory was correct. The first one I had was a dark brown color (chocolate?). The cookie itself was crumbly and crunchy; not chewy. It was a bit too sweet for me but probably regular acceptable for others. The texture was slightly gritty so you know it was made with almond flour. The vanilla(?) one was similar in texture-- definitely not fresh and the day of.

It's a cute little shop in the ferry building-- hopefully I'll stop by for something more exciting next time.
author: Nicole H.

description: A few years ago I would have passed on a macaron if offered one, having too many so-so ones. Thanks to Miette I am now a macaron convert! Miette's take on the French meringue confection is a little chewier, has a lighter crunch, and is true to flavor. Definitely prefer Miette's interpretation over Chantal Guillon or Laduree. The chocolate macaron tastes just like a brownie and the pistachio is my favorite so far with its subtle flavoring. They also have great cookies and brownies. It is pricey, but the quality of the products is worth it. There are lots of items I've yet to try, but I will be back for more!
author: Edwina D.

description: Small candy shop located inside the Ferry Building. Off the bat you'll notice that the candy is ridiculously overpriced. For gummy candy and anything else you can find at the convenience store it's $5 for a small bag. I normally wouldn't buy candy for that price but I saw that they had Turkish Delight. I love Turkish Delight but I never see it sold anywhere so I gave in and bought a bag to share with my friend. It was good but for $5 they should give more than 7 tiny cubes.
author: Ramona G.

description: Miette is an extremely cute shop in the Ferry building, with a great macaroon display all the time! The macaroons are stored in glass jars, which leads to some of them cracking before they can be eaten, but for only $2 a macaroon they make a great snack! The Hazelnut flavor is very rich and gooey on the inside, Rose Geranium manages to walk the thin line of being a great flavor and not having the rose overpower everything! The Dulce de Leche and Raspberry are good too!
author: Kulmeher D.

description: The raspberry macaron and chocolate Sharfenberger cake were of very high quality. The cakes are not only cute, but the friendly person who helped me SMILED and asked if I would like a box for the cake. YES!
author: Monica S.

description: O my goodness I have never had such amazing macaroons  I had 4. My favorite was the vanilla one. The others were not bad just not my favs. They package their stuff so nicely. They don't charge for bags either. Their prices are reasonable considering they are in San Francisco with a nice location. I will be back   Wish they would make a pumpkin macaroon, those are my favorite.
author: Jessica M.

description: Cute desserts but they're really overpriced (even with expectations of being overpriced for the area. I got a yellow cupcake with strawberry butter cream frosting for $3.75 and I thought it was eh. I have regrets! Maybe I should've tried the panna cotta. The bakery desserts might be worth a try, but the prices on the small bags of candy are ridiculous!
author: Alaina P.

description: Can I just say that this place is the absolute most cutest stall in the who Ferry Marketplace Building!!!! I almost felt like I was in Europe!! Sooo adorable!!!! Those macaroons though!!!! Oh my gosh!!! So delicious and a different take on macaroons than I'm used too. They were more "hearty" and natural. Who needs those food coloring anyway? Especially when the taste is a gazillion times better!!!!!!! Unfortunately, I had to run and catch the Ferry so I was unable to look around. I had a mission (get those macaroons) and go. I wish I had an opportunity to look around. But I definitely will next trip!!!!
author: Maile H.

description:
Got a chocolate flan tart on a whim while walking around the ferry building after dinner. Flaky but crunchy crust with a creamy dark chocolate filling, and I appreciated the salt sprinkle on top. Comes a close second to my favorite chocolate flan mini pies (from Peasant Pies). $6 is a bit expensive in my opinion, but it satisfied my chocolate/dessert craving for sure. 

Just a thought, they should get smaller boxes or a paper sleeve option because the box they put the tart in was a standard to-go box size like at a restaurant, and easily could've fit three or four of these in there - and I was planning on eating it immediately, and it felt very wasteful to just throw (recycle) away.
author: Laura C.

description: I've been going to Miette a lot recently.  This is mainly because after I have my lunch during my break I have the mood to have something sweet but small enough for a few bites.  And that's where Miette's macarons come in handy.  There aren't too many spots around my work that have good macarons, so this is has become my go-to place.  My favorites are their Rose Geranium, Chocolate Lavender, Hazelnut, and Pistachio.  All are $2 each which for me is good enough for a quick sweet snack.
author: Rodney H.

description: You can tell all their stuff is made from scratch.  You won't get any boxed cake flour here or icing.  They had this one item called Buttermilk Panna Cotta, (no pic), which was great and a cupcake which was also good.
author: David S.

description:
I feel like four stars is spot on. During my third day of moseying through the Ferry Building Marketplace, I popped in to Miette Patisserie to purchase some "artisanal-style" gummies for my partner-in-crime. 

The shop is quaint and charming with light and airy colors and pretty displays and packaging. I honestly think my experience would have been closer to a 5 had the staff been a little friendlier and enthusiastic about the product. I was informed the gummies were good but it didn't seem that they were mind-blowingly delicious to match the price point. Next time I'll give the toffee bark a whirl. Apparently, I should also try the cheesecake next time.
author: Brittany S.

description:
GET THE LAVENDER SHORTBREAD COOKIES. You will not regret it! I've tried their other cookies, and of course they've been buttery and delicious and very subtly sweet (in a good way), but the hands down best is the Lavender Shortbread! 

The Lavender Shortbread Cookies are light and buttery, with the lavender flavor hitting you in waves of crunchiness. Unlike other shortbread cookies, it's not too sweet and not too buttery - making it easy to keep munching until you realize you're covered in crumbs and are now holding an empty bag of cookies... 

Needless to say, I love these cookies and I have to get them every time I'm at the Ferry Building. They're $7 for a bag... but can you really put a price on happiness? 

Pro tip: They also offer samples of some of their cookies - just ask the staff behind the counter! You don't really get a choice in the flavors because they offer you what has already been opened, but it's delicious and free nonetheless, so definitely take advantage of it!!
author: Joyce W.

description:
Macarons - got an assortment of each flavor but have to say they all tasted the same and for the most part, they all looked the same too

Bland cookie & subtly flavored center - would totally skip these in the future..... my best advice is to stick w/ the cupcakes!  They still rock!

I chose my go-to Gingerbread & the Mr got Strawberry.  He loved the intense berry flavor & my gingerbread was the expected intensely flavored molasses & ginger.  Perfection!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Miette has a pretty good selection of sweets for a small shop. The pastel green and pink shelves hold an array of shortbread, meringues, macarons, and other confections. They even sell pastel cake stands. There's also a small fridge that holds ice cream sandwiches.

I was attracted to the simplicity of their cakes, with just layers of cake and creamy frosting, with minimal frou-frou decorations. The packaging, on the other hand, is very flowery and cutesy.

Most cakes are about $30 - $40 for around 6-7 inches. I've never had cake here, but I have tried the Old-Fashioned in cupcake form. Cupcakes are $3.25 each, which is on par with the cost of most cupcakes, but theirs seem a little on the small side. 

The Old-Fashioned is chocolate cake with marshmallowy icing. The chocolate cake is rich and moist. I didn't really like this particular icing and I think icing is what makes the cupcake. The main feature is actually the single peanut on top, covered in red candy coating. It reminds me of one of my favorite candies, peanut M&M's. 

Above the cake display are several glass jars, filled with macarons. Each is around $2.50 and a box of 6 is $14. These macarons are quite good for a place that doesn't mainly specialize in macarons. They're actually pretty light and delicate. I quite like the hazelnut flavor. The exterior crumbles easily upon biting into them, but the interior is somewhat chewy.

It doesn't look like they sell macarOONs, which are more like coconut covered biscuits. 

I'll have to return to Miette the next time I'm in the Ferry Building with a sweet tooth, and check out what else they offer.
author: Joy W.

description:
Ever since my first trip to the Ferry Building, I have adored Miette. Not only is it the cutest stall in the whole building, but it has something for everyone - macaron, candies, shortbread, tarts, cupcakes, etc. I have yet have an unsatisfactory visit to Miette. 

Miette takes an American approach to French patisserie, and the results are delicious. I come for the macarons - they are SPECTACULAR. The creme in the middle is almost a buttercream, and it's never too sweet. The shells are crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside. And, at $2 each, they're an excellent accoutrement to the lunch hour. 

When at the Ferry Building, to Miette you must go.
author: Annie S.

description:
This review is just for the cupcakes. Went to Miette and ordered four cupcakes ($13): the Italian meringue, gingerbread, vanilla with raspberry frosting, and chocolate with chocolate frosting. These cupcakes looked pretty, but tasted very dry! The gingerbread one was the best tasting because it was the least dry. The rest were just okay. I would say the italian meringue was the second best of the bunch. The vanilla and chocolate ones were nothing special. 

They were also difficult to transport and had gotten a bit smushed when I opened the box. The box was meant for six cupcakes. 

I was disappointed by the selection of flavors. There were about six flavors and three of them were chocolate bases with different frosting. Not much variety.
author: Christina G.

description: Was perusing the cute pastry shop and saw a sign that caught my eye, "100 Things to Try Before You Die." This little sign was with their gingersnap cookies.  Before buying a box, the nice lady working offered me a sample.  It was so delicious, like no other gingersnap you will ever have.  It's the next day and I'm almost done with the box.  My biggest regret is that I didn't buy more. I also tried a dulce de leche macaron.  It was absolutely delicious.  Now I can't wait to go back and try more things!
author: Jo-Ann L.

description: Absolutely delicious cakes! I got a birthday cake here that was really pretty and delicious.  It was a rich chocolate cake with a pillow of marshmallow frosting on top and it was perfection.
author: Salini N.

description: Pretty delicious cupcakes, but some don't really hold up in the weather really well. The old-fashioned cupcakes (black with white) all ended up melted while walking over to my friend's place 10 minutes away.
author: Steven W.

description: Macaroons from here are delicious and a nice treat to bring into the office or to gift to a friend.
author: Rod M.

description:
This is located in a prime real estate location in SF, where there are a lot of options of grabbing a snack.  We decided to give this location a shot as the line was a bit shorter and we were in a bit of hurry. 

The food itself is simply OK, but it's a bit overpriced for what you get. Let me repeat myself. Overpriced, overpriced, and overpriced. I ordered a mini chocolate cake thing for $6.50 and it was a bit on the bland side. Small and bland. Meh. I could go to Safeway and get an amazing quality cake for that price. 

Still, the shop is cute and friendly, so I'll give them that. Overall, it's pretty good, but nothing special.
author: Benny H.

description:
Seven dollars for a bag of cookies? Really?

No wonder they don't price anything.

Picked up a bag of chocolate chip cookies come expecting them to be around $3 or $4.50. Surprise!

Seven dollars for 10 cookies about the size of a half-dollar?

That's the Ferry Building for you!

Were they good? Yeah, they were okay. Would I have them again? Eh, probably not.

That's the price of two Blue Bottles.
author: Kristin Leigh M.

description:
Sweets! Ok time to refill my kitchen which already contains lots of candies and pastries. The pink decoration of Miette further added towards my appetite. 

Quickly grabbed a small bag of butter cookies (coming only at 7 dollars, good deal!) and almost grabbed the green chewy fruit bag lol. They also have tasty chocolates/toffees on sale. I wish I could buy the whole store!
author: Elaine H.

description: As always, satisfied 100%! Love all the macaroon flavors! Expensive but worth the price!
author: Tae N.

description:
Just made a last minute order with them and they accepted!!! I've had their cakes before but have been more timely with my request, and was happy they were able to help me out.

Delicious cake in a fabulous location by the bay. Love that it is so close to my office so I can stop by and enjoy sweets in the evenings with some friends.

Old Fashion is by far my favorite cake they have!

Muah much love~
author: Jesus B.

description:
Miette is one of my must hit spots when I come to the Ferry Building. The pastries they make are amazing. 

I usually buy the rose meringues but this time I went outside of the box. The cheesecake slice is amazing. It is creamy and sweet with a hit of tartness that is great from a traditional cheesecake. 

I also got one slice of the chocolate layer cake, Boy did I regret only getting one of the slices. The chocolate cake has a delicate crumb and great chocolate flavor. But the best part is the filling used between the layers. It is a tradition buttercream with a light a fully texture.  It melts in your mouth. You would not think it is buttercream.  I now know why my sister does not share when she gets it.  

I wish they would put a location at the Oakland Airport. I would love to get some items before I had back to reality the next time.  This a must go to spot.
author: Joanne S.

description: The gingerbread cupcake is top of the line.  Delicious sponge, delicious frosting.  The ratio of cake to frosting is better in the cupcake than the gingerbread cake.  If you like gingerbread you can't go wrong.  Miette's is always fresh with impeccable ingredients.
author: Portia S.

description:
I love you! 

Chocolate eclairs~DIVINE! We are eclair junkies....these eclairs can't be missed!

Macaroon...no one in our group really cares for macaroons...until, we had these macaroons! Rose & pistachio are a must and will create a macaroon admirer outta anyone! 

Cheesecake...this is the reason I stopped by here & I have no words to describe. One of the best cheesecakes I've ever had! Smooth-silky-sweet-tart!!!!! Must! 

Hazelnut torte (or something like that)....I love hazelnuts-I liked this torte, but I wouldn't get it again.

The hazelnut dragees-if you like hazelnuts, these are a must!  They are a bit sweet with a light dusting of cocoa...delight! 

The ginger cupcake is I'm sure deliciousness to those who love ginger cupcakes-to me it was whatever-although the frosting was delicious!

Pot de crème- this is like eating silk! The crème on top is different-you can tell they use fine quality products!

This place opens during the week so skip the weekend and enjoy-I'm sure you can't go wrong in this place!
author: Rula S.

description:
REVIEWER # 1489

What a cute little store!! The headquarters of all the Miette and I have to say I am a BIG FAN!

I didn't know cupcakes and macaroons could taste so moist and delicious until I found this hidden gem in San Francisco! Miette Patisserie is well known for their macaroon and tasty cupcakes. The macaroon selection is off the charts and soft and delish!

They also have a large variety of cupcakes and regular cakes as well! BIRTHDAY PARTIES ANYONE?? Well this is the place! They also have small bags of candy that can be given as gifts or prizes for a work event. The options of those little bags range from: gummies, chocolates, licorice and marzipan.

All of the delicious items are packages so cute and presentable in the cutest branded bags. 
DID YOU KNOW: They even have a cookbook that has all the recipes and the photos entice you to want to own your own bakery and make all the delicious cakes./cupcakes!

I've tasted their chocolate cupcakes and fell in love!! Now...this is surprising because I am not a chocolate person at all! However, taking my first bite at the cupcake and tasting that delicious buttercream icing!! OMGGGG! Words can't even describe my first taste! 

HAPPY HOUR!! Yes, you guessed it! This place has a happy hour and during that time the prices on the macaroons and cupcakes are at a sweet deal! Macaroons are only a $1 and the cupcakes are 2 for $5! OMG, does it get any better??

Definitely a place to check out when in the San Francisco Hayes Valley area! Treat yourself to something sweet and delicious, especially during happy hour!

REVIEW 127/196
author: Porsche C.

description: vanilla macarons - that's all and so good. Would like to try the cakes and other items but I always default to the macarons.
author: Christine V.

description: Everytime I go to SF. I can't leave without buying a box of macarons. They are the only pastries I buy. The texture and the flavor is amazing. I like how there's definitely a great selection of desserts :) I won't stop returning!
author: Maribeth D.

description: I get macaroons from here and all flavors generally good. I got cake from here a couple of times....once it was delayed because of backed up orders n once I just bought available one from the shop. The cake was very dense and heavy as opposed to light. I am not a fan of the particular kind of cake but I am sure it might be popular with some.
author: Tejashree M.

description: This place needs to work on its service. Rude bartender took other orders before ours and served me a lukewarm drink. Take a cue from Danny Meyer and welcome your patrons.
author: Patricia J.

description:
This little patisserie is totally adorbs! My daughter and I swing by whenever we are in SF. It is conveniently located inside the Ferry building, so you can walk from the tram or the BART. As for the hours, well I wish they were open a bit longer but understandable considering the Ferry a Building does close early. Don't expect mall hours, it's not happening. So if you plan on visiting Miette do it before dinner.

We've tried the macarons, candy bars and a few of their cakes. My favorite has to be the coconut hot milk cake (coconut creme cake). The size is generous and has the right amounts of cake, creme and coconut. At other places, the same type of cake can have too much cake and can leave your mouth dry. This was perfect!

The macarons are nice too. My favorite is the ginger. I like the bite of the ginger along with the sweetness. Their candy bars are high quality too, the presentation in the cute wrapper is what urged me to buy it. A couple of the bars would make nice gifts too, I know I would like to be gifted with a few. ;)

Miette also has a cookbook, if you didn't know. My daughter was gifted a Miette cookbook for Christmas. Along with her Laduree cookbooks, it is one of her favorites that she uses a lot. You can make your own Miette creations at home!
author: Trixie N.

description:
We were at Ferry Building and saw this shop with the macarons in the display area.  There were items for sale inside as well as outside displaying a variety of cookies.  The sign for the gingersnaps caught my eye as it stated it was on the list of the Top 100 items to eat before you die.  I like gingersnaps and gingerbread cookies so I couldn't resist buying a round container that had about 10 cookies inside.  The cookies were shaped as a scallop and lightly dusted with sugar.

I didn't have any during my stay in San Fran but when I got home, I tried one.  They are delicious! The cookie is crispy and the ginger and spices add a little heat and lots of flavour.  For ginger fan, definitely a yummy treat! The cookies were $8.50 and they kept fresh for the 2 weeks from the time I bought them.  Good thing I don't live in San Fran as I would be back for these cookies.

We also bought a few macarons to enjoy while sitting outside the Ferry Building.  I'm not a big fan of them but the hazlenut was light and not too sweet and I liked it.  

Will be on the list to visit again!
author: Violet P.

description: I am in love with the chocolate caramels from this store. The regular sea salt caramels are good as well. While they are good sized, and oh so delicious, the caramels are a bit of a splurge at $1.25 a piece. In addition they sell what I think are the best french macaroons I've purchased to date. I believe they now have an additional but smaller location near the Larkspur Ferry terminal.
author: K L.

description:
I ordered a "Scharffen Berger" for a friends bday, which is described as "moist, dense chocolate cake, with a bright fruitful flavor at its finest level." The cake was no where close to its description! very dry and boring, she couldnt even finish the slice that she cut. I felt so embarrassed getting such a sad cake for her, a grocery store cake would have been better.

Staff could try to be a little friendly.
author: Crystal P.

description: Vanilla Buttercream Cupcake. It tasted stale, cream was too thick and  too hard. Maybe they were from a couple days before.
author: LJ E.

description: So the line for ice cream a couple shops away was crazy long.  Over at Miette's though - there was no line!  I don't know why - this place is dreamy!  With its cakes and cookies and pastel colors and decor.  I limited myself to two macarons (hazelnut and pistachio) but now I'm wishing I had added a few other items to my order.  Those macs were darn good!  Pick up a couple next time you're in the Ferry Building! :-)
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Oh how I missed my Miette!! For me it's an annual specialty since 2003. Especially from here it is one of my go-to places when I'm in town. Have to, have to, have to get this! 

What I like about this place is they don't have to please us with the prettiness of the food coloring for each flavor. It does well without it. The natural colors of the almond-based cookie part defines the macaroon along with its respectable and presentable shape and texture. As you take a small bite into the macaroon the softness and chewiness density sinks into your teeth and the center filling slightly oozes out but stays in tact. This completes the taste for an amazing sought after macaroon. This time around they had chocolate lavender, green tea, rose germanium, vanilla, strawberry, dulce de leche, hazelnut, and pistachio flavors.  

On this trip I bought a chocolate lavender and green tea for $1.85 a piece. That was not enough for me!! On the last day of my trip in the city I had to buy at least a small box full. For a small dark chocolate color box of 8 they offer to wrap it in packaging string and patched it with a Miette sticker.  The 8 macaroons were devoured within a 2 days stretch but definitely eat it on the day of so that the you'll enjoy the freshness. 

Miette also sells little cute cakes, cupcakes, cookies, and other sorts. They have 4 other locations in surrounding the areas and if you check out their website you can always order online. Hmm...should I?
author: Tzarina W.

description: The eclair was fantastic!  The dulce de leche macaron was fresh, tender, and crispy.  Did I mention their eclair is to die for?
author: T C.

description: The macaroons here at fantastic. A few of the flavors stand out more then the other.  The rose & coriander macaroons was the best of the bunch, but pumpkin pie was right behind it.
author: Dan L.

description: I will preface this by saying I've never been to France. Still, I've had quite a few macarons in my life. These have to be my favorite. Great texture and not too sweet! I only wish I could get them in Nashville. Maybe it's better if I don't though.
author: Michelle H.

description:
The customer service was kind of interesting ... asked a question and the girl turned to another employee and started answering my question towards her.

I ended up trying one of their pistachio macarons. For $2, it's a bargain! However, the macarons itself was nothing special.  It tasted more caky than fluffy, crispy, and chewy.
author: Carlin T.

description: My friends and I come here specifically for the Macarons! The flavors and variety are perfectly flavored. These little pastries are a must to pick up here at the Ferry building. I decided to get their cookies, Chocolate Wafer & Graham Cracker. They're flat and round, sweet & sugary... and my children loved them!  Will be back for more
author: Tracy D.

description:
I really like the look of Miette Patisserie - cute packaged goods filled with cookies, macarons, cupcakes, cakes, etc. The prices are also pretty generous for a small boutique located in the ferry building. I came to Miette with the intention to buy macarons and even though the lack of color in all of the different flavors was off-putting, I still bought 6 just to try. The girls behind the counter were pretty helpful, but seemed to be in a hurry to finish helping me. They packaged the macarons in a small Asian to-go box - each macaron was $1.75 I believe. 

So I believe that all of Miette's macarons contain the same flavored shell with the inside filling being different. The shell didn't have much taste at all, and the only flavor I liked was rose. Chocolate, hazelnut, pistachio, green tea were too sweet and didn't taste very good while the last flavor wasn't memorable at all. The filling for rose was great and captured that flowery essence without being too overpowering; however, the shell lacked flavor and was much too crumbly for me. 

I don't think I'd recommend this place for macarons unless you really like rose macarons. I probably won't come back.
author: Tiffany C.

description: this is my absolute favorite place to get macarons. every time i visit SF, i make sure to make at least one trip out to the ferry building so i can pick some up. the macarons are $2 each, which is a bit pricey for the size but so worth it! my favorite flavor is the pistachio, because the shells are pretty sugary but the pistachio balances out how sweet the overall macaron tastes. what makes these macarons so good is that they're cooked perfectly! the shells have a crispy outer shell, but the center is still really chewy and dense - perfect texture! would highly recommend stopping for their macarons, they're also a nice snack for walking along the pier.
author: Ellaina L.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of macarons but my friend who was in town wanted macarons because there wasn't many places that sold macarons back in Michigan.

We stopped by to get two flavors of each and for 16pcs. The total ended up around $33.30 which makes it $1.85 each plus tax. The only flavor I really liked was pistachio everything else was a-okay. We didn't have a lot of time to look at what else they had because we sorta kinda, illegally parked and ran in to grab a box of macarons.

I found out they had panna cotta and I love panna cotta so next time I'm in SF I'll stop by and try out their caramel panna cotta that fellow yelper Sammie raves about.
author: Sophia V.

description:
You know, I see all these reviews on their macarons and everyone has a completely different opinion--some say it's too sweet, some say it's too light, and some straight up say they don't like desserts PERIOD! I'll take the goldilocks stance and say it was juuuuuust right:

Rose Geranium: This was my favorite--many rave about this, and rightfully so. The geranium adds a slightly different floral flavor to the macaron that complements and works so well with the rose--I would've never guessed! A must try, if you just had to try one.

Pistachio: This was a fail for me, as I am accustomed to making my own macarons and I make my pistachio ones with pistachio flour/meal. These fell a bit short for me as the shell was still the usual almond (I can't complain as most macaron places do the same), but I don't think there was enough taste in the filling to fully enjoy the pistachio flavor. Perhaps roasting the pistachio may help, or making the feeling less heavy/creamy?

Caramel: This was my boyfriend's favorite. The caramel flavor is very "in your face" and a stark contrast from their lighter fillings. Heavy and bold, the caramel pretty much announces "IM HERE!" whether you like it or not. If you love caramel and rich flavors, this is the one for you.

Chocolate Mint: This tasted like a mint fudge brownie. I don't know what else to say; it was good, but not OMG MUST TRY.

Overall, the shell of the macarons are softer and more "cake"y than I am accustomed to, and it created a fudgy texture once eaten with the filling. This makes for a lovely chocolate macaron, as you're pretty much eating a fudge brownie, but could be strange for the flavors that need a bit more texture, like pistachio. The filling in general veers towards the creamier side, giving your mouth an aftertaste of rich cream/whole milk. I certainly didn't mind, but I can see how it might be off putting for those who want the lighter taste. Either way, the general consensus of both bf and I was that we liked these macarons and would be back to try more!
author: Monica L.

description:
Checked in 6/1/2016.

They had macarons in huge glass containers, which surprised me.  Since macarons are so delicate, usually I've seen them in other shops in smaller quantities.  Anyway, considering the number of people stopping by, I decided to order 5 different flavors of Macarons to-go.  They were decent sizes and cheaper than the other location in SFO where I had macarons earlier in the day.  I should have listened to my inner voice!  Except for one flavor, all of them were dry and definitely not fresh.  On second thought, all the people stopping by were ordering ice-cream and not macarons.  Well, I won't be stopping by again.
author: Anjali A.

description:
I've heard so much about Miette Patisserie from friends that I was worried I'd be over expecting how great the macarons were. I'm soo glad I tried them.

I bought four flavors of macaron - pistachio, rose, dulce de leche, and green tea. I loved that the texture is soft and chewy, that the macarons itself weren't overly sweet. I especially love the pistachio. The flavor was strong and delicious. Each macaron costs about $1.85. While these macarons aren't as colorful as many of the macarons out there, I feel that the flavor really stands out.

I also bought a caramel pot de creme. I loved that it came in a little glass container. It's sweet and creamy, the perfect serving size. I tried the chocolate pot de creme, and loved the rich thick chocolaty taste. Both pot de creme were amazing, and ran out before the end of the day. They each cost $5.

If you're in the Ferry Building, I highly recommend stopping by Miette for macarons and desserts. They're soo delicious and I can't wait to go back for more.
author: Andrea G.

description: The macaroons are incredible. And no artificial colors added. I bought 12 of all their flavors, it was fun to guess which one was which!
author: Esther D.

description:
An absolute great experience. My creativity on a scale of 1 to 10 is -5.. Max. 

I was looking for a creative gift to send my clients thanking them for their business. Jenoah heard my cries and came to the rescue. Not only was the order on time.. The presentation exceeded my expectations. 

I can't thank the team in the ferry building for being professional, on time, and reminding me some things are left for the professionals.
author: Samuel C.

description:
Of course the decor of this spot in the Ferry Building (and the practical overflow of cookies and candy spilling out into the walkway) was what drew me to taking a look around. Mint green and pale pink accented with marble really just make you want to shop for delicate sweets, no? 

I was in a little bit of a hurry to go back and pick up a dinner order I had placed at another vendor but since it seemed as though it was nearing closing time for quite a few of the businesses in the Marketplace, I figured I could sneak just a few storefronts over as I waited so as to see what I could see. I wasn't rushed in a sense that I was expecting to be helped at Miette right away, but in a way that I knew my food wouldn't be ready immediately yet I still wanted to get back to it in a timely manner. I had picked up a small tube of their Rose-Geranium meringues, but when I saw that both employees were helping other guests for extended periods of time, I had to put them down and walk away.

After I got my food and there was still about 15 minutes until the shops closed, I headed back, picked up the same tube of meringues and grabbed a few more goodies. I didn't really know what I wanted so because everything looked good I grabbed some sea salted caramels and raspberry flavored mini-hearts and I was on my way. The service I received wasn't overly quick or friendly, but at least I got to give them some money in exchange for sweet treats! Everything I grabbed was delicious and well worth the wait.
author: Emily S.

description:
Cute, pretty, sweet shoppe!!! ^_^

Of course, all the colors are just plain adorable and girlie. It was nice to actually wait in line for a change. The line did move quickly. I saw cakes, cupcakes, macarons, and much more cutesy sweets galore! 

I only bought Macarons, one in each flavor. 8 macarons all fitted into a small box & wrapped in a string bow. Each cost $1.85. I remembered tasting the unique flavor of the Rose-Geranium Macaron at home and liked it. Service was swift and friendly.
author: Andrea S.

description:
My actual birthday day: September 6, 2013.

I decided to create my own buffet-day by going around SF visiting a couple of places I've always wanted to go to. Miette was on that list as I love macarons. 

Box of macarons ($1.85 ea) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco#p_8EzDwXNslnQfT2hvG2Pg
*Pistachio
*Hazelnut
*Chocolate
*Chocolate lavender
*Vanilla
*Rose geranium
*Raspberry

I got one of each. Honestly, I didn't care for the macarons. I found them too sweet and grainy. They did have a nice toothsome chew though.

Box of tartlettes http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco#yjCLiRJYl1CTLDjDcMk-9Q
*Banana cream ($6.50)
*Lime meringue ($7)
*Raspberry ($7)

*Eclair ($5) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco#lFzUUp0XMNhS_I9CijereA

I adored their tartlettes and eclair though! The tartlettes were delicious! Creamy, great crust and not too sweet. And the eclair was light. The cream and chocolate with the eclair made for a great bite!

Miette really is a cute storefront. Look at their sweets table!
*Sweets table: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=wlBpiZWcGfaKKbBa6HfzZg#wlBpiZWcGfaKKbBa6HfzZg

Even though I was disappointed with their macarons, their tartlettes and eclair made Miette a wonderful bday stop!
author: Elena N.

description:
3.5 stars! 

After lunch in the Ferry Building, you need a treat, right?! Well I do... 

Miette Patisserie it was! Cute shop with lots of options - both fresh baked and bagged candy. Bright colors, clean & fresh. Employees were friendly, line moved quickly. 

I got a lemon tart and it was yummy. Thick crust that held up well, perfect lemon curd inside. It was tart and made me pucker, which is what a lemon tart should do. It was small, but $6, which seemed a little steep to me. 

I liked Miette Patissrie, but it wasn't anything phenomenal, especially at the price, and with so many other options in the Ferry Building.
author: Elise H.

description: Excellent Macaroons and totally worth the price. Chewy outside and very creamy inside.
author: Stacy H.

description:
Cute shop in the Ferry Building. My husband bought me a cookie sampler from here as a little surprise, and it was a little disappointing. I think they do more shortbread-style cookies here, which isn't really my thing; however, I'm never one to turn down sweets so I pushed through. The chocolate sable was probably my least favorite, as it had a slightly burned taste. The lemon shortbread was by far the best, with enough buttery flavor but not overpowering.

We made a couple of other purchases throughout our trip since the Ferry Building was so close to our hotel: a slice of the chocolate cake, a slice of cheesecake, carrot cupcake, and a gingerbread cupcake. If you're going to purchase here, getting a slice of something is clearly the way to go. Both the cheesecake and cake slices were great! Unfortunately, the carrot cupcake was incredibly dry. The gingerbread cupcake was a little more tender, but it didn't compare to the cake slice.
author: Cassandra B.
Pauline P.

description:
The design of this shop is really cute and it is located right across from blue bottle coffee. There are many different things to purchase here such as marshmallows, cookies, macarons, etc. There are also cards and mini cards here for you to purchase and use as a gift.

This review is only for the macarons as I have only ate the macarons. Coming from Toronto region, I've tried a lot of delicious macarons, though I still believe Laduree is the best.

Although the macarons didn't taste like they came out from the fridge and they were pretty cheap: $1.65 each, the taste and flavour was lacking a lot. First off, biting into the macaron shell, it didn't have the crisp texture of the macaron shell. The almond flour was extremely rough, so rough that I could feel the almond grind and flour. I have purchased eight macarons, 7 flavours: hazelnut, chocolate lavender, green tea, pistachio, vanilla, rose and dulce le leche. The shells of all the macarons were very similar in taste and were all similar in colour (glad to know that not much food colouring is added), but disappointing to know that they all tasted so similar. 

I would say for macarons, 70% of the "mark" i would give the macaron normally goes to the shell as it is so hard to make well - the almond flour, the aging of the egg whites, whipping it up, etc. 

Next, the filling. I was very dissapointed in this filling as well. The filling was not smooth and it was not creamy enough. Furthermore, I couldn't really taste the flavour of the filling, all of the macaron fillings tasted fairly similar.

I would love to give some other desserts a try, but I would not recommend this place for macarons.
author: Kristy N.

description:
Delicious macarons! Super moist and chewy on the inside with a perfect cookie to filling ratio. They don't bother with food coloring so you don't really know which one you're eating once they are in the box. 

Definitely drop by if you're in the Ferry Building.
author: Lucy N.

description:
Located in the Ferry Building, this little storefront is a true gem! There's so much going on in the building, that usually I just walk by without stopping anywhere because it feels too crowded and I get claustrophobic. 

I ordered some cupcakes and macaroons for my wife's birthday over the phone, and even though their website says they need a few days notice for orders, they were able to have it ready for me almost right away, even on a weekend! (Sorry that was a long sentence)

Simply put, some of the best cupcakes I've ever had. Frosting wasn't too sweet, seemed more like a light chocolate whipped cream. 

Next time I'm in the area, I know where to get some great sweet treats.
author: Josh F.

description:
I tried the macaroons yesterday when I took a walk along the Ferry building. My God! They are just so sinfully yummmyyyy. I bought the pistachio and the vanilla macrons. Pistachio is really soft and flavorful. The vanilla just melts in your mouth.
Will be definitely coming back!
author: Steffi C.

description: Love their rich and delicious chocolate tarts!  I buy a bunch and freeze them, and they are still wonderfully rich and yummy.  The packaging is adorable, too.
author: Hello K.

description: Got the rose flavour macaron after lunch at the ferry building. I was delightfully surprised by the soft texture with just the right amount of sweetness. $2 per macaron is a little pricy but I thought it was worth it!
author: Michelle C.

description: Beautiful confectionery items...cupcakes, cakes specialty marshmallows and other various candies, but the woman working there was completely disinterested and far too consumed on her phone to offer assistance.  Since I was in a rush, I couldn't wait any longer to buy my items and left empty handed.  :(
author: Lucky S.

description:
Macaroons are $2 each but also bigger than some other places I've been to. Made with coarser almond flour than I'm used to but I enjoyed the texture and so did the family. We got the rose, choco mint, green tea, dulce de leche, pistachio. 

All were fantastic!

The rose was typical rose.
The pistachio was well liked by the family even though they don't typically like the flavor.
Chocolate mint was very nice and the mint came through just enough 
Green tea was a little weak in flavor
Dulce de leche could have had a more caramel taste. It was a little weak too.

We got 5 macaroons and I wanted a box to carry them in but the lady behind the counter said they only give out boxes for 6-8 macaroons and wouldn't give us a box for our 5. She was pretty adamant about it for some reason. It was the only blemish with our visit.
author: Leah L.

description:
Dry, tasteless & just not good.  I get that the prices must be this high for the area this shop is in, but for that price these cupcakes should be edible.
I bought more than a few cupcakes for a party and was so embarrassed when everyone took a bite out of these.  I almost went back to ask for a refund, they were literally inedible.
author: Kiki A.

description: Meh-super rude and in a city where you can find macarons by the plenty, I would go somewhere else.
author: Emily G.

description:
I'm a HUGE fan of Bakerella and when she blogged about Miette Patisserie, I knew it was a must visit on my trip to San Francisco.  I was only visiting for a weekend so I'm glad Miette has a location in the Ferry Building so I could visit and hit the Farmers Market at the same time.

The little shop is just the prettiest.  It was a happy place for me since I love all things girly.  I was able to pick up a couple of delicious macarons for myself and beautifully packaged candies, cookies, and chocolates for my family.  A wonderful place to treat yourself and others.
author: Nadia K.

description:
Such a cute little bakery located inside the Ferry Building.
 
I've been to the Ferry Building numerous times now, and I always stop by Miette to grab some macarons. I'm no macaron connoisseur, but I really like the ones at Miette. They are pricey, but always taste fresh. They only have a few flavors, but each flavor is perfected. Most of the flavors are chocolate-based--I highly recommend either the hazelnut or pistachio. I've also tried the buttermilk panna cotta, which was very tasty. It comes in a cute little mason jar, and is filled to the top with fresh strawberries. It's the perfect sized desert. I'm definitely going to try some of the other desserts in the shop.
 
Again, the price at Miette are on the steeper side, but that's expected of a shop located inside the Ferry Building. I highly recommend checking this place out; there's bound to be some dessert that is satisfying.
author: Joy L.

description:
I stumbled upon this place amidst the hustle and bustle of the farmer's market outside. I'll admit that I was drawn to the cute confectionary look of this store. Once I saw hundreds of macarons stacked in apothecary jars, I knew I had to take a look. These macaron looked like they were made with great technique because the "feet" of the macaron were perfect.

Even though I only intended to have one, I ended up buying a dulce de leche macaron and a rose geranium macaron. There were plenty of other tempting flavors like hazelnut, raspberry, and coffee but I had to draw the line somewhere. The shelves of the store were filled with delicate desserts like lemon loaves and gum-balls decorated as tennis balls. 

The macarons were probably some of the best I've ever tasted. I'm a HUGE fan of Laduree and Lette but I think that Miette beats them by a smidgen. The dulce de leche was absolute perfect- sweet and slightly salty filling sandwiched between two perfect ends. The actual macaron had the exact texture that a macaron should have- delicate at first touch and slightly chewy upon biting into it. The rose geranium lived up to the hype that the saleswoman claimed it had. The macaron had a floral perfume and many layers of flavor. Although the flavor seemed subtle, I really enjoyed it. 

At $1.85 per macaron they aren't cheap, but this is a standard price for a macaron. The actual size is a generous for a macaron and the flavors are great. I think Miette is a very charming shop that I will definitely return to. Thankfully I don't live in San Francisco or else I'd be here every week!
author: Megan K.

description:
Their special, brown textured and individually flavored Macarons, are so scrumptiously delightful!

It's a cute bakery shop that is located at the 1 Ferry Building.

Their packaging is adorable too!

I love me some Miette!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Miette Patisserie is a small and charming little macaron boutique in San Francisco's Ferry Building that offers arguably bland and mundane macs. 

I was a bit stunned when I saw the Yelp rating for Miette Patisserie to be honest, I didn't get it at all. The shop itself was clean and pleasant but the macarons were mediocre at very best. I dislike cloyingly sweet macs, but Miette Patisserie went too far in the other direction. The Hazelnut mac had a grainy and mealy mouthfeel and a nearly tasteless filling. They also had large air bubbles, which is the hallmark of a undestinguished mac. It was a bit of a disappointment to San Francisco and by way of origin, even France. 

The top shelf service and boutique were about all I enjoyed at Miette Patisserie. I would forgo a future visit.
author: Aaron E.

description:
Perhaps more so than most of the rest of the shops at the Ferry Building, this is the one that your female companion (girlfriend, mom, daughter, etc) will OOOOH + AAAAH over the most. It's got a table of cookies, confections + sweets in the front http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=j04Mu7lTQS4usIXEaOvaJA#j04Mu7lTQS4usIXEaOvaJA, a pretty selection of simply decorated cupcakes, tarts + cakes under the glass counter
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=KsBhfLKgQcLPr0ckmik1yA#KsBhfLKgQcLPr0ckmik1yA, + cute packaging  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=coEQ8mPVllizuMGOStCGbw#coEQ8mPVllizuMGOStCGbw that was obviously designed knowing the purchaser might be making a gift out of one of these dainty goodies. I'm sure I drooled a bucket upon laying eyes on some of these beauties. 

With glazed eyes, we got suckered into buying a whole box of 4 baked goods http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=yDROodSk657ZhkF1cekh3A#yDROodSk657ZhkF1cekh3A + a few of the macrons. Such an instagram-worthy moment! But the excitement dulled as soon as we started taking bites. Chocolate cupcakes with Meringue topping ($3), Chocolate cupcake with Coffee frosting ($3) + a Mini Scharffen Berger Cake (~$5) ... none of them really stood out as tasting as good as they looked. Of the 3, I might get the Mini Scharffen Berger Cake again as I'm always a fan of chocolate on chocolate.

And then onto the macarons... As someone who lives + works a stone's throw away from both 'Lette + the well-known Bottega Louie in Downtown LA, I've unfortunately developed a fairly high standards for macarons... their perfectly uniform shape, brightly enticing colors, tantalizing selection of flavors, the delicate crunch of the shell followed by the chewy consistency almost melting with the cream filling in your mouth...  All of these attributes are expectations I have for macarons as I've come to know + love them...

And all of which the macrons at Miette just don't quite seem to have. The half-dozen jars on the counter http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=vwQgLJefPy8DAEd-0ZJdug#vwQgLJefPy8DAEd-0ZJdug are filled with bite-sized morsels of the brown-colored variety much like cookies. I suppose there is something honorable that could be said about their unique composition (of ground-almond meringue cookies) or that they proudly do not contain food coloring... but at the same time, it's admittedly much harder to get excited about spending $1.85 a pop when the texture is just so... unrefined, for lack of a better word.

Overall... cute shop, pretty sweets for the eyes, average taste on the tongue... I would come back to quell a sugar craving after having a Roli Roti Porchetta Sandwich, but only because I was already at the Ferry Building for that aforementioned sandwich.
author: Janelle Q.

description: I live close by and definitely make it easy to get hooked on their macarons. Although their flavors change from visits to visits, we are able to find something we like every time. Rose Geranium and Chocolate Mint are my top choices.
author: V L.

description: I only come here for their caramel. Omgsh... they have the most delicious caramel candies here. So worth the $1.75.
author: Esther L.

description:
This time I went back and got myself one of each of the Grapefruit, the Rose, and the Pistachio macarons. Visually it's hard to tell them apart, but one bite will have you know that they are labeled differently for a reason. 

The grapefruit reminded me of orange more than an orange cream could ever hope to remind me of an actual orange. It was fruity without the tanginess of a citric fruit.

The Rose had a nice sweet essence but I couldn't put a finger on it while munching on it seeing how I had forgotten which flavors I'd purchased; which is a pretty good way of putting the taste to the test.

Lastly, I had the trusty pistachio macaron which didn't let me down, as usual. It was still just as delectable as the day I first had it.

Yes, the macarons are solid (figuratively)!!!

€€€€€€€€€€€¥¥¥¥£££££££££

Many winters ago, I was of the opinion that Miette created overrated and terribly expensive cupcakes. Well, they still make pretty expensive cupcakes but I'm glad to find that their repertoire had expanded (and thank God for that!) greatly.

After putting in my order for a Bluebottle latte next door, I hurried over to satisfy my treacly-tooth ("sweet tooth" would be an understatement).

And this time I decided to go for the chocolate ganache tart and a couple of macarons --- a hazelnut, and a pistachio. 

The tart's chocolate ganache filling was silky smooth and just plain amazing! I had always loved ganache tarts but this pushed the bar that little bit higher! The flaky base had just the right amount of crunch and the right bit of crumble. And that sprinkling of sea salt on it is not just there to be a pretty wallflower. It truly served to open up the taste buds and greatly enhanced the intensity of the ganache as it melted its unctuous richness inside your mouth, caressing your smooch-thruster.

Though I must admit I haven't had all that many macarons and hence can't claim to be a connoisseur, I do know what tastes good when it lands on my taste buds. And the macarons were delicious! They were airy, light, and oh-so-slightly chewy. In fact, I preferred these over their much vaunted counterparts at the Bouchon Bakery in Yountville; those had too many hollow pockets in them.

I highly recommend both the macarons and the tart. On my next visit to grab my favourite latte at Bluebottle, I know what I'm getting to get my bites on.
author: Umesh T.

description:
Macaron - An Almond, Meringue based Sandwich Cookie
Macaroon - A Coconut Cookie often dipped in Chocolate.

Know your Pastries people!!

This shop may be on the small side but they sure pack a lot in there. Cupcakes, Tarts, Brownies, Bars, Cookies and Macarons. They even have bags of goodies which make the perfect gift.
I've only tried the Macarons here and must say they are really good. Crispy shell and chewy on the inside. Delicious!

I love the location too but it can get crazy busy in here because of that so it's good to know roughly what you want before you come so that you don't get overwhelmed.
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
Conveniently located in the Ferry Building, Miette Patisserie has pastel walls covered with candy, glowing cases filled with cupcakes, cakes and gorgeous glass jars that  are filled to the brim with various macarons, caramels, meringues, and candies. It is a beautiful store. It is one of the sweetest little bakery and candy shops you will find.

From all of these sugary offerings I chose to try the cupcakes!

Old Fashion Cupcake ~  is super moist chocolate cake topped  with boiled icing a ooey gooey marshmallow icing, I don't think I have ever had boiled icing before, and I was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. It wasn't horribly sweet like most buttercreams and had a phenomenal texture that complimented the dense and rich chocolate cake. The frosting was fluffy and sweet--utterly perfect.

Yellow vanilla cupcake ~ that had a fresh refreshing silky  vanilla buttercream icing, that tasted more amazing than a glass of water the morning after a hard night of drinking.

Carrot Cupcake -The cake was perfectly soft and had a perfect addition of crunchy currants and walnuts, and the Cream Cheese frosting, well, who can go wrong with a kick ass cream cheese frosting.

Miette's pretty Parisian aesthetic enchants visitors making this place a delight to visit for anyone with a sweet tooth! Love it! No matter how full I am eating a hearty lunch from one of the many food places at the Ferry Building I always make it a point to get a little something from Miette!
author: Maria M.

description: Miette is truly a sweet lover's dream come true.  From their cupcakes, macarons, cakes, cookies, and other sweet treats, you can really go any direction here and it'll be fantastic. I've had a number of treats from here before, and I'd have to say that my favorite things to get here are the Lavender Shortbread cookies and any of their macaron flavors. Their little cakes are a little on the pricey side but they're perfect for a special occasion!  All of their items make for great gifts for friends, or a gift to yourself!
author: Lisa I.

description: The macarons here are delicious! Perfect place to swing by for dessert if you're already eating in the Ferry Building. I only tried two flavors--hazelnut and pistachio, and they were both great. The texture of the cookie part of the macaron was perfect! Moist on the inside with a slight crisp. Pistachio flavor was good and level of sweetness was just right. I didn't like the hazelnut one as much as the pistachio, but it was still really good! I just found the inside chocolate filling to be a little too sweet, and it tasted more chocolate-y than hazelnutty to me. Texture was still great, though. Will definitely be back to try some of their other flavors and desserts.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
This review is based on MACARONS (and service) only.  The macarons are the freshest, softest and creamiest macarons I've ever had.  I've eaten them in major cities all over the world, and the technique on these is so unusual but very nice.  Unfortunately, the one critique I have is that the flavors were a little bland.  I tried the Chocolate, Hazelnut, Pistacio and Grapefruit.  Grapefruit had the most potential with a bit more flavor than the others, but still not a whole lot going on.

I ordered 6 macarons at $1.85 each.  Not a bad price for these treats (comparatively).  The gentleman helping me packed them in a small flat bag and I went on my way.  A few minutes later, I reached in to snack on one, and to my dismay they were all smashed together with the fillings oozing out.  So disappointing!  I was hoping to take a few back to my family but they were now cracked and ugly.  As I was still in the vicinity, I stopped back by to ask for a box to put them in and explained what happened.  The gentleman and lady working both insisted they give me replacement macarons and this time packed them graciously in a box that protected them for the next couple of days.  I cannot say enough nice things about these lovely people and their amazing service.  Miette is lucky to have employees that give customers a great experience and this business a solid reputation.
author: Sasha R.

description:
Okay.  First things first, I have to state my bias before I write this review.  I took a box of their macaroons home, and am eating them as I write this review.

holy moly.  amazing.  Seriously these are ranking as some of the best macaroons I've had.  Yes it can be crazy busy at the shop (and yes they should install AC in the building as it was pretty warm in the terminal yesterday!), but trust me, the wait is worth it.  Pretty unique flavors (as well as some classics).  So you can have Vanilla, or Pistachio, or Chocolate and Lavender or Dulce de Leche.

Really these macaroons make this trip to San Fran worth it.
author: James O.

description: I like the macarons, but i'd like them better if they were in one piece.  The  tall woman who picked them out of their jars was either in a hurry--her overall rudeness suggested that--or didn't know how to use the tongs; when I got  they all had serious dents in them.
author: Bruno A.

description:
