I've walked past Miette in the Ferry building countless times, and I always wondered what it was all about. Decorated with lots of pink, fancy containers and a display case of cupcakes, this place certainly looked well put together. 

So I did some research and found that Miette is a popular patisserie with its main storefront in Hayes Valley. It's claim to fame is that Food Network named it as having the best cupcake in america in its Gingerbread cupcake.

Taking home a box of four of these gingerbread cupcakes, I also grabbed a container of their gingersnap cookies and a creme fraiche ice cream sandwich.

Gingerbread cupcakes - These were very good, although I don't know about it being the best cupcake in america. Everything about it was definitely of quality though. The frosting was creamy while not being too heavy or buttery. The cupcake had a nice gingerbread taste to it as well. The best part was the consistency, which was extremely moist and soft.

Gingersnap cookies - These were a little disappointing, given that their label advertises these as making it on some top SF list as well. The texture felt like it was trying to be both chewy and crispy while not really pulling off either.

Creme Fraiche Ice Cream Sandwich - This was surprisingly good. I got this as an impulse buy, having come here for only the cupcakes. The cookies were graham cracker and the ice cream was so creamy yet firm that this was one of the better ice cream sandwiches I've had. 

I don't know that I would come back again, but I did enjoy it.
author: Mark O.

description: This is a great little patisserie! I tried the carrot cake cupcake, and it was delicious and beautifully decorated. Also their chocolate-covered gummy bears are the softest, most delicious I've ever tasted.
author: Catherine W.

description: Bought my boyfriend the tomboy cake for his birthday. Called in advance to reserve the six inch cake in case they ran out so they put one aside for us. Seriously one of the prettiest cakes that I've ever bought anyone and also it wasn't overly sweet like I expected. Was slightly dry but it went well with the frosting. Will definitely go back for the little desserts.
author: Eunah T.

description:
When at the Ferry Building, Miette is one of my stops.

My must-buys: 
* regular and chocolate caramels. (I take these home and enjoy with chilled sliced green apples
* hazelnut dragees

Seasonal buy: 
* gingerbread marzipan (imported from Germany)
* Baru individually wrapped chocolate covered marshmallows
author: Dot B.

description: OMG, my boyfriend bought me a chocolate cake from them for my birthday and we polished it off in 2 days -- rich and moist but not too sweet -- you can really taste the cocoa (vs. mostly the sugar from most other bakeries). We're very particular about our baked delights and Miette gets our enthusiastic recommendation.
author: Kate A.

description: Such a cute vendor in the Ferry Building. Every time I come to they city I have to stop here. Macarons are delicious and so are their cupcakes. They are a bit pricey but what isn't in SF? You can blow $20 with just a few items.
author: Cha R.

description:
Pretty, pricey, precious!

Everything is adorable, but the prices might make you gasp!  The service we received was excellent (the young gentleman behind the counter was smiley, polite, and very eager to offer us good customer service!), and the baked goods?  Well, the macarons were just fine...nothing special, but tasty.  They're a little on the heavy, gooey side, not the lightweight ones you'd actually get in France. 

Miette was mostly cleaned out after what was probably an extraordinarily busy Sunday, so there were only about five flavors of macarons left to choose from, most of which were weird flavor combinations, including a lot of floral flavor combinations...But thankfully they at least had some chocolate and hazelnut macarons left for me to purchase!  

I've had their cupcakes in the past, and while I found them to be a-okay, I wouldn't call them special, and they're a little on the small side considering the price.

Will I shop at Miette again in the future?  Yeah, sure, I probably will...but most likely it'll be because I just happen to be walking through the ferry building and get a sudden baked good craving, look to my left, and just happen to see this shop on my left.  I would not, however, buy one of their cake stands, which are priced waaaay higher than they should be (as someone who owns over 15 cake stands of varying colors, sizes, and eras, I feel well-qualified to offer this opinion).
author: Amy L.

description:
This is another storefront inside of the Ferry Building Marketplace.  Tons of sweets to satisfy your sweet tooth (or your girlfriend's).

I don't remember all of the things that they sold, but they did have various chocolates, toffees, cookies, and macarons, at the very least.  I got some chocolate wafer cookies for me and some dark chocolate toffee for my gf.  Both are fantastic.  I will be back for these items alone.

As with anything in the Ferry Building, it can get crowded.  You might also, as I did, find it a little disorganized, and you may not know where to get in line.  If you need anything from the counter, it appears you should wait there, but if you don't, just go straight to the register.

It appears that the things here are at SF prices, but that is to be expected.  That's okay, the stuff here is good and it's worth it.  TREAT YO SELF.
author: Brent T.

description:
We stumbled upon Miette while exploring the Ferry Building (Miette is located inside), not knowing how widely acclaimed it was.  Miette means "little crumb" in French.  It's a small, European-inspired pastry shop that opened in 2001.  The storefront is simple and elegant with cakes, cupcakes, cookies, macarons, and other delightful confections on display.  Packaging and presentation is nice.  Cakes and cupcakes are on display behind crystal clear glass display cases, cookies are neatly stacked on a table out front, and macarons are stored in glass jars.

We ordered one of every macaron they had available that day.  The macaron flavors were:

- Chocolate Orange
- Vanilla
- Rose Geranium
- Pistachio
- Hazelnut
- Grapefruit
- Chocolate

They weren't exactly cheap at $1.85 a pop, but expectations were high given the looks of the macarons, the store, and where we were (the culinary destination that is the Ferry Building).  The quality was indeed superb.  The macarons were made out of coursely-ground almond meringue cookies and filled with a buttercream or ganache.

They were delicious.  I enjoyed all the flavors except for the Rose Geranium.  This is a personal preference, but they were too flowery in taste for me.  Regardless of flavor, each macaron was simple, rich, and delicate.  I could tell the pieces were fresh.  They were slightly moist and easily melted in my mouth.  Each bite was a bite of joy.  That is the sign of an excellent macaron!

So, I recommend Miette and look forward to trying one of their cakes, cupcakes, and/or cookies during one of my future visits to San Francisco.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Inconspicuously situated to the left of the shop is an ice cart that is filled with ice cream sandwiches. Miette uses their own cookies to sandwich three varieties of ice cream ($%). There's creme fraiche with graham cookies, chocolate on chocolate wafer cookies and a mint chocolate chip with chocolate cookies.

I had the chocolate wafer cookie sandwiching chocolate ice cream. Is this death by chocolate you might ask? No, the chocolate cookie is delicate and just like their thin wafer cookies. The ice cream is semi-sweet, not too sweet and not part of the hyped up "salted" version of ice creams that many an ice cream shop is pushing.

Delicious!
By pass the Humphrey Slocombe line when it's too long and pick up a quick ice cream fix from Miette. Who would have known that their ice cream is so good!
author: Joanna T.

description: I love Miette! For one, it's friggin' adorable inside. And their sweets are delicious! Hubby ordered me a cake for my birthday and it was waiting for me in our hotel room upon arrival. It was scrumptious and beautiful! Thank you, Miette!
author: Tiff H.

description:
Not sure why I poo poohed this SF bakery for so long - the cheesecake is amazing! 

Yes, I tried a more authentically French creation first, a pot de creme. It was divine. But that cheesecake? Dense and fluffy at the same time, the perfect cut of cake. It was like Mozart wrote a cake symphony just for me.

The damage to my wallet for two desserts? A mere $11, with tip. 

Miette, je t'aime!
author: Abby S.

description: Being a commuter I am always getting on the ferry from Vallejo to San Francisco's Monday- Friday and I walk through the ferry building all the time so one day I wanted a chocolate brownie so bad omg!!!!and I stopped in to Miette Patisserie the best decision EVER!!!!The brownie was on point but I said to myself let's put Miette Patisserie to the Test with Starbucks Chocolate brownie so I went and bought a brownie from Starbucks and Drumroll Please!!!!Lol!!!!Miette  Patisserie was the Winner with the soft chewy center and not so hard edges Starbucks Brownie tasted very Store bought and Miette tasted like someone is the Kitchen working hard to make them home made brownies I've been back since and I bought some Milk tea from there Boba Guys milk tea who is local if you haven't had a Boba Guys Milk tea Get yo life together Hunty!!!!try Them Asap Okay Sorry back to Miette Patisserie Lol!!!!i also tried some pudding that's in these little honey comb jars and omg!!! If you are pudding lover like me you will enjoy it.The Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the pastries I will be going back for sure if I could give Miette Patisserie another Star I would.
author: Enjoli L.

description:
Got their macarons per friends recommendation, and was not disappointed! 

Finally, after coming back to the Ferry's Building, I knew I had to come to Miette's! I got their Rose-Germanium macaron and shared it with two other friends. My only regret is that I didn't get more for later! It was soft, flavorful, and just absolutely different than any macaron I've had! They don't have an alarming food colored shells and filling, instead they have a very natural and earthy feel to their macs. The filling also did not feel oily or too buttery at all, which was great. Since I split the macaron, it was very pliable. The shell did not crack and the piece stayed together very well (aka no crumbs on your clothes after devouring it).

They have so many other cute cookies, candies, and pastries on display! I can't wait to come back and try more of their amazing goodies.

Overall, I thought $1.85 for one macaron was a great delicious value, most macarons I've seen cost over $2 and do not have the same quality!
author: Winnie I.

description:
Everything I've had from this place is just plain delicious. It's a little pricey, but I guess it's fair considering the overhead for their locations. (Ferry Building and Jack London Square are the ones I've been to.)

I have enjoyed the following from this place - Tasty macarons, delicious caramels, cookies, a yummy cupcake (of course) and those homemade marshmallows look damn delicious.
author: Brittany N.

description:
Yesterday we brought home of my favorite cupcakes in the Bay Area....their Gingerbread.  Moist, spicy, so good.

For a girl who is *not a fan* this is a big step!!
author: Katherine F.

description: I ordered the Rose, pistachio and hazelnut macaroons ...soft in texture, fillings were more whipped than creamy, and not as flavorful as I had hoped
author: Jenny N.

description: Not super impressed with the macarons. The flavor and texture just wasn't there for me. I would be willing to try the other options, but probably not my first choice for baked goods.
author: Kelsey O.

description: I love Miette! I'm a diehard fan of their shortbread, especially the lemon. Cupcakes are good too. Their stuff isn't cheap so I try not to go too crazy. But their sweets are worth every penny.
author: Mel L.

description:
Picked up a Mini Scharffen Berger Cake, which is a moist chocolate cake covered with two layers of bittersweet chocolate ganache.   It was fantastic.

I said it was for Father's Day and she put it in a bag with tissue.

I also bought a pistachio macaroon which was tasty, but she warned me it just came from refrigerator and it was too cold.

...yesterday was wine tasting tour with SFSU and sangria party.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Miette makes wonderful, tasty things. But please don't hire them for an important event if it's important that they follow through.

We hired Miette to make and deliver three (3) cakes for our wedding. We paid for them and even called them a few days in advance to confirm. 

However, when we arrived at our wedding reception, only 1 of the cakes had been delivered. Miette was closed and not answering their phones. The restaurant sprang into action and whipped up some extra desserts (thanks, Epic Roasthouse!). But our guests got a slice of wedding cake so paper-thin you could see daylight through it. People kept asking for more cake, but there wasn't any. I gave up my own piece so that a guest at another table could have some. 

On Monday following the wedding, a lady at Miette called us while we were on our honeymoon. I have to admit that she was quite chipper as she admitted they never made 2 out of the 3 cakes. Whoopsie! She said that she could refund the money for the 2 missing cakes "as a courtesy." Her call was to process the refund for the 2 cakes that never arrived. Otherwise, she did not seem the least bit concerned, and after that nobody ever followed up with us to try and make things right. 

C'mon, Miette. Refund the delivery fee, give us a store credit, or even take 3 minutes to send us a handwritten note. 

But here's the thing- they are apparently doing so well that they really don't need our business and they really don't care whether or not we trusted our special day to them and they blew it. Oh well. We learned that the hard way. 

So. They make delicious, attractive baked goods. But I wouldn't count on them to carry through on something important. And I wouldn't count on them to make it right afterwards. 

(Side note: we had a fantastic wedding, and more importantly: we have each other. The cake was the only wrinkle in the weekend.)
author: Michael C.

description: So cute and small, love the set up! Tried the Lime Meringue Tartlette, and really enjoyed it. Too sweet for my taste, but there were so many other desserts to try!
author: Justine S.

description:
Not your typical macaron.

I've strolled through Miette a bajillion times, mainly because I'm attracted to pretty things. During each visit, I've definitely taken notice of the macarons but was never inclined to try it because I'm one of those people who truely eats with their eyes. You see, their macarons don't look like your traditional colorful yet light looking patties. The neutrality in color in combination with the visibility of almond meal conveys a heavier pastry feel, which is why I never bothered to try it. (I like all my sweets nice and light) However, today, I was craving a snack to accompany my afternoon read. 

I was debating between getting 1 or 2 but the size of their macarons are quite substantial so I opted for 1. I ended up getting the Rose-Geranium, which I was told to be most fragrant in taste, which it most definitely had. What I liked about the macaron was that the texture is different than your average macaron. It's a bit "cakey-er" and chewier than your typical macaron yet its still relatively light. It feels much more filling than your typical macaron as well. What I liked was the lightness and cool temperature of the cream, which was a great contrast to the"buns". This was a pleasant surprise for me because typical macaron creams are usually too sweet and my least favorite. 

All in all, I'm excited to find an excuse to try my next flavor.
author: Becky M.

description:
What a cute little shop! If you're looking in the Ferry building it is near Blue Bottle Coffee and right next to Humphry Slocombe.

I love their setup with the macaroons in giant vases and the rest of their deserts display in glass cases like any good bakery. The service is great, friendly smiles. The line can get long at times, but it moves fast.

I personally adore their Dulce de Leche macaroon- it's to die for. The vanilla is also a good choice. 

They do accept debit/credit cards. I'd suggest stopping by for a little sweet treat.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Not bad.  Not bad at all....

Bf and I were in the Ferry Building, and was looking at all the possible sweets the Marketplace would have.  Noticed this one with its pretty colors and very clean storefront.

I was in a wheelchair, so I had the bf park me somewhere while he went and got whatever he wanted.  I did tell him I wanted something taffy-ish, and he succeeded in getting me caramel!  

Lots of different sweets here.  We ended up getting only a cupcake and 8 pieces of caramel, as we were to be on the plane the next day.  The cupcake itself was pretty good.  The actual cake was moist, and the cream wasn't too bad.  Was in its own little to go box, so it didn't get compacted too much in my purse.  Caramels were neatly placed in its own small bag with a ribbon on top.  Very cute.   

No complaints on the service!  They were a bit busy when we visited on a Wednesday afternoon.  Everything definitely looked scrumptious...

Would likely come back here again whenever we visit SF's Ferry Building.
author: Grace C.

description:
Perfect. Pretty. Packed with flavor.

Pastries. Pastries. Pastries.

If you want a taste of perfection - this is the stop. My wife loves chocolate and this place always puts a smile on her face. We leave with a bag full of goodies every time we stop by. This last visit we left with a chocolate tartlet, 2 chocolate macarons and a scharffenberger chocolate dome cake. This may sound like a lot at first but once you taste perfection you have to buy everything in sight! If they had any additional offerings (late in the day the supply runs low) we would have purchased those as well! 

Everyone these days is making macarons. Why is this chocolate macaron the one worth trying? 
1. They are always fresh. They crunch when you bite in but melts away as soon as it touches your tongue.
2. The filling is the perfect combo of sweet but not overpowering chocolate.
After trying macarons on each coast (SF and NY - Laduree ) and everywhere in between - these are the best. If you are ever going to try one for the first time - try one here. Fair warning - you'll be disappointed everywhere you go after this!

As far as unique offerings go, the Scharffenberger chocolate dome cake takes the cake. *pun intended* It's cute to look at - the cute little flower adorning the top of the dome makes me say to myself this is too cute to eat. Then you succumb and take a bite. The dome is a gooey chocolately fudgey layer of goodness that enrobes your tongue in flavor. The cake inside is moist and flavorful. Each layer could be a treat by itself but the combination, according to my wife, "makes sweet magic in your mouth."

How do you ever argue with sweet magic in your mouth? This is pastry perfection here and you owe it to yourself to try!
author: Sabrina B.

description: The prices here are more on the high side, but then again it's to be expected since they are in a touristy location. The creme fraiche ice cream sandwich is so good though. The cookie alone doesn't even need the ice cream, but as an ice cream sandwich, it makes it even better! Oh, and my husband is a fan of the peach gummies that they have!
author: Mertani G.

description:
One of my favorite places in the Ferry Building in San Francisco is Miette, a dessert shop that offers cakes, cookies, food coloring-free macarons, and ice cream sandwiches.  I usually go for their macarons and ice cream sandwiches, and this time I went for the first, 'cause they ran out of the salted caramel ice cream sandwich!  Also, I quite dislike food coloring, and Miette is one of the only places that make macarons without.

I was a bit disappointed because the macarons were a bit stale this time around, and they appeared to be smaller and collapsed than I remembered.  The rose flavored was just as I remembered it, and ended up being my favorite, but the flavors of the others were also delicious.  The mouthfeel wasn't as superb as I had remembered, with the center lacking the moist chewiness that macarons have.  They were good, but didn't quite live up to my expectations this time.  Hopefully next time when I return, I will experience the goodness that is Miette!

//edit
The other day, I had their strawberry ice cream sandwich.  It was paired with their graham cracker cookies, and was the taste of summer!  The strawberry ice cream was flavorful, with bits of strawberry and creamy as ever.  The cookie wasn't as flavorful, as it was hard to tell it was a graham cracker, but I suppose it highlighted the ice cream.  I also had a bite of the salted caramel, and while the chocolate cookie was good, it overpowered the flavor of the ice cream.  Of the two, I would definitely recommend the strawberry one!
author: Tammy L.

description:
I'm gonna be all fancy and eat some macarons by the bay. 

What a life right? Eating macarons by the bay trying to be all Frenchie. If only I was in Paris by the French Riveria. But I'll settle for the bay for now. 

This petite little bakery can be found at the Ferry. They have jars of macarons so we helped ourselves for a few, such as the strawberry, pistachio, something, and something else. I know, great memory?! But I really liked the strawberry http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uvifFrhglC6Xe17_-bAIZQ&userid=x2kIaq8x6Q2I6uJxmVg4cA and pistachio ones! :) Nom nom. 

Enjoy yourself with some macarons and buy some coffee or a latte at the Blue Bottle across!
author: Marthie D.

description:
I cannot believe that it's been 5 years since I first tried Miette! It is such a memorable bakery around the Bay Area, and I suspect for most travelers/tourists, the Ferry Building location is the first introduction to Miette. There are also two other locations: Octavia Street (Hayes Valley neighborhood) and Jack London Square (in Oakland). The Oakland location is where their pastries are made. I have yet to visit the Jack London Square location, but definitely do check out the Octavia Street one as in comparison to the Ferry building location, it's larger, calmer, has walls of imported candies, and is an actual store (rather than more like a open booth). Really quaint and lovely. 

If you're a fan of macarons (or just are curious to try one!) and enjoy trying different types, these ones are definitely worth checking out. They're on the chewier side, but not in a bad way, depending of course on your preference. But not one of those macarons in which you think why did I just spend $2 on a tiny piece of colored sugar that fits between my fingers and tastes like artificial sweetener?? Hah. I haven't had a flavor I don't like. They're all distinct, and not overwhelmingly sweet. It's too easy to eat at least a few at one go...

Also try their other goodies, like their cookies. My family would finish a couple of boxes of these in less than a couple of days! This is a great stop to bring home some pretty gifts that you can't find elsewhere and support a local business!
author: Tiffany L.

description: This French patisserie in the Ferry Building is across from Blue Botttle, which is a winning combo. We got a stack of fresh and spicy gingersnaps to share with our coffee. Rimmed in sugar, these mahogany colored cookies were spicy, not overly sweet and super fresh and crunchy. I look forward to trying more treats here!
author: Stephanie B.

description: About 10 years ago a HS teacher introduced us to the pistachio macaroons here. It was my first time ever having a macaroon and I remember how soft, chewy and mildly sweet that first bite was. I recently took my fiance here for the first time and had the macaroons again. When I took that first bite again I felt like I was transported back in time. Damn good macaroons and they haven't changed a bit.
author: Norman L.

description:
The Ferry Building has become of a bit of an upscale bakery / tourist trap over the years, and while this is a cute little place to grab cookies on the run, it's a bit overhyped in my opinion. The macaroons we got were maybe 25% better than average store-bought cookies, for twice the price.

If money is no object, the people working here are nice, it's adorable, and the cookies are quite pleasant, but not really a lot of bang-for-your-buck compared to other cookie shops that are more "go" and less "show", IMO.
author: Sean B.

description:
I don't get the hype.

Service was friendly enough. I tried the pistachio, rose-geranium, hazelnut, and one more that I can't even remember... It was a little too sweet and the consistency wasn't what you might expect from a macaron. Generally, the meringue cookie portions were too heavy for the lightness of the creams. It's hard to perfect a macaron--this just left me wanting a taste of the real thing. /:

Then again, my review is based purely on the macarons and none of their other items. Maybe their other baked goods are better but if you want a great macaron, I'd try elsewhere.
author: Michelle K.

description: Incredible chewy perfect textured macarons. This is exactly what I look for in a mac and they've nailed it. Flavors are slightly more subtle but feel truer to what a real macaron should be. Absolutely recommend them. Also enjoyed their crumbly crunchy lavender shortbread cookies.
author: Marmar Q.

description:
Chocolate Cupcake topped with an Italian mergiune is simply divine. The cake has just the right texture, not too soft, not too dry with a great balance of sweetness. The icing on the cake, no pun intended, so happens to be the frosting on top. Has the ooegy gooey quality of marshmallow but without the sugar high. 

Overall Thoughts

Cupcakes done right!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Miette is cake bliss.  Their signature cakes are divine.  But I have special love for their gingerbread cupcakes.  

Gingerbread is hit or miss.  Many versions are too spicy, or too dry.  An all too heavy hand w molasses is a frequent problem.  Then there's the denseness issue...

The gingerbread cupcakes @ Miette are nothing short of perfection.  

The texture?  Subtly rich.  Key word being subtly.
The flavor?  Spice that greets your palette without overwhelming it.  Perfect balance.

I have literally dragged my friends here just to try them.

Then there's the signature Miette cakes.  Again...perfection.

Always gratifying even just to look at them.

Thank you Miette.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I love the cutesy-styling of this fun little shop at the San Francisco Ferry Building. I'm pulled in with promises of something delicious to sink my teeth into, and Miette's French macarons (truly live up to my culinary expectations.  The small shop features a selection of sweets and goodies. I have every intention of trying the non-macaron items, but I'm deeply drawn to the large glass jars filled high with stacks of freshly made macarons. What I love about Miette macarons: the not-too-sweet, moist, soft yet chewy texture hidden within the thin, crisp shell and flavorful creamy filling. I love seeing the flecks of almond skins floating around the cookie. I've tried macarons from several other bakeries (Chantal Guillon, L'Artisan, Satura Cakes, La Maison du Chocolat, Oui Oui, La Baguette to name a few), but I do not recall any of the macarons having flecks of almond skin or this amazingly chewy texture. The staff is always super nice and they ask "eco-friendly green"questions, like whether or not I need to have my little waxed paper envelope sealed with a sticker. "No need, I'm going to  eat them RIGHT NOW."  Ha ha. I love Miette's French macarons like a kid-with-a-weight-problem loves cake.

Flavors I've tried: 
Rose Geranium
Vanilla
Pistachio
Grapefruit
Chocolate Hazelnut
Chocolate Orange

Miette's talented team of macaron-artisans know their craft LIKE A BOSS.

Tip: $5 minimum credit card purchase. Macarons are $1.85 each.
author: Liv K.

description:
I love macarons!

After having had some really good macarons from Ladurée and Pierre Hermé in Paris, I was searching for a local pâtisserie that will offer something similar.

The macarons at Miette are actually quite unique because their macaron cookies are made of coarsely ground-almond which adds texture to each bite and the fillings are all very creamy and authentic.

The chocolate cupcake is so rich and moist and sooo cute with the dollop of white marshmallowy cream and little red candy on top. It's also not too sweet so I can really taste the chocolate and other natural ingredients they put in. Just the way I like it!

I recommend anyone who likes Macaron and chance to pass the SF Ferry Building to give it a try!
author: Sherry C.

description: I had a couple of macaroons from here after lunch at the Ferry building. I chose the pumpkin, the hazelnut, and the chocolate. These were unlike macaroons I've had before because I thought I was eating more of a sandwich cookie like an oreo rather than a macaroon. In fact, I am pretty sure these should be marketed as sandwich cookies instead of macaroons because nothing about their taste resembles a traditional macaroon. The filing inside is more like frosting than meringue. So as sandwich cookies, the pumpkin and the hazelnut were good. The chocolate was bitter and blah. I think there is some hype around this place because I've seen the cookbook in various shoppes around SF, but I'm not sure why.
author: Caroleigh N.

description: Raspberry chocolate cake.. The worst cake I have ever had hands down. I didn't even think those words were possible. It is so dry and dense I couldn't even cut into it. I had to throw the whole thing out. 35 dollars wasted.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The first time I bought goodies at Miette Patisserie was a couple of years ago.  I bought a chocolate truffle tartlette, Mini ScharffenBerger cake, and few chocolate fleur de sel caramels.  I enjoyed everything I had.

I recently returned to get some more tasty treats.  I guess I was full from lunch, because I only bought one chocolate fleur de sel caramel, 2 chocolate macarons, & 2 orange-chocolate macarons.  

I was disappointed with all 3 items.  The caramel's flavor was good; nice and salty with a deep chocolate flavor, but the texture was kind of dry and crumbly; not good.  My macarons were dry and gritty.  I don't know how fresh they were, but the texture was not enjoyable.  The items from Miette Patisserie were the last bites from my vacation in SF.  I'm sorry to say my vacation did not end on a high note.
author: Lorianne L.

description:
The macaroons here are perfect: Crispy and creamy with light flavors. Just perfect. I've tried every single macaroon here (get a bakers dozen if you can't decide) and I've loved every single one of them. Perfect as gifts and even better in your tummy. My favorite flavors have to be the Pistachio (perfectly light and awesome crushed and creamy pistachios) and Strawberry (light and fluffy with just a hint of strawberry). Fantastic macaroons!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=KBINe3ohHMphtOyNxHwRVw#KbNxkFo_6xkMcZx3FqS0vQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=KBINe3ohHMphtOyNxHwRVw#fAhBx6BCrOSN9V7IVgEHlg
author: Vivian A.

description:
Skip.

Confections: 4 stars
Price: 3 stars
Service: 0 stars

I came here earlier today to pick up macaroons for gifts and got the rudest and most hostile service I've ever received in San Francisco. 

Granted, it was about a quarter til closing, but there was only one other person in line. The two girls behind the counter snapped at me, without a hint of a welcome; switched on and off while attending to me and another patron, making it a very confusing customer experience; didn't speak up and acted appalled when asked to repeat themselves; and to top it off, were terrible about communicating about the minimum required for box packaging (7 macaroons.)

Don't snap "We don't give boxes for orders that small" when "That order's too small to fit in a box, but will a bag do?" will suffice. Beyond that mess up, every other occasion I've walked out with a bag, they've put a sticker on it to keep the macaroons from tumbling out. They don't here unless you ask, and after having placed the bag in my purse and rushed out, having assumed there was a sticker shortly after, I found them no longer in the paper bag but scattered instead at the bottom of my purse, ruining it and my jacket inside.

The confections are clutch as a simple, delicious, last minute gift but at this location, the accompanying disrespect will prevent me from ever returning-- not as if I felt like they wanted me to.

Try any of their other stores-- in Hayes Valley, Marin or Jack London-- over this one.
author: Crystal H.

description: My favorite cupcakes of all time!!!! Can't put it in words... Just a special place in my heart
author: Theresia B.

description:
I struggled somewhat between 3 and 4 stars for Miette, but I think I have to hold off on the 4 until I've been back. This time though, I liked one out of the three macarons I decided to get, so overall I wasn't super impressed. 

I came here on a whim towards closing time on Friday evening, and I did appreciate the fact that they were well-stocked in tasty treats (personal pet peeve of mine is when little shops run out of goodies towards closing time). It's a cute little stand in San Francisco's famous Ferry Building, and there were two ladies behind the counter. Both seemed a little tired and lackluster, for lack of a better word. They weren't unpleasant, but they weren't actually friendly either. 

Macarons: rose geranium, pistachio, and grapefruit:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=ssJ6fgc33H3UBuD8gqZaWQ#Wx-9naTKYxF1iSJw0MAXPg)
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=ssJ6fgc33H3UBuD8gqZaWQ#j70bQbN9ZOTyqUUrtYXvog)
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?select=ssJ6fgc33H3UBuD8gqZaWQ#BNmi5ibAuKHxzP-zcfgUUA)
As you can see from the pictures, these macarons all look generally the same upon first glance. I was a little mystified at first, since I'm used to macarons looking vibrant and colorful, but I can also appreciate the lack of artificial food coloring and in-your-face tie-die rainbows. They're a little hard to tell apart though, especially as they were all packaged in the same bag for later enjoyment. I had to employ the taste-and-tell method, as the cream in the middle all looked pretty much the same as well..

I think my favorite was definitely the pistachio, as it tasted the most natural yet true of all three flavors. The rose geranium was very floral, and I thought the balance of rose and geranium was done pretty well, but the whole thing just tasted a little too.. floral to me. I know it's supposed to, but maybe there was a tad too much extract in there? The grapefruit was probably my least favorite, which was a disappointment since it was my friend's favorite. I just thought the artificial grapefruit flavor was much too obvious, and there wasn't a real balance between the extract-y taste and the sweetness. 

I appreciated the generous amount of filling in between the macarons; this isn't one of those places that skimps on the cream, so you can definitely taste the velvety texture when you bite down. And contrary to some of the other reviews, I rather liked the semi-gritty texture of the macarons themselves, and I thought it had a good initial crunch before delving into the chewiness of the macaron shell center. 

I think the overall monotone appearance of the macarons takes a little bit to get used to, and I'd like to try some other flavors next time. I liked Miette, but I'm a little on the fence about whether I'd return specifically.. maybe for an ice cream sandwich or lavender cookies next time?
author: Maggie X.

description: The macarons here are delicious! Great flavor and light, airy with the perfect crunch. I'm a repeat customer. Vanilla is my favorite!
author: Nicki L.

description: Excellent macaroons!!! I was in town for a week and visited this place 3 times. I can't have gluten so it's exciting to find tasty pastries that I can eat. Everything else looked good there too. Highly recommended.
author: Jamie S.

description:
Mmmm, as I peer through the case ~ I almost feel guilty, because I'm about to have one of the best desserts in the city. 

My mouth waters as I'm trying to decide and I think I can't do it. Everything looks amazing, I tell him to pick and walk away to look at the many different bags of candy and confections. Festive gourmet goodies for the holidays.

He chose the coconut cream cake, which is perfect. I mean you can't go wrong here, but this was right. The layers between the cakey goodness are filled with coconut cream and topped with frosting and shaved coconut. 

I'm enjoying every bite as I crack that smile like I am getting away with something. It's sinfully good. The cake topped off a perfect lunch on a nice weekend in the city and a walk through the Ferry Building. 

It's desserts like this that remind you that it's the little things in life that can make you happy. Like cake. ;)
author: Rebekah T.

description: Their coconut cake is the best. No funky coconut after taste or scent. It is very light, moist and not over the top. The ratio of icing to cake is perfect and the portion is great! Not dense. It is the best coconut cake. Off course, their macaroons and ice cream sandwich deliver too!!! Love all favors. Try them
author: Kitty D.

description:
Not a fan of the grainy textures, but maybe that what is meant by the "California-style French macaron"? The shop itself is super cute and relatively easy to find in the Ferry Building. Jars of macarons among other sweets, such as chocolates and cookies, make it easy to spot.

I love the layout of the shop. The servers are also very sweet and patient. My box of macarons was nicely packaged and wrapped with a ribbon. I ate the macarons individually and spaced them out so I could truly enjoy and savour each one. Not only was I not too fond of the grainy textures, I did not feel there were distinct differences among some of the macarons (mostly among the chocolate-based macarons) - and I ordered all the flavours available that day. I was glad that I was actually able to taste the lavender though!

Would love to give this place 3.5 stars. I can't say I'm a fan, but it really is A-OK and a little more than that. Wouldn't mind coming here on my next SF visit to try their other sweets!
author: Kelley L.

description: San Francisco, you are truly lucky for this gem of a place! The plain cheesecake was probably one of the best cheesecakes I've had. It wasn't too sweet and the crust complimented it so well. The chocolate eclair was also delicious, a bit too much chocolate at the top but the custard in the middle along with the dough was perfect. Definitely will be coming back when in town!
author: Sara S.

description: Dope. This place made me feel so much better about my macaron obsession and realized that they don't have to look perfect to taste incredible. Also try the Turkish Delight if you're into that.
author: Danielle H.

description:
I admit, I have a problem when it comes to sweet things. I can't pass by a sweet shop and NOT take a look.  I usually end up buying at least one thing too. No self control I tell you -__- 
Saw a few people in line here while walking around the ferry building and decided to take a look. Ended up buying a few macarons and a cupcake. Everything at this store looks really dainty and is packaged super cute. Just makes everything look all the more appetizing. 
I thought the macarons were very light and flavorful. They had a nice bite to them and were chewy. The cupcake was just okay to me, nothing I would go back for. Maybe I just got the wrong one during my visit. It seems like they have a lot of other good items here so I wouldn't mind coming back to try some different things next time around.
author: Tina M.

description: These macarons were extremely sweet. I got the pistachio, green tea, dulce de leche, and chocolate and the filling for each one tasted like frosting. I appreciate that they don't use any dyes but that's the only thing I appreciated. The cookie part of the macaron was decent but the overly sweet frosting like center just ruined them. I also asked for a box since I didn't want them to get smashed in my purse and the girl gave me an ugly chinese carryout container instead of a Miette box. If I just spent $10 on macarons, they could at least give me a small box.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
OOPS for not trying their macaroons but instead GOING FOR THE GINGER SNAPS THAT ARE ON THE 7X7 SF 100 list of things to eat before you die!!

stopped by on my way through the ferry building & picked up a package of ginger snaps (they aren't sold individually)
----these THIN thin cookies really have a snap in texture & SPICE.. real ginger taste if you are game!

not to mention the decor & display cases are just SO CUTE & adorable!
author: Jenny S.

description:
Caramel panna cotta... TO DIE FOR. It's too bad they don't make it anymore, so my visits will halt for now and a star gets deducted :(. They offer the buttermilk one still, and also a chocolate pot de creme, both of which are good by most people's standards, but I'm not a huge chocolate fan, and I think the buttermilk one is kind of plain despite the fruit they top it with. 

The baked goods are a-ok in my book, pretty good but look better in presentation than in flavor. I just had to review to remind myself that they discontinued my absolute favorite dessert in SF.
author: Lily C.

description:
It's like something straight from a Wes Anderson movie!  Amazingly well curated candies from literally everywhere, from Oakland to tiny towns in Europe...
And the most amazing little macarons!  They have seasonal flavors like strawberry and grapefruit, and they're all-natural. No artificial coloring or flavors! 
Their bakery is right across the bridge in jack London square, and they get fresh deliveries daily, so the pastries are always crazy moist.  Also, their standard is perfection. I've never seen such beautiful, individually perfected pastries. 
I'm in love with the little shortbread cookies, particularly the brown butter, perfect as a side with a cup of tea. Their Ballpark Brittle is an ode to classic cracker jacks, and is featured in foodie articles practically every week.  The Miette ice cream sandwiches (my favorite being the creme fraiche and graham cracker sandwich) are the least diabetic sandwiches I've ever tried, small enough to not make your stomach hurt for the whole day. 
At least get a macaron, or try a slice of their incredibly light coconut mousse cake.  Whatever you get here, you're bound to experience something new and delicious.
author: Sebastian V.

description:
Voila Paris meets the Bay!

Being that Paris is my home away from home I know a thing or two about what a Parisian pastry should look and taste like.  They have their finger on the pulse of something great here.

While wondering through the Ferry building on a crowded Saturday I saw a vision in pink down one of the halls.  As I got closer I could see it was little mini French pastries.  So I stood in line because there was no way I was going to pass up trying one of these delicacies.

I got the lemon tart knowing that I would be able to taste any fraud in either the crust or lemon custard from the tart.  Low and behold as I bit into the tart it made my mouth water.  A rather embarrassing thing to have happen while you're eating in front of a lot of people but it did.

I was drooling and eating at the same time.  Had it not happen to me I would not think it possible.  So light, so delicate, so flakey, so rich, so DELICIOUS.  Just the right amount or tart and sweet all mixed together in a WONDEFUL little pastry.
I think my mouth is watering just remembering the taste.  They did an EXCELLENT JOB!  I don't know if the pastry chef is from Paris or trained there but they know what they are doing.

A definite must go see and taste while in San Francisco.  They also sell several flavors of macaroons as well and from what I saw people were standing in line with handfuls.  I also notice cakes as well and they looked just and good.  
If you're in the area give them a try.  You will not be disappointed!

In French...

Voila Paris rencontre la baie !

Que Paris est ma maison, je sais une chose ou deux au sujet de ce qu'une pâtisserie parisienne devrait regarder et le goût. Ils ont leur doigt sur le pouls de quelque chose de grand ici.

En demandais via le traversier s'appuyant sur un samedi bondé, j'ai vu une vision en rose dans une des salles. Comme j'ai se rapproche, je pouvais voir que c'était peu minis viennoiseries. Alors je me tenais en ligne parce qu'il n'y n'avait aucun moyen j'allais laisser passer essayer un de ces délicatesses.

J'ai reçu la tarte au citron sachant que je serais en mesure de goûter toute fraude dans la croûte ou citron crème de la tarte. Faible et voici que j'ai mordu dans la tarte il fait mon eau à la bouche. Une chose plutôt embarrassante d'avoir se produisent pendant que vous mangez devant beaucoup de gens, mais il l'a fait.

J'ai été baver et manger en même temps. Il avait à me n'arriver pas que je penserais pas possible. Si léger, si délicate, si flakey, si riche, si délicieux. Juste la bonne quantité ou au goût âpre et doux tous mélangés ensemble dans une magnifique petite pâtisserie.

Je pense que ma bouche arrose juste rappeler le goût. Ils ont fait un EXCELLENT travail ! Je ne sais pas si le pâtissier est de Paris ou formés il mais ils savent ce qu'ils font.

Une certaine doit aller voir et goût alors qu'à San Francisco. Ils vendent aussi plusieurs saveurs de macarons aussi bien et de ce que j'ai vu les gens sont tenaient en ligne avec poignées. Je remarque aussi des gâteaux aussi bien et ils ont regardé juste et bon. 

Si vous êtes dans le coin de leur donner un essai. Vous ne serez pas déçu !
author: Ryan P.

description:
Ah yes, Miette Patisserie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?userid=lj3rJy1dUuHMDnqU_OCfsA#18EgMY4l_adNugz0gmcVsQ)~

For the sweet-tooths out there, this is probably the go-to place for them. I was drawn to Miette by their amazing display case of cakes, candies, baked goodies and French macarons!

BROWNIE (**4 STARS**) - was choco-licious! Made with roasted walnuts, the tender chocolate brownie was decadent, divine and delivered morsels of choco-amazement to my taste buds. My boyfriend and I wanted more! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/miette-patisserie-san-francisco?userid=lj3rJy1dUuHMDnqU_OCfsA#bleahmVS6gzUAGtOAKTIjA)

FRENCH MACARON (hazelnut flavor, **2 STARS**) - was not that great. I'm sorry I've had much better French macarons elsewhere. Miette has a limited amount of flavors for their macarons. The shell of the macaron did not have that encasement shell that one would get once they bit into the cookie. In addition, the filling felt like it didn't really have much flavor - it just tasted like confectionary sugar in a solid cookie form. Sorry I wasn't feeling this. I'd rather have my French macarons from Bottega Louie (in LA). 

Although I didn't try everything at this sugar shack, I thought there some hits and misses. One thing's for sure - I will NOT purchase any French macarons from here, but will purchase another brownie or other baked goodies. I'll definitely drop by again in the future!

Yelp 2013 100+ Reviews Challenge (going for 200!) - Review #118
author: Kristen M.

description:
The macarons were different. It didn't have a smooth texture or bright colors that I'm accustomed to seeing. However, I mostly buy these as gifts for friends and relatives and they weren't a fan. I tried one out for myself and it didn't really have any features that would positively stand out for me. They're all pretty much the same color so I had trouble distinguishing which flavor I ate and therefore cannot comment. I will say their presentation is pretty fitting for small gifts if that's what you're looking for and the employees were very helpful. 

This bakery stand does present alternatives for your sweet tooth though. I saw some flavored marshmallows and meringue that seemed interesting and am inclined to come back to sample other items.
author: Quoc N.

description: This morning, I bought a couple of eclairs and a few macaroons from the Ferry Building store. Just sampled a few of them now and they are so delicious and fresh. Will come back again.
author: Osman G.

description:
So this is what Heaven tastes like?

This 5 STAR review is only for Miette's AMBROSIAL Macarons. 

My very first visit to Miette was when I was on a quest last year to put a dent into 7x7's List of  "100 Things to Try Before You Die": #49 - Miette's Gingersnaps. Being a hardcore ginger fanatic who will happily eat steamed rice with ginger-scallion sauce all day, everyday, I was sorely disappointed with the Gingersnaps. Although it had a nice crispy texture, the ginger "spice" was very overpowering and had a very sweet finish. I haven't had much luck with other items on the 7x7 List so it was that day I decided to end my pursuit with the 7x7 List. 

However, while visiting the Ferry Building one day, the whimsical rainbow of macarons sitting in the crystal-clear glass cookie jars caught my eye and were calling my name. These macarons totally redeemed Miette!

The macarons come in 7 flavors: Vanilla, Chocolate, Hazelnut, Pistachio, Strawberry, Rose-Geranium and Chocolate Lavender. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=VdVsk_bydzv1XO916lyw8Q

These circular pieces of heaven have an almond glazed crust that gives it a nice, crispy contrast to the fluffy and moist, cake-like center. The combination of the two creates the perfect toothsome chewy texture. The crème filling is lusciously thick and melts in your mouth like a fine triple cream butter. Vanilla is my favorite as the fragrant simplicity complements the almond glaze flawlessly. My only gripe is they're just several bites large so you have to S-A-V-O-R them slowly, making sure each bite is as sweetly divine as the first. 

At $1.75 a piece, these macarons are pricey but it's small price to pay for a little taste of heaven.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Bypass the gelato line next door and grab yourself a ridiculously awesome, lusciously handmade, and perfectly indulgent ICE CREAM SAMMIE at Miette. Yes, they've got more than just cookies! Strauss Creamery Lavender Honey Ice Cream slathered between two thin Miette Honey Grahams is about too much goodness for one mouth to handle. So, share a bite and watch your likeability factor soar. These sammies are magical.

And yes, the macaroons are worthy of ALL the hype. I thought macaroons were silly little cookies with too much air, not enough sink-your-teeth-into goodness, but Miette has proved me wrong with their dense, chewy, cream-filled pistachio gems. For $1.75, you really have nothing to loose. 

For the tough-to-please lady in your life, a gift from Miette just might do the trick.
author: Nique F.

description:
Macarons, yes.

Brownie, yes please.

Cupcakes, not my cup of tea.

Ginger Snaps, 7x7 must eat but not for me.

Chocolate Ice Cream Sandwich... MUST! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=Pk0wqu77QLacX4FNR35xZw)

Sold out today, but will be back!
author: Mike C.

description:
Good:
The store location is pretty convenient (just some blocks away from Bart station and Muni stops) and also it is a very touristy area. They have a good selection of desserts like puddings, cakes and muffins. But their specialty are the macaroons which are incredibly tasty and they also feel really good in your mouth (seriously the cookie is crunchy outside, soft inside and the filling is fruity refreshing and melts in your mouth)

Not so good:
The prices for the desserts are a little high (like the puddings and cakes), and apparently they are getting higher (before macaroons were $ 1.75 now I think they are $1.85, will it get even higher in the future?) 
Sadly certain flavors of macaroons run out really fast, so you better get them on time.
author: H C.

description:
I don't usually like macaroons, but there's are SO good! They're pretty pricey at ~$1.85 per macaroon, but they're well worth it. They also have a variety of other sweets to choose from. 

Try it!
author: Bernadette T.

description:
Macarons here taste super good....but $1.85 for one......REALLY hurts my wallet...especially since I want to just pop one into my mouth at a time instead of taking small nibbles trying to make the $1.85 last...

If they were $1 each...oh man I'd buy a dozen every week!

But right now it'll cost $11.10 for half a dozen...
author: Gabriel D.

description:
I really liked the macarons at Miette. They were better than any other macarons I've had elsewhere... Tastier than the colorful assortments they have at Bottega Louie in DTLA and softer than the choices at 'Lette in Pasadena. 

In fact, the macarons at Miette are devoid of any Easter color I've come to associate all macarons of having. Just brown, cream and thats pretty much it. There were 5 different flavors the day I was in the Ferry Building: chocolate, vanilla, chocolate lavander, hazelnut and rose geranium. I ordered 2 of each. My favorite, of course, was the hazelnut. Any item with hazelnut is pretty much my kryptonite and this little macaron was by far the tastiest of this flavor rich bunch. Bought a stack of Miettte's graham crackers for some friends and they really liked them. As well as the macarons that we didnt finish on the spot. It was too good NOT to share. Such a shame I'm over 360 miles away at the moment... If I were to leave now... Hmmm...
author: Chuck D.

description:
How I love your lavender shortbread. They used to be $5 per bag and now they're $6.50 per bag. Still worth it and the hassle of keeping them protected in my carry-on so they don't get crushed on their way back to LA!

Miette used to make my favorite cupcake - chocolate with vanilla buttercream and sprinkles. Best frosting in the world. The cake was more chalky than I remember but still delicious and decadent but not too sweet.
author: Susan K.

description:
Wow! 

Cute little store located in the Ferry Building. Lots of baked goods and sweets to choose from. We got some macarons (delicious) and an ice cream sandwich. We got the crème fraîche one. The ice cream portion was like a cheesecake flavored ice cream. Delicious! And the cookie portion??? Divine! 

They gave samples of their graham crackers, with a touch of honey and what they are known for. And this was no ordinary graham cracker! Sweet, soft, with a touch of honey, it was like a light buttery cookie. Wow! You could buy a package of these phenomenal graham crackers for $8.50 or get them paired with ice cream in the form of an ice cream sandwich (yes that was the cookie portion of it). 

So gosh darn good! I can't wait to come back and load up on those grahams!
author: Angelique M.

description:
I am a sucker for macarons and have tried ones from all over the world (Pierre Hermé Paris, Ladurée, Chez Cima). I even perfected my own recipe, from which I made several hundred macarons as favours for my wedding and later helped a friend make them for hers.

So when I spotted the macaron display at Miette Patisserie while wandering through the Ferry Building I had to try some. 

I picked up a box of four: Chocolate Lavender, Rose Geranium, Pistachio, Vanilla

Unfortunately I thought they were just okay. They had some technical issues that were quite obvious (e.g., almond flour not ground finely enough resulting in a bumpy/rough exterior) and I found the flavor balance a bit off in the floral ones. The vanilla one was my favorite of the bunch.

Wishing now I had picked up a cupcake instead as those looked quite lovely.
author: Gita R.

description:
I was showing a friend around the Ferry Buildings and we ended up buying sweets from here. Intention was to buy it to take home for later, but we ended up eating everything almost right away. 

My friend bought the lime meringue tart and the buttermilk panna cotta with fresh strawberries. 

Lime meringue tart was delightful. Fresh, tart, sweet. Graham crust was yummy. Boiled marshmallow topping on top (or at least, that's what I think it is) is awesome for sure. Recommend. 

Panna cotta, although adorable to look at, was not something that impressed me. Tasted good and fresh, but tasted like regular strawberry yogurt. I expected something more special. 

If you buy the desserts in a jar, you can return the jar and get a dollar back. Keep in mind.
author: Sofia R.

description: Cute little Shop of goodies. I wanted to try everything but I was super full from lunch. We had the almond shortbread cookies, it has a great crumbly texture and savory flavor. And one macaroon, the pistachio one, not sure how I was able to resist! Will be back for more
author: Linda L.

description:
Raising it up a star. Was tempted to buy macarons again (but resisted only to later buy some at Tout Sweet -haha). Realized that the macarons are actually well priced here even considering the size. $1.85. Normally, they are over $2 each. 

Ended up buying a chocolate cupcake with italian meringue icing for my daughter. She loves cupcakes. It was super messy, but the italian meringue was very good. Cupcake was moist and had a very rich chocolate flavor. Sometimes chocolate cupcakes disappoint in that regard. I didn't manage to try very much because my daughter wanted it all for her very self. 

Maybe will retry the macarons next time.
author: Nora S.

description: Only bought their Gingersnaps ($7.00) - 100 things to eat before you die. Pretty good! Inside the Ferry building. You can just check out the stuff on the table and against the counter. You'll get rung up on the lefthand side where the registers are. Staff are friendly, but not out of the ordinary. I must say the gingersnap cookie does live up to its expectations, only if you're into sweets. Everything is not for everyone. Everyone has their own preferences and opinions.
author: Tina N.

description:
I actually heard about Miette a couple of years ago and had been itching to go there eversince.  The first time I went too late as they've just closed for the day.  The second time around I made sure I was there early....I stocked up on all their yummies:  chocolate pots de creme, banana cream tart, 2 each of the macarons and lemon cream tart.  I devoured the macaons on the spot and couldn't finish the rest of them. So I brought them back home and they kept pretty well in the fridge for a few days.

Their style is really unique...especially their pretty little dainty cakes (Old Fashioned and Vanilla Tomboy) and the little rose deco is oh soooo cute.  

Well I will definitely be coming back next time in SF.  You rock Miette!
author: Sharr K.

description: Really bad customer service!!! I used to come here all the time before having a kid it's so sad that all of the old staffs are gone! I was so excited to get some sweets but customer service turned me down!
author: Nomiko B.

description: My employer likes to order cakes from Miette for when we do our birthday celebrations.  As such, I've had a few of their cakes now- the Old-fashioned, the Scharffen Berger, the Lemon Debutante, the Gingerbread, a special order Princess Cake, and I've also had an eclair at their storefront.  Hands down my favorite are the lemon and the gingerbread.  I recommend  them.
author: Joselyn P.

description: So glad I happened across this cute establishment while wandering around the ferry building. I was drawn to the chocolate wafers despite the price tag! The description talked about dark chocolate and sea salt...that was enough to catch my attention. However the best part was the friendliness of the staff. I was debating what to get and I ended in a long conversation with a woman working at the store regarding the difference between the different cookies and the process of making them. As someone who loves to bake I loved getting more info from the staff and stuck to my initial decision to get the dark chocolate wafers with sea salt.
author: Allie S.

description:
I went here to get some macaroons and a mini Scharffen Berger. 
The chocolate orange macaroons were pretty good. They were chewy and I liked how they were on display in glass jars. They weren't too sweet and had just the right amount of chocolate. 
The cake was below par. The ganache was thick and delicious, but you feel sick after eating a couple of bites. The inside wasn't very moist and very crumbly which made it hard to eat.
author: Kristy K.

description:
This review is for their service and Christy Ann.  For the longest time, I was looking for the corrected version of their cookbook (the ones at Costco and at Amazon had typos or errata in them).  It appears the only place to get the amended cookbook was through their website.  

Well I wasn't going to pay for shipping since I'm in SF so on a lark, I emailed the store to see whether I can pick up the book there.  Christy Ann was very prompt in her response and she was able to get an autographed copy of the book for me.  The best thing was the book was on hold at the store for me.  Same price sans shipping.

Christy Ann said that whatever is on sale at the website, but not stocked at the Ferry Bldg store, can be ordered and routed to their store.

Thanks for the book Christy Ann!
author: Wendy H.

description:
I can only vouch for their Graham Cracker cookies.  OMG...buttery, not too sweet, crispy & tasty morsels.  For $7/box they are pricey but well worth the indulgence.  

The line for the bakery case was pretty long so I just picked up a few boxes of the Graham Craker cookies and walked right up to the cash register.  I'd have to agree with Lorraine P that the counter help are b-tches.  But for those tasty Graham Cracker cookies...hell I'd walk over glass to get me one.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Yummm!!! I came here right after having lunch and got their chocolate truffle tartlette and I loved it.  They didn't have milk which I needed so badly with this devilishly good chocolate that I ended up going right across them at this grocery like store to get some. I really didn't know what to expect from it and wasn't looking for anything tart. I was assuming it would be tart because it contained the word tartlette.  Instead,  it was a nice and smooth chocolate taste and even the crust surrounding it gave it a nice compliment.  I ate this with my niece and almost every bite,  I was like hmmm and yummm. 

One of the downside to this place is, it's kinda pricy. I mean for one dessert, it was $6. But hey,  it's good so I guess I can't really complain.  

I would definitely come back.
author: Loreto D.

description:
Talk about pretty in pink!  Miette is a cute girly little French bakery filled with cupcakes, cookies, candies and other pretty pastries. Not sure why the girls behind the counter are such b-tches though.  If I worked in a bakery, I'd be plump and jolly.

We got 4 different macarons and sadly, they didn't do anything for me. The flavors all tasted similar and they were a bit on the dry and dense side (maybe that's why those girls were not so happy).  I was told that they're not baked on premises, so that may explain it.  Next time I'll go with a cupcake.  Hopefully it's just as tasty as it is cute.
author: Lorraine P.

description: Soft macarons with a whipped inside. I prefer and expect the chewiness and gel like center of a macaron with a gentle bite from the exterior. This macaron reminds me more of a soft cookie...I liked the pistachio flavor though. Also got the chocolate cupcake with vanilla buttercream. The frosting is very buttery with a top solid texture. Not a fan. The carrot cupcake with cream cheese frosting was good though!
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Macaron Review:

They had a decent variety of flavors.

The texture was okay, I was worried that it would be crumbly since I saw some bad ones in the display, but the one I had was much better than some of the places I've been to recently.

The flavor was lacking.  It tasted too much like sugar, instead of the labeled flavors.
author: Jason S.

description: This little store inside the Ferry Building is one of my favorite shops in that building. Whenever I am in town I want to come here. They have yummy cupcakes and macarons. I especially love their gingerbread cupcake. Very unique flavor and so moist. I'm pretty picky about cupcakes but the last time I was in town I came back twice in one weekend. I knew I should have just purchased a batch.
author: Madison D.

description: Was roaming around the ferry building and spotted the macarons here. Being fans of the little French cookies, we had to get some. They only had 4 flavors that day. I got the green tea one and the grapefruit one. My friends got the crème brulee and chocolate ones. None particularly stood out taste or flavor wise. And I was excited to try the grapefruit as I'd never seen that flavor before. It was just sweet and citrus-y. The shell part was also dark and spotty like they used almond meal rather than almond flour. It was different. The shell was soft and chewy and the filling was creamy, like buttercream texture. Next time I'm back at the ferry building and if they have other flavors, I may try them again.
author: Alison W.

description:
The chocolate sables and lavender shortbread cookies are the best things they sell here. Some of their cakes are actually quite good (I loved the grapefruit cream one back in the day) but the macarons and cupcakes range from good-ish to average. Don't bother with the pretty candies they sell. Most of them are overpriced and don't actually taste that good. Their caramels are unfortunately kind of amateurish. I was excited to buy a bag ($12 for 8!) but they were disappointing. The sea salt caramels aren't salty at all and the chocolate caramels taste like liquified See's lollipops. At $1.50 each, there are better caramels out there.

Warning: if you try to order the shortbread cookies online, you should know you'll be receiving a bag full of crumbs. I know from my experience of buying them online, complaining to them at receiving crumbs, asking them to resend, complaining again about crumbs. Maybe one day they'll figure out a better way to mail them but for now, you should really just buy them in person. They did refund my money which was nice of them. 

4 stars for the chocolate sables and lavender shortbread. Also, I love their decor and Meg was really nice to me back in the day when I was a regular.
author: Annie C.

description:
I am in love with their macarons, no food coloring and not too sweet. My favorite so far is the hazelnut and the chocolate orange. It can be hard to tell the flavors apart since they all look about the same, but once you bite into one, you'll know which one it is
. 
The price is $1.85 each, they do have boxes for 7-8, 11-12 or more but the macarons are sold at individual prices, no set price for a box. 

The back wall is lined with a assortment of candies ranging from chocolate to gummies.

 The people who work there are friendly and helpful, quick service. Miette has become my favorite place for macarons, most likely will come every time I have a craving for one.
author: Jen M.

description:
Best macaroons, black forest, lemon tart, sea salt caramel chocolate tart, pot de creme and carrot cake in town. The rest of the stuff is good too. They are partially responsible for the extra pounds I have ;) 

Love this place and recommend it to everyone with a sweet tooth.
author: Balu V.

description:
I took my cousin and sister here when we visited SF during Christmas Break! 

I tried one of their Rose Macaroons and a Chocolate Cupcake. I loved the macaroon and how thick and rich it was...but I wasn't really a fan of the cupcake. It tasted like a Smore's cupcake to be honest, with marshmallow tasting icing with gooey consistency. 

The decor is really fancy and cute though.
author: Jeanette S.

description: I consider myself a bit of a macaron connoisseur, and this place rates high on the list for French macarons in the Bay Area, but these should be closer to the bottom of the list. The shell is too mealy, too grainy, the filling is a buttercream which just feels like a cop out. The flavors all blend together, as it's just sweet buttercream and the same mealy almond cookie shell. I tried Grapefruit, Hazelnut and some flavor I have already forgotten. Barely distinctive and they looked identical. Please, do try Chantal Guillon if you truly want a delicious, unique from one flavor to the next, made with fillings that are not overly sweet buttercream, French macaron.
author: Yolanda B.

description:
Their Caramel Panna Cotta is TO DIE FOR! Not only that, you take home a tiny/cute glass container which is great to use for anything in the kitchen for storage, etc.

They are located in the Ferry Building and their shop is super cute! They have various sweets and goods from macarons to cookies, to chocolate, and cupcakes... Since I only had their Panna Cotta, which was amazing, I'll go back any day to try anything else.

A little on the pricey side, but a great place to think of for a special treat. :)
author: Sammie T.

description:
Love this lil bakery shop 
Perfect treats with coffee
Gotta try all of their yummy macaroons
And cookies
They also have rose drop candy from France
author: Mochi A.

description:
I got some macarons for $1.80 per cookie.  Tried four flavors: chocolate, choc lavender, rose geranium, and vanilla.  The macarons are as advertised!  Soft, chewy, and the filling not too overly sweet.  I can't NOT buy any when I pass by a Miette Patisserie location. 

One of these days, I need to buy something else here other than macarons.  I guess that's why it's called an obsession!!

Friendly staff was very helpful, even helped me put into a box and wrap it in string instead of a wax paper bag.

Definitely worth a stop here if passing through the Ferry Building.
author: Ben H L.

description:
The happy hour macarons are only at the Hayes Valley location!

Regardless, the macarons I bought were quite delicious. It was a little on the crumbly side instead of the chewy side, but the flavors were spot on for the most part. Grapefruit & hazelnut were my faves. Pistachio didn't have much of the pistachio flavor and rose geranium was just too flowery for me.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
On my way back to work I noticed the cover of the box was open. The macarons looked so crowded in that tiny box, the cover just won't close. A bit of the cream ended up on the box, too. The macarons were hastily packed. Now one of them is crushed! How about some TLC next time, huh? 

In response, the manager has offered a free macaron. Nice gesture, no doubt. But I can't think about that now. I have to nurse that poor, crushed macaron.
author: K T.

description:
OH EM GEE. For some bizarre reason I am always to full after my trips to the ferry building to even attempt at getting anything for dessert. But I've finally gotten around to pick and try a few treats from Miette and I so, so regret not purchasing anything from them every time I've been there before! 

Possibly the cutest of the ferry building shops, their pastel themed bake stand cannot be missed. First I picked up a cupcake and a few macarons. After I had devoured one cupcake, IT WAS TOO GOOD I HAD TO COME BACK FOR ANOTHER ONE. And this was also after I got a Humphrey Slocombe cone nearby lolol. DON'T JUDGE ME but their cupcakes are so, so good. 

Chocolate cupcake with Coffee Buttercream: OMG. SO GOOD. I CAN'T. I've been having a mighty guiness & baileys sort of cake for the longest time. But with St. Patty's not coming up anytime soon, I knew I just had to check this cake out. The cupcake was so moist! The chocolate was perfectly bittersweet. AND DAT BUTTERCREAM. Light, fluffy, and buttery. Moment on the lips, forever on the hips but DAYUM.

Chocolate cupcake with Italian Meringue: SAME DELICIOUS CUPCAKE BUT WITH THIS AMAZING, SILKY MERINGUE. The marshmallow like cream was smooth and perfect! 

I'm not too much of a macaron fanatic, but these were great! I've heard they use a slightly different almond flour for their macarons, and they aren't down for artificial food coloring which would explain theirs aren't as bright. I recommend the rose and chocolate lavender for floral goodness.  

They need to expand to south bay because it's just so so far away from me... :C
author: Kero D.

description: I would pass up on stopping here next time we visit.  Everything in the shop ls beautiful and very expensive but tasted terrible.  The cupcake was very coarse and dense and the coconut cake had a weird gelatin like filling.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Those salted caramels haunt my dreams. Gooey, creamy, salty, wonderful. I've given them as gifts a number of times and the recipients were always very pleased.

I think the vintage-y, Pinterest-esque decor in the store makes it significantly more appealing than it might otherwise be... but it's nice to be surrounded in colorful kitsch every once in a while. It's a fun stop if you're in Jack London Square or Hayes Valley, and makes for a nice store front and a good addition to a trendy neighborhood.
author: Orr R.

description: Bought a few cupcakes and they are dry and way too sweet. The frosting tasted like pure butter.
author: Giovanna R.

description:
I was so excited to see the cute presentation of the storefront and baked goods. In turn, I was equally excited to try the pistachio and strawberry macarons that I purchased. 

I don't know if I heard incorrectly, but a woman that walked by asked if they were gluten free and the girl working there told her yes. That might have something to do with the fact that I did not find them enjoyable at all. I should probably stop by again some time to see if any of their other pastries would be delicious. 

I ate leftover pizza for lunch earlier today and poured myself a cold cup of milk as I sat down to indulge in my macarons. They didn't have that initial crispness that I always look for. The inside of the pastry wasn't chewy, but almost dry. It seemed very grainy to me. And they didn't taste sweet at all. I've never thrown away a macaron before, but I threw away the last half of the strawberry one that I was trying to finish. 

I'm so bummed. Maybe I'll give their macarons another chance when I return to the Ferry Building.
author: Venna Q. T.

description:
Yet another favorite stop when visiting the Ferry Building.  They have delicious baked goods that are adorably packaged. My favorites are the gingersnaps which I definitely love. I'm not just speaking off the cuff - gingersnaps and gingerbread is kind of my thing, sooooo I know what I'm talking about! Ha!! These are not traditional in that they are extra firm, rather than chewy, but gingery and sweet.  Another favorite is the lemon shortbread - buttery and light, with a hint of lemon. 

My friend loves the pot de creme - but its so tiny, served in a small jar (very cute), so I'm thinking it would be torture because you'll likely want way more!!  :-) They need bigger serving size for sure!!
author: Coreen L.

description: I was the only person in line right in front of the dessert case and there were two white ladies behind me just browsing looking around to see what they had. When the worker asked who was next in line I raised my hand and said nicely "oh me!" And what was I invisible to the worker? Or did she just want to help the white women and not me? Obviously I was next in line and ready to order, but she totally ignored me until the other women said that they weren't ready yet. Already pissed I ordered three macaroons, a rose, chocolate lavander, and green tea. And when she handed me the little Baggie I see the green tea macaroon is smashed because the green cream is smeared all over the bag. Didn't even offer me a new one. Horrible service.
author: Linz C.

description:
The pink walls of Miette are inviting, as is their display table of perfectly square shaped cookies with rounded edges atop lacy mats and their counter of princess cakes, chocolate and vanilla cupcakes, chocolate eclairs, and fruit tartlettes.

My favorites will forever be Miette shortbread cookies, the flavors which I've all sampled. Chocolate chip, lavender, peanut butter, walnut, lemon, and gingerbread. Buying a bag and bringing it home is like Christmas Day. It's a little present to yourself.

Their princess cake unfortunately wasn't spectacular, and after trying it once I've never purchased another one. The texture of the cake was not particularly moist and the chocolate cocoa was not particularly rich.

My most recent visit to Miette I purchased their raspberry rose tartlette, a small fruit tart that would have otherwise been the same found anywhere save for the rose infused thick cream. Each mouthful was a combination of firm crust, thick aromatic filling, and plump raspberry.
author: Cici T.

description:
What a cute, pretty, little gem.

You're definitely paying for quality, presentation, and the whole package here!  $5 bought me a chocolate lavendar macaron and a gingerbread cupcake.  The macaron was one of the best I've ever had in life (you do have high hopes for $1.75/macaron); it was gooey, chewy, and the egg white part was delicate. The lavendar wasn't overpowering at all.  

Cream cheese frosting topped the gingerbread cc, and it was fresh, delicious, and inhaled by me in 10.2 seconds. 

Thanks for the pick-me-up, Miette!
author: Tricia D.

description:
Holy $#!*

We ordered two cupcakes: one carrot cake and one chocolate. Bliss.

We also bought a package of semisweet nonpareils. They seemed a bit pricey at first at $8 a pop, but after we got home we agreed that they were well worth it.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Mini Scharffen Berger Cake: Moist chocolate cake covered with 2 layers of bittersweet chocolate ganache. Oh my goodness, so delicious!! So many cute choices to select from at this little shop, but this dessert in particular, when I laid my eyes upon this mini cake, I knew I had to try it. I'm still not entirely sure what ganache is, but I know that it tastes amazing. This cake was very rich, very chocolatey. So good. Wow.
author: Christina L.

description:
I missed my ferry by 3 minutes thanks to ridiculous Market St traffic congestion, so to console myself, I decided to check out Miette Patisserie.

The raspberry creme cake was pretty tasty and not too sweet, but despite being a rather large size, I still found the $6 price tag a bit steep for what you get. 

I also got one of each flavor of macaron:

Chocolate lavender: Fragrant and light, but the lavender flavor is a little hard to detect
Rose geranium: Unique and delicious
Raspberry: Pretty forgettable
Vanilla: A nice, tasty basic flavor, good for those new to macarons
Pistachio: Nutty and delicious
