Hazelnut: My favorite because I love hazelnut, but even if you don't, you'll enjoy the sweet, rich, cocoa-like flavor
Chocolate: Solid, like the vanilla

Unfortunately, while everything was pretty good quality, I just can't give this place more than three stars. It's a little overpriced and the people behind the counter are so stuck-up. The girl who helped me didn't crack a single smile the entire time we were interacting. I don't know if they think that this is how people in French bakeries operate, but having actually lived in France, I can say that it's not customary to get so much snootiness from your patisserie.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I couldn't try many items here, as they all contain wheat; I believe the only gluten free products are the macaroons and the custard. However, I must say their macaroons were absolutely delicious--light, creamy, and pillow like. It was just...ugh. It was almost an out of body experience, eating these little cookies. Let me tell you that. At $1.85 for a single bite or two, I just purchased six: two vanilla, two pistachio, and two hazelnut.

Just delicious.
author: Nadir G.

description:
So this place has a book. For good reason. The baked goods look pretty. They taste pretty. And they make you want to get fat.

I've come here on several occasions. 

I bought my fiance his birthday cake from here and it was a GORGEOUS and delicious cake! It had nice plump fresh strawberries on top and ladyfingers that rimmed the cake. 

The macarons aren't the best I've ever had but they do the job. They aren't overly sweet which I appreciate but it's not like it was an explosion of flavor in my mouth either.

My coworker brings back Gingersnap cookies for the team which I have to say might be my absolute favorite thing from here. It is perfect, crunch, and so flavorful so don't expect a soft chewy bland cookie!
author: Michelle T.

description: I like Miette and I love the Ferry Building, but something about this Miette location in the Ferry Building doesn't appeal to me. The other locations have the quaint, boutique shop that I associate with the brand. This little stand seems too constrained and lackluster in its display of candies and treats compared to the other store locations. The macarons are delicious without a doubt, but flavors are natural and subtle, traditional and not too inventive. They are also not vibrantly colored like what other stores offer. I'm a fan of the old fashioned cupcake. The other cupcakes are good too. The frosting is buttery and not as stiff as it looks. It has a high ratio of frosting to cake. The panna cotta is ok. The Scharffenberger cake is crazy chocolatey. Hot cocoa is to sipping chocolate as chocolate cake is to this Sharffenberger chocolate cake, if you know what I mean.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Pistachio macaroon was good, The rose macaroon was also good. They were both better than your average macaroon

guinness cupcake (voted top ten dessert in US by Alton Brown) was grand, although I would not have put it in top ten, still grand nonetheless

I have to mention, I really enjoyed the colloquial cupcake girl behind the counter. She was nice.
author: renje g.

description: Well if a cupcake isn't even buy the whole cake. That's exactly what I did. I took one look and it was a easy choice. Shared it of course. lol. Well no I really did. Although it was gone right away. Love the chocolate old fashioned cake. MMMMM drool. Lots of candies too. The turkish delight was great. The peanut brittle was pretty good. Get the cake or cup cake.
author: Jamie S.

description:
I never get out of here spending less than 40 bucks, and such a small bag...  But good things come in small packages.  This is an amazing place.  I was first seduced by their French macaroons- because I'd had those at Bouchon, and was too lazy to make them myself, and the frozen ones at Trader Joes just aren't good enough.  The rose geranium macaroons?  Pure heaven.  Even at almost 2 bucks a pop.  And those "graham crackers"- they aren't like any graham cracker you've ever had.  They are more like thin honey short bread.  They are just sinfully delicious.  The first time i bought them I only bought one package- big mistake.  I was so sad when they were gone.  Now I buy several, and hide them.

You WILL love this place.  I can't imagine anyone not loving it.  Just know that it will be expensive, but if it wasn't, California would be a much fatter state.  It's a Good Thing we can't eat as much at Miettte as we might want to.
author: Alex M.

description: Bish, PLEASE. Them macaroons thangs are on HIT. Git some.
author: Vi T.

description:
I came for the macarons because that's what I'd heard about - and they were delicious! The shell gently cracks to give way to a dense, chewy interior. And because their pistachio macaron isn't lime green, you know it's all real.


But as delightful as the macarons were, the most memorable were the fleur de sel caramels! Although it seemed a little pricy at $1.50 each, it's good for three buttery luscious bites. And they travel well if you can find the generosity to share.
author: Lydia N.

description: I've heard many good things about Miette, so of course I had to stop by. Like most bakeries, it's adorable - the decor, pastel colors, and packaging. There were a lot of treats available, so it made decisions that much harder. I settled on their shortbread cookies packaged in adorable polka dot bags. There were four flavor choices and I chose Lavendar and Lemon (each were $6.50). They are so, so yummy!! They have a wonderful texture, slightly soft, buttery, and the flavors are perfectly subtle. Some floral products can be overwhelming, but this hand-picked Eatwell Farms' lavender is very nice. I wish I had more time to admire everything available in the shop, but I will make sure to do so next time. The young lady behind the counter was so kind when assisting us and we felt welcomed.
author: Amelinda L.

description:
The office ordered the Lemon Debutante cake for my birthday for $60 and it was the worst cake I have ever had.  Described as with a "light buttercream frosting" the frosting was heavy and like solid ultra sweet butter..it was like eating a stick of butter.
The cake itself was heavy and dense and the lemon flavor hit you like a ton of bricks.
And it was overwhelmingly sweet.....I threw the left over cake away.  Just not enjoyable.  I think I dont appreciate French cakes.  I recommend Ladyingers Bakery in Oakland where I tried the Pirate Rum Cake and it was superb at half the price.
author: Margaret L.

description: I'm no macaron expert, but the ones I had here were heavenly. I had the vanilla and hazelnut. I'll be back to try other flavors and goodies :)
author: Sammie B.

description: I love Miette patisserie! Such delectable selection of cookies, caramels and Macarons! I love that the desserts aren't artificially colored or flavored and each piece is carefully hand crafted. I love the delicately rose flavored Macarons the best. All were perfectly sandwiched by a generous shmear of buttercream frosting. I had a variety of Macarons on my last visit with a Blue bottle bevvy, it was an absolutely perfect way to while away the afternoon, while watching the ferries come in. I came back later that week for some shortbread and fleur de sel caramels- all equally delectable. A must visit for a sweet treat in San Francisco.
author: J T.

description:
OMG OMG OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I wish there was a shop here in Seattle!!!!! My aunt and I stumbled upon this place when we were on vacation and visited the Ferry Building. This experience was very bitter sweet for me. Sweet because this place BY FAR has the best macarons i have EVER tasted and bitter because i realized that i can't have them very often because i live in Washington. 

ok did i mention that they have good macarons? every other place i've tried could never compare to Miette. Sign -_-. the macarons aren't too sweet and they don't taste artificial at all. i didn't get to try all of the flavors, but the ones that i did try (strawberry and chocolate) blew my mind. 

wahhhhhhh Miette i love you SO MUCH :(
author: Michelle L.

description:
My first time having macarons was overseas at a Lindt chocolate cafe. So, I have this guideline that a macaron is suppose to have a nice light crisp crust that contrasts with a smooth and flavorful evenly spread out filling. The bite and mouth feel is part of the experience. It's also fun when you have a variety of flavors and colors. (http://static3.px.yelp.com/photo/ensObseBfg9KNTGu3zglpQ/l)

Miette didn't have a huge variety of macaron flavors, maybe only about 5 or 6. We ordered a hazelnut, chocolate, pistachio, vanilla. I couldn't tell which one was which outside of the chocolate because they all pretty much looked the same. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=3FxndcIkDkX_lfXY1dJoFQ) 

The macarons weren't too sweet but I'd say they were more bland than anything. These also didn't have the contrast in texture that I liked.  The chocolate macaron tasted more like a brownie and even had that similar chewy mouth feel. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=LmHIanpuaTL30MV4wWg1IQ)
 
I'd like to one day maybe see and try a macaron and cheese flavor.
author: Earl G.

description: We bought a carrot cupcake and two macaroons- pistachio and rose. I enjoyed everything... My picture of what's left is the proof of that. I really liked the fact that they didn't use too strong of the artificial color for the pistachio. Reasonably priced. Would come again!
author: Hari P.

description: Cutest little patisserie in the Ferry building! Huge assortment of pastries and sweets. All around best macarons I've ever had!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Swung by here last weekend to pick up 2 macarons as gifts for a friend. Selected Rose & Pistachio flavors. They looked so cute and dainty. My friend appreciated and loved the yumminess. :)
author: Yonnie C.

description:
Ever since I've tried the Miette in Hayes Valley, I've been completely hooked and obsessed!  

However, this one's not just a cute little pink candy store.. they also sell cupcakes, desserts, pastries!  Oh, it was the end of me once I walked up to the counter.  

Once again, the pistachio macarons are amazing!  You cannot go wrong with these little guys.  They also package them up in cute little boxes - great for gifts!  The cupcakes looked oh-so tempting, but I will proudly admit, I did refrain from over indulging there.  However, I must come back next time and try something else (it'll be so hard to pass-up the macarons).  

Beware, prices can add up.  Don't just order what your eyes are telling you to... I've learned my lesson.

I'm always prancing away as a happy little girl every time I leave Miette.  Love it!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Tried this place for the first time on my visit with family for holidays!!

These are the types of macaroons you will never find in grocery stores!
This will now be a traditional location to visit since it entirely topped off traditional boxes macaroons (but who would want to settle with that when it's made fresh with perfected technique?)

These are the types of macaroons that will top Trader Joes, Costco, and other convenient store macaroons ANYWAY


Forget it, Miette owns because that's how GENUINE FRENCH MACAROONS are done; like a boss 

2 stars for staff and service
3 stars for genuine technique, fresh products
author: Libby A.

description: My first time at Miette was at the Jack London square storefront - loved their pistachio macarons. This was my first time at the Ferry location and I enjoyed their carrot cake cupcake - very most and not too sweet. Great addition to the Ferry building for a quality dessert after dinner.
author: Briget P.

description:
This may have been the first place I had a cupcake years ago once the upscale cupcake revolution began. I fell in love with the "old-fashioned" even though it did not represent any cupcake I had in my youth.

It's a rich chocolate cake with creamy marshmallowy topping and a piece of hard red candy on top. Is it a nut?

Since then I've tried many upscale cupcakes and now I'm a bit more savvy a consumer. The other day while foraging at the Ferry building I picked up 2 of their cupcakes and 2 macaroons. One of the macaroons was the rose geranium and I have to say it was a little bit of heaven. It's a tad less expensive than most macaroons ($1.75 vs. $2/each) which is a bonus. The other one was chocolate coffee...nice...but nothing unusual.

The cupcakes were the old-fashioned and a gingerbread with cream cheese frosting. So the old-fashioned chocolate cake is not as wonderful as the Feel Good Bakery and the topping didn't wow me like I remember. But this gingerbread cupcake was a keeper!
author: Leslie K.

description:
This is a bakery located in the Ferry Building which hits a big 4 stars because of their tasty macarons. 

The staff was very generous in giving us free crackers before we purchased anything. On my visit, I was lucky to purchase the pistachio and hazelnut macarons which are one of the more popular items at this location. One bite and my taste buds were dancing. It was chewy which I preferred and the flavor was abundent.

Stop by to enjoy a quick bite and a smile.
author: Santi T.

description:
This review is only for the French macaroons. 

I was thinking with the cupcake fad now fading (thank goodness), people might discover other pleasures and French macaroons might be the next trend.  I've been thinking about making some, but I've never tried any.  I was in the Ferry Building and here was my chance.

I had the chocolate, the hazelnut, and vanilla.  They were exquisite.  What surprised me was that they were sweeter than I had predicted (love that!).

The only negative I can think of is the price point.  $2 for a very small cookie is a bit much.  It may be why French macaroons may not be the next big thing.

Having only tried Miette's French macaroons, and having no point of comparison, I'll give it 5-stars based on my initial reaction: these are delicious!
author: TennisBum P.

description: Turkish delight was very tasty and reasonably priced. Quick Service. Friendly employees. Great location in the ferry building.
author: scott h.

description:
This is an UBER cute dessert shop for any sweets lover! Their displays couldn't be any cuter or more girly, which just made me squeal with delight!! 

I forced my fiance to buy me a macaroon, even though they cost $1.75 each. Pretty steep in my opinion, but then again... we're used to Bottega Louie and 'Lette, so it wasn't that much of a shocker. Miette's macaroons are definitely different than most macaroons - they use a really light buttercream for the center, the cookies are softer, and they seem to contain less sugar. 

I tried the pistachio macaroon, which is supposedly their most popular flavor. The flavor wasn't too strong, but I enjoyed the cake-like texture of the cookie! Nonetheless, I think I still prefer the crispy, slightly crunchy texture of the macaroons at 'Lette, which is my FAVORITE macaroon place of all time. But, Miette has good macaroons if you like softer textured baked goods. Or have sensitive teeth. Or both.

We also picked up some of their famous ginger cookies, which I am planning on using to make ice cream sandwiches with soon! I will report back once I try them ;)
author: Nancy T.

description:
I can't get enough of their macarons!
Hazelnut, pistachio, chocolate...all so good....My favorite is the pistachio, its not too sweet with just the right nuttiness...
Thank god I live in NYC, bc otherwise I will be there everyday.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
Thought it was going to be more about pretty presentation and less about flavor.

Usually places that make things so pretty always seem to lack in taste.
They really get it right here.  Best of both worlds.

Macaroons were good, but the banana cream pie was so delicious that we were tempted to buy another one, when we were only a few steps away from leaving. Did not even compare to the crap at Tartine.

I regret not trying out their cupcakes and tarts.  Next time though.
author: Enjella L.

description:
Needed a little pick-me-up or two after two weird happenings early on Friday. Walking to this place, I saw so many people everywhere along the Embarcadero taking pics/video recording the jets (planes) since it was Fleet Week. Really..I could care less. 

I got the mini Schaffenberger cake which was soo yummy & decadent. I love! Then I wanted to try the chocolate cupcake w/ italian frosting which was okay. The frosting was pretty good, but the cake part was pretty dry. 

Then if you want a bag, they would charge 10cents. But you really don't need one.
author: Amy C.

description: Im looking for cake for an important last minute meeting. I know these cakes are worth the $30 I was willing to spend!!!!  I could have walked to SAFEWAY!!there are TWO people behind the counter. One is washing dishes and the other is taking a phone order. I patiently wait for her to end her call. She does, and then sits down in front of the computer with cell phone in her hand saying she needs to call someone back... Not talking to me just looking at me while talking to her coworker whos still washing dishes. Rude... Better cheaper bakery on the other side of the building! I never give bad reviews but this one took the CAKE.
author: Ms C.

description:
Do I still feel the same way about Miette as I did from my first review... you betcha!

They are consistent with their product -the macarons are absolutely delish. Stopped by in here to get some for Dave's family to try and both his mom and dad loved em!

The service was friendly with a smile!
author: Sheila P.

description:
Love the ferry building and love roaming through Miette when I do. Who doesn't love sweets right? 

Miette's macarons are good but not the absolute best. They have all the traditional flavors however, and coffee was good. 

I've yet to try any of their mini cakes and should since Miette is known for them. Their cookbook is great as well. I've tried a few recipes and the results were fantastic.
author: Amy P.

description:
Where should I start on my 1st SF/East Bay Vacay Yelping...ooh, I know, about these ^_____^: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=WuNA4AtqZvqTm-cZsDe7sg.

These guys are located in the historic, market-filled Ferry Building during a short Embarcadero trip w/ Daniel L.  Inside this building lays Miette, which not only bakes these naturally colored, beautifully speckled, giant (3-inch) macs--i.e. none of that chemically colored dyes--but they also specialize in confections, ice cream sandwiches, other cookies, & cupcakes (unfortunately I didn't spot any RVC during this vacay).

But b/c we were on a mac hunt that day, I only bought 4 at $1.75 each, & here I go with the frenzied descriptions...

-Chocolate Lavender:  Ok, I adored how I can ascertain both the decadent chocolate & heavenly lavender at once.  But I will warn to friends who aren't comfortable w/ the floral part touching their sweet receptors w/in their precious, foodie tongue.

-Vanilla:  It's an okay vanilla flavor, but it's pretty invigorating.

-Hazelnut:  It's a bit too quiet--not as strong as the flavor of Nutella--but man how this pairs perfectly with my coffee.

-Rose Geranium: Well I don't really know how a geranium flower smells like, but I could distinguish that lovely, rosy "perfume" without being toOoOoOo perfume-y.  Ahh, this one's my all-time Miette favorite xD.

And of course I'm not leaving this review about the textures.  It has the fine, roughly thin crunch w/o making an annoying mess, & within the exterior shells contained a nicely dispersed cakey-ness while comfortably sandwiching the very creamy ganache on all four Parisian almond cookies.  In the end, I do give the non-adventurous flavors a 3, but the florally exotic ones get a 4.

So for your future SF journey & are interested, have fun mac-hunting, too ;)!
author: Fia R.

description:
The boyfriend & I are trying to knock off as many items on the 7x7 Big Eats lists as we can so after catching up with a friend @ La Boulange de Market (read my review), we strolled over to the Ferry Building & started checking things off.

First on the list: Ginger snaps.  Beautifully golden brown sparkling with sugar, these babies looked good.  UNfortunately, they were way too hard to bite into & the ginger flavor quickly gave way to a buttery after taste that was quite off-putting.  In addition to the cookies, I got a Chocolate macaron & a Chocolate lavender macaron.  Neither was very flavorful & they did not have the crispy shell that I had previously experience.

You stuff looks good, Miette; but that's about it.  Sigh.
author: Karen S.

description:
It's been a while since I ate that beautiful box of 6 macarons all in one sitting during my visit to SF last spring, but I still recall that Miette's has the best macarons I've tasted to this day. I'm so glad my friend managed to drag my butt to the embarcadero location or I would've really missed out!

I tried the pistachio, chocolate, and hazelnut. I'm pretty sure I loved them all equally. The shell was perfectly crunchy and the cookie was chewy with just the right sweetness. It didn't taste like I was biting into early diabetes, which is always a plus. The only thing that would make Miette even better is if they came out with a salted caramel macaron. Then I would just set up camp in the Ferry building and refuse to leave even if they threatened to call security at closing time to drag me out.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Love Miette's, but here's wedding info in a nutshell:

$3 cupcakes each, $10 cake slice each, cute cupcakes, not super sweet, organic, but limited flavors. 

My choices:  gingerbread w/cream cheese frosting, choco + choco buttercream, yellow + strawberry or raspberry buttercream
author: Peg S.

description:
I admit it. I am NOT over the cupcake craze.  I know, I know, a lot of you are.  But I am firmly hanging on.  I love cupcakes.

I certainly love Miette's cupcakes.  I've had lots of them.   Old Fashioned, Chocolate, and Yellow Lemon get hearty votes from me.  Oh, and their gingerbread cupcake deserves some love too.  I even included some in my Valentine's day gift bag.  Needless, to say, they were a hit.  Brownie points or is that cupcake points for me.

Let's not forget the macarons. You can drop some of their chocolate macarons by my deserted island anytime.  

Some day, one of two things are going to happen.  So that I can try some, I am going to buy some lucky person a cake from there or someone is going to buy one of their cakes for a very lucky me.

The staff has always been friendly.  They make great sweets!  It's a win-win.
author: Mark D.

description: First time here and the staff was so friendly. Added bonus the macaroons are gluten free and I could actually eat them! They were so delicious and now I regret that I didn't buy more. Definitely a must stop everytime I visit now. :).
author: Julia V.

description: The macaroons were delicious but the girl at the counter who helped me was insanely unfriendly. She acted like she was doing me a favor selling me $20 worth of desert.
author: Alycia M.

description:
My favorite macarons in SF...so far. They've got a great assortment of flavors! I didn't intend on getting macarons at all, but I was in the Ferry Building and just couldn't help myself.

Price for macarons are outrageous to begin with, so the pricing is very fair relative to everywhere else. Whenever I'm in town, I always find a way back here :).
author: Christina N.

description:
Imagine a muy Caliente muchacho, Miette is like that.  They look so good that you expect greatness from them.  Until you put them in your mouth and realize looks can't keep your bed warm at night.

*Slaps face*

"Looks aren't everything my friend"

The store is located in the amazing Ferry Building and boasts so many cute tempting treats.  However, the few macarons I tried were okay but not that flavorful,  the cake we got was forgettable and had a gross fondant covering around it, and the ice cream sandie was disappointing and icy.

A few years ago there was this boy, (Let's call him Abercrombie, since he worked there and that's all he wore) I dated "briefly" who was so cute!  I almost couldn't believe he was interested in me.  He was cute, conveniently close to me, went to the same college as me, and had a job.  Wrap him up, I'll take him to go.

The first time we "hooked up" it lasted a mere seconds.  Two thrusts and pop goes the weasel!  I guess they relied on their looks for so long they feel like they don't have to try anymore.  

Miette should focus less on aesthetics and more on flavor.  Cause at the end of the day, the decor has got to "come" off anyway.  2.5 stars bumped up because I like their style and presentation, but that's about it.
author: Anthony N.

description:
OOOh & AAAh's
 I've been wanting to try those cute little macaroons for so long. I keep reading reviews and seeing them everywhere. But somehow it's just never the right time, or I'm too full or, or, or....I dunno? blah blah blah...

So walking through the Ferry bldg. and being teased by all the delectable eatables, our eyes meet....oh so cute perched on the counter in those big jars....okay so they don't have eyes (whatever). 

We just had a light late lunch at The Slanted Door and needed alittle something sweet, and what could be more perfect? I decided on a hazelnut, pistachios, and chocolate one each. My husband is more of a brownie guy and picked out one of those. (though those cupcakes looked damn good too? hmmmm) Nope, been wanting to try these for ages, here we go hazelnut first. Oh not bad, then I bite into the Pistachios and that's even a bit tastier. But now I've saved the Chocolate for last, and WowwieWow it's sooooo delicious! These are chewy and moist even though they look dry on the outside. And even though small, the three were the perfect amount to top off my late lunch.
(I so don't want to know the caloric count) 

The little bags of candies here also looked beautiful and would make a lovely gift idea. I will file this place in the back of my brain as a "special treat" to go back to again! Yum!
author: Susan D.

description:
Any sweets-obsessed San Franciscan will tell you that a trip to Miette is an absolute must after a meal at the Ferry Building. I had tried their other desserts before, but was excited to taste their macarons, which conveniently happen to be one of my favorite desserts as well as one of their signature items. 

I don't know if it was the selection of flavors that just happened to be available that day, but I found it frustrating that I couldn't tell the flavors apart. I even took a bite out of each one of the 6 that I bought to try to find the rose one that I was so looking forward to, but all I could taste was the similar sugary, almondy sweetness. Is my palate just super underdeveloped, or were they having an off day? I also wanted to try the chocolate lavender but again, all I could taste was sugar and a hint of chocolate.

That's not to say they weren't delicious... they were. Miette's macarons have the perfect texture, that wonderful delicate crispness on the outside and the gooeyness on the inside as macarons should have. I think maybe I just had a tastebud killing lunch beforehand or something?

Every other item at that bakery that I've tried is stellar, from the brownies to the lemon tart to the merengues. Not to mention that they really have the whole cute, girly bakery decor down pat. Lots of places do that now (they know how to cater to their most voracious clientele), but I think Miette's one of the best at it. You can't help but get in a good mood when you look at their stuff! 

I haven't given up on their macarons yet!
author: Christina P.

description:
I love French macarons (I'll choose this over a cupcake anyday!) and the pistachio flavored one is my favorite from Miette. This along with a cup of coffee was a wonderful way to start my Sunday morning this past weekend. 

I'm not a cupcake snob by any means but Miette's cupcakes are just ok to me. 

And yes, they take plastic. :)
author: Esther A.

description:
My mouf is currently stuffed with the coffee, pistachio & geranium maracons.  

LOVE the cute pink bags and the miniaturized sweets.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Meh service makes me go meh to meh cupcakes.... Their cupcakes are 3.5 stars, there is nothing special about them. I was looking forward to giving them a rave review. 

I have very high standards when it comes to cupcakes, other cupcake places have cool flavors like snickers, drumsticks or they are decorated super duper cute. ie. weights, BMWs, horses, tennis but Miette is definitely a solid 3 stars.
author: Suzzie B.

description:
I need to finish up these last couple SF reviews that I left pending for a few weeks.

Anyways, on my journey of macarons, I have already planned to stop by Miette. I have stopped by here last August, but wasn't really in a mood to get anything and was determined to get something this time.

I love the entire concept of the store, being all cute and playful, at the same time, Miette means business when it comes to their baked goods.

I took a leap of faith and went with two floral (rose and chocolate lavender) and a nutty flavor (hazelnut). Love the fact the display of macarons are in a glass jar, but noticed that they keep a huge stash in the fridge behind them.

Rose had a nice hint of rose, and hazelnut was pretty nutty. My only disappointment was the chocolate lavender, being all chocolate and no lavender what-so-ever. I do want to try a few more different pastries next time, and maybe just one macaron instead of three.
author: Tom T.

description:
Let's play two.

Rare occurrence: http://www.athleticsnation.com/2014/4/16/5621670/dld-as-rainout-vs-seattle-rescheduled-for-may-7-doubleheader-marcus-walden

Rare combination: crème fraiche ice cream surrounded by graham cracker cookies.

Skeptical a $5 ice cream sandwich could be worth it. One bite into this deliciously unique combination was totally sold. Not the only one: http://www.refinery29.com/best-ice-cream-san-francisco#slide-7

Let's eat two.
author: Jason B.

description:
Wow, Wow, WOW.

You've got to buy a box of macaroons here.

They take SOOOO much pride in their work and creations.
Absolutely FANTASTIC.

IF you are in SAN FRANCISCO..
You MUST stop at one of any of their locations to try it out.
You will regret ever eating here.
NOT because it sucks.
But because you will never have anything comparable unless you live in Europe.

I was mad at my partner at first, for spending $30 on a small box.
When we got back to my relatives house off Market, I was hungry and took a bite.
I ate 4 in total. I was in heaven. How do you SFers stay so fit???????? Omg!?
author: Robert V.

description:
I ordered six different flavors.. none of them really stood out. I felt like they were pretty mediocre macarons relative to what I enjoy in nyc. Not worth the price. 

All the flavors were too similar and they all had an unappealing slightly grainy texture.

ooo and DONT buy any of the other brands of chocolate they sell.. WAY OVERPRICED. Several of the chocolates you can find at local grocery stores or shops for literally HALF the price!
author: Angela K.

description:
Catch up review:  

Came back to my old stomping grounds in the Bay Area to visit and explore.. Sad to report that this was my first time at the ferry building!  Why didn't I discover this before?!  OM NOM NOM!

Tons of wonderful shops and discoveries.. cheese, breads, fishes and more!  Came by this joint to hit up their macaroons.  Actually grabbed a bag of goodies to munch while on the plane back to socal.

I was pleasantly surprised by the macaroons.  The pistachio and chai flavors were definitely my two favorites.  Soft, fluffy with the right amount of shell crunch.. Miette Patisserie did an excellent job with making these huge macaroons.  Wasn't as big of a fan of the chocolate one (but I'm not really a chocolate gal so that's fair) and the vanilla was standard.. good but I'd opt for the first two..  

Decent price for the size and quality.  Good service and lots of fun.

Would recommend if you have a hankering for macaroons.  Especially if you're familiar with Botega Louie in LA and needing a fix.  

Recommended.  Prolly would return. :)
author: Kimmy C.

description:
So, I had a crazy sweet tooth and yelped around dessert places and this one caught my eye since it was in my favorite area. It's a cute little shop next to blue bottle and humphrey's. 

There wasn't a long line, thank god, so I got to order right away. I ended up getting the gingerbread and cream cheese frosting cupcake, two bite sized dolfin chocolates; one milk the other milk and caramel, a dark chocolate cover marshmallow with fleur de sel caramel and strawberry taffy. 

I'll start with favorite to least favorite 

The marshmallow cover in chocolate with fleur de sel was ehhh. You literally will enjoy that piece of chocolate more at See's candy. 

The bite size dolfin chocolates were alright. Nothing to rave about, again I've had better. 

The strawberry taffy was pretty good, I'm use to taffy having a little tangy kick to it after, but this one was pretty smooth in taste. 

And lastly, there's the gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting. Now, I absolutely love cream cheese frosting which is why I picked this cupcake. Of course I licked the frosting first before eating the cupcake whole and was a little disappointed that is was more on the cheesy side than sweet. Because I make it at home sometimes I load it with powder sugar. So once you take the cupcake wrapper off you can immediately tell how moist the cake is, which is great. Then I consume the frosting and the cake together and it was a perfect balance, it was no loner too cheesy because the gingerbread made up for the sweetness. 

And my final total was about $11

Would I come back here again? Possibly if I'm in the area, but it definitely won't be for chocolate, pastries only.
author: Laurel C.

description:
Perhaps it was due to the build up, but the Tomboy was a let down.  Although the cake itself was good-- moist and spongey-- the buttercream was pretty much flavorless.  

Pass.
author: DarkwingDick _.

description:
I've never tried gingersnaps and don't like ginger itself either, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  But Miette's gingersnaps are on the 7x7 list, so I had to try it out and was pleasantly surprised!  The ginger taste is strong, but for some reason, in cookie form it's not as revolting to me.  Definitely had a nice crunch.  I brought these to my family and they finished off the box pretty quickly.  I've tried the chocolate, vanilla, pistachio, and hazelnut macaroons and I liked pistachio best.  But my favorite Miette product is their lavender shortbread!   

I love Miette's packaging...too cute!
author: Jane N.

description:
Conveniently located inside the Ferry building, this cute French patisserie has lines.

I would grab hand-dripped coffee from Blue Bottle Coffee Co. across the hall, and purchase a yellow cake cupcake.

Macarons were good, but nothing to write home about. It was a little thin and chewier for my taste. The filling was unremarkable was well.

Get the cupcake!
author: Angie K.

description: Shortbread, shortbread and more shortbread. Multiple kinds you say? Excellent. Lavender, lemon, walnut and chocolate all fit the bill. Im not sure what a Coffee Tomboy is but it looks intriguing. Until then, Ill OD on shortbread.
author: Kim N.

description:
Miette is a famous and fabulous bay area bakery with beautiful french macaroon treats. In typical San Francisco style, the founders like to use fresh local ingredients in their specials that change seasonally. No dyes are used, so their cookies have an earthy palette and flecks of freshly ground almonds. The texture and consistency of Miette's macaron's is perfect, I love how chewy and soft they are. But Miette's treats fall sadly short on the FLAVOR factor. All of their flavors are subtle and do not stand out.  I tried a box of all their macaroon staples and was unable to tell the difference between rose and pistachio. And while I love natural and organic ingredients for my goodies, the macaron is not the cookie to downgrade the fun. Their cookies lack color and the kind of flavor that macarons are famous for.

Miette you're cute, but I'll be saving my macaroon money for Chantal Guillon and Patisserie Philippe!!!
author: Caroline J.

description:
For those who may not know, I am a Macaron Hunter. I've been to every place in my local area (San Diego) that offers macarons. Farmer's Markets, pastry shops, cafés, commercial bakeries, and more recently, fancy-pants grocery stores like Whole Foods & Bristol Farms.

Miette had the BEST macarons yet! 

Visibly ground almond meal, no artificial colors or flavors. Foodie treat perfection. I also love that these normally delicate treats have taken a step toward a hearty almond cookie rather than typically fragile-shelled variety. They are different in the best possible way. The flavor combinations ranged from classics like Pistachio or Hazelnut to lovely combinations like Chocolate Lavender or Rose Geranium. 

Beyond these tasty macaron bites, I very much enjoyed the Scharffen Berger mini chocolate cake. Rich fluffy cake topped with velvety thick frosting. Paired with cappuccino from Blue Bottle Coffee it was decadent dessert perfection. Especially when enjoyed from a sunny bench overlooking the bay.
author: Charlotte C.

description: A pretty adorable bake shop situated in the Ferry Building, Miette's known mainly for its macarons which seem to be love-or-hate depending on the taster's preferences.  I ordered one of all the flavors (not terribly difficult to do as they have just a half dozen or so) and they're undoubtedly different than classic French macarons in terms of the texture and density.  The shell is more substantial and "cakey" albeit exceptionally moist cake.  I personally appreciated the change of pace and found most of the fillings to be pleasantly delicate as opposed to more sharp and robust like some other bakeries.  The rose-geranium was easily my favorite though all the flavors minus the chocolate ones were great...as much as I love chocolate, they simply tasted like mini-brownies.
author: Eric F.

description: My review is fort he macarons only, because that's what I tried.  I was really excited to try these, but sadly they did not live up to my expectations.  Don't get me wrong, they were delicious cookies, but they weren't macarons.  Macarons should have a crisp exterior and a chewy texture, but these had neither.  A soft, delicious, flavorful cookie, but not a macaron.  Maybe I should try one of the other items?
author: Calee S.

description:
I got all of the different types of macaron that they had available today. There were 7 different types and you know what? I liked most of them. We also got an ice cream sandwich which was a graham cracker cookie and crème fraiche ice cream. 

The cookies for the sandwich were amazing! I loved the flavor that they had. The ice cream was a bit too much for me. I'm not in love with crème fraiche, so I didn't love the flavors, but my bf loved it! He chose it so I hoped he enjoyed it!

The macarons were pretty good. The texture was just wonderful. My bf said that he didn't like macarons, but I changed his mind today. WIN! Vanilla - great vanilla flavor, but it wasn't too amazing. It was definitely a great macaroon. 
Rose Geranium - it's a great way to get introduced to the flavor of rose. It's pretty good. 
Pistachio - I really couldn't taste the pistachio flavor, a little bit of a disappointment
Hazelnut - nice flavor, but not loving it. 
Chocolate-Lavender - the lavender was just too overpowering of the chocolate. I do wish the flavors were more 50/50. 
Strawberry - great strawberry flavor, rich and creamy!
Chocolate - the BEST one. The chocolate flavor was just so bold and it was just like chocolate ganache all in my mouth. Delicious! 

Loved my experience there. May need to try the cupcakes, but the chocolate macarons win my heart!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Okay, I know this is going to sound really stingy, and it may be the Milk Tea Talking... but the sweetest thing about Miette Patisserie is the merchandising, followed by the sugar concentration per sq ft.  

I passed on the macaroon, because I've had them before, and they're nice.  But at $1.75 a pop for something the size of a contact lens here... when I can revel at Bouchon Bakery's delicacies that are bigger than the size of my palm for $3, I prefer to drive to Yountville, gas prices be damned.  

And it's not just the size that matters, although it really does, *cough, cough* the spectrum of flavors is much more expansive and I just love watching the freshly-assembled beauties get restocked, right off the proofing trays.  

The $4 pot de creme is as dainty as it is dense, though the $1 refund for the container is keeping it real.  Real green, and that is, as Mother Martha would say, "A good thing." 

I had to check out the organic Strauss Creamery Ice Cream Sammiches: I wanted Strawberry w/ chocolate cookie, but of course that was sold out.  Vanilla Cookie w/ creme fraiche was choice #2, and too subtle for my palate, though very true to taste.  The cookie component was delicate and didn't hold the crispness that I prefer and the holding temperature was a bit low.  I shall not tell a lie: I ate the whole thing, but think it would have been Happy Dance Worthy if there were some swirls of balsamic to complement the light creme fraiche.   Fleur de sel caramel would also have piqued my interest.  

Water board me all you want, but the Scream Sorbet Sammiches (also $4) are much more dense, delicious and decadent.  Noah, I promise I wasn't cheating on you, I was just exploring my curiousity - it will never happen again.

I picked up a few goodies, but the price point is a deterrent, even for an exquisitely described fruit-infused Italian sugar cube smaller than a matchbook for $1 each.  

Basically, I'm awarding 3 stars, rounded up from 2.5 for the Bathing Suit Competition - the packaging and merchandising are lovely, but I want more than "World Peace" when it comes to my taste buds.
author: Kim D.

description:
4 stars for the lavender shortbread, the fleur de sel caramels, the selection of beautiful desserts and the lovely packaging and presentation.  Minus one star because the macarons were ok and they seem to be their signature treat.  I had the chocolate lavender and the pistachio.  (Full Disclosure:  I just got back from Paris and nothing will EVER compare to Pierre Herme)  The chocolate lavender was interesting and intense.  The flavor was a bit harsh at the beginning and slowly smoothed out and felt a bit more balanced, although never quite amazing.  The pistachio was totally indistinguishable.  It could have been vanilla or caramel or salted caramel....i never tasted the pistachio.  I tossed it - not worth the calories.  I tend to prefer a bit more "cakey" macarons, and these were like that, but the fillings felt frosting-like and goopy, and the flavors of the fillings were mediocre.
I would go back and skip the macarons and load up on their shortbread , for sure!
author: Lisette C.

description:
So I was just innocently wandering around the ferry building when I suddenly caught sight of this little kid holding a delicious looking macaroon and without even acknowledging it, I started to follow the little kid around, eyes glued to the macaroon he had in his hand. And to my luck, he lead me back to the very bakery that sold the heavenly item. 

MIETTE PATISSERIE....where have you been my whole life?? Oh right...in the ferry building on the OTHER side of the bay!

I don't even remember how much the macaroons were....which is a good indication of how tasty they were!! The flavors and the texture were impeccable! I will be dreaming about these babies for a LONG time! And I will surely come back for MORE!!
author: Amiee H.

description:
The old fashioned cupcake is amazing, and definitely one of their signature items. It's light, fluffy, and perfectly moist. 

And the secret? One of their best items might just be their macarons. Unlike Paulette's (now renamed?) vibrant and distinct flavors, Miette goes for a soft and delicate flavor with the right amount of crispness and softness. However, it seems like the biggest problem we Americans have with consuming food (obesity aside) is that we don't know how to really enjoy it. The French have one-upped us on this one.

Some of the reviews here say that they're bland and nothing special, but I believe that you just really need a clear palate and few expectations. Take a modest bite and let the sugar-coated macaron linger on your tongue before cramming the rest into your mouth. Perhaps sip a light tea, and let your taste buds speak for themselves.

It's a shame that they're $1.75 now, because I remember a time a year of two ago when I could get them during 'happy hour' at their Hayes location (pre-French pastry hype!) for $1!

Favorites:
The old fashioned cupcake
The banana creme tartlette
The rose macarons
GINGERSNAPS. Duh.

Eat it, love it.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I came here during their last hour and lucky me, there were still a good amount of macaroons left. I went for the coffee chocolate macaroon and the pistachios macaroon. I wished i had some tea with me to ease out the sweetness of it (im not a big fan of sweets) but regardless, it was delicious! i wished i was able to come back and grab a few more before i left but didnt wanted to stand in a line to make another purchase. 

Will def come back for more!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Super cute shop and delicious macarons! 
Macarons are comparable in price to Chantal Guillon but they are slightly larger and a bit less sweet. I like them a lot because you can always taste the almond in them, regardless of what flavor you get.
author: Sophie Y.

description:
#49 on the 2011 7x7 List: Ginger Snaps**
#49 on the 2009 7x7 List: Ginger Snaps

**now $8 for a dozen in a canister

-Tasty?  For $6 a canister, you would think that they would be fabulous.  The packaging and design are pretty but for the product themselves - the snaps are thin like the Garden brand Pop-Pan Spring Onion cracker (just google it).

-Service:  Quick as they were about to close when I visited

-Ambiance:  The location is at the Ferry Building, so it's like the other stalls.  

-Worth the trip/try?   There are about 4 or 5 other things on this 7x7 list in the Ferry Building so you can knock them all off with one trip.
author: Winnie L.

description: I give this place 3 stars because is a cute sweet/candy shop. I loved the fact that it was painted pink. The Macarons were spectacular. Only feedback I have is for the employees to do more than greet us and stand behind the counter. I would of liked him to explain to us the history of the shop or the different types of sweets they offer.
author: M B.

description:
Got rose geranium macaron. 1.65.  Liked the rose flavor. Not sure what geranium tastes like, but liked how it was a nice light natural rose flavor. The healthy texturey cookie part was great too. Wish I got more of their macarons now.

Also got the scharfen berger $6 cake. Definitely had that distinctive rich nutty sharfen berger chocolate taste on outside cream part. Inside was a Lil dry, but all around wonderful choco cake.

Also got some candy treats. (They have a great and cute international selection.) We really enjoyed a small Italian choco hazelnut one. Reminded us of an even better ferrero rochero.

Also really helpful and sweet salesgirl with short brunette hair on Sunday.
author: Cara H.

description:
My absolute FAVORITE is their rose and geranium macaron. There's something about it that tastes refreshingly different. The staff here is always so sweet! The other day, my mom's friend brought over a box of "graham crackers" from Miette, and I thought to myself... "eh, graham crackers, whatever..." THANKFULLY, I was craving a sweet snack a few minutes later and decided to try this "graham cracker" of theirs... 

BLOWN AWAY. This is not your average graham cracker. It's BUTTERY, RICH, DECADENT. It might just give their macarons a run for their money! Miette graham crackers are now on my list of dependable sweet treats I can count on to satisfy my sweet tooth :).
author: Judy L.

description:
Such good macarons!  Now, I'm a New Yorker terribly spoiled by the La Maison du Chocolat macarons that I was doubtful I'd encounter anywhere just as good.  But I was proved wrong.

Their hazelnut and chocolate lavender are my favorites.  I also tried the rose geranium which I wasn't too crazy about, and the chocolate parisian is just as good too, although a little more on the sweet side.

I wish they had one in New York!
author: Caroline K.

description:
Chocolate chip cookies were great.
Ginger snaps were too gingery for my taste.

A fan --so this was a go-to for this year's Mother's Day gift.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
This is my FAVORITE bakery in the entire Bay Area. Yes, even better than Sprinkles! I'm addicted to this place & have been since I discovered it in 2005 while I was in culinary school. I tend to avoid going to SF on Monday's because they're closed that day! Or at least they were.

My favorite? Lemon Caramels! Old Fashioned Cupcake is really good. The Lemon and Lime tarts are perfect. The crumbly crust and the sweet citrus tart... its making my mouth water just thinking about it! But above all (besides the Lemon Caramels) my favorite has go to to be the Panna Cotta!

Honestly I just bought it cause it was cute and I wanted the jar. But OMG! Ever since I had it, I've been hooked on Panna Cotta's and I cant find any that are as good as this one. The fresh strawberries are such a nice addition to it as well.
author: Hazel V.

description: I gave it 4 stars only because the vanilla frosting on the chocolate cupcake was sooo sweet my daughter couldn't eat it & she's a sweet lover.  BUT, lovely, lovely, lovely!  The walnut shortbread cookies - wow, fabulous.  The packaging is beautiful, staff is great - tip them, they all have to go to the dentist!  I was actually surprised that the items were reasonably priced!  Would buy here over all the other bakeries in the Ferry Building.
author: Elena M.

description:
My intention was to go to Ike's; way on the other side of where I was at. Then I remembered I wanted to check out the Ferry Building Farmers' Market. That's what I did and wandered into the marketplace after my venture... 

I passed by so many food stands, food stores, restaurants, and everything food-related and there I saw Miette and little did I know I bookmarked it so yes! I was in line waiting to try their macaroons and I was enticed by looking at the chocolate cake w/ butter cream and ganache.. I can finally unbookmark this to lower my bookmark counts. Lines were long but was executed rather quickly. 

I was finally up. I did not go overboard.. I saw various types of bagged cookies, cupcakes, tarts, cakes, macaroons, brownies.. I did not even get a chance to see what is on the left shelf! On impulse I got 2 macaroons for $1.75 each (yes, rather pricey in my opinion), I got 1 chocolate and 1 hazelnut one and I couldn't help it, I also grabbed a slice of that chocolate cake that I have been eying since I was in line.

The macaroons were placed in bags and a cute sticker sealed the bag nicely, the cake was wrapped tightly and nicely and into a box, also sealed w/ a sticker.. then stuffed neatly into a shopping bag.. I have to hand it to them that the cake was packed superbly! I walked around the city for a total of 5 hours and guess what- the bag was a little battered but the box, the cake... held its form, extremely moist, rich, sweet, and I did not feel guilty eating that entire slice for dinner. I think I licked the box.

The macaroons was another story.. I didn't wait to get home. I didn't wait to get out of there.. I opened the bag in excitement right after I paid for them and took a bite out of the chocolate 1 first and oh my- I stopped, screamed in total happiness, and plopped the entire thing in my mouth while onlookers laughed at me and some laughed w/ me afterwards.. I giggled and claimed that it tasted like heaven... it was so moist, sweet, and light in texture... my God I wish I bought 100 of those! I then plopped the entire hazelnut in my mouth but it didn't give me a taste orgasm like the chocolate one did.. still good but very light in hazelnut flavor. 

My next trip here- I will get 100 chocolate macaroons and a million slices of that chocolate cake w/ butter cream and ganache. I cannot say anymore other than, "OMG- that was fucking delicious!"
author: Tram N.

description: Must try their chocolate tarts!!! Really cute bakery loads of sweet options from Macarons to chocolate burger cakes (dar chocolate an absolute MUST try) and seal salt/carmel/sprinkled hand made chocolate pouches a great gifting option. They also have cute cards on the side in case ur heading straight out with your sweet gift box! Love the place !
author: Ritu M.

description: Light and delicate, Miette Patisserie in the Ferry Market building is dainty and sweet, and has all the ingredients for a cute pink little tea party. The macarons are among the best I've ever tried.  i especially love the rose, and grapefruit-flavored ones.
author: Hieu H.

description:
I had a major sweet tooth today and had to try this place out!  I had the Pistachio Macaroons and the Banana Tart and they were both amazzzingggg!  The pistachio was not overpowering, with just the right amount of crunch and sweetness.  The tart was decadent, with a layer of cream, a layer a chocolate and a brittle-chewy crust that all went together so well.  My only complaint was that it could have had more banana flavoring.

If only I could eat more!  This was a great place for desserts and it completely hit the spot for me after my lunch at the Pier.  I must come back and try more of their delicious sweets!

Thanks, Miette.  Till next time!
author: Julie C.

description:
This review is less for the delicious treats and more for the pretentious girls who work there. 

This isn't Paris, you're working in the Ferry Building of San Francisco. So, put your nose down, smile once in a while, and show some gratitude to your paying customers. 

I've been treated poorly twice here by the snobby staff and will not be returning.
author: Meg I.

description: I had already had some ice cream and my sweet tooth was quite satiated, but when I saw that Miette had GREEN TEA macarons I couldn't resist! It was delightful. Flavor was just right and the texture was chewy and light. They had a good selection of flavors to chose from that I would've gotten my hands on if I didn't sweetened out already, so I'll be sure to come back to try their other flavors (among their other sweets!)
author: Iris H.

description: My friend brought me a beautifully packaged little box of macarons. I liked the raspberry, hazelnut, pistachio but was not impressed with the chocolate -- it was just a little too crispy and crumbly for me.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Such a cute place! Pink walls, polka dots, pretty packaging...I love it. Macarons sold in large glass jars. I got the rose and geranium macaraon. A light sweet flavour, so unique. It as a bit chewier than I usually like it to be. 

Also saw these super yummy looking cupcakes while I was paying. Had to refrain myself from buying them, but now after reading all the rave reviews I wished I had tried them.
author: Vincci L.

description:
Every time my husband and I visit the ferry building, Miette is a MUST STOP for me! Everything is delicious - most recently I purchased a handful of the oversized chocolate sea salt caramels and they were very, very good. My sister-in-law was on a hunt for hazelnut macarons and found them here. She commented that they were as good as the ones she had in Paris and better than the ones she purchased at Bouchon in NY.

It's a tiny little spot in the ferry building, but they are able to pack in a wide variety of flavors and products that go quickly. Everytime we have visited we try something new and have yet to be disappointed!

They do have a recipe book out - that might be my next purchase. Stop by Miette if you want a tasty treat - or save it for later - everything is well worth the calories!
author: Kat H.

description:
After the boyfriend had brought back macarons from a shop that flies their macarons from Paris, France every two days, I have been on a macaron kick! So after convincing the boyfriend to try just one, I was disappointed! I never should have convinced him to let me go and get one because he was right, they probably wouldn't have tasted good and they did not taste good!

Reviewing the macaron: I concluded that it tasted like jam between two pieces of toast (or bread) - not much flavor and not much crunch. Better save your money and just keep walking over to another macaron place!

I'm not a macaron expert but I have had macarons from Paris, France, it must have changed my palette for the finer things in life (haha just kidding, I wish I could afford the finer things in life)!
author: Mona L.

description:
Whenever I'm craving sweets, this is the place to be.

It's quality.

My favs are the hazelnut macaroons and of course the Scharffen Berger chocolate cake. This cake is not too sweet and has an intense rich chocolate flavor! Luv it
author: Christina M.

description:
Mini store and yet mighty treats!
Inside the Ferry Building
Enjoyed the interior decor and color schemes
Tempted to buy everything in sight
Told myself I can come back another time
Eyed the cute package of LAVENDER SHORTBREADS ($5) and it came in there super cute pink bag!! ^^

Go green take: anything that goes towards the Ferry Building (12, 71, F, etc.)
author: CeCe C.

description:
I don't know why, but I can't seem to wrap my head around Miette Patisserie and give it raving reviews. Yes, the place is really cute, lots of stuff to choose from (candies, chocolate, cakes, etc.), but my review revolves around the macaroons my gf and I ordered.

We got the rose and the grapefruit macaroons. The cookie portions are light and chewy...but my main gripe directs itself towards the filling. Normally, when I've gotten a macaroon, the filling is really intense and flavorful, making sure you know you are eating chocolate, green tea, mango, or whatever flavor you choose.

Well...Miette Patisserie fails to deliver when it comes to this. Yes, I can tell I'm biting into a rose or a grapefruit macaroon, but the flavors are so light that it's hard to tell after a while. Despite the glowing reviews for this place, I'm not really a fan...
author: Kevin J.

description:
I had heard so many good things about Miette I had to find out for myself if it was all true.  Well, it is and then some.  My only regret is that I arrived around 6pm-ish so the refrigerated area was quite bare.  On the upside, I was able to treat myself to:

1) Macarons (Vanilla, Strawberry, Pistachio, and Hazelnut)
- I ate the pistachio one before dinner which means I didn't get to take a picture of it.  These are pretty darn good... better than Bouchon's.

2) Chocolate Truffle Tartlette
- Extremely rich. Must eat with a side of soy milk.  

3) Chocolate Waffers
- Wow, I should have bought two boxes.

4) Ice Cream Sandwich 
- I wish I had extra room to two while I was there.

This little place is too sweet for words.  I wish I had a little kitchen area I could doll up just like this.  I can't wait to go back!!
author: Nathalie V.

description:
Honestly I wasn't that impressed. The macaroons were fluffy but not very flavorful. Macaroons are usually loaded with flavor since they are so small but these were not.
I got the hazelnut and strawberry. 

I've definitely had better especially considering they are $1.25 a pop!
author: Erica C.

description:
* this review is for the macarons *

easily at the top of the list in terms of macaron taste, texture, size, and value. miette macarons are HUGE compared to others such as paulette, 'lette, laduree, bottega louie, etc..

i had a coffee macaron and a rose geranium one. both were awfully delicious!! the filling could use a bit more flavor but the texture is wonderful. i plan to visit to try their cakes/cupcakes and maybe more macarons.
author: Jenny K.

description:
OMg this place is amazing ..... I wanted to be part of the cupcake craze and see what all of these people on cupcake wars were talking about with there buttercream frosting and blah blah blah ....

So I saw this bakery while in the ferry building and wanted to try a coutoure cupcake . I bought the yellow cake with strawberry buttercream forsting . omg it was so yummy I almost fell off the hotel bed.  Right after I ate it I told my husand we must stop on the way to the train station so I could get some more to take home 
I came back and bought more all of them were yummy ...

Than I also tried a geranium and rose maccaroon and it was oustanding .
I will def stop here again my next trip to the city :)
author: Lori M.

description:
There are a couple of Miette's in SF, but I particularly like this location as it is located in the Ferry Building--where there are a plethora of other businesses to check out as well.

The macarons from Miette's are not your typical vibrantly colored macarons, as no artificial food coloring used. They have about seven different flavors which include: chocolate, chocolate lavendar, hazelnut, pistachio, rose geranium, strawberry, and vanilla. The macarons are perfect here! They are nice and chewy inside and have condensed flavors in their cream filling. The ginger snaps are great too! I highly recommend!

P.S.
Get a dozen macarons and get one free!
author: Lien T.

description:
Dearest Chocolate Wafer Cookie, 

I can eat you all day long and buy so much of you, as presents to friends, only to find out, that i'd rather keep you to my own. 
You are heaven in each bite, but I'm sure you're slowly obsessing me with your decadent, not too sweet chocolate flavor, that your magic of fattening me is starting to work through adding inches to my thighs, and belly; not to mention adding more pinchable cheeks to my cheeks; without me being too aware of it.

However, I'd like to keep you forever.


Love,
Me.

P.S. Your friend Scharffenberger Cake has the most bittersweet chocolate ganache I've ever had. You two make me smile. And to the sweet lady who made me try the Pistachio Macaroon,  I loved it too.
author: Monica H.

description:
One of my favorite macaron places. This place ranks high on my list of favorite macaron places in the bay area. I've been to miette a couple times and I've never been disappointed with their macarons. The macarons here are always consistent and hold a perfect texture for a macaron. I've had a couple of their regular favor chocolate, hazelnut, pistachio, and raspberry. All good! They also offer seasonal flavors that I've tried. This last time I got a hazelnut raspberry and lavender. Both were very good. 

Miette's location is pretty awesome. Located smack in the middle of the ferry building; right next to blue bottle coffee. You can enjoy these delicious macarons with great coffee. A great place for a day date.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I get a giddy with excitement when I pass Miette's displays of oh-so-perfectly packaged sweets and treats. It's so cute - like tea shop-meets-bakery. 

Their gingerbread cupcake was featured on the Top 10 Desserts in America list, so I had to try it. Topped with cream cheese frosting and a sugar flower, this cupcake was incredibly moist. The cool, slightly creamy frosting contrasted nicely with the sharpness of the cake. Their cheesecake is also very rich and creamy. All their desserts are meticulously packaged and beautifully presented, so needless to say they are pricey. But then again, that also discourages me from overindulging.

Make sure to pick up some gingersnaps. They're on the SF 7x7 list. I only wish they were available to buy individually, like they do with their macarons. Next on my list: Miette's ice cream sandwiches.
author: Mariela D.

description:
I was surprised with all of the good reviews for Miette's Macarons. 
They aren't colorful at all. They all looked to be the same color of pale beige (minus the chocolate which were obviously darker). 
I figured that they may taste better than they looked, but unfortunatley... not.

I tried the Rose first. It was CHEWY. Like, really CHEWY. SO chewy that it got gummy in my mouth. Macarons are not supposed to be gummy. The flavor was nice, but I couldn't even finish it the texture was so dissapointing. Maybe this was just a fluke, because the texture of the Chocolate macaron that I got as well, was better, but still not with a slightly harder exterior, and light creamy center, that superior Macarons have.

The guy at the counter that helped us was nice.
Maybe Laduree has ruined me for other Macarons as none I taste hold a candle, but that Rose macaron was so bad that it doesn't even light a match.
author: Sarah Y.

description:
Cute shop. Macaroons are now $1.85 each- yikes!
They have happy hour from 6-7 where the macarons are $1 each.

Macaron Flavors:
+ chocolate lavender macaroon and didn't taste like either chocolate OR lavender! Still tasty though.
+Rose - much better

I'd try a few more before completely veto-ing this place!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Yummy macarons! This is the place to get them if you don't have access to the Napa area (Bouchon Bakery).

They have so many good things at this bakery that it's hard to not want to try everything.
This is a must-visit spot in the Ferry Building.
author: Marlon T.

description: Very cute place, but after looking at everything I felt like there wasn't actually that much variety. The cupcake flavors they had were pretty plain and there weren't many macaron flavors. I bought a lemon tart to try and was impressed with the quality. The lemon curd was rich and the crust was nicely flakey and tender, but even so $6 was a bit steep. $5 would have been more reasonable, even considering their location, etc.
author: Claire D.

description:
Miette's ginger snaps are on 100 Things To Try list.  Usually,  I don't really care for ginger snaps to begin with but, I went by and they had ginger snaps all ready for the taking in plastic packages for $7.  I thought $7, that's pretty pricey... I got to try them out and boy, I loved the crisp to the snaps but I think it was a little too gingery for me, especially for a person that is not super fond of ginger.  I've had ginger cookies before but not as strong as these ones... At times, I felt like there were actual pieces of ginger in the snaps, which was a nice touch for those ginger lovers out there.

All in all, I don't think I will be getting them again but I will definitely try their other pastries and ice cream sandwiches!!
author: Kathy D.

description:
The macaron I had was a fluffy pillow of sweet flavor with a touch of crispness that melted on my tongue as I took each careful and slow bite - to make sure I savored all of the tiny little morsel.

When a food lingers on my brain, as this macaron has for the last few months, I know it's worth writing about. 

This cute little shop in the Ferry Building was staffed by friendly folks who were willing to help this tourist out with his questions. The prices seemed fair and the quality of the product was top notch.
author: Mark F.

description:
HORRIBLE. CUSTOMER. SERVICE.

I patiently waited by some customers with a smile on my face. I was excited to try their goodies, why wouldn't I be happy?  

I understood the girl was busy helping clients and she did look at me knowing that I was waiting to be assisted. Another girl behind the counter just walked around, looked at me and did not acknowledge me. It didn't bother me that she didn't help me, I understand that it might not been part of her job duty. However, a nice greeting or telling me that someone would be assisting me, wouldn't have hurt. I was in no hurry, but common courtesy shouldn't be a lost art.  

I was still happy and was waiting to be assisted. The couple before me paid and more customers came to the counter. The girl that saw me earlier, looked at me but then directed her attention to the couple that just came. She asked if she can assist them and the couple pointed to me. In which I politely said, "I believe I was here first." She did a mini eye roll and didn't even talk to me during the whole transaction. She just placed the two macaroons I picked in a bag and rung me up. She didn't even tell me the total. I paid and thanked her and she just stood there like some cranky ass. Silent as ever. Pardon my French, I am now utterly pissed off that I patronized a place whose employees didn't give a rat's ass to provide decent service.  

I am sorry that I am not fancy enough for your fancy ass desserts. I'm sorry that even though I tried to remain pleasant and cordial to you, my dear bakery employee, that you couldn't even utter "You're welcome". Hey, I understand that actually takes effort and actually caring about the company you represent. I mean businesses don't really need customers, right? 

Seriously, to the business owners of this bakery, train your staff. I understand you might have some wonderful products (I actually loved the macaroons, they were delicious) but without matching customer service, it really does your products and business injustice. While the macaroons were sweet, the whole experience left a sour taste in my mouth.
author: Elsvette B.

description: Their macaroons were so fresh and light! I tried the hazelnut, pistachio, and vanilla. So delicious and a great flavor! $1.75 for each which is not too bad. You can find the stand inside the SF Ferry Building.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Wow, their Scharffen Berger Chocolate Cake was absolutely incredible!

I've been curious about Miette for a long time and it was great to finally try it out.  Everything in their store definitely looks "pretty", but sometimes looks can be deceiving - thankfully, that's not the case here.

I tried their Scharffen Berger Chocolate Cake - a nice, moist chocolate cake topped with a bittersweet chocolate ganche.  The entire thing is rich and delicious and perfect for any chocolate connoisseur.    I had the mini cake for $5 or $6 and while a bit, pricey, it's well worth it considering the taste and quality.
author: Ken G.

description:
Pretty good french macarons but I think paulette still has an edge for best in SF. I tried chocolate, chocolate lavender, hazelnut, and strawberry. Only one I didn't enjoy was the chocolate lavender because it reminds me too much of soap.

I'll be back to try their cupcakes and ginger snap cookies.
author: Kien M.

description:
One of my favorite destinations for sweet guilty pleasures for years now (thank heaven they opened a storefront in Oakland!)

Favorites include their LAVENDER SHORTBREAD COOKIES, MACAROONS - Pistachio (subtle flavor that's SO unique)  AND  the Rose Geranium (a floral explosion in your mouth) to be exact.    Delicious texture and flavors without being overly sweet.

Worth the wait if there is a line, and although they are pricey it's a nice indulgence every once in a while.

Staff is always courteous, efficient and friendly
author: Catherine R.

description:
I ain't no cupcake queen.
...but I was tasked with getting dessert for an Oscar party where a lot of alpha women were out with daggers over the evening gowns seen on the red carpet. It just didn't seem right to get six pounds of sticky rice from Golden Gate Bakery.

I went over to the Ferry Building just before they were closing and got the last eight cupcakes they had. They placed the stash in a pink box and put the box into one of their fru-fru shopping bags. I took said bag onto the #1 Muni where I was met with patronizing glares of derision from a couple of thugs. Was I to be the object of a potential hate crime ...a potential petty theft ...or did they want to point out that my socks didn't match?

I think they just wanted my cupcakes. But nobody touches my cupcakes unless I want my cupcakes to be touched. Chocolate cupcake with a chocolate truffle ganache. Another chocolate with a marshmallow cream. Yellow cake with a light buttercream. Gingerbread with cream cheese. I made it to the party where the cupcakes were devoured before the Best Short Subject (Animated) award. They didn't even make it to the "In Memoriam" tribute.

I've had Miette's cupcakes before, Kara's too...here's the thing - I think the cake part is boring, but the frosting is always tasty, never as sickening sweet as I anticipate due to a childhood spent eating  Betty Crocker's Ready-To-Serve Frosting from the can. Like I said, I ain't no cupcake queen, but the alpha women seemed pleased...until they saw the hideous gown on Daniel Day-Lewis' wife. Did you see that fashion don't?

CUPCAKES - 4 stars...for the frosting, not the cake
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's just the Ferry Building...and chaotic on a busy Sunday afternoon
SERVICE - 3 stars...bit of clockwatching in the cursory way she packed those cupcakes
TOTAL - 4 stars...when you need to please a flock of alpha females
author: Ed U.

description:
I love their chocolate tarte and cake. It is dark chocolate and super rich in flavor.
The best of all.....
author: Bentley K.

description:
I just love the Macarons at this place. I have had all the different kinds, but my favorite is the Rose Geranium. I also tried some of their candies. Today I had some bergamot flavored hard candy, crazy delicious, unique flavor for a candy. Also tried some caramel nougat action, it looked like a small Tootsie Roll but absolutely fantastic too. 

I can't go to the Ferry Building without stopping by this place.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
Ice Cream Sandwiches!

Throughout the season the flavors change but their golden child and my personal favorite... the Creme Friache is year around. On some days I get naughty and get two sandwiches for myself. These puppies are addicting. They can be overlooked because of all the pretty, dainty desserts and decor at their Ferry Building location. The large metal freezer by the door holds the path to enlightenment.

Some of the other things I have tried are the macaroons which are good in terms of texture but the variety in flavor almost rarely changes. Classic flavors like pistachio, coffee, vanilla, rose.... yada yada yada. I hope they get seasonal with their macaroons selection soon. Cupcakes are good and moist, flavors change a lot more than the macaroons.

Lastly their gingersnap is noted as one of the top 7 cookies to have in SF by a local publication. After years of coming for their ice cream sandwiches and macaroons i finally tried these gingersnaps and let me tell you I felt like I was scammed!!! These gingersnaps were hard as rock and contain sooooo much ginger that my friend and i both needed a palate cleanser and maybe a dental exam. I wish there was a way to link this review to the editor of the Food/Wine section of that publication.

Ice cream sandwiches are the way to go here.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Saying that Miette is adorable would be an understatement. Not only is Miette's storefront at the Ferry Building super cute, but their sweet offerings are actually very good. Prices are also pretty reasonable, and the staff is more than friendly. 

I have to admit that I didn't try too many things here, just the beautifully packaged gingersnaps and graham crackers. I love that they don't really try to reinvent the wheel here in terms of turning out really spectacular or innovative sweets, but rather just make desserts and candies that everyone is familiar with - only with much better ingredients and technique. The graham cracker, for instance, is made with organic local honey. So while these goodies may not be exactly be helping your waistline, at least you can rest easy knowing that your purchase is helping local purveyors and farmers. 

The one thing I think may be overlooked here is their ice cream sandwiches. The bf actually stumbled upon their small freezer filled with three types of ice cream sandwiches that day while he waited as I "wooed and awed" at all their adorable treats. He was instantly intrigued by the meyer lemon ice cream sandwich between those scrumptious graham crackers. Not only was the fragrant meyer lemon ice cream nicely creamy and just slightly tart, but the graham crackers managed to maintain some of their crunch. It's also the perfect size as well, manageable and easy to eat unlike your typical ice cream sandwich with melting scoops dripping out the sides between the monstrous cookies. 

As much as I love fancy French patisseries, sometimes all you need is a nice little American place that takes you back to your childhood.
author: Cecilia Z.

description:
Wow oh wow. Since my girlfriend and I didn't have dessert with our lunch at Plant, we walked over to the Ferry Building and were seduced by the offerings in the display case here. 

We decided to share a gingerbread cupcake (moist and flavorful) and a lime meringue tart with a gingersnap crust. The meringue was delicious and thick and texturally,  almost seemed marshmallow like. The crust was tasty, though a bit thick for the amount of lime custard/curd on the tart. Had the lime been a little more plentiful, the dessert would have been perfect.

I am a definite fan and look forward to tasting other treats from here in the future!
author: Tam F.

description:
One day, I want to stuff Miette cupcakes into an emptied plastic cupcake container from Safeway, bring them to a potluck gathering, and observe to see if anyone notices.  I believe their cute pink boxes with Miette sticker adds to the eating experience.  It lures you to say, 'Hmmm, it's good!'  

I admit that I have failed to jump on to the latest cupcake craze, so I am not the best person to accurately judge cupcakes.  I continue to be unsuccessful in discovering what is so special about these simple desserts, which I have been eating since I was a child.  It was not special when I was 9 years-old, and it's not so special now.  For some reason, I thought cupcakes were popular because it was something easy to make at home.  So, I don't understand why I want to buy them for $3 a piece.  Furthermore, I find it difficult to eat frosting and cake in equal proportions.  I end up eating the part with lots of frosting first and the cake without any frosting remains.

How does Miette Cakes compare to Kara's Cupcakes (http://www.yelp.com/biz/LD-AEBPmSwaQ1eWf9ZKLcQ), Citizen Cupcake (http://www.yelp.com/biz/AXGWt9tJiRjl1_uJHbQEzA) or Sweet Things (http://www.yelp.com/biz/w83ZWz4tEBTIct6l8GS7TQ).  I cannot tell.  To me, cupcakes are not interesting enough where I could differentiate the taste.  To me, as long as they are fresh, it all tastes like......well, cupcakes.  I will admit that Miette's butter cream was quite enjoyable.  I usually do not care for butter cream because of the overwhelming sweetness, but frosting on Miette's cupcakes were just right.
