OTHER THAN CUPCAKES: I've bought their ginger cake before, which was good, but not great.  I felt that it was a bit too sweet.  There are so many other options to buy a whole cake; I didn't see the need to go back to Miette Cakes.
author: トモ T.

description:
3.5 stars. It's pretty hard to walk by Miette and not want to buy something (if you're a girl and have a sweet tooth).

Every time I walk by, I'm lured into the bakery. Sometimes I can resist, but I gave in this past weekend :D 

I tried their macarons in the past and was NOT impressed. Even though everyone raves them about, I found them to be dry, strangely textured, and unexciting. 

This time I tried:
-Salted caramel chocolate tartlette: this was by far the best thing so far. The chocolate was rich and dark, and the crust was buttery goodness. I would prefer more fleur de sel on top, however. 

-Scharffenberger chocolate dome: The chocolate ganache outer layer was very good, but I found the chocolate cake on the inside to be boring. 

-Old-fashioned chocolate cupcake with Italian meringue on top: My sister said the cake and frosting were both good, but she didn't rave about it.

For such a highly praised bakery, I think they could improve the taste (but I give them an A for presentation and quality of ingredients). Prices are fairly high, but Miette is located in the Ferry Building so it's expected!
author: Patti F.

description: Fantastic pastry shop in the Ferry Building. The lime meringue tart is one of my favorite treats of all time!
author: Michael C.

description:
This is the cutest little stand in the Ferry Building with the most amazing desserts!

Even though it was a little cold out, my coworker and I decided to grab some ice cream sandwiches as we had heard so much about them. The chocolate wafers were the best I have ever had, it was sweet and had a hint of salt, and mixed with the ice cream was incredible!

I got another coworker a macaroon from here and she said it was one of the best she'd ever had.

I am hoping another business trip takes me back to San Francisco just so I can go back and get more desserts!
author: Annie-Lee T.

description:
I've heard so much about Miette, I knew I had to get something here after eating lunch at Gott's.  I finally decided on a hazelnut macaroon after a few minutes of looking around.  I don't think I've ever eaten a macaroon before, but it was light and crunchy.  I wish the hazelnut flavor popped out more, I was envisioning the heavenly taste of Nutella like on a crepe....but it was just a subtle flavor.  And it was so small for $1.75, I pretty much forgot what it tasted it like after my three little bites were up.

Maybe if I was craving something sweet at The Ferry Building and didn't want Ciao Bella Gelato, then I'd think about stopping by here again to either get a pastry or an Ice Cream Sandwich, but no more Macaroons.

**SF REVIEW #100**
author: Cat C.

description:
I'm in love.

Not the sort of love that makes the male population take off as if the devil shot them with cayenne pepper or the kind of love that makes people forget about being practical and resort to impractical decisions thereby impeded their vision.

I'm speaking of the love that grabs you mid-stride and tugs you slowly toward the inevitable center with immense power, that of the elusive  gravitational pull.  This was clearly experienced when I was literally trotting through the Ferry Plaza with a bag of pasta in one hand and my iPod in the other, ignoring everything that swept by me; people, cars, noise from the Embarcadero...until:

I felt them.  Warm.  Inducing.

The seductive glances thrown my way by rows and rows of sweet, puffy and round cupcakes glossed heavily with creamy icings.  White puffs.  Pink puffs.  Topped off with crinkly sugared flowers.

How could I resist.  I was weak.

The small carrot cake frosted with cream cheese icing winked at me, with a heavy brick-size attitude, complete in it's non-assuming box folded neatly away.  Mmm, I'll have that one. ($6.50)

The two small glass rounds filled with rich panicotta and topped off with fresh strawberries made me an instant adulterer.  I was smitten,  I elected two of them. ($5.00 each)

The girls behind the counter were quite helpful as I stood there, lost.  They smiled knowingly.  

"Bring back the two glasses and you'll get $2 off on your next purchase," she reminded me.  She patted the boxes down and placed them in the cutest pink paper bag.  

As I walked back to work, I noticed people looking over at me.  Through the open windows from their cars lining Spear to get onto the highway.  The group of men leaving Rincon.  Even the clerk at RJ's as I purchased my daily cantaloupe slices, he actually smiled at me.

Hmmm, not at me, I realize.  Rather, at the ubiquitous pink bag swinging lightly by my side.  

Ah, yes, they can tell when one is in love.
author: Miika M.

description: This place is amazing and a "Must-Stop" for anyone visiting the city! My favorite sweets here are the regular and chocolate fleur de sel caramels. They are delicious and melt in your mouth with all their buttery-goodness. Whenever we have out of town guests, we always make sure to bring them here for a true taste of the best San Francisco has to offer!
author: Sarah P.

description: My family and I shared an assortment of all the Miette's macarons flavors - chocolate, vanilla, pistachio, hazelnut, grapefruit, chocolate-orange and rose-geranium.  Their macarons are made of coarsely ground-almond meringue cookies filled with either buttercream or ganache. I like the fact that their macarons don't contain any food coloring or artificial ingredients.  All the macarons flavors were light, delicious and not too sweet, but my faves were chocolate, vanilla & pistachio.
author: Racquel E.

description:
With not enough time to make a birthday cupcake myself, I opted to purchase one from Miette Patisserie instead. I picked up a lovely gingerbread cupcake with a cream cheese frosting. The price was about average for a gourmet cupcake and came in a cute little take-out box. I didn't taste the cupcake since it was for my sister, but I have had the macarons before and they were pretty good. My sister seemed to enjoy the cupcake, but only recognized the cinnamon, not gingerbread flavoring.

If I ever need any gourmet goodies and I'm in the area, I'd probably return. They don't have a large cupcake selection, or any super unique ones to begin with, but they have several other sweet treats to satisfy your sweet tooth!

Bonus points fora a friendly and efficient staff!
author: Leana L.

description:
MACARONS!!! 

If I am anywhere near the Ferry Building all my brain can think about is the Macarons at Miette... I have tunnel vision, and there's not a light at the end of the tunnel, there's a Pistachio Macaron at the end of the tunnel!

My favorites are the Chocolate, Vanilla, Hazelnut and Pistachio. The Chocolate and Hazelnut are both filled with rich chocolate ganache and the Vanilla and Pistachio are filled with creamy vanilla buttercream. 

You have to try these Parisian Macarons to really understand how amazing they are. These may look a lot like French Macarons but they are not! They are wonderfully tender and delicate, whereas French Macarons have a crispness to them on the outside. These are simple and pure which is a recipe for greatness.

They always have a full case of gorgeous cakes, cupcakes, cookies and other sweet confections. I have yet to step out of my Macaron bubble and try any of their other products but I will eventually. Do yourself a favor, this is a must stop in the Ferry Building, you will thank me!

I give these decadent bites of heaven FIVE million stars!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
I have never been and probably will never be a dessert person. Because of my lack of a sweet tooth, I usually skip the bakeries and patisseries... so my encounter with Miette on a random rainy day in San Francisco was definitely fate!! lol

What initially drew me to Miette was its super cute pink flowery signs inside the Ferry Building after walking out of the restroom... and then I noticed the jars of macarons and decided to buy some. Just because they're trendy and cute. 

Every single bite of each macaron (pistachio, grapefruit, rose, orange chocolate and vanilla) was heavenly.. the crispy and chewy outer layer and the smooth and creamy middle achieve a perfect combination in your mouth.. and yes that was the start of my newfound love for marcarons :)

Definitely will be back soon!
author: Joyce C.

description:
We ordered a small box of macaroons and they were so delicious that we wished we ordered a bigger box.

These macaroons are soft and chewy and oh so heavenly! We got a variety of different flavors and they were all amazing!

Highly recommended!!
author: daniel c.

description:
Ok, I get it. This place has great stuff. Great macarons, great cakes, great tarts. I understand. I understand so much that I came to Miette to purchase a birthday cake for my co-worker first thing in the morning at their said opening time (9am). Frankly, I was in a hurry to get to work, and this was the only option I had at such short notice. To my surprise, upon arriving at Miette, the gates were still closed, the lights were still off, and the workers were still setting up for the day. Totally understandable, right? Well that would've been the case if the two gals behind the counter weren't so busy gossiping and gushing about their recent trip to Mexico, all whilst giving me dirty looks and whispering to each other about my early morning presence. 

I politely ask one of the girls "excuse me, what time do you guys open?" (mind you it was 9:05am and again, their opening time is 9). She snaps and says, "we will be open in 5 minutes". Fine. I can wait 5 minutes. So I wait, and I wait, and I wait. It is now 9:25 and the gates have finally opened and the girls set up the outside displays. I'm still standing there, waiting. After about 2 minutes of the girls standing and looking around, one finally looks at me and says "you know we're open right?!" 

Oh. Hell. No. 

While I consider myself a professional, there was no way I was going to stand for that type of attitude. I politely walk up to her and ask "do you guys always open 30 minutes late? That's pretty unprofessional". She quickly replied with an excuse (instead of an apology), "oh, our delivery came late". Classy. 

Like I said before, they have great stuff to offer. I just don't appreciate the snarky attitudes and ridiculous sense of entitlement. Miette; hire better help, give them better training, do whatever it takes to make sure that your bakery isn't represented in a classless and unprofessional manner. People come from all over the world to visit San Francisco and the Ferry Building at that, you do not want their lasting impression of your establishment to be of two undercover ratchets talking about how drunk they got last night. Ain't nobody got time for that!
author: Mary S.

description:
It is a cute little store in the Ferry Building.  The decorations are very cute and girly.  It really makes it stand out from other stores there.  They have cupcakes, cookies, macarons, candies, cake, and even ice-cream sandwiches.   Everything is just so cute there, especially all the cupcakes.  And this is why I ended up to buy a cupcake and a macaron.  

Cupcake was $3.25 each and I got the "old fashioned" cupcake.  "Old Fashioned" cupcake actually was the cupcake with the bright white meringue frosting & shiny red candy coated peanut.  It had the cute looking but it does not taste as good as it looks.  The cake itself was a little dry and the taste of the frosting was so-so.  The frosting was not go well with the cake and it melted too FAST!  By the time when I got back to the office, the frosting was melted already (only five minutes walk).  It was a mess..........Maybe the packaging was also a problem for this cupcake.  They put the cupcake into a Chinese food take-out box and that was too big for ONE cupcake.  It was totally fine for other types of frosting cupcake but not a good idea for this kind of frosting  

For macarons, it was just so-so too.  Not impressive at all.  It was too expensive for its size.  3 LITTLE bites for $1.75?!?!?!  I got the Hazelnut one and it did not taste any hazelnut at all....just way too SWEET!  Also I don't know how long they keep in a jar because mine was not that fresh............

Overall, it seems like Miette Patisserie put a lot of effort into packaging and decorating, but I don't feel their products can compete with other bakeries in town.
author: Liza T.

description:
This little shop in the Ferry Building features some baked goods and candy.  The nicely designed shop is done up in nice shades of white and pink that feels just right for its target audience.  Their selections are well presented (the baked goods but also their packaged candy from other suppliers).

While I did not try any of their baked goods, I did like how a lot of their packaged candy was sold by the piece (as low as 25 cents).  There is quite a bit in the Ferry Building that is too big, too expensive or just more practical for local residents than visitors.  It would be great for locals, but as someone just passing through, I just want something quick, tasty and disposable and luckily they had some things at Miette that fit the bill.

I picked up a honeycomb peanut, which I haven't had in a long time.  It was fresh, crispy, tasty, and just how I remember it.  I can't recall all of the other candies they had, but they had a pretty good selection with some candy types (like the honeycomb peanut) and smaller name brands that you may not find elsewhere (even a candy specialty store).

Service was friendly and good.

If you find yourself at Ferry Building and need something quick and satisfying, Miette Patisserie is worth a visit.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Their cheesecake is AMAZING. And I'm still obsessed with the chocolate wafers. I've always had good service at this location, and everything I've had has been perfect. I've never tried their macarons, but they look really nice and I'll definitely try some in the future. 

Miette i luv u
author: Jessie A.

description:
This review is for Miette's lemon tart. Folks, I will be frank: I am not the sort of person who freaks out in a state of bliss when chowing down (I am a pretty calm cool and collected girl), but this lemon tart sends me to the freaky place. It is PERFECT. If I ever get to choose my last meal, I would ask for this lemon tart. It is the supreme queen of every food dream.

MIETTE LEMON TART FOR PRESIDENT.
author: Liz F.

description:
Looks 10, taste 3.  
That ain't it, kid.  That ain't it, kid.

Thirty-five bucks I hand out, 
For something to make me stand out.

And what I got was a very beautiful Vanilla Tomboy cake.  But the proof is in the eating, and this one was dry cake, with little flavor.  The rubbery frosting failed to add any much needed moisture and fell off in peels when each slice was plated.  

I was embarrassed that this was my contribution to a dinner party.
author: Bay G.

description: My boyfriend and I came here to get something sweet before going back home on bart. We got the carrot cake cupcake.  i Wiil say, it looked better then it tasted. The frosting was awful and the carrot cake was just kind of bland. I do not think I will be coming back. Also the workers were kind of cold and rude ( an asian women was helping us). I took 2 stars off for the coldness and rudeness and 2 stars off for the taste as the presentation of it was the only decent thing.
author: Ruthe Ann G.

description:
Yum, their macarons are pretttty good! I got the rose flavored macaron, and it was delicious! Good thing I only had one though because it was also very sweet.... 
Prices were decent for macarons, I think it was under two dollars if I remember correctly...

Nice stop especially after a day at the farmer's market :D
author: Ashley N.

description:
Two words for you to remember when entering the archways of Miette:

Gingerbread Cupcake

You're welcome!!

Okay,  went in and picked out a baggie of chocolate chip cookies and then went to the counter and asked for a chocolate macaron. The guy behind it, Alex helped me out and also helped me decided between the Gingerbread and the Carrot cupcakes. He said both were good and I wasn't going to be disappointed. And no, I wasn't. My non-sweet tooth boyfriend even liked it. The frosting was perfect! Most cupcakes I usually scrape off the too-sweet frosting, but this was perfect!!!

The macaron was also delish!! And those cookies were yummy too!!!!

Will I be back? You darn tooting right I will be!!! =)

**note** The cupcake and macaron were consumed a day after purchase, and they were STILL kick ass good!!!
author: Jackie F.

description:
The Ferry Building is a great location for Miette. 
Lots of lovely shops, eateries and charming hustle-n-bustle.

I'm in love with their *ginger snaps*, the are the best I've had so far. 
$7 for a dozen-ish delicious cookies.
A nice balance of gingery snap and toothy bite.

If you're not a fan of ginger snaps, ice cream sandwiches, cupcakes, cakes, tarts, candies and other cookies are temptingly available.

Take your treat to go and enjoy the lovely view of the Bay just steps away.
author: Cathy K.

description: Lovely lavender and lemon shortbread cookies and macarons in assorted flavors like chocolate lavender, hazelnut and pistachio. This place is just adorable.
author: Claudine D.

description:
Full disclosure:  this 5 star rating may be a little overboard, but based on my first experience, both with Miette Patisserie and with macaroons, the 5 stars are totally deserved!  

Yes you heard me right, I ate my first macaroon at the age of 32.  Are macaroons supposed to be chewy near the center but perfectly cakey on the outside?  Are they supposed to have fluffy, sweet-but-not-too-sweat whipped creamy filling?  Are they supposed to melt in your mouth while simultaneously giving your mouth an orgasm?  I would answer yes to all of those and say that if your favorite macaroons don't have all of those characteristics then you need to get to Miette stat to see what you've been missing.  

I loved my first macaroon experience, but it also made me a little sad only because I now must try macaroons everywhere I go to see if, in fact, Miette holds the US macaroon title (something I awarded the bakery after that 1 small delectable pastry).  Why does that make me sad?  Because it means I'll have many more calories to burn when I travel.  Oh well, totally worth it if other macaroons make me as happy as Miette's did.  

Go forth and BUY A MACAROON HERE!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Pros:
Macaroons are good (if they are fresh)
Princess Cake is amazing (but expensive)
Ice Cream Sandwich is omg so delicious!

Cons
Macaroons can be stale/old
Pricess Cake was expensive and a small portion
author: Samantha S.

description:
Tried Miette's famed macaron for the first time, and thought it was just A-OK. It has a doughy, cakey consistency rather than the crumbly, airy texture than I'm accustomed to.

I enjoyed the subtle flavor of the pistachio one, but disliked the overly strong scent/flavor of the popular rose-geranium.  At $1.75, they're more expensive than most macarons and actually on the smaller-sized end. 

The cupcakes/cookies/cakes didn't look too amazing to me, and everything was very, very pricey. The store was cute, and if I'm ever having a macaron building while at the ferry building, I may return for another pistachio macaron.
author: Anita C.

description: The macaroons are not bad. I think if you have a craving this place will do it, but I don't think it's amazing as Laudree in NY/Paris. They are pretty soft, but a little bit on the sweeter side. If you are wandering the ferry building make a stop here and grab a couple macaroons.
author: Nancy L.

description: Cute shops with lots of yummy treats. Love their gingersnaps, ice cream sandwiches and creme de pots. The ice cream sandwiches are their cookies w/different flavored ice cream in between. They also need to be eaten right away as they're made fresh and doesn't travel well. The macaroons are fairly good as well. I typically get the Hazelnut, Pistachio, coffee, or lavender. You gotta try something from here if you're at the ferry building!
author: Kitty K.

description: Every time I hang out in the Ferry Building I pass this place by because of the long lines.   I finally arrived late just before a lot of stores closed and found no lines so I picked up a package of Walnut Shortbread Cookies, and they were great!  I ate them in two days!  Which is fast for someone avoiding sweets!  The cookies are not extremely sweet, but just right!  I was informed by a staff member that the Lavender Shortbread Cookies are good and popular.  I will try them on my next visit.
author: E D.

description:
If it involves sweets, I'm almost always a huge fan.

I've only tried Miette's macarons and their ginger snap cookies. While I wouldn't necessarily want to return and buy another batch of ginger snaps (they're pretty intensely flavored in my opinion, so more than one or two of them at a time is a little too much ginger for me), I go back once every week and a half to two weeks or so and buy myself a couple of macarons. As a pick-me-up. You know how it is.

I've tried an assortment of their macarons (rose, vanilla bean, chocolate hazelnut, espresso, etc.), and all of them have been pretty flavorful. I like their flaky cookie outsides and their yummy buttercream insides. When I want to cheer myself up, I go and buy myself macarons.

They're a biiiiiit pricey for individual macarons, but hey. You get what you pay for in this case. I don't see myself ever buying more than a half a dozen at a time, tops, from Miette, but I definitely think that it's a place worth trying if you're a macaron connoisseur!
author: Anna W.

description:
Our San Francisco macaron quest started in the Ferry Building at Miette. The Patisserie is actually a little bit understated compared to the over-the-top Confiserie, but it's still quite girly.

Macarons aren't cased; instead, they're kept piled in glass cylinders, a bit of a strange presentation. Flavors are limited, but intriguing. Chocolate-lavender and Rose-Geranium are the hybrid ones that you'll most assuredly want to get.

The macaron texture may be best described as sticky. For some reason, it feels like it deviates from the traditional French macaron, putting a little bit of an American twist to the dessert. I'm not sure how to better explain it than that.

We also picked up a can of the famed gingersnaps (quite spicy) and the chocolate wafers (overtly dark). They're also quite pricey at $8 a pop for a can.

Price is an issue at Miette, but it's (relatively) worth it. If you're trying to get the true Miette experience, I recommend the Confiserie, but if you're out and about in the Ferry Building, this is a must stop.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
I went on a little craze buying up all the pastry cook books I can get my hands on.  When I saw the cover to "Miette", I thought that the picture was very pretty.  So naturally, I ordered a copy...  

This was about two months before my planned trip out to San Francisco.  Once I finished reading the book, it dawned on me that I HAD to stop by the Ferry Building and taste their wares...  

As soon as I stepped into the Ferry Building, my sights honed in on the "Miette Patisserie" signage.  I walked straight into their little shop.

I was so enamored by their decor - all the little bags of sweets displayed along their wall, the display case with the incredibly simple and beautiful cakes...  After talking myself out of buying two whole cakes for myself, I settled for a bag of their marshmallows, a case of their graham crackers, and a few of their macarons.  

The macarons were so fresh and crisp on the outside, soft and sweet on the inside.  

The marshmallows were so soft and gooey with the vanilla beans giving it that slight crunch.

The graham crackers were more like shortbread cookies - oh, so buttery with the right amount of spice...

This place alone is worth a day trip out to San Francisco!
author: Vicky P.

description: I adore this Patisserie and only dream of them with opening one in the Los Angeles area. One of the best places for macarons. Only place that would be similar to Miette's quality of macarons in SoCal would be Jin Patisserie in Venice Beach. You can't go wrong with anything and everything at Miette's! Love, love, love them!!!
author: Erica T.

description:
Pink, Cute, Girly! 
dude sucked it up and helped me take photos, since he knew i would buy him a pistachio macaron. 
A Definite standout in the Ferry Building (thanks Ken G. and Kris H. for recommending!) , i was looking forward to trying these macarons that everyone seems to call "nutty and chewy". And they did have a rather different texture- tony wasn't feeling it- but i enjoyed the pistachio one i ate. 
The gingersnap on the other hand, which was recommended by my boss- was holy moly strong. I took them to work and had a bite and wasn't super thrilled. I should have bought the chocolate ones instead, but i can see that if you like ginger, this might be a delicious treat, but i'd rather get some more macarons!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Like the saying goes, don't judge a cupcake by its cover. Even though Miette's LOOK overly sweet and dry, they actually have a rich, decadent consistency; just enough crumbly cakey fudgy in one bite - but I have to admit, I definitely prefer the frosting at Kara's. That's the one place you will find me scraping frosting off the cupcakes and directly into my mouth. Pleasant image, I know.

The chocolate pot de creme is served in a cute little glass cup, but its $4 for a tiny serving ($1 reimbursed if the container is returned)! If you like pot de creme, try the one at Modern Tea. The $10 credit card minimum charge was a blessing in disguise because it "made" me get the blueberry tart also. Halleluja.

Miette has two locations - the one in Hayes Valley has more selection and the employees are not as snooty as the ones in the Ferry Building. Definitely make a visit to HV, their store is super cute!
author: Jess C.

description:
O
M
G

so, we were here during farmer's market. So it was crazy packed and hectic all over the place. I needed something sweet to bring down my boiling anger and frustration from being pushed and shoved.

Rose and Pistachio... One bite, and it was like all the people around me went away for a few milliseconds. Then the cookies were all gone...
author: So H.

description:
This pinkish store caught my eye as soon as I stepped into the ferry building. There are lots of cupcakes, cookies and other sweet goodies for sale but when I saw their gigantic jars of macaroons I knew I have to try them all! All the macaroons are perfectly shaped, they are round with a fairly thick layer of cream in the middle... sooo cute!!! 

Of course, knowing that I won't stop eating if I buy too much, I restrained myself to 4. Rose and lavender are two flavors not commonly seen so I've decided to try them. The taste is amazing! The floral smell is quite strong and very unique. I also had hazelnut and chocolate and they are all soooo delicious! The texture is also perfect, you can take multiple bites and it won't break apart. They are also not overly sweet which is great!
author: Ceci Z.

description:
i tried their sea-salt caramel macarons.
Decadent little sugar-devils they are.
...short and sweet!
author: Derek N.

description: One of my guilty pleasures when seeking something sweet, and not over the top.  I love their macaroons (salted caramel, pistachio, chocolate to lavender) and cakes.  They are always consistent with the quality and service. Plus, there is something about how they present or package my desserts in cute little French style boxes.  It is all too special to open and devour, but someone has to, right?!
author: Nina V.

description: Tried vanilla buttercream chocolate cupcake and strawberry buttercream yellow cupcake----stunning!!!! This is my first time to finish a whole cupcake! Cakes are softer and moist, and the buttercream are smooth, creamy and absolutely NOT TOO SWEET!  The strawberry buttercream is really amazing!
author: Daphne H.

description:
Absolutely cute storefront! I really could stare at all their pastry gems from the window case for hours. 

I came here for a cooking demo and found out Miette was located here, so I was pretty psyched since I've been wanting to get a hand on their book. 

Onto the cupcakes! I tried the Lemon Cupcake, it was pretty rich and buttery but didn't have enough of that lemon zing I'm always looking for. The buttercream was surprisingly light and uber creamy (like a mixture of sugar, butter, and lemon curd).

The customer service here was friendly, fast and super efficient. 

Presentation was neat, cute, and clean cut. 

When I start rolling in the green again, I am definitely coming back to try the macaroons and tarts!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Yummy cupcakes but bad customer service. 

Today I checked out Miette for the first time and the shop is very cute and the food looks delicious when you're walking past the store front so we decided to check this place out. 

There were like 6 different kinds of cupcakes to try so we started asking questions about what kinds to order. The sales associate seemed somewhat friendly at first but was very short with her recommendations. And when I asked about what gluten free items they served she was not willing to show us or explain what items were available. So Rude!

The gingerbread cupcake and the vanilla cupcake with strawberry buttercream frosting were delicious but I was so no happy with the service at Miette.
author: Heather J.

description:
Hello, from the girl with the biggest sweet tooth.

This place has unbelievely good brownies, chocolate goodies... I hate that I don't remember the things I've tried because I've been fortunately spoiled by others bringing these treats to work. 

Gaaahhh, amazingly melts in your mouth, creamy, sweet and crispy all at the same time... Oh and let's not forget the Macarons! My boyfriend usually isn't a fan of these but he loved it! As simple as vanilla and chocolate... their so yummy and at the perfect chewy texture. 

I swear, I'm wiping my drool off my keyboard as I'm dreaming about everything miettes in my mouth.. (thats what she said).

There are two locations - this one at the ferry building and another one in hayes valley - octavia area. Miette: A must if your ever around the area!

- not the best parking around available
- super cute and girly shop!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This cute and colorful little store caught my eyes among the big crowd of people within the Ferry Building Farmers' Market.  Super cute decor with these irresistibly sumptuous macaroons and other baked goods staring at me behind the glass cabinet.  One word: evil.

I am not a big fan of macaroons, but this place has the BEST macaroons I have ever tasted!  Mmmmm, especially the chocolate hazelnut one.  I also tried the ice cream sandwich, which was also pretty freakin' awesome.  On a side note, I don't want to know how many calories I ended up inhaling from this place, because this is what happens when you are on vacation, right? lol 

I also got a chocolate bar by Mast Brothers...  I'm really not a chocolate bar kind of girl, but sometimes, my money is somehow spent on unnecessary things that are just way too cute-looking - especially when my brain is on vacay.
author: Fi H.

description:
A great place to sweeten your sweet tooth and to pair with your Blue Bottle coffee.
My girlfriend and I visited this places twice while we were in San Francisco.
Both times we had to try something different.
While this place is primarily known for their macaroons, we wanted to go there for the cupcakes, since we are both lovers of them.

Visit #1
Raspberry macaroon
Vanilla macaroon
Vanilla cupcake w/raspberry frosting

Visit #2
Chocolate w/ vanilla frosting cupcake 
Chocolate w/ raspberry frosting cupcake (my favorite)

Their macaroons were very moist and decadent.
They surely didn't disappoint us. 
But their cupcakes were very delicious.
The frosting consisting of a light and delicious liqueur taste.

We also grabbed the local favorite Blue Bottle coffee (located adjacent to Patisserie) to accompany our delicious treats. Be sure to enjoy your treats out in back of the Ferry Building. A great way to sit and enjoy the view with a delicious treat.

Miette Patisserie has many treats if you're not into Macaroons.
The counter girls are very friendly.
It surely won't disappoint you.
author: John S.

description: Heading to the Giants game, decided to stop by Miette Patisserie to get some sweets. Got some macrons and cupcakes to-go so I can eat it later in the stadium. The packaging for the cupcakes was a cute carry on box. Even the bag to put everything in was cute and I love their friendly service. I have to admit, the macrons was delicious. My favorite was the raspberry macrons.
author: Owie N.

description:
Carrot Cupcake review: "butter-cream" frosting was more like "butter" frosting...it melted on my fingers while eating it and was REALLY heavy on the butter...which is weird for me to notice as I grew up with butter being the "secret ingredient" in ALL of my mom's cooking.

Staff: super friendly. Even asked me if it was okay that the Carrot cupcake had walnuts in it (good to know if i had an allergy or distaste for walnuts), which was NICE, but what i REALLY would have liked to have been asked is "is it okay if there are raisins in it?"...i have a distaste for raisins. bleh.

Overall: i picked the raisins out, and although messy, the cupcake was just worth 4/5 stars. I might try a different cupcake next time!
author: Robyn K.

description:
Recently, my friend Jason told me that he was taking a trip to PARIS.   

Immediately I thought "BAKERY."  It's downright Pavlovian.  Louvre, schmovre.  Given the choices of:  1) a Parisian bakery or 2) anything else in Paris, I will choose ze bakery every day of the week and dix fois a dimanche.  (Oh what and like you wouldn't?)

Not finding an extra $1,000 in my pocket to take a quick trip to Paris, I did the next best thing.  I went tout de suite to Miette.

J'ADORE Miette's macaroons!  They are prettily displayed on the top of the counter in glass jars.  A row of hazelnut, coffee, chocolate, lemon, vanilla, and pistachio macaroon-y goodness.     

And while you may think that $1.50 is too much to spend on a cookie the size of an Oreo and yes, you could buy an entire bag of cookies for around $1.50, once you have tasted one of Miette's amazing macaroons, you will change your mind.  Je promets!
author: Amy C.

description: My favorite macaroons ever !!!!!   The walnut brownies were super moist and delicious, perfect with a warm cup of coffee.   The service was really good and fast!!
author: Miguel M.

description: Cute little shop in ferrry building. I had the chocolate lavendar macaroon. It was very good. They have a decent selection of macaroons. They also have marshmallows, cupcakes, and other baked goods.
author: Al D.

description:
" miette, receipes from san francisco's most charming pastry shop"

Hey!  I was just at Costco in Richmond located in the East Bay.  The cookbook is out, I just got it!  It is beautiful!  The contents are beautiful inside and outside!  It is priceless!  The photographs are beautiful and breathtaking!  You will just salivate looking at the photographs and never mind making the pastries, just go out at get them at Miette Patisserie!  My suggestion is to wait until you have time and in the right frame of mind to bake Ms. Ray's easy-to-follow-recipes!  Baking is not only a science, it is an art in this case!

Go out and get it!  Pick it up at the bookseller nearest you!  Buy it at Miette Patisserie!  Buy it at amazon.com.  Just buy the cookbook titled:  " miette, receipes from san francisco's most charming pastry shop"!

You will not be sorry.  Now, I just hope there will be an opportunity for Meg Ray, the owner and author to personally autograph my purchased copy of her cookbook!
author: Chiara A.

description: Amazing! We had a wonderful chocolate torte (with a bit of sea salt) and a buttermilk panna cotta. It's a relatively nondescript desert place (for the has-everything Ferry Building!), so I'm writing this to remember how awesome it is!
author: Isaac L.

description:
I went here for the 7X7 listed ginger cookies.  They are thick, gingery, crunchy, and a little buttery.  They were delicious. The cookies lost a star because I prefer them to be thinner, more like a ginger snap. I also tried the caramels, which were delicious. 

All the cookies at Miette look thick and crunchy. If that's not your thing, I suggest looking elsewhere.
author: Amy L.

description:
Cut to the chase, shall we? 

Miette treats you should get before you die from global warming:

Carrot Cake Cupcake
Chocolate pot de creme
Cheese Cake Slice
Espresso Macaroons

I don't know where to start complimenting on the cakes here, but basically, everything here tastes as godly as they look. Their carrot cupcake with cream cheese frosting is perhaps one of my classic favorite. Very light textured and in perfect sweetness, you pair it up with Blue Bottle Coffee from across the hall and you're part of the clan. Did I not mention the cute, tasteful packaging these treats come in? Yes, absolute sweethearts. I would just love to spoil anyone, and I mean just myself, with anything from here.
author: Rika P.

description:
The BEST macarons that I have ever had. The rose are my favorite.

Macarons have become so trendy...leading to too many bad ones. And rose flavored can be the worst.

Price - fair, you get what you pay for so I expect them to be pricey.
author: ILene S.

description:
Miette hands down is my go-to place for macarons for a few reasons:

1. The quality of ingredients is fantastic! They do not use artificial colors and their flavors hold true to the ingredient itself, not some artificial flavor that a scientist rendered. 

2. Their macarons are wheat-free and are placed in separate containers away from their wheat-containing desserts. 

3. A couple other desserts are also wheat-free, I've had their Panna Cotta and Chocolate Pots de Creme which were both delicious! 

4. Service is always quick and friendly! 

I would say that their Pistachio Macaron is by far my favorite, with their Rose Geranium being my least favorite--I felt like I had a mouth full of perfume after one bite.
author: Juliette R.

description:
I've had every flavors of french macaroons that they have here. My least favorite is the chocolate lavender...I've never eaten lavender before so I wasnt sure how it was suppose to taste. 

The shell is made out of almond for all the flavors and they're not colorful like everywhere else. My favorite is the rose, vanilla, and pistachio. The girl told me the chocolate macaroons were the favorite but I didnt like them very much. Try the pistachio or rose first.
author: Cat N.

description:
I hate to be the naysayer amongst 700+ reviews who give Miette 4 stars, but hell no!

I've been reluctant to give Miette another chance since their macarons from the now closed Marina location disappointed, but I love trying new cupcakes & wanted an after-lunch sweet. Unfortunately, the 2 star first impression they made on me was accurate.

My lunch partner & I shared:
* [yellow strawberry cupcake]: the strawberry frosting had a thin consistency (almost like whipped cream-blech!) & tasted very little like real strawberry. the vanilla cake was a good combination of dense but moist, but lacked any distinct flavor. cute flower topping, attractive pastel color but the taste was boring my taste buds.
* [old fashioned cupcake]: i don't usually go for chocolate cupcakes, but I made a "sacrifice" since my lunch partner loves chocolate anything. again, same complaint--gorgeous cupcake with the bright white meringue frosting & shiny red candy coated peanut, but the flavor was just so-so. I favored this cupcake over the strawberry. the chocolate cake was moist & tasted like a dark chocolate which went well with the sugary meringue...but I would never purchase it again.

Cupcakes are $3.25 each. 

If you are wondering about the adorable cupcakes in the display case--i'll tell you the dirty little secret they are hiding--they are cuter than they are tasty.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Is it possible to give more than 5 stars?? I love this place! I seriously not a huge sweets or pastry fan but I do have a thing for macaroons. I tried many places and this is my favorite. It could just be the fact they have rose macaroons! The texture is perfect, nice crisper shell, chewy but soft. Plus there's no artificial taste nor is it too sweet like lots of other ones I tried. Just yummy goodness. I tried almost all their flavors, every one is great!

I also recommend the Chocolate pot de creme, lavender shortbread, and the rose meringue :)
author: emily y.

description:
You cannot walk by Miette's showcase and not stop, little alone walk by without looking. Then of course since everything looks so good, you cannot purchase just one, I have to try at least two.

I tried the gingerbread cake with cheesecake buttercream and the second one was chocolate cake with coffee buttercream.  They both were absolutely delicious with the gingerbread cake being my favorite.  The chocolate cupcake was nice and moist, soft, and the frosting had a nice hint of coffee flavor.  However, I think the buttercream could have had a stronger coffee experience.  With that said, the cupcake could have also had a more chocolate flavor, the cupcake all around needed a more bolder flavor.  I still enjoyed it though.  The gingerbread cake was a totally different story and experience.  It secured the fourth star in the rating.  It had all the right qualities of a good cupcake: flavor, moisture, softness, texture, sweetness, spices, complimentary flavors, etc...  The frosting was a wonderful match-up with the gingerbread spice.  It had balance of flavor and boldness that it needed to wow you.

Enjoy!
author: Randy G.

description: Must try their ice cream cookie!! Their homemade gram cracker tops are soon good and the vanilla lemon Fraiche is off the charts. Everything was stiff and in place. Nothing broke apart. I'm speechless. Forget cream, get this. It's $5 a pop
author: Allister D.

description:
When ever i lose the wife while walking around the Ferry Building i know where to find her.

I always come here for their ginger snaps when ever we go to SF. This last time around we got an array of other macaroons from hazelnut and chocolate/orange.
author: Johnny C.

description:
The macarons here are so good! Now if your one of those people that says they don't like macarons these are special macarons. They don't taste like any other one Ive ever had. So try them. My favorite is the classic vanilla. Its nice and soft but chewy with the cream in the middle that is fluffy and light.

It's in the ferry building my suggestion is get there at 11:30 to beat traffic.
author: Jess O.

description:
They have a Thanksgiving Menu.  Hope to try some of the specials soon.

Princess Cake: 6" serves 6-8  $30; 8" serves 10-12  $50
Pecan tart 7" serves 6-8  $24
Pumpkin walnut bundt cake serves 8 - $14
pumpkin cheesecake  6" $30; 8" $50
Gingerbread  7" serves 6-8  $24

Reserve your selection by Mon 11/24/08.  415-837-0300
author: Ann L.

description:
Wow, this store is just amazing. Being a huge cupcake freak, and making them myself, I love to get out and look for inspiration, taste and admire. 
I took the chocolate cupcake with Italian meringue and the chocolate cupcake with raspberry buttercream. This last one was incredible. Okay, I'm not a fan of buttercream because I think a cupcake is already heavy enough. But the sour flavor of the raspberry in combination with the sweetness of the wet chocolate cake was WOW. 
I was glad I had that one as last, because the Italian meringue was not that great. It tasted fluffy almost like a marshmallow but it was too wet. It slipped off of my cupcake while I was eating it and it was just too much. Also the wetness of the meringue in combination with the wet chocolate cake made the whole thing just BAM, too heavy. 
Overall I was very pleased to see the more special combinations instead of the regular flavors all the time. Also the fact that they don't have 10 million flavors assures me they know what they are doing and they only make what they know they can bake!
author: Florence V.

description: Cute, delicious, and all around lovely! The cupcakes were moist and sweet. Perfection!
author: Kim K.

description:
Tried their hazelnut and their pistachio macaroons. 

You know.. after having Bouchon's macaroons other macaroons are not the same.
author: Vicky T.

description:
meh i don't really like this place.. which is a shame bc everything looks so good

i've had their
-choc covered gummi bears: i didn't think this would be a good combo at all but was pleasantly surprised at how addicting these are

-macarons: grainy cookies.. one of the worst macarons i've had
-choc
-hazelnut
-strawberry
-pistachio
author: Raquel T.

description:
Best. Macaroons. Ever.

My boyfriend's favorite is Grapefruit and mine would be between the Pistachio and the Hazelnut. But honestly, you can't really go wrong with any flavor. I love how the outside of the macaroon is so soft and crumbly, yet the inside is a bit chilled with just the right amount of rich flavor that isn't too overwhelming.

If you're just visiting the area, I suggest buying a dozen to bring home. You'll regret it later if you don't.
author: Sandra C.

description:
I stopped by Miette and took home some dark chocolate cookies with salt that were pretty tasty.  They had a great shortbread-like texture with deep rich chocolate flavor and minimal sweetness.

These cookies almost made up for what was perhaps the worst macaron I have ever had.  You would think that a place with a name like Miette Patisserie would have a little pride in its fake French heritage.  I adore macarons and was excited to sample one from this cute little shop.  It was small and expensive, but I was even tempted to buy more than one.  I'm glad that I didn't do that.  The raspberry macaron was dreadfully mediocre.  The outside was bready and dull like a biscuit, and the inside was like a saccharine buttercream.  What a disappointment.

I will give credit, though, for the adorable space and packaging, as well as for the cookies.  I suppose if I'm in the Ferry Building again, I might pick up another batch.
author: Steph C.

description:
Not impressed. Their banana custard tart looked amazing in the window, and I just had to try it. I ended up eating only the filling - the tart itself was extremely hard and I was unable to cut it with a fork and knife. The filling just tasted like a layer of hardened chocolate and some mashed banana. 

Their macarons were rather dry and tasted more like biscuits than anything else.
author: Crystal J.

description:
Miette officially began my renewed addiction to MACARONS! Such delightful but sinful little suckers!

I've tasted some a while ago but they never tasted as good so I quickly forgot about them.. until now of course! I tried the HAZELNUT and PISTACHIO flavors.. OMG.. major orgasm in my mouth! No joke.. I can't exaggerate enough how good they were. The macaron meringues had a nice, soft texture which sandwiched the most amazing cream inside. It was sweet but not overpowering to where you'd worry about cavities the next day. I also had their carrot cupcake. It was pretty yummy but a bit different in that wasn't your usual carrot cake. Yes, it had the  sweet icing but the cake itself actually carried more of the carrot flavor. I really liked it! If you're feeling cupcake-y.. try the carrot cupcake!

As for the macarons.. well let me just say that as much as I love chocolates and ice cream.. Miette macarons are on a whole other level of heavenly goodness! A definite MUST-TRY!
author: Valerie M.

description: Hands down, best cupcakes in the city (maybe even in the state). I wish they delivered!
author: Crystal T.

description:
I love the Macarons here! As a disclaimer I prefer a slightly chewier Macaron over the traditional airy but slightly chewy texture.

Atmosphere: Very pink and girly. I like it. I love how their desserts are all very visually appealing and overall everything is very pastel color based.

Service: The line moves pretty quickly here and the staff is relatively friendly.

Food: The macarons are kept in jars which is a bit weird. However they taste great so I can get over that. They don't have very many flavors but my favorites are: Rose Geranium, Pistachio, and Parisian Strawberry. One thing to note is that their Macarons aren't brightly colored like most Macarons. They all seem to center around a brownish base for the exterior and the filling has a faint pastel color corresponding to the flavor. A bit confusing but you'll get used to it. 

Overall, things can get pricey here but I think their macarons are worth it. Definitely stop by if you're close to the ferry building!
author: Lily W.

description: This is for the macarons alone. Everything else wasn't appealing. There are cakes and cupcakes, all of which looked like too much. They also have dry-looking shortbread cookies that I'm not a fan of. So... onto the macarons. Delicious. I just wanted 3 of the best ones. I have no clue which I got actually. The cookies look the same with different fillings. Regardless, they're good.
author: Julie L.

description: The chocolate cake here is absolutely divine. The cakes are a little expensive here and are on the small side, but they're exquisite. They make for a very nice birthday cake for a party or group dinner, for about 6-10 people. The macarons are also very nice - I really liked the rose and orange chocolate ones. They're not artificially colored like other places' macarons, instead they all are light brown in colored, specked with almonds. But the flavors are true, so don't discount Miette's maracons because of that!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Best Pistachio Macaroons ever! 

To avoid embarrassment, I ask for a small little box of assorted macaroons and insist on them wrapping it up as it is going to be a gift for a dear friend. I then proceed to a quiet place away from the crowds to tear open the box and stuff my face! NOM nOM noM nom! 

I've only done this like once, ok maybe twice, but I think it would be pretty ill if it's something I did all the time and the workers never caught on and I'd be like this: http://images.wikia.com/toddlersandtiaras/images/7/76/Tumblr_lxwft0cKjc1rnuge7o1_500.gif and have a "muhaha" or "he,he,he,he" laugh.
author: Chris W.

description: Gingersnaps, Crisp and buttery with a delicate level of spice. $10 a package is kinda steep for cookies but they are a nice gourmet treat.
author: Oulie T.

description:
#49 on the Big Eat SF List: Ginger snaps at Miette

I'm not the biggest fan of ginger, but still wanted to try the ginger snaps here. I had a little trouble finding them thinking they are in glass case near the cashier, but they were prepackaged (about 10) in a clear container with a blue Miette label on a display shelf.

My first bite was so good. The ginger snaps had a spicy kick at the end. I shared them with my friends and they loved them as well. These ginger snaps and Blue Bottle coffee (across from the store) are a perfect match in foodie heaven.
author: Rhoda G.

description:
I've been a huge fan of yours for years, Miette.  Amazing cookies, macaroons & cakes I've had so far.  Very pretty fem digs to, a throw back to the days of soda fountains and ice cream parlors with striped walls and beautiful glass cases featuring splendid confections.

BUT, your customer service STINKS.  The last few times I've gone, your staff doesn't greet customers, smile or say thank you, ignores those patiently waiting in line, and act like they'd rather be at the beach.  Customer service is an important part of the food industry and in one of the busier and high traffic areas in San Francisco You should be on top of your game, instead of having SULKY AND DOUR staff who would  rather talk to each other than help prospective customers.

I'll find another bakery who makes delicious treats and have employees who are happy to help customers.  No thanks.
author: Jen L.

description:
Tried 4 different french macarons here. Not bad! I kept reading and hearing about Miette so I was excited to finally visit. They make beautiful cakes and other desserts. Really cute! 

The shells of the macarons were perfect...when touched, a careful crack is created - awesome - moist and not too sweet, creating a delightful flaky but chewy texture! To my surprise, the macarons were not very colorful. They all looked the same actually. But each one taste quite different from each other. My favorites of the 4 has to be the rose one and the caramel one. Tasted light and balanced. The macarons are a bit bigger than I'm used to but that's certainly not a complaint!
author: Joa K.

description:
I am completely comfortable about admitting that I spent $10 on sweets here. I have a sweet tooth addiction and I can't help it, especially with sweets this delightful. If you don't want to spend $10 here, it's imperative that you at least spend $1.50 on their delicious macaroon. I prefer the chocolate mainly because I am also a chocoholic. Next to the macaroons are their salty and sweet caramels.  These are the perfect sweet to end a meal at the Ferry Building. 

It would be a sin for your sweet tooth if you didn't pay Miette a visit when you're at the Ferry Building.
author: Lindsey D.

description:
One of the reason why I went to the Ferry Building was this bakery.  

I read great review on this place so I had to check it out.  The bakery was super cute.  

Macarons: Chocolate and Vanilla macarons.  wow!!  It was super good.  Just the right sweetness and taste.  4 stars.
Lavender Cookie: crunchy and yummy.  3.5 stars.
Chocolate:  dunno if it's good but it's definitely cute.  4 stars.

Service was good here.  I wish I was there before Valentine's Day so I could get my Valentine gift there.  

4 stars.

Miette Patisserie is yummylicious!!!
author: Maggie C.

description:
I went in looking for the ginger snaps I had heard so much about.  They were totally worth the trip.  The store is so bright, cheerful, it's impossible not to be happy.

They're sweet, and kind of salty, and have some bite from the ginger.  I really didn't think they would be this good.  at $7 for about 12, I don't think it's something I can keep as a staple, but they will be a great treat!
author: Lilly N.

description: The gingerbread cupcake was perfect- spicy but not too sweet, rich and moist with delicious cream cheese frosting. I got macaroons to take home and was surprised they were so inexpensive for having organic ingredients.
author: Tara W.

description:
PROS
+ Convenient Ferry Building location
+ Wide variety of cookies, cakes, and other confections to choose from

CONS
- Macarons are not uniform in size or shape - unprofessional-looking 
- Display method of macarons in glass jars = crushed shells
- Buttercream-like filling oozes out of cookie sandwich
- Limited flavor selection
- Barely detectable flavor 
- Macaron consistency is way too cakey 

Note: This is a review for -only- Miette's macarons.


Came here on a Saturday evening around closing time (~7pm) for a post Giants game snack. The end-of-the-day hour at which I came may have contributed to the shoddy state of the macarons by the time I got to them, but there are a number of things that are unacceptable for the premium price I am paying for a professionally made macaron. I will address each listed CON below: 

1. MACRONS ARE NOT UNIFORM IN SIZE OR SHAPE. 
The two cookie halves are not symmetrical. Each half is bumpy and lumpy and the "foot" is uneven. It seems the almond flour is coarsely ground, making for the lumpiness and grittiness. Chantal Guillon makes theirs perfectly circular, and each macaron is uniform in appearance - this is what I would expect from macarons I buy in a store.

2. DISPLAY METHOD IN GLASS JARS = CRUSHED SHELLS
Macarons are displayed in large glass jars, with one jar of each flavor. While this may make for a pretty display, it does not bode well for the delicate macaron shells. The server behind the counter reaches into the jar with a gloved hand, and no matter how skinny the server's fingers are, he/she will have to dig around the surrounding macarons to get yours out. By the time the macarons were handed to me, part of the shells were crushed and bits of the foot were chipped off.

3. FILLING HAS BUTTERCREAM-LIKE CONSISTENCY
To make matters worse, because the filling is more like buttercream than ganache, and the macarons are kept on the counter at room temperature, it is melty and runny, and when the server digs out your macaron from the jar, the cookie halves are partially separated and the filling oozes out. Terrible.

4. LIMITED FLAVOR SELECTION &
5. BARELY DETECTABLE FLAVOR
They only have 7 flavors. I guess for some, this creates more than enough choice, but seeing as I can barely detect the rose flavor in the rose geranium, nor the lavender flavor in the chocolate-lavender, NOR the pistachio, well, I guess it doesn't matter how many flavors they have. The dark chocolate flavor completely overshadowed the faintest hint of lavender. The chocolate flavor was quite good... but what happened to the lavender?

6. MACARON SHELLS = TOO CAKEY 
Macarons are supposed to be delicate and airy. Miette's shells are way too chewy and cakey and taste like a full-on almond cookie. Not good. 

OVERALL:
To be fair, I haven't tried any of their other dessert offerings. But their macarons were a complete miss. For $1.75 a pop, I expect quality I can't achieve myself at home. Make your way out to Hayes Valley to Chantal Guillon instead. Theirs go for $1.70 only, and are much, much classier and just plain better.
author: Megan L.

description:
Came here looking to be blown away by their cupcakes ($3.25) but to my dismay they had a ridiculously slim selection and lousy buttercream frosting - it was actually the mini scharffenberger ($5) that saved the day and review for Miette.

They had about 6 different flavors of kara-sized cupcakes on display, none of which included red velvet (I was told this was due to the artificial food coloring in red velvet cupcakes and since they're an organic bakery, etc. etc. (I knew this was a cop out on their behalf but didn't feel like informing the poor girl behind the counter that there is in fact 100% all natural, organic, vegan, gluten free, kosher, food coloring available. For example, see: http://www.naturesflavors.com). Anyway, to top off Miette's pathetic excuses for their lack of red velvet was the fact that nearly none of the other cupcakes on display had any other frosting other than buttercream. Meh! (there was the ginger cupcacke with creamcheese frosting but honestly, who wants ginger in a cupcake outside of Bangkok?) 

We ended up ordering a chocolate cupcake with chocolate buttercream and although the cake part was ridiculously good (thanks to scharffenberger), the icing was disappointing. It was one of those "butterface" moments - the cupcake had everything going for it, moist and chocolaty goodness cake, nice presentation and when you make it up to the top, you realize the rest of it just isn't worth it. I don't know any other way to describe it other than perhaps recommending that they change their description of "buttercream" frosting to something more accurate, "butterface". Thankfully we had also ordered the mini scharffenberger which was a chocolate scharffenberger cake dome covered in two layers of scharffenberger ganache, mmm, sooo good. The best dessert I've had outside of Europe!

Bottom line, we'll definitely be returning for those mini scharffenberger bites of heaven but won't be frequenting Miette for our cupcake fix.
author: H T.

description:
Store is blindingly pastel and sells all that overpriced art chocolate you see during the holidays, but so much of their stuff oozes cuteness that you really can't complain. They sell a glittery log that holds egg candies and then mushrooms made of marzipan (I think), so you can do the whole candy forest theme gift bag. Cupcakes are mighty tasty here even when we let them sit for hours and the meringue top decided to die and flop into the non-Chinese but very Chinese takeout box they individually pack cupcakes into. 

Alert: the Miette bag for purchases is pastel pink and decorated with the most "I AM A SMALL GIRL CHILD" flowers. My friend bought me a few cupcakes and I ended up skipping through the Tenderloin with the womanly bag in tow. How I wasn't gaybashed by hobos is a wonder and a half.
author: Kevin L.

description: Becoming my favorite bakery in the city. I've tried the ginger cake and the lemon cake. I'd highly recommend the ginger cake - a crowd pleaser every time. Pastel colors, beautiful presentation, and right in the ferry building - many things to love!
author: Linda X.

description:
macaron mania!
Must try the Rose Geranium and Hazelnut.. Then walk over to Peet's for a cup of joe. 
Sit at the dock of the bay and enjoy the view of the bay bridge and ships sailing by. 
WOOF!
author: Chesca A.

description: These macarons are huge. Like okay not huge but bigger than average (about twice the size of a normal one). I was walking around the Ferry Building and was doing pretty well in the self control department, but then I passed by Miette and caved. Everything was calling out to me: the cupcakes, the ice cream sandwiches, the pots the creme, etc. I ended up just getting a hazelnut macaron and that was absolutely delicious, although judging by the other reviews, I should've tried the pistachio. Their macarons aren't as pretty as what I've seen, but the texture and flavor are both spot on and I would like to try more if I were to visit again.
author: Helen S.

description: Oh I feel in love with Miette many many years ago, it was my favorite pastry shop, loved every detail of the store, the cakes, cookies all perfectly decorated, if I was to open a pastry shop this is how I would do it, I love french pastries and so does Miette. Every time I am in the area I head on over to Miette, I haven't been in the bay area since 2009, and was very excited to be headed back to my favorite shop, walked into the ferry building, turned to the left walked a few feet and their I was at the front of the shop, I had with me my son and daughter and I said guys, this is the place! I was craving their macaroons, so I ordered a half dozen  I let the kids pick 2 of the flavors they wanted and I got 2 as well I went with the vanilla and chocolate macaroon, and this is where I was disappointed, I think Essence Bakery has ruined me with their mouth melting favor exploding soft pillows of heaven macaroons, I was wanting that same experience but wanted it more from Miette, this is my favorite bakery, I traveled over 700 miles to get there to have a sweet taste of bliss, and I feel let down. Oh so sad :(  but on the upside, I see that Miette has a cookbook, very excited, already placed my order haha
author: Monica O.

description:
I am not into spending $3 for one cupcake when I can bake from scratch for a little over that and have a whole cake or 2 dozen cupcakes.  But they did look very pretty and fancy. 

But I came here for a reason - Parisian Macarons.  These are not like macaroons w/coconut.  Definetly different in all kinds of yummy ways. 
They are $1.50 each and if you are dainty enough you can get 4 petite bites outs if it or just pop the whole thing in your mouth for an yummy explosion! 

I got 4 pisatchio - pissstaseeo - but thats how i sounded when the lady asked if i wanted help because I was like a crack fiend for them, and also Vanilla.  It was so moist with a chewy but melt in your mouth texture and the filling was very light with a hint of buttercream.  Try not to just pop in your mouth - its hard not to just gobble them up.  But I was out in public so I had to look demur and feme.  But the little fat girl inside wanted more!! 

I did also get 2  fleur de sal caramels and 1 chocolate fleur de sal.
I have to say the chocolate one kinda sucked.  The regular fleur caramel was yummy - you get the salt flavor right away which hits the salavatory glands and mixes with the warm, creamy sweet caramel.  It was delish! And easy to eat on Bart.  

I either need to find an exact recipe for the macarons or I am going to be spending a lot of money because I have plans on using the macaron as party favors or something!!
author: Erika G.

description: Love everything about the Ferry Building in SF. This place is so quick, easy, and cute. The macarons are delicious - love the Rose and Vanilla flavors the best. So sweet, moist, and perfect texture.
author: Kate P.

description:
Miette Patisserie offers some delicious macarons, however the prices are quite steep for the sizes. They are $1.75 each and just a tad bit larger than a 50cent coin.

They also offer cakes and cupcakes and everything looks delectable AND pretty!

Very girly and I think these desserts would all make great gifts for a female friend, teacher, mother, sister, etc... I know I'd certainly be happy to get something like this - a real treat =)
author: Veronica S.

description:
This review is only for their macaroons since that is all I have tried, but man are they GOOD!

I don't know if all macaroons are this good because this is the first time I have tried them, but they will haunt my naughty food dreams at night!!

I've often seen pictures of brightly colored macaroons artfully displayed on fancy silver trays, but they never really tempted me (and we are talking the little cookie sandwich type not the coconut kind) they looked to me to be dry and crunchy almost like an Oreo with food color. MAN was I wrong!!!

THESE macaroons were soft, chewy, and creamy more like a squished cream puff than an Oreo. I tried the pistachio and hazelnut; both were amazing but it is without a doubt the pistachio that will keep me under its spell forevermore!
author: Jill P.

description:
Only 6 favors to choose from... All favors look the same in color, so I minus 1 stars for lack of variety. $1.88 each which is not bad. 
minus another star because the macaroon does not taste fresh, like it is not crispy outside and mushy inside, the cream in the middle is too sweet and lack of favor. I usually can distinguish which favor is which, but with the four macaroons (of course, 4 different favors), I could not taste the difference at all. A little disappointing since there are several good review for Miette. Maybe I just went on a wrong day.
author: Rebegi G.

description:
The World According to Noelle
Allergic Girl's Guide to Life

After shopping at Sur La Table and picking up lunch at the Acme Bread Company we decided make a stop at Miette for some sweet treats. It was extremely crowded. 

We picked up:
Caramel Candy (Hard Candy)
Cotton Candy (Hard Candy)
Salted Caramels (Soft)
Blueberry Jam with Meyer Lemon
Ginger Snaps
Meyer Lemon Curd Tart
Caramel Pot de Creme
Chocolate Pot de Creme

The hard caramel candy and cotton candy were just okay tasting (25 cents a piece). The Salted Caramels (with Fleur de sel) was melt in your mouth delicious (expensive a little over $2.00 a piece). The Ginger Snaps were buttery, sweet and a lil spicy. I was majorly disappointed in 
Caramel Pot de Creme and Chocolate Pot de Creme- they were not rich, they were not flavorful. The lemon curd tart was a perfect combination of sweet and tart with the most delicious crust ever- seriously the best lemon curd tart I've ever had. 

We'll try the jam out tomorrow. The person behind the counter was rushing me to make a decision, I told her twice that I couldn't see the other glass case because there were two people ahead of us blocking the view.  It turns out the people ahead of us only bought one macaroon each but were just taking a long look at the case. I didn't like the abrupt attitude from the customer service person. When I'm spending $5 or $50 I expect good customer service. Here the customer service was CLEARLY LACKING. 

Icing on the Cake in Los Gatos is still our family's favorite for sweet treats and candy confections. For a better chocolate pot de creme try Gayle's in Capitola. Miette is good but not great. I would expect a little more for the price point.

Noelle's Notes
Not bad pastries.
Horrible customer service.
author: Noelle J.

description:
After enjoying some food from the stands outside, my sister-in-law & I went inside the Ferry Building to get some dessert from Miette Patisserie. This place is so cute! & so many sweets to choose from! :) 

Valrhona Chocolate Ice Cream on Our Delicious Chocolate Wafers - SOOOOOOO YUMMYYY!!! I knew it had to be good because it was one of the only ones in the freezer compared to the other flavors. I'm a big fan of chocolate. The ice cream was very rich. & the wafers complimented with the ice cream well. They sold the wafers by themselves, but they taste even better with ice cream. I can't wait for the next time that I'm at Miette Patisserie so that I can get another Valrhona Chocolate Ice Cream on Our Delicious Chocolate Wafers!! :) It's a definite MUST TRY! 

Buttermilk Panna Cotta w/ Fresh Strawberries - I've never had panna cotta before until my sister-in-law ordered it. YUM YUM YUM!! It comes in this small little jar w/ fresh-cut strawberries on top. It's DELICIOUS! & you get $1 if you return the jar. All of it tasted just right :) 

Chocolate Macaron - This was my first time trying a macaron. As already mentioned, I'm a chocolate fan. I enjoyed the chocolate one. 

Hazelnut Macaron - I like hazelnut, but this one was just okay. Nothing special. Probably wouldn't get it again though since there's many other things to try.
author: Jessica A.

description:
"Sweet like candy to my soul.....sweet you rock and sweet you roll..."

-Dave Matthews Band's "Crash"

I haven't found the right girl who will 'crash' into me, so I substitute my love for sweet girls by eating sweets.  And muffins.  ;)

The cupcakes here are divine.  Beyond divine.  

My visit yesterday guided me in another direction.  Their cheesecake.  I love cheesecake like I love baseball and the Dodgers.  

Miette's cheesecake is probably the best I've had.  I'm lusting after it as I type.  It took me to a sugary blissful place that I long for.

Picture this:  Tall, black, motherfucker (me) on Market Street near the Subway and Noah's eating the above.  With his hands.  Utensil free. 

I told you I loved cheesecake.  :)
author: Carlos K.

description:
My friend and I heard that this place has some pretty darn tootin macaroons and arguably the best in San Francisco. So, obviously we're going to check this place out since we have nothing better to do.

First off, 1 Ferry Building?! What's that??? I've been living in San Francisco all my life and never heard of a marketplace inside here. Only time I ever go to the Embarcadero is during Giant's season. Man...I need to go outside more often. Right when we went in, we were WOW'd. What the f**k is this place? I shit you not. I felt like I was Harry Potter walking through Diagon Alley.  A bunch of little shops and filled with people walking around. Now to look for Platform 9 and 3/4. (HA.HA.HA)

Anyways, we found Miette Patisserie and started picking out what we want to eat like a bunch of little kids in a candy shop. We got a bunch of Macaroons (Chocolate, Hazelnut, Coffee, Vanilla) and two cupcakes too. In the end, it totaled out to be around 22 dollars. Kinda pricey, but overall..NOT TOO SHABBY.
author: Eric M.

description:
This is a really cute place. There's so many delicious things to try, and everything looks so good! The disclaimer on my review is for the ginger snaps only. I didn't get anything else because I was overwhelmed, and only got the ginger snaps because it's on the 7x7 list. 

The ginger snaps would be good, I think, even great, if I liked ginger snaps at all. There was definitely a nice "snap" to the cookies. It was thick and crispy. The ginger taste was definitely there. I could taste that they used lots of fresh ginger because it was quite strong. So if that sounds like something you like, or you're a fan of ginger snaps then Miette is a place for you!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Their Gingerbread cupcake has 2 things in common with me: 

1. It's small, and full of things that are bad for you. 

2. It's made with ginger. 

Add these two together and you know it's going to be DAMN GOOD.
author: Emily D.

description:
I feel like there are so many bakeries around SF that are similar to Miette--girly, pink and kind of expensive for what it's worth.

Okay things
- Macarons: They only have 7 flavors here and it's nothing too out of the ordinary with chocolate, vanilla, raspberry and flavors that are in shades of light pink, cream, or brown. There's a nice nuttiness to the macarons and some chewiness. At $1.80 apiece, it's pretty standard pricing.

Not so good things
- Gingersnaps: I have heard so much about the gingersnaps at Miette, but what I had was a thin, almost stale-tasting piece of crunchy cardboard. It has a very strong ginger taste, which is nice if you're a fan of ginger, but the texture is really off-putting. It also isn't too cheap, as it comes like 8 to a box for $8 dollars for the thinnest cracker/cookie you'll ever have. Seriously, how is this on the 7x7 list of 100 things to eat before you die?!

Maybe their cupcakes and cakes will be redemptive, but I'm not too impressed for now :(
author: Shira C.

description:
French macarons.... smallish, delicate, light, great flavors...
we opted for a pistachio, a grapefruit (sesasonal), and I cannot recall the last one. Such a cutsie little shop lookin like it's from a movie prop inside of the Ferry Bldg. 

absolute perfection with a cup of Blue Bottle freshly dripped! spendy

PS Another location in East Bay's Jack London for a little while now. FYI
author: Jana C.

description:
Macaroons! Macaroons! Macaroons!  $1:75/each
Typical Flavors: Chocolate, Hazelnut, Strawberry, Vanilla, Pistachio.

Not good for sharing, so buy extras to keep your family & friends away from your goodies! :P 

My favorites so far: Pistachio and Grapefruit Macaroon!!  SOOOOOOOO GOOD!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
High Art of Sweet Tooth.

Everything we've tried is beyond niggles.  Highlight: crispy cookies are fantastic.  If you like ginger cookies you better be careful with theses... you could bankrupt yourself.

Unusual delectibles to be found, like delicate candied pistachios for Easter.   

Chocolate lovers will be satisfied here.  Even if you don't like sweet, you might try the kickass pink watermelon gums.

Expensive and worth it.
author: Bob K.

description: Tried their macarons (all flavors). Not a fan. Chewy, grainy, and nothing like real Parisian macarons. These are a weird San Francisco version. Chantal Guillon is much better.
author: B T.

description: With all the reviews, I thought I'd try this while wandering the Ferry Building. I got the Pistachio. I do like how chewy the cookie part was, but I didn't really taste the pistachio in the filling. Still quite a nice little sugar hit.
author: Deb G.

description: First time coming here and it looks so amazing. There were two friendly men who greeted us, once we entered. I love the decor of the place and the smell. I got one hazelnut French macaroon and I loved it. I can taste a moist, chewy, delicate, macaroon ever. I felt so embarrassed though when we left. We forgot to hold the door behind us to close the door. Instead it closing it slowly it sounded like we slammed it shut.
author: Neryssa U.

description:
You know, just enjoying the Ferry Building, cruising the shops on Embarcadero and then...POW! The best macaroon I've ever had in my life! Not exactly a common sentence for most. Something that may slip out of your mouth once or twice in one's lifetime. 

"That was the best macaroon I've ever eaten!" He said. "My goodness, I can't wait to say that again!" Knowing it wouldn't likely happen again within the span of his life. 

A quaint shoppe, festooned with chocolates, cakes, infamous macaroons and plenty of pinks, pastel colored cake dishes and sugar-laden goodies. 

Try the hazelnut, vanilla and chocolate macaroons. You could easily wolf down 10 of these suckers (more or less like oreos) and still go back for more. Justifiable at about $1.25 a piece. Not ideal for sharing, but can be done if you're in a pinch. 

They also sell Mast Brother's Chocolate! Huge win! This place rules. Can't wait to visit the original location! Viva Miette!
author: Benjamin G.

description:
The macaron was just too soft~ The flavor did not stand out either.
I felt like I was like eating a regular mushy cookie.
No crunchy shell or chewiness at all.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Have you ever heard of a "Cookie Photoshoot"? Yeah, me neither... until I came here and was inspired to conduct one. Must've taken at least 20 shots in 3 light settings with these babies both in and out of the cookie bag...Top Angle, bottom angle, close up, stacked and unstacked. 
  
You might be judging me right now and thinking, "She's insane. Photoshoots for cookies?" but I am not exaggerating when I say that Miette makes the most photogenic cookies I have ever seen from my years of cookie eating experience. These Macarons (which my less classy friend has termed "fancy oreos") are a bit bigger and sharper looking than other Macarons I have seen so it gives them a bit of a rustic look. Not even an Instagram tint could've done a better job in selling them! 
Being a smidgeon larger in circumference and at $1.75 a pop they were priced at a pretty competitive market value price.  
Next shoot: Their icecream sandwiches... cupcakes would be too predictable.
author: Spring L.

description:
I love me some Miette.  I'll be honest ... it definitely deserves to be one of the top 10 desserts in the nation, named by the Food Network.

It's also got one of my absolute favorite flavors of cupcake: gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting.  This has been voted as "BEST CUPCAKE IN AMERICA," people.  You gotta try it.

Look, it's made with: dark stout beer, molasses, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon and cardamom then topped with a sweet cream cheese frosting.  How could you not want a piece of that goodness?

If you're in FiDi, take a walk down to the Ferry Building, meander down the corridors to Miette and grab yourself a gingerbread cupcake.  They usually sell out after lunch, so morning would be best.  They've also got a ton of wonderful treats: great chocolates, yummy cakes, pot de creme, and more cupcakes!  It's definitely worth a trip - maybe not for the cupcake addicted like me, though.
author: Liz A.

description:
I'm a big banana cream pie person. So when I saw the banana cream tartlette, I had to give it a try. It was a bit pricy for a little tart at $6.50. I took a bite into it and thought it was worth it. I'm not big on chocolate but it complemented the fresh banana and cream very well.
