I got the honey graham crackers for $8.50. They smelled really good when I opened the container. It tasted just as good as they smelled. Fresh, crunchy and not too sweet.
author: Sammi C.

description: To be fair, some items, like the sable cookies, are great, as are the caramels. However, the customer service is RUDE AND HORRIBLE. I shop at Miette every 2 weeks to pick up treats for the office. Never again. I will never, ever again shop there with their condescending staff. I'm also upset about their terrible cookbook - if you were thinking of buying that, please don't. It's filled with errors.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Homemade marshmallows are the next big thing. They've been neglected too long. Jacques Torres covers them in milk and dark chocolate. Chikalicious creates tiny squares feathered with coconut. Bittersweet Cafe recommends having them with their hot chocolate. Miette makes them plain and simple.

Shaped like baby hockey pucks, Miette offers three flavors (lavender, vanilla, and honey). I picked up a bag along with chocolate chip cookies and the obligatory macarons for a hostess gift I knew my bff would love. 

The marshmallows were like pillows of sugar. They were fluffy, not sticky, lightly dusted and were infused with vanilla. At our dinner party, some of us chose to dunk them into our hot cocoa (where they bloomed but still stayed in tact) and some of us held them over candlelight (where they proceeded not to burn or toast). The marshmallows from Miette were strong and meant to be eaten just as is, plain and simple (unaltered). I think that is the best way to appreciate homemade marshmallows. Take a bite and pay attention to the soft texture. Let the marshmallow dance with your tastebuds.

I really hope marshmallows become the next big thing in 2010. Until then, I'll supplement my cravings with all of the other has beens. Miette offers an assortment of mini cookies, cupcakes, candies, and tiny cakes fit for princesses. I'd only buy a few items at Miette. Not everything interests me. But I am rooting for those marshmallows. They sure are good.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Several months ago, a girlfriend of mine finally devirginized my farmer's market experience at the SF Ferry Building. I used to live in the city, but moved to the east bay awhile back. Since I've been living across the bridge, i haven't really walked around the Ferry Building during a weekend. Well we had brunch and enjoyed the nice Sunday weather and bought  different kinds fruits, etc. OK so if you are reading my review, you are probably thinking, "How the heck does this relate to Miette??"....

     Well, the highlight of my Ferry Building experience was not exactly the Farmer's Market, but stepping inside the Miette Patisserie and tasting their scrumptious french macaroons! We walked throughout the Ferry Building and checked out several stores, but hands down, Miette is my favorite place within that vicinity. I tried the different flavored macaroons, but pistachio was the best. Then my friend reminded me that we went to Miette Patisserie in Hayes Valley several years ago. I recall that store was definitely an eye candy. Another review mentioned that the place looked like a "Willy Wonka Candy Store meets Alice in Wonderland" and i definitely agree with that yelp-er! However, when i went to the store in on Hayes Valley before, i didn't  try any of the macaroons. I was more fascinated with the colorful assortments of candy, cupcakes and cookies. 

     Nevertheless, the french macaroons are lovely with a sweetness that is very subtle so it keeps you wanting more. The only reason i gave Miette four stars is because they ran out of the pistachio flavor when i came back to the store a second time around that day i went to the Ferry Building, in hopes to take some home. But i guess it was such a popular flavor, so i should have just grabbed the opportunity and bought some the first time.
author: Karla M.

description:
I will never never never EVER EVER get sick of Miette's. 

Their macaroons, especially the pistachio macaroons, are dangerously & delightfully delicious. They are so light and flakey and creamy and tasty... and ultimately so FULL of "melts-in-your-mouth" type of goodness. The other flavors- vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut are good as well... but there's something quite "essspeciale" about the pistachio flavor.  I have intro'd a good amount of my friends to these tasty little morsels, and they too have enjoyed them.  Haha, someone referred to it as an "orgasm in your mouth". Not quite the choice of vocabulary I'd use, but I can easily see how it relates. LOL

The 7x7 list references the Ginger Snaps as the "100 things to try before you die." It was $7 for about 12 cookies. Too bad you couldn't have just purchased 1 rather than the entire package. They weren't anything I'd rave about to friends or keep coming back for more. I'd be happier paying $21 for 12 of the macaroons instead of the snaps. ((Snap!))

Enough said. :)
author: Joy A.

description:
The macaroons here are made for the gods. Ambrosia, I tell you, Ambrosia!!

Here are the steps to follow...
- Get a chocolate macaroon
- Close your eyes
- Take a small bite 
- Let the flavors flow over you
- Finish macaroon
- Get another macaroon
- Repeat

The mini Scharrfen chocolate cake (not 100% certain about about name) is reeeally good as well.
author: Sunil R.

description:
REVIEW IS FOR THE MACARONS ONLY

Sorry but the macarons are terrible, aweful, horrible they are so chewy. Macarons NOT supposed to be like a cake/brownie. They should be delicate and light/airy not dense wet feeling almost like a brownie. I was so disappointed because I bought 6 or 7 macarons and not one of them tasted like they should. I ended up taking a bite out of each one to taste them and just tossed them into the trash. I really wanted to love this place because the decorations and desserts looked amazing. I hope the rest of their desserts taste better than their macarons.

Sorry to be so crazy about macarons, but I know what they are supposed to be like and not just because I have had them in Paris at Laduree, which is like the god father of macarons, but because I have had them at other places, New York Laduree, Mason du Chocolat, Los Angeles Bottega Louie, Lette and other small artisan shops so I have a bit of macarons experience.
author: Tiffany O.

description:
GOD THIS PLACE IS WAY TOO CLOSE TO MY OFFICE.

The only full item I've gotten here so far was a hazelnut macaron, and it blew my mind. I'm a huge Nutella fan (who isn't?), and not a very experienced macaron-eater, but it met all possible expectations a connoisseur could possibly have.

The macaron itself had the best bite to it ever. So delicate and crisp on top, with a light and chewy center. The ground hazelnuts really come through. 

Very excited to try other flavors. I also tried a sample of their chocolate sable, which was ridiculously good. I was also eyeing the ice cream sandwiches...oh, and their packaging design just punches things up even more.
author: Rachel F.

description: First time tasting their macarons and they are DELICIOUS!!  We tried the Dulce de Leche it didn't disappoint. Very good and will definitely go back again!
author: Stephanie M.

description: I am obsessed with their mint chocolate covered almonds! My mouth is watering just thinking about them. Their macarons are delicious! My favorite is their salted caramel macaron. Yum!!
author: Annette Y.

description: I wasn't overly impressed by anything at Miette - well, perhaps their packaging. It is really cute! We stopped off to pick up a few macaroons on Saturday while at Farmers Market. They were ok, nothing out of this world. I still love La Maison du Chocolat from Paris. Of course as soon as I saw they had vanilla bean marshmallows I had to have a package, again - not impressed and I LOVE marshmallows!!! Overall, cute little goodies but the taste didn't win me over.
author: Candace L.

description:
$3.50 for a macaroon

First time I've been and being a macaroon fan I couldn't resist.

Tried coffee and pistachio. 

Coffee was nothing special. BOOOO!

Pistachio however was pretty delicious!!  

I definitely thought it was a little pricey because let's face it a macaroon is only 2 bites max but it was worth a try. 

Would I come back?? Not a definite yes but not a definite no.
author: Vanessa F.

description: So glad my friend got me marshmallows from here, because, otherwise, I would have never in life purchased them of my own volition. These marshmallows are def not the Kraft ones you grew up with, they are light and fluffy with specks of vanilla scattered throughout. On my last trip to the bay, I had to make a special trip to the ferry building to purchase as a gift for my buddies and the peeps were impressed as well. Package was gone in 2.5 seconds.
author: Suzanna L.

description: The mint chocolate ice cream sandwich was bomb. So was the caramel and ginger cupcake. The cupcake was so moist and the frosting was made of cream cheese. Come here to satisfy your sweet tooth craving if Smitten's line is too long. You won't regret it.
author: Elise G.

description:
I like all the goodies here except their cupcakes :( I've had better ones.
Macaroons are good too but the ones I've tried in my life are better. 
But still I'm a fan haha! I'm a sucker for sugar seriously!
author: Cryszilla G.

description: I heard great things about this place, so of course I had to try it. I was told their macarons and cupcakes were amazing. I've tried macarons from France and wanted to see how they compared. They were indeed really good...different from the ones from France because they were chewier and were more dense but I liked that about it. The old-fashioned cupcake was perfect because it wasn't overly sweet. Since I don't live in SanFran, I will definitely be ordering some online and having them overnighted to me!
author: Kat A.

description:
I really wanted to be a fan of this cute patisserie, but after giving them several tries, I don't agree with the hype.

First of all, their macarons are not good. They're not very flavorful or authentic (with the whipped filling and not-quite-right texture). They definitely can't compare to the ones at the top Parisian vendors (Laduree and Pierre Herme) or Chantal Guillon in Hayes Valley.

Their cupcakes are also not rave-worthy. I was excited when they had cupcake versions of their famous old-fashioned cake with Italian meringue frosting (so I could finally cross that off the 7x7 list of 50 SF sweet treats), but it honestly wasn't that special. It's just whipped frosting instead of the usual super-sweet harder frosting. The cake part was not moist enough for me.

The Carrot Cake cupcake was decent but felt TOO light to me. I probably consumed about as many calories as would be in a Sprinkles cupcake, but it didn't taste indulgent enough to be worth it.

Also, $5 minimum for credit cards (Visa and MasterCard only).

What a bummer. I'll just have to get my sweet tooth fix somewhere else.
author: Amy X.

description:
Lord...how did I spend $11 on five macaroons...

Well, these babies are worth it! I wanted to just buy one, but saw all the different flavors and succumbed. I got one of each of buttercream flavors! Hazelnut, pistachio, rose geranium, vanilla, and coffee!
author: Michelle N.

description:
Baked goods and pastries that are both cute AND delicious? What a treasure. I found myself sharing some financiers and salted caramels with my sister outside on the pier after purchasing from Miette and was like "wow, this is a really luxurious moment." The financiers were perfectly sized and caramelized with a delicate, buttery crumb. The salted caramels were simply ethereal, and melt oh so softly in your mouth (must be all that good butta!)

Treat yourself to some Miette!
author: Amber M.

description:
Cutest store ever! They didn't have a lot of macarons to choose from, but seeing as they had a lot of other treats, that was to be forgiven.

I had the ginger snaps and it was simply delicious. When I opened the container, I could smell the combined scent of the ginger and sugar. A bite of it was delicious. Two bites of it was scrumptious. And well, by the fifth bite, it was gone.
author: Karen Y.

description:
my favorite bakery to buy macaroons...omg...i love you soo!  I promise you...they are sooo damn good.. I dream of them.

the cupcakes are the best. My favorite? The freaking carrot cake one! god i love it soo...

I'll be back again for more desserts...if you are at the ferry market, stop by and pick up some delicious sweets from Miette...
author: Rita L.

description: Lovely macaroons , cupcakes, marshmallows and other decadent sweets that surely will give you a toothache and fix your sugar cravings.
author: Claudine V.

description:
When I say: I LOVE macarons! It's pretty much an understatement.. I seriously drive hella far to try some! At first I didn't like the place because the worker who helped me wasn't really friendly.. I didn't appreciate the stare as I admire the store..

I paid for 10 macarons and only got 8 (sidenote: is it macaron or macaroon? Anywho!) Automatic 1 star review, the macarons it self deserved 1 1/2. After trying many macarons I've decided to base macarons spots with the flavor rose (my favey!). 

Miette's macarons texture was different.. It had, like chunks of almond in the cookie part. That was the first time I've had a macaron like that. I love when I take a bite of these little things and they burst in my mouth - full of flavor, but theirs is a little understated. I tasted the rose flavor but not as much as I wanted or what I'm used to.. 

I don't want to yuck anyones yum, but this isn't a yum for me, it'll be a: thanks for the experience but I'll pass.. And is it too late to get refunded 3.50 for the two macarons I didn't get? (Just kidding!)
author: Mare L.

description:
Anytime I see french macarons, I have to try them. HAVE to try them. I don't know why. They're not anyone's favorite dessert or snack, they're incredibly hard to get right, and a cupcake is so much more satisfying than one or two macarons. Regardless, something about those adorable little rounds compels me to try them. 

I tried their chocolate, hazelnut, and rose geranium. The flavors were all quite lovely, but the texture was just not right for me. Too dense, both the cookie part as well as the filling. And the almonds used for almond flour in the cookie dough had not been sifted.  Perhaps this was intentional, but I'm sure this added to the density of the macaron. They were edible, but not to my liking.
author: Jennifer F.

description: This little stall is so cute! All of their desserts are well-presented and look delicious, but I just got the macarons and lemon shortbread cookies. The macarons are so tasty! I tried the hazelnut, pistachio, vanilla, and chocolate macarons, but my favorites are the vanilla and pistachio ones. The shortbread cookies are also amazing. They are very light and crisp.
author: Rachel H.

description: Caramel panna cotta is a must get! I wish I bought more. Its light and not too sweet and comes in this cute little jar, love it!. I also bought a bag of mini chocolate chip cookies. They were good but crunchy, I prefer chewy.  BF got the lemon tart, didn't get to try it. I will be back to try more sweets next time.
author: Shirlene N.

description:
M: I got you a box of macaons and a banana cream tartlette from Miette.
C: Awesome (unwraps box)

C: They're so pretty babe!
M: I know. Hope they taste as good as they look.

C: (bites into first macaron and looks confused)
M: What do you think?

C: Um...What flavors did you get?
M: Not sure. Rose, hazelnut, chocolate lavender, and strawberry I think.

C: This one's doesn't really taste like anything. (moves on to next)
M: But they're sooo pretty!

C: Waaahhh!  This one also tastes like nothing.  These macarons suck!
M.  Looks like we're moving on to the banana creme tartlette. (takes bite)

M: OMG this is amazing! Nom nom nom (stuffs face a la Cookie Monster)
C: I thought you got that for me! (grabs tartlette and smacks M over the head)

M: Ouch...BEST nom DESSERT nom EVER!
C: And you're the BEST BF EVER!

--

Overall I would have to say that I'm a fan and will definitely be back for their awesome desserts.  The service is always great and I Love Love Love their decor and overall style.  

For the most part I've enjoyed everything that I've gotten from Miette, except for their macarons, which in my opinion pretty bland and flavorless. I don't get it though because the texturally they're awesome.  They're just lacking the extra umph..

As far as their other desserts, I've gotten a chance to try their banana creme tartlette, which could be one of my favorite dessets ever.  Don't pass this up!  The lime meringue tartlette is also quite delish, and if you like teh tart sweet combo then this is right up your alley.
author: Michael C.

description:
MACARONS!! My favorite so far from all the places I've tried, actually! The shells of the macarons are not airy (which is good) but dense enough where it has a crack when you bite into it and it's chewy. The filling has just enough cream and they aren't overly sweet, which is why I LOVE EM!

I usually walk down to the ferry building during my lunch and when I'm craving something sweet and enjoy it while looking out into the bay with a view of the bridge (I LOVE MY CITY, btw).

Guess I'm not giving the whole 5 stars since I haven't tried everything they have to offer AND it's pricey. 

The decor is so cute too; aesthetically pleasing is always a plus in my book!

Favorite Flavors: Chocolate Orange and Lavender

The Ferry Building itself is great place to take anyone and while you are there, might as well get a sweet treat from Miette.
author: Olga F.

description: Try the Rose & Geranium Macaron and Banana Cream Tartlette if you don't mind growing a big fupa. Best when paired with Ciao Bella gelato next door immediately after.
author: Suany W.

description:
Passed by here with some friends. Saw some pretty good reviews about this place, so I decided to try their pistachio macaroon. Though, it was an overpriced macaroon, it was well worth the $2. 

The texture of the whole macaroon worked perfectly together, the outside shell was perfectly flaky and in the interior was perfectly chewy. It was so good! Maybe next time when I have more money, I'll try more of their treats. But, as of right now that one pistachio macaroon has me convinced that they have good stuff here. 

Not to also mention that the whole store looked very cute.
author: Amy H.

description:
As I'm an out-of-towner, my review is based on a single item. I asked the server to recommend me their best single little snack and she went with the chocolate with lavender macaroon.

I was in Paris last month and had some outstanding macaroons there. This was just as good. The lavender came through and was able to hold itself against the chocolate. The shell was crunchy and the inside chewy. Exemplary.
author: Yee Gan O.

description:
On our tour of the Ferry Building, we had to stop by Miette for some snacks. I wanted to try the graham crackers, but I didn't have anything to carry them home in, so we just got a carrot cupcake, raspberry macarons, and pistachio macarons here. 

The cupcake was pretty good, but there were too many spices in the cake, which was really moist and light. The frosting was a little too sweet but tasty. The macarons had a grainy texture an weren't as smooth, light, and airy as macarons from other bakeries. They were okay flavor-wise, but not my favorite macarons overall, due to texture issues. 

The whole little storefront is all pink and frilly, so I found it endearing, but my husband was not impressed by the decor -- he didn't like it or dislike it, he just felt ambivalent about it. 

The prices are pretty expensive, but the macarons were surprisingly more reasonably priced than other items. 

Looking forward to my next visit here. The graham crackers will not be safe next time.
author: Anh D.

description:
I think the staff at 7 X 7 Magazine made a serious mistake.  Unless you need massive amounts of ginger to spice up your sex life (ginger is a known aphrodisiac) or you ARE Ginger Spice (of the spice girls!)  make sure you skip this one:

#49 Ginger Snaps at Miette on the Big Eats SF list

For $6.50 you get 14 ginger snaps arranged in a neat stack in a plastic container.  The ginger's spiciness becomes evident after a couple of bites.  You really need to get the saliva action going because this cookie is dry and its supposed to be crunchy, but it's really more on the hard side. (as if it's been in the container too long)

I'm glad I also purchased some macarons: rose geranium and pistachio flavors which costs  $1.50 each.  Pistachio is my favorite macaron flavor!  So I guess next time I come to Miette, I will just stick to that.
author: Janice C.

description: This is a super small and cute place to take your tourist friends, or anyone perhaps! I took my Hong Kong friend here and we went NUTS with the macaroons! We ordered the strawberry, vanilla and rose ones for starters. He said he couldn't taste it in the beginning but the tasted it after. They are delicious! They just melt in your mouth. So soft with a slight crunch and it's not too sweet. I just wish it wasn't so expensive so I can buy so much more!
author: Linda K.

description:
They ran out of the rose macaroons by 10am yesterday!

I basically came here from Southern California for a rose macaroon. And they were out. The other macaroons are good... but just not on the same level.
author: Ami Y.

description:
Disclaimer - I'm not a huge sweets person, I don't really enjoy extremely sweet or chocolatey desserts, and I guess I don't really like macarons either.

Kind of silly to review a macarons place if I don't like macarons, but whatever - maybe there are some people out there with similar tastes who are considering trying Miette.  And don't get me wrong, it is definitely worth a try.  The shop is very cute and the macarons look really good.  However, if you are trying out Miette for the first time, I don't recommend buying $8 worth of macarons like I did.  I got one or two of almost every flavor (pistachio, strawberry, chocolate lavender, rose vanilla, etc.), and ended up taking a bite out of every flavor before discarding it.  They were just too sweet to finish.

The macarons are tiny and should not be too hard to finish, but some of the flavors I thought I'd really enjoy - like the chocolate lavender - were just way, way, way too chocolatey for my personal taste.  I think my favorite flavors were those of the vanilla variety, not the chocolate.

However, I think some of the vanilla macarons have hazelnut in them, even if they do not specify a hazelnut flavor in the cream.  This is unfortunate, because I am allergic to hazelnut.  I suggest asking them beforehand about all the flavors if you have any sort of nut allergies.

Overall, Miette is a cute pastry shop and I'm sure if you love sweets and macarons, you will love Miette.  But if you are trying it out for the first time, go easy on the macarons and make sure you try one or two before buying the whole shop out.  Next time, I will probably skip their macarons and try their ice cream sandwiches instead.
author: Amanda N.

description:
Current weekend obsessions: 

Rose Geranium Macarons*
Gram Cracker Ice Cream Sandwiches**

* Yes, that is the correct spelling with reference to the sweet French confection.. Not to be confused with "macaroon", which is an entirely different treat (think: coconut macaroons).

** Easily missed if you're not looking for them..find the ice cream sandwiches in a small freezer chest to the left of the shop. $4 a pop.
author: Elaine T.

description: Finally had the chance to try Miette and not sure what the fuss is all about! I tried all the macaron flavors they had to offer that day and all of them tasted the same. I was surprised how cheap the macarons were but honestly I can tell why -- no quality ! The 2 stars are for the great customer service and beautiful decor.
author: Lidiana K.

description: I love all things gingerbread and Miette definitely delivers on their gingerbread, cream cheese frosted cupcake.  It's no surprise that this cupcake is #5 dessert in the nation by Alton Brown. This is melt-in-your-mouth perfection. Amazing!
author: Tami D.

description:
(See pic)

This place looks immaculately clean, and the desserts look meticulous, well polished, almost Stepford Wives style.

I only tried 1 piece of Opera cake, well named I must add as it has multiple layers of bitterness (coffee), sweetness, crunchiness, smoothness and richness. It's complex and sophisticated. It's 4 dollars well spent.

And they use Chinese takeout boxes (with handle) with their stickers, cute but strange.
author: T L.

description:
When it comes to macarons (note: not macaroons), you can't beat Miette Patisserie, especially not at these prices. Consider that making these airy little sandwich cookies yourself might be the world's biggest pain in the ass, and then consider that you can buy them for less than $2 each, where they come in a nice waxed bag with a cute sticker. Buy four and they come in an adorable, elegant little box. 

The only thing that makes me sad is that they don't sell real food, but if Miette's quality comes from their laserlike focus, then I say they stick with what works.
author: Aaron Y.

description:
There's not much more to say about Miette that hasn't already been said. 

I go here for the macarons - they are the BEST in town. Pricey, but I know I'm going to get a consistent, delicious treat. Trust me, I've tried them all...several times. Also, if you have someone to impress or a special occasion, their cakes are delicious. You have to love dense, chocolate-y goodness. My favorite is the old-fashioned with the marshmallow icing. 

Not to mention the beautiful, clean presentation. It's adorable, it's elegant, and it makes my mouth water. Even their logo and boxes are lovely. My only complaint is the inconsistency of the packaging - sometimes they give me a Chinese take out box w/ a sticker and sometimes it's a box with their logo. Sometimes with a sticker, sometimes with a ribbon, sometimes nothing. Most of the time it doesn't matter b/c it's all for me, but I definitely want to know the cute wrappings are available when I'm purchasing as a gift.
author: Julie L.

description:
Just for the macarons. A-OK. Nothing mindblowing.

For $1.75 you can get a nicely sized Miette macaron (which means a bit larger than your typical 1-2 inch circumference macaron). They're quite thick and have a good balance of filling and cookie, but they aren't the best in my opinion. Too cake-y and they don't melt in your mouth like they're supposed to. 

Flavors are rich, however, which I liked. My favorites are the hazelnut and pistachio.

Did not like the chocolate lavender. It's like biting into a flower and chasing it with nesquik.

Also wish customer service was better. In the two times I've gone (within one year) the girls serving the desserts were kind of unpleasant. If you're not enthusiastic about giving me these macarons, how can I enjoy them??
author: Colleen V.

description:
I've never been a huge fan of macarons. Something about the chewy- and sticky-textured meringue just doesn't appeal to me. However, I sometimes buy (and eat) food based on its sheer cuteness, and this is how Miette sucked me in.

Arranged neatly in clear jars adorned with a brown ribbon (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=Wpp7aC6GUe_ahx4zPnRSzw), the charming display drew me in. The next obvious thing to do was to check out what flavours they came in. I had originally planned to just get one but had a hard time deciding between the 7 flavours, so I ended up getting 3 - chocolate lavender, rose geranium, and pistachio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=LFlB2WvcLYDAEyxjzGJt_g). The pistachio wasn't very flavourful or memorable but I loved the other two! The chocolate lavender and rose geranium tasted exactly as their names described - I definitely got the chocolate, lavender, and rose flavours, though I'm not sure what geranium tastes like. I thoroughly enjoyed them, or perhaps I just like floral-scented food...

I'll be back to try the raspberry passion and hazelnut macarons!
author: Steph L.

description:
this review is strictly for their macarons and the salted caramels....

i love me some macarons! so after getting my blue bottle latte i made a bee line to miette (perfectly placed right across the way!!) after seeing such cute jars housing these delectable delights. well being the little piggy i am, i ordered one of every flavor minus the rose macaron (fyi - macarons here are $1.75/macaron). though i know the reviews here love them, i've never been a fan of rose macarons.

my macaron breakdown in order of most favorite to least:

hazelnut
pistachio
chocolate
raspberry
vanilla
chocolate lavender

i like to bake macarons as much as eat them, so i've gotten quite picky on the ones i buy. miette's macaron shells are a bit more grainy than i like-which is most likely bc they use almond flour that's made up of the ground almond and ground almond skins. fine call me macaron snooty, haha but i prefer the almond flour w/o the ground almond skin. the macaron fillings seem to be buttercream based. i couldn't really taste any vanilla or raspberry flavor in my macarons. i guess i was looking for stronger flavors, especially on the raspberry. i'm usually a fan of anything w/ lavender, but i just didn't like the pairing of chocolate/lavender this time around. hazelnut, well...i don't think i've had a hazelnut macaron that i've yet to enjoy. the pistachio was quite tasty as well and the chocolate macaron was like eating a brownie.

as for the salted caramels...LOVE LOVE LOVE their salted caramels here. not too chewy like the old school sugar daddy caramel pops or too sweet like brachs caramels. remember those? and i loved the fleur de sel sprinkled w/ my caramels. perfect mixture of salty sweet! sure $1.50/caramel may seem pricey to some...but you pay for good quality..i promise you'll like them! girl scout honor=). even the hubby who isn't big on sweets was a fan of them and the friends i bought them for as well seemed to enjoy them too. so recap:

macarons: 3 star
fleur de sel caramels: 5+++ star
service: great!

y'know the mantra: good service + yummy treats = thumbs up miette!
author: Belle L.

description: Yummy AND pretty.  This is where I discovered my love of macaroons.  So delicate and tastey.  Rose Geranium on the top of the list.  But try it all!
author: Chrissy C.

description:
I have tasted macaron perfection... and it is not to be found here.  Had I not have had (1) Bouchon bakery and (2) Fillmore bakeshop, I may not be so militant about macarons, but I have and I am. 

I was at the Ferry Bldg with some friends and got excited to see macarons at miette.  I don't go to the Ferry Bldg often, so having miette there was definitely new to me, though I think they were still in their initial months. 

I thought that the storefront presentation of the macarons was cute- macarons in apothecary jars. In retrospect though, I question the wisdom of storing them in this manner... touching each other and putting subtle pressure on the ones beneath. 

I got three macarons, two "normal" ones (chocolate? and possibly pistachio?) and one frou-frou one (the rose geranium).  The "normal" ones were unmemorable- neither succeeded in blowing my mind the way that Bouchon and Fillmore Bakeshop macarons do every time I bite into them. And there was just a hint of staleness. I hated the rose geranium. Just too weird for my tastes. I think I tend to be conservative when it comes to my macaron (and ice cream) flavors. But I suspect that people who tend to like things like lavender or verbena in their food might like the rose geranium.

It was really the service that sours me to this place. I don't think that people need to fawn over their customers, but I draw the line at overtly rude. The woman who helped me with my order flatly acted as if it were the biggest burden in the world to open the apothecary jars and pull out the macarons. She also openly looked aggravated that I dared to ask her a question about the rose geranium macarons. Maybe someone pissed in her cornflakes that morning, who knows? Nonetheless, the product (the macarons) is not good enough to justify snootiness on the part of the staff. In the future, I will be fulfilling my macaron cravings elsewhere.
author: Jia min C.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday April 19, 2009 @ Noon
Location:  The North-West Side of The Ferry Building
Company:  Michael & Jack 
Crowd:  Young Families w/ Adorable Children in Lilly Pulitzer Frocks or Bonpoint & Small Groups of Attractive Girls in Little Alice+Olivia Dresses
Atmosphere:  Cheery
Decor:  Shop 10.  Charming.  Cookie Display w/ Ginger Snap, Walnut, Lavender Short Bread, Chocolate Bundt Cake & Lemon Loaf.  White Country CupBoards Filled w/ Tins of Bonte Candies, Jams, Chocolate Bars.  Impressive Counter Filled w/ Pretty Cupcakes, Chocolate Pot de Creme & Panna Cotta in Small Glass Pots & Cakes w/ Jars of Macarons Atop The Case
Service:  Nice & Efficient
Devour:  Grapefruit, Rose, Pistachio Macarons, Tiny Jars of Panna Cotta w/ Strawberries $4 Get $1 Back For Returning the Jars, Old-Fashioned Cupcakes.
Total:  $23.55
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
"dude, that lady isn't wearing a bra and it's cold in here...you can totally see her DING DONGS, YOO HOOOOZ, NIPPLAGE!!!"

(Takes a bite of the pistachio macaron)

"HOLY MACARONNNNNNNNNNNN,........................this is delicious. Wait.   What the hell was I raving about before?"

This is how amazing the macarons are.  That even a nipple lady cannot divert attention from all the euphoria, utopia, bliss that is achieved with.  one.  bite.  

This is how a macaron should taste.  If I could eat only one dessert for the rest of my life, this is it.
author: Pauline M.

description:
Everything in this tiny shop is simply decorated.  It looks like someone went to the Arts & Craft store and purchased cut out pink labels and hand wrote "Miette" on them and tied them around each item with a bow/string.
I was tempted to buy everything, but only one thing was on my mind, Macarons.  They're a small to medium size at $1.50 each.  With 6 jars of flavors, I began taste testing each one.  Their light fillings and not too sweet.  After taste testing the basic flavors, chocolate, pistachio, and vanilla, I asked for a box of 24 mixed flavors to go.  

I wished they had pre-packaged ones with 4 in a box (for gifting), but they didn't because of their high quality for "freshness." 
The girl at the counter took out a pink box and started arranging them in the box.  Then she placed a nice sticker on it and wrapped it in string.  

I prayed these would last another 2 days, and they did!  My friends and I enjoyed them.
author: Sandy C.

description:
Miette macarons! SOOOOO pretty and delectable! IMO their macarons are far superior to Paulettes. 

I don't even like buttercream, but Miette's buttercream filled macarons are really good. Not too sweet but the flavors like vanilla, strawberry, and pistachio are really good and subtle.  Definitely pick up a few if you get a chance. 

I'll admit, I haven't tried all their cakes and pastries yet, just the macarons, however, I did purchase the Miette cookbook and have been using their recipe for buttercream. MAN, is it good! When I bake macarons I use Miette's recipe for buttercream in my filling and people absolutely rave about them.. muhahahaha.. it's Miette's recipe. :) 

I can't wait to try their old fashion cupcake along with some more macarons on my next visit. :)
author: Cindy C.

description: Thinking about this place makes me so homesick. Can't wait to visit soon. Everything is gorgeous and delicious. My favorite was the Scharffen Berger cake.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
AHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!

This bakery  is ridiculously good. 

In New York I thought cupcakes were over, but my fad-baked-goods-lethargy has been vanquished by Miette's "old fashioned" and carrot cake cupcakes. 

Oh my goodness. Oh my goodness. The way they tasted were a dream, like however you imagine a great cupcake should be... it is.

The cake for the "old fashioned" was super moist and the soft meringue on top was gooey and fluffy. I didn't really care for the candied red peanut in the middle, it made me feel like I was eating a weak treat at grandma's--- but it was a nice aesthetic touch. 

Our carrot cake was spicy and moist. The raisins were incredibly plump and there were micro-ribbons of fabulously carroty carrot. I still can't decide if my favorite part is the soft frosting or the cake. The frosting was oh-so delicately tangy from cream cheese and not overly-sweet so that it really let the complex cake spices sing. 

I also bought a box of ginger snaps for my huz and he has been blissfully crunching away at them throughout the day. They are indeed very snappy, but also really rich and buttery. 

Miette is decorated to look like the inside of Hello Kitty's playroom and that's not really a bad thing. I love that they just go all out with their vision.

I've never had a better cupcake in SF!
author: Lisa Q.

description: All I have to say is Salt Chocolate Ice Cream sandwich made with their Chocolate wafer cookies!! OMG so good!!! best ice cream sandwich I've ever had. The macaroons are good too. It was $5 for ice cream sandwich.
author: Karen T.

description:
This place was soooo cute that I stopped in my tracks while walking by. I wouldn't mind if I my future house was decorated like this store and all the cakes looks so perfectly decorated to suit my taste.  Tried the chocolate strawberry cupcake. The creme on top was strawberry and it was so light and tasty. It wasn't too sweet and really tasted like a strawberry. 

I also looked at their website and they offer classes too.
author: Sarah C.

description: Delicious and adorable. What else could you possibly ask for?? I was dying for a cupcake, and I was steered toward the carrot cake, which was decorated like a flower. So pretty I almost didn't want to eat it. Almost. So glad I did, because it was heavenly!
author: Katie O.

description:
I'm one of the more picky macaron consumers out there. 

we picked up a pistachio and a hazelnut macaron to go along with our Blue Bottle from across the way (actually right across).  their selection of macaron flavors is quite limited at this location.

-fillings first: the pistachio filling was light in texture and very subtle in the pistachio but had some depth in the flavor after a while. however, I got more of the pistachio flavor from the macaron pastry. the hazelnut filling was a bit underwhelming in that it really just had a singular dark chocolate character, and the consistency of a thick smear of nutella.

-the macaron pastry portion was far too chewy for my tastes, and very starchy.  I feel like macarons should be a light and delicate concoction, and Miette's felt somewhat amateur in their execution.
author: Chris L.

description:
What you really come here for is the experience. Walking through the bustling, restored ferry building, people watching the mix of tourists, yuppies, and hippies, and eventually basking in the sun and air of the pier. All while perusing some of the best of the food-obsessed bay area's treats. 

The macaroons are a must. The BEST in the city!  The cakes are beautiful, delicious, and the perfect birthday treat.  The decor is precise, dainty, and neat: perfect vintage, parisian chic. 

Can Miette and Ici please get together and make the mother of all ice cream cakes? The Berkeley ice cream parlor seems like its cut from the same cloth. If you like Miette, check it out.
author: Cady T.

description:
So Lovie and his fam bam made a visit to the Ferry Building last week. Lemme say, Lovie knows the way to my heart is through my stomach via sweets. He knows that's the sure shot way to win me over or cheer me up. Heaven forbid, if he does something to piss me off, he knows a box of cupcakes, chocolates, or cookies would help me forgive and forget. Screw the bouquet of flowers. Sweets is where it's at.

In this case, chocolate wafer cookies from Miette was the "get well soon" offering from Lovie. I was stuck under bed rest orders from the doctor for the entire weekend after being diagnosed with pneumonia. Feeling emotionally and physically down with a bad case of cabin fever, Lovie came back with these cookies. One bite sends you into this chocolately oblivion...so dark and twisted with its sweet with a hint of salty. And it was just what I needed to lift my spirits.

Chocolate wafers are bomb. Next time when I'm here, I'll make it a point to try the lavender shortbread cookies or their cupcakes.
author: Grace L.

description: I've tried their gingerbread cookies, carrot cupcake, and chocolate cupcake. They were all just OK. I'm not a big fan of gingerbread cookies....so maybe that was my bad and I shouldn't judge too much. But the cupcakes were small and overpriced and left much to be desired, especially with their frosting which tasted too sugary and there wasn't very much of it. I wouldn't go here again, especially for cupcakes.
author: Kiki H.

description:
My rating should be a 3  1/2  but I will be nice today and round up to a 4.

[Side note: My first time ever trying a french macaron was at a high end award winning French inspired resort in Mexico (ironic, I know).  At that resort, they served french macarons (banana cookie with a chocolate filling) which was chewy and decadent.  This is where I fell in love with french macarons.]

We tried Miette Patisserie back in October as it came highly recommended by a friend with a sweet tooth.  They are located in the Ferry Building so their location was quite small thus, offering a limited selection of french macarons.  It was a bit disappointing to find that with the limited selection, the selection of flavors was similar in taste.  It was even more disappointing to find that the cookie crumbles and was not at all chewy (I learned later that there are french macarons that are chewy).  I've tried this place with its hype and all but probably won't pay it another visit.
author: Sharlene M.

description:
i am in love with their hazelnut macarons. by far the BEST MACARON I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. no offense to thomas keller, but bouchon macarons don't even come close to the masterpieces that miette creates. hazelnut flavor is the best in my opinion, pistachio was okay but the cream was a bit more liquidy so it got a little messy. they do sell out of hazelnut towards the end of the day so make sure to go by early afternoon. (not always the case though) the macarons are made with almond meal in case anyone was curious or is allergic to nuts. (my friend was so it was really good info to have)

their ice cream sandwiches ($4) are also a must try. the vanilla creme fraiche with the graham cracker crust was heaven in your mouth. 

shortbread cookies are amazingly buttery and unfortunately very addicting. 

gingersnaps are on the 7x7 100 list but they are too gingery for me. i think their macarons need to replace the gingersnaps on that list. but if you are a ginger person, you will definitely love them.

had a cupcake once, it was okay. definitely well baked and moist but i go more for the macarons.
author: Pauline H.

description: This is a review for the cupcakes. They're my favorite cupcakes in San Francisco and they're both cheaper and tastier than Cako and Kara's. I can't even tell you which flavor is best because they're all so good but I'm partial to the chocolate with salted caramel butter cream frosting and salt flakes on top. They always give you the cupcakes in really pretty boxes, whether you buy one or 10.  Some other cupcake places won't give you a box until you meet some minimum or their box is quite ugly. As far as this location, it's in the Ferry Building. The Ferry Building is mobbed by tourists on the weekends and more than once I've needed to get cupcakes for a party or birthday on Saturday and Miette is totally sold out of cupcakes. Like not one cupcake. The should stock more cupcakes on Saturday in the Ferry Building location and I should get there before noon if I expect to get cupcakes on Saturday.
author: Cat M.

description:
The first time I tried the deliciousness from this place was when someone brought 50(!) macarons to a party. YUM!! I couldn't get enough of those cookies and ate one in every flavor! 

I went to the source a couple of weeks later on my way through the ferry building. I don't know if there was some sort of mix-up or what (maybe an employee came late to work?) but they had signs on the tables and counters saying that they weren't going to open until noon that day. No biggie. I could wait 10 minutes to get my sugar fix. However, with me and a couple of other people standing around checking out the pastries on display, one of the workers started whispering about us to her other co-workers and shooting us looks of disgust. Normally, I don't jump to the conclusion that someone is talking about me just because there is whispering and glances thrown my way. However, I draw the line when there is pointing involved. I decided to walk away and not bring my business here. I was ready to give this place 1 star, despite my love of their macarons. 

But, I couldn't stay away. I came back and bought a slice of the strawberry mousse cake, along with a chocolate cupcake with strawberry buttercream, and a strawberry macaron. Mind you, this was not all in one visit. I just love love love strawberries and since it's a seasonal item, I wanted to take full advantage of its yumminess. I am so glad I decided to come back to Miette! I attribute that one day of rude behavior to someone waking up on the wrong side of her bed. Everyone I have encountered at Miette afterwards has been wonderful and sweet, just like their pastries!
author: Lynnie P.

description:
I love their chocolate cupcakes!  

I've been to the ferry building a couple of times and always wanted to try one of their cupcakes (After all, Food Network rated it one of the Top Ten desserts).  My boyfriend and I each got a cupcake and we were both pleasantly surprised. 

I got chocolate with vanilla buttercream and he got yellow cupcake with strawberry buttercream.  I was expecting it to be extremely rich (like sprinkles) and needing an entire gallon of milk to get through my cupcake.  But it was light and fluffy!  The vanilla buttercream was really light and airy.  I got through without getting a food coma and needing to sit down for 20 minutes after eating.  It is the perfect snack.

I tasted the yellow cupcake, I wasn't a big fan of the strawberry buttercream, but the cupcake itself was really good.  If they have yellow with a different flavor buttercream next time I go I'm going to get that shizz.
author: Celine C.

description: Macaroons are amazing.  We picked up a lovely selection with a cupcake for the kids to share (they are huge!) for dessert after lunch at the Ferry Building.  They hit the spot and everyone was happy.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Soley for the fact that they have great French Maccaroons is why I love this place so much! It's the only thing I order although their display of other dessert goodies looks so good, I can't bring myself to order anything else. 

They have yummy flavors like: Pistachio (my favorite!), Hazelnut, Lavendar, Coffee, etc. and the presentation of the little cookies is adorable.
author: LuLu M.

description:
My lovely friend Celeste picked up a nice box of mini Macaroons.  The last Macaroon I had was from Bouchon Bakery in Napa and it left a bad taste in my mouth for two reasons.  1.) Way too over-sweet 2.) Bitchy Stuck-up girl behind the counter.  I was actually ready to have a good experience with these pretty little things...

I tried a little Chocolate one... it wasn't too sweet and had a very nice texture and you can tell they use good chocolate.  Highly recommend their little guys.  Thanks for sharing Celeste!
author: Shiho F.

description:
I try to treat myself to their macaroons and mousse cakes here at least once a week - often, they're the only desserts I'll have - they're that good! I highly recommend the pistachio and vanilla macaroons above all others. Somehow the other flavors (chocolate, hazlenut, rose geranium, orange...etc.) don't have the same perfect chewiness in texture. I also love the strawberry mousse cake - not too sweet, and pairs perfectly with a hot cup of tea or Blue Bottle coffee. 

Some tips: Sometimes the staff here can be irritable if you don't know the rules of the line. Wait for one of the girls to acknowledge you, and stick with her...don't move to the register and think the other girl will be the one to ring you up. The same person that helps you is the same person that will process the transaction/order. Also, be ready with cash if you're spending less than $10.
author: Elaine W.

description: This place has the best Macarons ever! The Hazelnut melts in your mouth when you eat it. I can't really speak too much about anything elses they sell because every time I come to this place I purchase either the Hazelnut or chocolate Macarons. But believe me this place will not disappoint! Lord I just wish I could make it to JLS during the week to hit up their Macaron happy where they sell these pleasantries for a $1. I am liable to put them out pf business the day I'm able to!
author: Char I.

description:
I can't seem to stop by the Ferry Building without going to Miette, the place where I first fell in love with gourmet cupcakes years ago.  I still love their pretty cupcakes.  The marshmallow frosting on the gingerbread one is too sweet for me personally though.  Their Tomboy cake (chocolate cake with vanilla buttercream) is pure deliciousness.  

Everything they make looks elegant and decadent at the same time.  They sell cookies, tarts, tea cakes, éclairs, petite scones, and several types of macarons stored in glass jars.  And cute licorice candy in tins, fruity French Pierrot lollipops, English toffee and caramels.  I even love the slightly misshapen, handmade, flower shaped ceramic cake pedestals you can buy there and the animal shaped candles.  

Their phenomenal graham cracker cookies are like no other graham cookie I've ever had - extra thick, rich, and very buttery.  They had six types of Parisian macarons (vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate, rose geranium, grapefruit, chocolate orange, $1.50 each):

* Hazelnut macaron: The cookie isn't smooth because it has ground hazelnut but the overall macaron is soft and nutty with a melt in your mouth quality
* Chocolate macaron: Also soft but a little chewier than the hazelnut, the chocolate ganache filling is smooth and rich

The filling to cookie ratio is better here than at Paulette's (Miette gives you more filling) and the Miette cookies are softer.  

The shop is pastel and dainty (Martha Stewart would approve, every aspect of their presentation is impeccable) and they know how to display their wares attractively.  Every package is sealed with a Miette sticker.  

Miette is one of those rare bakeries where you can taste the quality of their (organic) ingredients.  Yes, it's more expensive but worth it.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Day two of my SF trip started Saturday morning with the Ferry Building Market. I spied this little bakery and drooled over the cakes in the case. It was 9am and so I talked myself out of buying anything.....but after a walk to Fisherman's Wharf and back to where I parked the car, I took a detour back to Miette to pick up some macarons. The girl at the counter was very pleasant and told me her favorites. 

I chose four flavors: Hazelnut, Pistachio, Chocolate, and Strawberry. They smelled incredible and I loved the natural colors. My favorites were the Hazelnut and Pistachio. Chocolate was good too. I didn't care for the Strawberry though, it did not pack as much flavor as the others. Macarons are $1.75 a piece which I thought was reasonable. If you are looking for a sweet treat to cap off your feast at the Ferry Building, go here!
author: Alison B.

description: As I was planning out my food trip last Thursday, I decided I would get some ginger snaps a la 7x7 list.  I arrived at Miette and it was adorable.  The display full of pastries and the small cute pots de creme.  *Dies of cuteness*  I was so tempted to buy a bunch of desserts, but resisted and kept my eye on the prize.  I picked out my ginger snaps container.  The Ginger Snaps costs $7 for a good amount.  They gave me a cute pink bag.  I was on happy clouds.  I finally got to taste a ginger snap.  Wow...the ginger is very potent.  You first taste the sweetness of the cookie and then BAM, hello burn of the ginger and it lingers.  If you're a fan of ginger snaps, it's a very high quality snap.  I take mine one half at a time with lots of water.
author: Carolen M.

description:
Yum! Love the vanilla macaroons and the caramel panna cotta thing in a mini jar! So cute and if you bring it back they give you a $1! 
Walk around the Ferry Bldg, grab a bite to eat and definitely stop by here for dessert!
author: CY C.

description: Light macarons, crumbly and chewy, but somewhat forgettable.  Gingersnaps have strong ginger flavor but texture is way too hard... my jaw gets tired after eating one. The caramels are pleasantly chewy and not so sticky that you feel guilty thinking about the next visit to the dentist.  Not bad overall but given the price point, I wouldn't make it a priority purchase.
author: Renee L.

description:
Everything is good but everything is expensive.... The Italian Cream topped chocolate cupcake is hellah yummy!!! The Italian Meringue Cream would be good on anything, I don't even think that I  noticed if I liked the cake or not cause that Italian Meringue Cream was soooo goood!!!! You can even order this cupcake combo as a large round cake - whoo that would be calorically dangerous....
The Pistacio,Hazelnut and Caramel Macaroons were perfectly textured but expensive for a tiny cookie....
The Chocolate Dome (Chocolate cake drenched in a chocolate ganache) was good but nothing compared to their other items.
The Vanilla Cupcake was OK- nothing crazy good.
I wanted to try their salted caramels and lemon tart but I think enough money was spent.
Everything is displayed cutely and service was helpful but you can get the feeling that they wanted you to hurry up- money is time and time is money - I guess.
author: Ursula U.

description:
Their macaroon are are amazing! My favorite is the Vanilla. I feel that the Hazelnut or chocolate is a bit on the sweeter side, but still very good. They are fresh, perfectly texture and its chewy good! 

Another thing that you must try is the ginger snaps! There is a reason why they are on the "Big Eat" list! The only thing I would say that needs a bit adjustment is the size of the container. I think its slightly too big. I know you would say that if its good, then it should be in larger quantity right? I can't eat them fast enough before they go stale. Its a great size to share though!
author: Mo W.

description:
On my visit home, I wanted to find a place with good macarons since I've been obsessed with them ever since moving to Manhattan. I was visiting a friend working in the financial district, who said he had never had one. Naturally I had to introduce him to the delicious confection, so we walked over the the Ferry Building and yelped this place. 

Not many flavors to choose from- hazelnut, vanilla, chocolate, pistachio, rose. They are a good size at only $1.75 a pop (I was ecstatic since I pay $2.70 for small Laduree ones in NY). I had the hazelnut and the vanilla, while my friend had the hazelnut as well. He said it was pretty good, but I found it to be a disappointment. The texture was very chewy and more cake like than I am used to. I prefer them light and airy. The filling was also more liquidy/creamy than I am used to. Don't think I'll be back for the macarons, but the other goods in the display looked appetizing.
author: Katrina L.

description:
Because I love to bake, I can never pass up a bakery without purchasing a variety of items to test and hopefully get inspired to do something new in the kitchen. Of course, as I stumbled on Miette Patisserie, I couldn't pass up the chance to sample a few of the items the bakery had to offer.

I purchased the Chocolate Parisian Macaroons, the Chocolate Orange Macaroons, a brownie, and a bag of the Chocolate Sables. 

The marcaroons, although great and tasty, I could not distinguish between the two flavors I purchased. I expected that the Orange would have more presence in the macaroon then it ended up having. It was still good but I wish I could've tasted the orange flavor more. 

The Chocolate Sables were good too. They definitely had their traditional sandy characteristic and were in fact, very chocolately. My husband has eaten half of the bag so he seems to really like it -- especially with this coffee. I'm not sure I would purchase these again though. I've had better. 

The brownie was by far my favorite item purchased. I found that the texture of the brownie was PERFECTO! The outside was slightly chewy and the center was perfectly moist and tender. I wish I would've bought more of the brownies to snack on later. 

Overall, I thought the Miette was just ok. It didn't blow my socks off but it was a nice treat.
author: Sharon V.

description:
I actually really really really liked the macaroons
I love what they do with the Rose flavor!
Tried ordering online, but the shipping cost is unacceptable to me... will try to make another trip.
( You should also grab a cup of the blue bottle coffee there =P)
author: Dalu Q.

description:
Miette, you sweet slut!  Your macarons, honestly, my first ever, were an amazing new exploration for my mouth... A light crisp to the outside, almost doughy inside, subtle and smooth flavor, soft cream binding the two sides and neither side so stiff that the cream squished out... Perfect!

The lemon tartlet made for a sweet late-night treat a day or so later then completed full double duty as a small, last, wistful taste of SF on our way to the airport on our last morning.

A friend asked if I had left my heart in SF, and because of Miette, I have to say I did... Sigh...
author: Allie R.

description:
ONE WORD review for Miette's madelines & macarons:

Madelines: Dry
Macarons: Chewyyyyyyy!!

I rather get a bucket of madelines from Costco.
author: Heidi C.

description:
A $6 total at Miette:

- 1 Chocolate cupcake (I believe I got the "classic")
- 2 Hazelnut macarons

The displays were quite tempting to stare at, and, after my first foray through the Ferry Plaza Farmers' Market, I decided a couple of treats from Miette was in store for me.

I could have used the $6 for a ton of treats at one of Chinatown's bakeries; oh well. It's a rare thing for me to go to a place like Miette to order treats, so I figured, why not?

I liked the presentation of the overall store, and how they packed the cupcake and macarons, complete with a "Miette" sticker on top. I was amused that they boxed the singular cupcake in a take-out box (Chinese-style!).

The actual taste/value of the products: The cupcake part was moist, not the tastiest I've had, but I liked the frosting. It wasn't overly sweet/packed with HFCS, so that was a relief. The macarons were chewy, like nougat to me--I'd definitely go back to have a few more of these when my income allows me to do so.

My palate is mixed on what I think of Miette in the end: the prices I can do without, but like I've mentioned before, it's rare to find me at a place like Miette in the first place anyway. The taste and quality of the food was fine and justifiable in most senses. Service-wise: the worker was quick and amiable, but wasn't the utmost best in service. What did I expect on an early Saturday morning though?
author: Helene K.

description:
If I'm being honest, Miette feels like it's catered to tourists who like to pay a lot for some desserts.  I've tried a few things here which were decent but they don't make me long for trying another.  Their store is quite appealing and cute like a candy shop; their cake displays are gorgeous, which lures me in every time.  But their prices give me a bit of sticker shock sometimes.

I finally gave in and bought a $3.50 cupcake one day and wasn't extremely impressed.  First off, they don't have many flavor options for cupcakes so I just got a chocolate with white frosting which was just okay.   Their macarons look delish but after eating one, I kind of felt like I needed to go back to Paulette and scream for a better one.  But of course I'm just a huge fan of Paulette and french macarons made by french people.

The cookies seem decent and affordable and the little caramels are very enticing.  I would probably stick with those.  Or get a cake if you can afford it.  They really are quite lovely.
author: Stacey C.

description: Yay  I'm a fan just by walking in what I mean is we didn't eat there because rushing to get the shuttle,so many pretty cakes and cupcake's Ice cream,books's and unique Item's,The very next vist to the bay frist stop inside the ferry building for sweets will be Miette.They have a special now on your first on line order you get 20% off code:cakesonline.....miette.com
author: Tommy M.

description:
MACARONS FOR DAYYYYS. These macaroons are so fluffy, delicious, creamy, heavenly, you won't be able to stop at just one.... not too sure if that's a good or bad thing.
However, they tend to run out of certain flavors during the day. By 2 pm on a Wednesday, all they had left was the chocolate, hazelnut, vanilla, and rose geranium.
author: Ada C.

description:
I will do all sorts of tricks...

...if you feed me these macarons.

Tips: $1.50 a pop. Save your lunch money.
author: Dave L.

description:
Miette Patisserie is located in the Ferry Building along with many other shops. There isn't a place to sit down on the inside of the Ferry Building except for a few benches here and there. There are quite a lot of benches to sit outside and eat though.

Back to macrons, they have seven tasty macaroons: chocolate, chocolate-lavender, hazelnut, pistachio, rose geranium, strawberry, and vanilla. All the macrons are well made and have a chewy yet crunchy texture to them. The rose geranium seem to be one of the popular flavors here since the jar was more than half empty. Went with that and it was pretty tasty. There wasn't any flavors that I didn't like actually.
author: Steven B.

description:
First time I tried Macarons, I wasn't a big fan of them...until I tried Miette's.

I had gotten so used to the flakey, meringue type of macaron that I didn't know what to expect with them. They sure changed my view of macarons. Their macarons are so tender and fresh that it almost tastes like a cross between a cake and cookie. It's not too soft and not too flaky. It was perfect.

Their rose geranium is definitely something unique to try. The floral smell is just right and not over powering. The buttercream in the middle was perfect and not too sweet. It complements the outer crust very well. 

All the other flavors tasted very good too. I don't think I'll eat another macaron again unless it is from Miette's. I just wish I didn't have food coma so that I could try the other desserts from there. Blue Bottle Coffee + Miette macaron = the perfect combination.

You won't be disappointed.
author: Bernicemina M.

description:
If you love ginger, you will love the gingersnaps! Spicy, with a good snap and very slight chewiness. I tend to savor these cookies over the span of a week or two just so they last longer. I've had the pistachio, rose, hazelnut, and chocolate lavender. They're not the best I've had but still good though a tad pricey. Perfect for a tiny snack after eating all day in the city. I also love how every is so darn cute.
I saw that they have a cookbook coming out on Amazon! I hope the home-made gingersnaps will taste half as good as the ones in the store.
author: Janet L.

description:
I used to work right around the corner from the Ferry Building and I would go to Miette all the time for their macarons. We're not talking one or two, we're talking a box. Sometimes I'd let my coworkers have some, but usually they got hidden in my purse for snacks over the weekend or that "30 Rock" marathon I had planned. Pistachio and chocolate orange were my go-to flavors. Whenever I was going to a party or had guests to entertain, I knew that Miette would have the perfect treat ready to go in a box tied up with a bouquet of colorful ribbons. Their holiday yule log cake is amazingly good.

I moved away from San Francisco about a year ago, and my boss in LA had some of their macarons shipped to me as a thank you gift. I gladly shared the treats with her, but I also took that as a hint to stop talking about them so much!

Miette has published a book through Chronicle with some of their recipes, but it should be more of a coffee table book if you live anywhere close to this establishment!
author: Victoria K.

description:
I write not just another favorable rating for a bakery that has been reviewed one too many times. No, this is more serious than simply that -- this is bigger than you and me combined...

This is, in fact, love.

Two days before my recent trip up the coast, a co-worker sent me a link to the Miette website. I knew this was the beginning of a very special friendship.  I couldn't wait to ditch sunny Southern California, for tumultuous San Francisco skies, a cup of joe by the Bay, and the potential for a renewed baked-good mania.

What can I say?  I fell head-over-heels at first bite.  

As others before me have said, the macarons are a delectable treat that defy words.  A perfect combination of sweet, fluffy, and chewy, these delights are well worth their $1.75 price.  Each cookie combines light textures with a subtle flavor that create the most amazing dessert I've ever consumed.  With seven flavors -- chocolate, chocolate-lavender, raspberry, pistachio, hazelnut, vanilla, and rose geranium -- you are sure to find one (or two) you can't live without.  

For me, it's the rose geranium.  Do you know that feeling that bubbles inside you when someone sends you flowers?  It's a combination of love and happiness -- that feeling has been, somehow, reduced to a flavor you can, well, taste.  Yes, the rose geranium macaron tastes like love and happiness.

I highly recommend it.
author: Liz M.

description: By far some of the best cupcakes we tasted for the wedding. The texture was good, the flavor was good but still not as good as homemade. Miette cupcakes are seriously expensive if you are planning a wedding, most cupcake sellers have price breaks for buying in larger quantity, but not here.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
Oh how I wanted to love your macarons and pretty princess cakes.  Though the cakes are pretty, they're not that special in flavor.  The Scharffen Berger was not dense enough in texture for me, though it looks so tempting for chocolate lovers.

As for the macarons, they look pretty displayed in jars, but macarons are very delicate, and they get cracked easily.  The macarons were disappointing - they were too sugary, and there was too much air inside the cookie part.

They do have cute packaged bags of treats that are nice for party favors or as gifts because of the presentation.  Everything there is indeed very pretty, but I don't think it justifies the price and wait.
author: Marilyn T.

description:
My beloved Miette...nothing cheers me up more than a delicious macaroon from this cute frenchy bakery in the Ferry Building. 

The macaroons are so soft, chewy, sweet, a bit nutty with the blend of almonds, and in the center is the sweet creamy frosting. I usually buy a small box of them with my favorites being the pistachio, rose, and grapefruit. Each respective flavor compliments the macroon extremely well without any other overwhelming after taste. Just the perfect accent. I seriously get angry when someone tries to eat one of my macaroons. So please, STAY AWAY. 

Besides the macaroons, Miette offers up other delicious and equally beautiful pastries. There are seasonal tarts like blueberry in the summer or banana cream in the fall with a flaky and buttery crust. The cream is always delicate yet rich. The Scharffen Berger chocolate cake is amazing with a nice warm tea or cold milk. Scharffen Berger chocolate has a lot of distinctive flavors to it and you can taste it in cake form as well. The chocolate is also not overwhelming where you can't taste the cake which is what happens to a lot of chocolate cakes. I also love their coconut cake which is very creamy with several layers of frosting and cake. I can just imagine how much work goes into it. There are also mini scones, eclairs, cupcakes, pot de cremes, the list goes on. 

Everything is always fresh and made with organic and local ingredients. All the sweets look so precious that it sometimes makes me ache to eat them. But all it takes is one bite and then there is no turning back. 

I dream about them when I've been away for too long. Few things in life make me as happy as they do.
author: Julia T.

description:
Delicious cupcakes and treats.

Plus if you love baking they have a book!
author: Chantal L.

description: It's a really cute shop inside the embarcadero ferry building. I walked past this place a couple of times, and finally decided to give a try. Decided to get my carrot cake fix here. Got a carrot cake cupcake. Later on that evening when I finally ate it I noticed that the cake was really moist. Probably my favorite part of it all. I think the frosting was too tangy and not sweet enough. I also got a pistachio, and hazelnut macaron. My favorite was pistachio. The texture of the pistachio macaron was great opposed to the hazelnut. Hazelnut was just too grainy. I was thinking maybe I should have gotten the raspberry instead.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
This review is only for the macarons. I visited the Ferry Building on Saturday (read: one of the busiest possible days at the Embarcadero), and after having lunch stopped at Miette to browse their adorably packaged baked goods. 

I have quite the sweet tooth and could not resist the tempting  jars of various flavored macarons on the counter. For this visit, I first chose a pistachio one and then asked the lady behind the counter what other flavors were popular-- she said that the classic vanilla was a crowd favorite. Against my better judgement, I went ahead with the vanilla as well. 

To be fair, I ate them the next day, so they may have lost some of their freshness. Both macarons looked similar in color, so I was hoping to distinguish them with a bite; unfortunately they both tasted the same to me (and I really like pistachio flavored things!) So if you are more into subtle flavoring, then these two flavors are for you. I on the other hand am a fan of bolder and richer flavors. 

As for the texture, it was very good. The cookies had a great crispy outer shell and chewy inner; the cream that sandwiched the two cookies together was nice and smooth.

At $1.75 a piece they're on the higher side, but I guess if I'm willing to pay $4 for a cupcake it doesn't seem so bad.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Such a cute store, it's always worth a visit in the Ferry Building. Everything is pastel and they have adorable cake displays, which you can actually buy!

I tried several of the macarons here: hazelnut, pistachio, and chocolate. Macarons are 1.75, which is definitely on the pricier side (.10 more than Paulette, which I consider to be 'premium' style macarons). They are quite small too. I would say they are average French macarons. They are rougher looking than the other macarons I've seen- perhaps Miette likes a natural look and prefers not to grind their almonds too fine. That's okay, I like the natural look too. But the taste was unexceptional... a little dry and the flavors were not all there.

I would return for the cupcakes though!
author: Cathy S.

description:
Likes: cute little place in the Ferry Building at Embarcadero.  chocolate cookies were good.  I like their dentist tips cup at the cashier.

Dislikes: pricey but probably due to location
author: Karen M.

description: Wasn't in the mood for a pastry to go with my latte from Blue Bottle, so my friend and I moseyed on over here. The decor alone is eye catching, but I already knew what I wanted from here, and that was macarons. Picked up a raspberry and hazelnut. Both were incredible. Like my fascination with cupcakes, there's a certain criteria I look for with macarons. It's simple, really: Good texture and not too sweet. These guys had both. Another Ferry Building gem that I'll be sure to visit again.
author: Rhia R.

description:
Ok, with 515 reviews....clearly this place is the bomb.

I perused this shop while waiting for my ferry to Sausalito- and I was in heaven! Everything looked amazing and delicious and all at reasonable prices- my favorite was the snowball...cake! MH! They also have really cute trinkets on sale, that I wish I could have justified buying (dang you condo!).

If I ever own a bakery I will definitely take bits and pieces of this place with me (see pics!)
author: Noelle M.

description:
When I was small (and Christmas Trees were tall), I read a story about a crow that had migrated from its native land and had found a new home in a lush green, gorgeous valley. It made friends and tried to adapt to the new surroundings. But, every so often, pondering over the vagaries of life, it would let out a sigh and say "Aah, incomparable soothing shade and restful comfort." 

When its new friends asked what that was all about, it would mournfully talk about the beauty and grandeur of its homeland. After a while the crow started feeling really miserable and homesick, and no matter how much its friends tried to cheer it up and want it to enjoy its new home, it would still only sigh "Aah, incomparable soothing shade and restful comfort". Their curiosity piqued, the other crows decided that they must indeed travel with the crow and see the wondrous land that made their friend homesick. 

So, one fine day they told the crow that they wanted to accompany it and see the beauty of its native land. The crow all excited flaps its wings and takes off and the others follow. After days of flying, finally the crow exclaims that home is nearby and picks up speed.

The other crows lag behind, but can hear its voice. After a few hours they hear it cawing excitedly, but can hardly see anything ahead of them. True, there's a clearing, but there is only barren land, and a solitary tree. 

Curious, they fly onward and finally catch sight of their friend. Sitting content and relaxed under the single remaining branch of the solitary tree, chattering: "Aah, incomparable soothing shade and restful comfort". 

So, what does this story have to do with Miette? Well, everything... I've had to listen no end to all the visiting and transplant friends from SF rave no end about its food and how NYC simply can't compare. While I usually agree with some of the food comments, I am not sure that the baked goodies and desserts in SF are all they are hyped out to be. As a dessert person, I listen with skepticism to excited chatter about how Magnolia is over-rated (true), how Sugar Sweet Sunshine is only hype (bah), how Payard can't compare to Miette (blasphemy) ... so on and so forth...chatter, chatter, chatter....

Tired of all this, even though my recent stay in SF was brief, I made it a point to sneak out in the evening and make my way to the Ferry Building to sample the "divine goodness" of Miette. Obviously, I only had high expectations. After extensive sampling, I thought the Pot De Creme was the highlight of my trip, followed by the macarons (of which I particularly liked Pistachio). The macarons had the perfect exterior (crisp and chewy) and a good bite through to the filling. To its credit, the crust didn't fall apart upon touch, but it wasn't the melt in the mouth goodness that is Payard. Nor is the macaron filling as generous as what one sees in the magic from La Maison Du Chocolat.

Being a huge fan of Pierre Herme who created Korova, I wasn't blown away by the chocolate sable cookie here. Nor, actually by any of the other cookies, particularly Peanut Butter (not after you've had Nutter Butter at Bouchon). But, the biggest disappointment were cakes (Tomboy and Scharffen Berger) and the cupcakes. While pretty to look at, the cake was consistently dry in all the versions I tried (vanilla, chocolate, or yellow). Even the flourish from strawberry butter cream could not save the cupcake. I found the popular marshmallow cream frosting quite meh...too sweet. 

I do look forward to trying out Crixa and Tartine on my next trip. But, sorry SF wallahs - for the moment it appears that when the gods of dessert were doling out their blessings, SF got shortchanged. Ah, well... you've got the (incomparable) weather.....let's talk about that.
author: Atif I.

description:
The surly girls behind the counter and the too-high credit card minimum aren't nearly enough to put me off Miette. Even when I manage to resist other treats at the Ferry Building (I'm looking at you Monsieur Recchiuti) I cannot help stopping in to check if there are any meringues. These tiny morsels of sweet sugary goodness are utterly irresistible. In fact, I could not manage to write this review without going to my still-packed suitcase to find my last package - strawberry flavored. 

Will I last until 2008 without another?
I may not! So if you live in SF please send help in the form of Miette meringues! I beg of you, do not let me waste away into meringue-nothingness!

Advice:
Skip the cupcakes, get the chocolate tart instead.

The rose-flavored meringues get little fanfare in the store but are amazing   - look for them!

Pink grapefruit anything - NOT TO BE MISSED!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Mignon!

Everything about this shop is cute as a button.  The packaging, the cakes, the colors...mignon, mignon, mignon.

I go to Miette for one reason, les macarons.  They are so so perfect, you cannot help but feel like Marie Antoinette as you feel the light crunch of the exterior give way to the tender inside.  The flavors are all good, classic, and never too sweet - pistachio, vanilla, chocolate, and my favorite, lemon.  They do not use food coloring and the ingredients are organic, so they are of the best quality as well as pretty.  *Added 3/3/07:  the Pink Grapefruit macaron is delicious -softly flavored with grapefruit - a must-try!  Thanks, Andy R. and Lady J., for cluing me in to this new flavor*

These are special-occasion cookies.  Over the weekend, I went to see a dear friend that I was overdue to see by about 6 months.  As a surprise I brought a colorful bouquet of French tulips, and a box of 6 assorted macarons to share.  We got all cozy on her couch and spent hours looking at old pictures, talking about France, and delighting in our flavorful treats.  It was a special occasion, indeed - an afternoon I will treasure for a long time.

That's what I think of when I go to Miette - little treasures.
author: Liz S.

description: Miette has beautiful pastries and cookies. They are most well known for their macarons which are truly a labor of love.
