They have published a cookbook which has macaron and other baked goods recipes and after seeing the process for macarons I decided it was much easier for me to buy them :-). There are at least 7 flavors and my current favs are pistachio and hazelnut. Lines here move quickly and come in waves. I'll be back for a sugar fix soon. It's pricey here but I suspect rents are high
author: Bebe W.

description:
Such a cute little shop! It's a charming bakery storefront in the Ferry Building Marketplace. Miette is chic, pretty, and tasty. 

I had the chocolate cake and bought some graham crackers. The chocolate cake was good but the g-crackers are the best I've ever had! I'm just sad I didn't buy more! Yes, they are a little pricey but their products are worth it. 

Everyone needs to treat themselves once in a while! Go here to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Patty G.

description:
I was super skeptical about buying macarons here since two of my trusted yelp elite buddies had been disappointed but I decided I needed to give them a try anyhow since damn it, I was in a macaron mood and they were the only ones around... and oh boy am I glad I listened to my addiction!

The reviews I read had described the macarons as lacking in flavor... either something has changed since then or those people just have way weaker taste buds than I do because HOLY BALLS were these things tasty. 

They cost $1.75 each. I bought one Rose geranium and one Chocolate lavender. They were both insanely delicious. They are quite large (that's what she said), the texture was amazing (soft and perfectly chewy) they were not overfilled, and the flavors were really spot on. I ate those two and went back for more. I bought 2 more Rose geranium and one Raspperry. The texture of the raspberry was a little less chewy, which was slightly disappointing but the flavor was fantastic.

I loved that these were not brightly colored and that the cookies had an almost whole grain look/feel to them... they just seemed healthier, tastier, and more substantial than any other macaron I've tried. Flavor wise it's hard to beat Paulette (now 'Lette) in Beverly Hills but these came in a veeeery close second for me. MMMMM Hmmmmmm!
author: April K.

description: Love, their madelines.  But, it's always crowded and a long wait to buy these delectable little french cakes.   On a positive note, they do validate parking with a purchase.
author: Susan N.

description: b pastries is a million times better but better then most of the corner bakeries. Expensive.
author: She L.

description:
I get the whole fro-yo thayng about as much I do the whole cupcake hubbub. $3+ for a teeny tiny cupcake? WTF?

Strolling through the Ferry Building with my kids, the place caught my eye. We weren't even on the look out for treats. You can't look at their display case and not smile. Their cakes and deserts all look so whimsical as they are lovingly created. Their creators must really enjoy what they do.

Before I knew it, I was asking my kids to decide which cupcake they wanted. Seeing them inhale their good fortune outside on a bench along the promenade overlooking the Bay Bridge was worth every penny:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mUbk7FCM1R9gSko6EMdU2A?select=kf-1raU9I61HiPdH6d7v1Q
author: David P.

description: Good macaroons but don't plan on getting here on time or early - they open 15 to 20 minutes late.
author: Andrew W.

description:
It was the first time I tried macaroons with pasty and grainy texture to it.
It was different, and it was excellent. I wish we had more to try, but there were only 8 of these for um 15 people.......thanks coz:-D
author: Jeff K.

description:
I give this popular bakery a 5-star for a nice and elegant presentation of the counter. 

Unfortunately, I can't rate the taste. I'll tell you why!

Thursday morning(7/27), I went there the very first time and spent $6.00 dollar for 2 very-popular cupcakes (1-Chocalate & 1-Gingerbread @ $3.00 each). I brought it to my wife's workplace in the Castro and we spend the morning with a cup of joe in her office. Once i gave her the cupcakes, she snagged it away from me and whoofed them down like the "Cookie-Monster from Sesame Street". I told her they are not M &M's. She was in heaven after those cupcakes,and I was saddened.

I will go there again and enjoy it by myself.
author: Matt G.

description:
In search of the best macaroons in SF, I tried Miette while in the Ferry Building. 

Verdict? DELISH! 

I got a vanilla macaroon and you could taste true vanilla bean. The texture was just right - the outer shell was stiff but not hard.. the inside of the cookie was soft with just a little chewiness and the perfect amount of true vanilla cream in the middle. 

I guess I don't have to search much farther... Thanks Miette.
author: Allie E.

description:
I've been wanting to check this little french patisserie out. 

2 cupcakes, $3 each, $6 total. 
Of course it's a tad bit pricey, but I had to do it.
love love LOVE cupcakes.

The gingerbread one was so moist and scrumptious. 
The old-fashioned chocolate one with marshmallow cream? on top was just okay. 
I will eat a couple each time I'm around the Ferry Building/Embarcadero area.

I want to try some cakes, macarons, tarts, etc. also...next time...

Minor note: love the little details like the carry-out boxes and the decor of the shop.
author: Kay N.

description:
Oh Miette, how I long for another one of your macarons.

The meringue cookie was different than most other macarons I've tried. Miette managed to make theirs moist, chewy, and crispy all at once as opposed to a simply crispy meringue. It's hard to describe the texture, and the only thing I can say is to try it yourself to understand.

Of their flavors, I tried the grapefruit, hazelnut, pistachio, and rose geranium. Hazelnut and pistachio were good but they weren't standout. Grapefruit, their seasonal flavor at the time I went, was surprisingly sweet and slightly tart without any of the bitterness of eating an actual grapefruit. The home run came with the rose geranium. It had the perfect amount of rose flavor to it to adorn your taste buds. 

At $1.75/macaron, it is on the higher priced side, but I found it worth it. They also have other desserts and pastries, also on the higher end of the price spectrum. One of these days, I'd like to try their Scharffen Berger cake, but at $35 for a 6-inch cake, I can wait.

The only downside is that the macarons in their jars aren't all the same size. When you order them, cross your fingers and hope they grab the big ones to get your moneys worth.

I'll easily come back for their macarons if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Kevin P.

description: Delicious :) Got an eclair and a cup of chocolate, both tastes heavenly. I'll have to come back for the macaroons.
author: Nikita K.

description: Their cupcakes taste amazing! oh and I love their chocolate wafers, too!
author: Rebecca T.

description: Full disclosure: I've only had the macarons here as I am allergic to almost everything else (thank you, gluten intolerance). But because I am allergic to gluten, I only ever eat macarons at bakeries, which makes me somewhat of an expert on this topic. Miette has the best macarons I have ever tried, hands down. They use only natural ingredients - no artificial food coloring, no strange syrupy fillings for the center. The cookie layers are nutty and flecked with almond. The filling is a light whipped cream with a touch of natural flavor (vanilla and pistachio are my favorite). If you are looking for macarons, look no further. This place does it right.
author: Clarisse S.

description: Absolutely love the macarons here! The florals (rose geranium, chocolate lavender) make for a wonderful gift, and are a great go-to treat, and you can't go wrong with any of the other flavors as well. I find their other treats (caramels, chocolates, meringues) to be tasty, but in my opinion, they just don't hold a candle to the macarons. The price is to-be-expected for such an indulgent treat, especially at the San Francisco Ferry Building location.
author: Steve F.

description:
Oy. Lemon tart... oy.

The Ferry Building is so lucky to house this little sweetshop. Miette makes all kinds of sugary things, from cupcakes to French macarons, meringes, blueberry tarts and more. Then they wrap your sugar high up in the cutest little boxes. I'm a sucker for pretty presentation.

My lemon tart was rich---a buttery crust filled with a delightful, glossy pour of lemon curd. It was tangy and sweet, and looked like a million bucks.

The only negative is that the brownie was a little dry, so I'd skip that.
author: Annie D.

description:
I love macaroons! I love Miette! 

Thick and chewy, just the way I like it! Prices were pretty standard at $1.75 each and flavor choices were limited to about 6 when I was there. 

I'm a fan!
author: Vivian D.

description:
I heart cupcakes. I think cupcakes don't heart me since they get the ultimate revenge by making my waist line a bit thicker and my badunkadunk dunk a bit bigger. But the cupcakes here.... oh my goodness.... are worth every little fat calorie... Whenever I'm remotely near the ferry building, I need to make a quick stop, pick up a super moist chocolate cupcake and indulge. 

If you ever find yourself in the ferry building and see an asian girl making out with a cupcake... now you know who it is.
author: Vicky L.

description: Mini maracons (each and every flavor I've tried is absolutely incredible) & ginger snaps. YUM YUM YUM.  How can I not love working so close to this fine establishment.  I have yet to venture deeper into their offerings.  I must say it's hard to stretch out my visits since it's so tempting to grab 1 of everything each stop in.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I spent 2 days in San Francisco and I ate at Miette 2 times... that pretty much sums it up! My wonderful friend Nique and I discovered Miette as a happy accident due to the three day long line for Gelato. Desperate for an ice cream treat, we reluctantly picked up the ice cream sandwiches. I wasn't expecting much but I am happy to say I was extremely surprised! Nique tried the lavender flavor while I stuck with the more traditional vanilla cream. The best part of the sandwich was the graham cracker shell. MMMM!!! If you visit the Ferry Building do let yourself indulge!
We tried again later in the week but they were all sold out :( I settled for a Macaroon. It was delicious, but if given a choice I'd devour the sandwich.
author: Julie C.

description:
My friends dragged me here after getting some lunch at Market Bar. 

- "You've never had one of their cupcakes, Andrew?!?" I felt like an unsophisticated country bumpkin in the face of their incredulous stares. 
- "That's all they sell? Cupcakes?"
- "They have other pastries and baked goods too, but their cupcakes are the best!"
- "Fine. Let's go before I change my mind!!" Can you feel my enthusiasm?

It was a good cupcake . . . I guess. Much more elaborate frosting than I'm used to at the company potlucks, that's for sure! Better tasting frosting too.

The cake part? Moist. Chocolaty . . . Dare I say gourmet? Nah! It's a cupcake for farking sake!! I mean it was good, but I could have had like 4 Krispy Kremes for that much dough! I guess I'm not a dessert connoisseur.

*But* now I can cross it off of my list of things to do before I die. "Eat cupcake shop cupcake." Thank you Miette.
author: Andrew C.

description: Wow, this place is amazing! The macaroons are so scrumptious. The store is inevitably cute with their sheep shaped cookies and unique greeting card selection. I recommend you buy at least one macaroon, you won't be sorry!
author: Cindy G.

description:
We'd window shopped Miette during our last trip to the Terminal. Having read a few reviews, including a report that their gingerbread cupcake had been named Best Beer-spiked Cupcake by none other than Alton Brown, I figured we'd best make a stop. We ordered the cupcake and a grapefruit macaron.

The cupcake we received was dense but surprisingly dry. Although it contains all of the usual gingerbread spices, the overwhelming flavor for me is that of savory bread, which I'm sure is a result of the beer, and of molasses. The cream cheese frosting is fine, but nothing special. All in all, it's a fine cupcake but I'm not entirely sure what the fuss is about.

The macaron has a touch of grapefruit flavor. Honestly, it could have used much more. There is also a very grainy texture to the meringue portion of the macaron that is not pleasing. Since their own menu describes them as containing coarsely ground almonds, it seems reasonable to think the texture is intended, but it comes off feeling somewhat unfinished or poorly mixed.

What Miette lacked in the goods, it certainly makes up for in style. The shop looks like My Little Pony wooed an Easy Bake Oven, and each item is impeccably designed and beautiful.
author: Ryan C.

description:
There's something about eating a strawberry macaron while you are freezing to death on board the top deck of the gold & blue fleet's bay cruise adventure... (yay for being a tourist in your own city!)

Super sad that the strawberry flavor is seasonal! :(

Chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting is good too.  Even after you put it in the fridge because you felt too guilty to devour an entire cupcake after you have just finished off a few macarons.
author: JUDY L.

description:
The long line on weekends confuses me. It's good but not THAT good. But I do think it's a bit of the mob mentality if you enter the Ferry Building during peak times. 

Recently indulged in French Macaroons: pistachio, hazelnut, chocolate lavendar, and something rose. Overall, not quite crisp enough on the outside so I didn't get that airy first bite and a tad too sweet. Hazelnut was probably my favorite. Also tried the gingerbread cupcake which was good until I remembered that I'm not the biggest fan of gingerbread so don't take my word for it. 

Cute place to visit if you plan to check out the Ferry Building.
author: Michelle R.

description: Really great short bread cookies. I loved the vanilla macron! Packaging is also really cute
author: C. M.

description:
The macarons were so delicious and beautiful that I was actually inspired to research taking a macaron class (Baking Arts - you're on notice!).  I had the hazelnut, chocolate and vanilla and they were all delicious.

The women who work there could be friendlier and the line a bit more organized but obviously the quality of the pastries made up for it.  Also, the pot de creme is the most adorable thing I've ever seen.  Not sure I would pay $4 for something that looks like it belongs in a diorama but it sure is cute.
author: Shauna F.

description:
TLDR:
- Marshmallow cream chocolate cupcakes.
- Pricey but worth it.
- Other stuff, so-so.
author: Christopher L.

description: I'm a fan of the macarons here. A lot of macarons from different places taste similar in that they are very sweet and mild on the almond flavor, but the macarons here are different - they have a strong nutty taste, which I like. And you know how it's hard to distinguish what flavor you're eating at some macaron places? It's not like that here; the macarons are strong on whatever flavor they're supposed to be.
author: Janet P.

description:
It is a pleasure stopping by here when i come to the farmer's market.

Their cupcakes are amazing. I need to know the recipe they use for their frosting. There are no words to describe how creamy and perfect it is.

I love all their cute little cookies and treats they sell. Their lavender shortbread cookies are so buttery and flavorful. I cant help but pick up a little of everything when i am there.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Although the prices are a bit on the pricey side, you can't deny the fantastic taste that comes from Miette. 

I was guided here by my very own walking Yelp and I was so happy that I took her advice. My father and I were looking for some dessert and we split a Chocolate Tartlete. As warned, it didn't look like anything special. The cupcakes looked much prettier, I must say. But the incredibly creamy, rich and full taste that flowed out of that tart was incredible. We just stood there in the middle of the shop, slowly devouring the fudge-like chocolate on that fluffy yet crispy pasty. Even though I thought that $5 was a bit much to be asking for it, my taste buds were blown away and I could no longer argue.
author: Mariko F.

description:
Get the MINI-SCHARFFEN BERGER!!  It's this little round chocolate cake covered with layers of ganache and perfect for dark chocolate lovers AND non-dark chocolate lovers, like myself!  I don't even care that it costs $5... it's true bliss.  Share with someone!

Since so many Yelpers recommended the gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting, I had to get it.  It was quite moist and although I'm not normally a frosting person, this was made well.  Not heavy and stiff for cream cheese at all.  Even though it was good, I still could've scraped off half of it.  

I've only had the vanilla parisian macaroon (compliments of Blue Bottle Coffee Co.) and it was delicious!!  Compared to Pamplemousse in Redwood City, the macaroon here is slightly firmer and I enjoyed the flour part here a little more because there are more levels of flavor.

I love how so many of the stores/stands in the Ferry Buildling and Farmer's Market incorporate local goods (Scharffen Berger, Acme Bread) into their own food.  Miette, please make my wedding cake at a discounted rate!  It's good but I don't want to go broke.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I keep hearing that Macarons are the new cupcake. Well, snake my rattle, they're right. I tried one tiny, gorgeous Vanilla Parisian and am convinved these will replace cupcakes toute de suite.

So soft and creamy and sweet, macarons melt in your mouth.  And unlike cupcakes, you must use white flour. None of that whole grain wheat bran granny muffin stuff that 'll rip the lining of your digestive system out.

So siree! Good ol' white flour for these petit pastries. I'm a fan!
author: Kelly G.

description:
Hands down - best cupcake I've ever had IN MY ENTIRE LIFE.

The frosting is LETHALLY DELICIOUS. The actual cupcake MELTS in your mouth - it's perfect! I wanted to make sweet sweet cupcake love to this cupcake eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Veda R.

description:
Macarons, macarons and... macarons! 

The bf and I decided to try one in each flavor (which were grapefruit, hazelnut, pistachios, and rose), and ONE bite into the first macaroon made the world stop for a split second and and set off the fireworks all around me as I slowly chewed on this delicate cookie. Then as I came back to reality, we ran back and waited in line to get MORE to share with the fambam later that evening (which was btw, a FAIL. Ha, share... who was I trying to kid) 

Anyways, the cookie had the most amazing texture ever. They had a crispy exterior, yet fragile to the touch. And still managed to be moist, soft, and chewy underneath the crispiness. After you chew on it, you'll notice little ground up pieces of almond embedded in it as well.. Yummmmy!

Among all, the rose was definitely my favorite, hands down. For a little cookie, it held a great amount of flavor, and aroma that just sends your eyeballs rolling to the back of your head as you put a smile on. The chocolate was extremely rich, and a bit too strong for my taste, but the pistachio and hazelnut both tied for 2nd best. 

At $1.75 per cookie, it's a bit on the pricer side, but well worth it if you're lucky enough to receive a big cookie as the macaroons vary in sizes. Which is slightly disappointing if you're stuck with only a tiny macaroon. So please! Have some consistency with your macaroons, and I will gladly give you 5 stars!
author: Thanh N.

description: A friend of mine bought me some macarons from here as a surprise. I though it was weird that different flavors had this same color. I couldn't tell which one was pistachio or vanilla one. Overall, I thought it was okay. I mean its not Laudree Macarons but it would do. I guess this place could be my second favorite place for french macarons here in the Bay Area after Chantal Guillon.
author: Julie C.

description:
Don't get sucked in by their "cute" storefront and its location within the Ferry Market Building.  

Their baked goods are decent... we tried some macarons and cookies and nothing blew us away.  The one thing that did blow us away were the prices... they sucked.  The macarons we got were tiny (a couple of them were about the size of quarters) and they were $1.75 each for one bite.  Had they been a bit larger, I wouldn't have felt as ripped off, but these were seriously the tiniest macarons I've ever seen.  I suppose I spend more money on a bite of sushi, but for some reason I feel more comfortable doing that.
author: Jefferson L.

description:
Prime location.  pretty packaging.  cutesy decor.  visually delicious.  

BUT, it was not meant to be.  i wanted to like this place but the cupcakes were mediocre at best..  the chocolate cupcakes were disappointing.   though i appreciated the fact that the frosting was not so sweet, it could have used s'more sugar in this case.  it tasted like margarine.  the cupcake itself, betty crocker could have done the same job.  

the macarons were interesting.  after eating  3 small macarons, i am still deciding whether the chunky nutty texture is something i would return to miette for.  my freind described her chocolate macaron as something similar to eating a brownie.  i guess i prefer my macarons lighter and smoother.

miette, overrated and  disappointing. :S
author: Kris H.

description: I'm not normally a fan of macaroons, but I must say, these were good! I had the chocolate lavender and rose geranium - both fresh, subtle and sweet. These little guys make perfect treats! My bf had the banana cream tart and he loved it. I had a bite and it was sweet and very fresh. Two thumbs up! Will have to try the cupcakes and ice cream sandwiches next time. We will meet again.
author: Cindy T.

description:
This place is magical. From all the pretty pastel colors to the delicious cupcakes/macarons/cakes/pastries - I would totally live here. 

The macarons were incredible. The cupcakes were great. All the bits of candy I tried were delicious as well.

I would seriously live in this store.
author: Kaylen W.

description:
Oh my precious! No im not talking about a ring im talking about miette's flourless macaroons, yup that's right FLOURLESS! This was not the best info for me to have during lent as I went through my no-flour diet. These little goodies come in strawberry, vanilla, chocolate with lavender, hazelnut and rose geranium. 
Cute cupcakes with icing done so perfectly it was almost too pretty to eat! The chocolate with crème fraiche cake was little of a disappointment as I hoped it would be moister than it was. Brought home a old-fashion cake for mom's birthday and I was divine with gelato from ciao bella.  The prices are more than your corner bakery but for an out of this world treat, worth every penny.
author: Lola L.

description:
Congratulations on "Best Cupcake in America!!!" I must say the Gingerbread Cupcake is quite tasty, it's like Christmas in a cupcake! 

The Old Fashioned Cupcake is pretty good too. I'm now a fan of boiled icing... pretty interesting stuff. Scharfen Berger cakes, macarons, banana tarts... this place just knows how to make everything good! Can't wait to try the Lemon Cloud Cake!
author: S Y.

description:
It's such a delight shopping in this petit bakery. For me, there's so much eye candy and attention to detail. From the ice-cream colored pedastals to the "you send me" glitter cards to the perfectly frosted cupcakes  - the whole package works.

I have yet to try everything (practicing restraint), but so far love the mini scones, chocolate chip cookies, and cupcakes. I agree with Sarah on the gingerbread cupcakes - they're deliciously full of ginger and super moist.

Yesterday, I finally broke down and got the gingerbread cake. The girl behind the counter asked, "the whole cake?" Do I look that out of shape? Anyway, it's absolutely mouth-tantalizing, we had to share... our friends loved it as well.
author: Lizelle G.

description: I don't know what it is about this place, but I'm just never excited enough to give it a second shot. The first time I went I got several cupcakes to try, pots de creme and the ginger snaps as suggested by everyone else. The cupcakes were extremely sub par and it had marshmallow-y frosting which I generally do not like. The pots de creme presentation was good--it came in a glass jar and looked great, but tasted a little burnt and grainy. The ginger snaps just taste like your typical gourmet cookie that you could buy at an overpriced grocery store.
author: Hayley H.

description: Excellent macarons.  The rose-geranium was flavorful yet subtle, with a wonderful texture. Pistachio was good, too. There just aren't enough meals or snacks in the day, or I'd have sampled everything.
author: Cherie C.

description:
Big fan of the macaroons and cupcakes.  It is on the pricier side, but well worth it, especially for special occasions.

I much prefer the cupcakes here over Magnolia Bakery's in New York.  The flavors from the Miette cupcakes seem to really shine through while being a little more delicate.  Magnolia's cupcakes are super dense, and I think the flavor gets lost in an overwhelming taste of butter.

If you need to pre-order, you can call in, and they will have your tasty goods ready for you to pick up.
author: Jen Y.

description: Macarons are the new cupcake and Miette's got these down pat. A friend surprised me with a special treat of chocolate, coffee, and vanilla macarons. The chocolate had so much depth to the filling. Delightful! Light and chewy just how I love them!
author: Anna R.

description:
The macaroons are HELLA good! I thought it was crazy that I paid $1.50 for each macaroon, but I decided to give it a shot.  I had 1 of each... all of them were delicious, with the exception of the lavender flavored macaroon. It was a bit strange... I think lavender is something that belongs in your closet and gym bag to make it smell nice, or in the bath or candle?!? I shared my macaroons with my friend, and she thought the chocolate macaroon was absolutely delicious. 

I've also had the cupcakes... they are ok. I might be biased because the cupcake shops back home in LA are just much better than anything I've experienced up here in the bay.
author: Jenn R.

description:
Macarons are really good.  The shells texture was just right.  No food coloring is pretty ballsy and not overly sweet.  The buttercream was smooth, fluffy and not overly sweet.  I prefer macarons fillings to be a bit thicker though.  Overall, still one of the best macarons I've had.

Lemon tart was also very good.
author: Will W.

description:
I used to take the long way home  just to stop by the only macaron shop in the valley (that's now closed). I later found Paulette's, and though they are delectable, the texture is lacking.

My awesome brother came back from SF with macarons from here (yay brother!)...and oh, my. It was like having my first bite all over again--the love, my heart--it stopped...and I knew this was it. The lavender chocolate is probably my favorite out of the bunch. There's amazing texture, there's a harmony of flavor--I do wish they were color coded, but I suppose biting into each will be more of a surprise!
author: Amberlin J.

description:
Well, Bob G. liked the cupcakes!  Yesterday I sent cupcakes to the Yelp Guys.  I did this long distance, from L.A., with the help of Miette staff.  Miette gets five stars for their exceptional service alone, even though I have never tasted their products.  I put my faith in the Yelper's reviews and it looks like those cupcakes were indeed a hit.  Miette does not deliver, so they arranged for a private messenger (not cheap) to bring my cupcakes to the Yelp office.  All it took from me was one phone call (and a credit card) and the bakery did all the rest.  Hmmm, I wonder if those Yelp Dogs got any cupcakes.......

Update:  the feedback I am getting indicates that there may be female cupcakeaholics in the neighborhood.
author: Joan S.

description:
I am in love with this store!  I was at the Ferry Building during lunch one day when I decided to browse Miette.  Their cupcakes are so good - I bought the vanilla cake with vanilla frosting. It was melt in your mouth deliciousness!  I also bought a bag of their lavender shortbread cookies.  OMG - I totally fell off the diet wagon that day.  Their lavender cookies are so addictive.  When I took home a bag for my sexy husband, he devoured the whole thing in minutes. 

Cute store - just a bit pricey.  But if you want to satisfy your sweet tooth, you've got to hit up this place.
author: Christine P.

description:
$5 for a bag of homemade Cracker Jack?
Ridiculous!  Only an idiot would pay this much for...crunch, crunch...um...crunchcrunchcrunchcrunch...CRUNCHCRUNCHCRUNCH...tip bottom of bag vertically.

The eclairs and brownies are heavenly too.  Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go sit down.
author: dan s.

description: I came here specifically for the macaroons. I can tell they were fresh because they weren't super cold when I got them like they are at other places I go to. The price is about the same $1.85 each macaroon, depending on the flavor. They aren't as sweet as other places and the filling is soft, not hard like other places. I'd come back again to try the other sweets they have to offer.
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description: We can't help ourselves when we walk by here but to grab a bunch of their lavender shortbread cookies and anything else that catches our eye (and tongue). I'm not usually a fan of lavender flavored things (b/c it reminds me of eating soap) but I really dig the cookies here. Also, they don't advertise their ice cream sandwiches much and I can't understand why not as they are damn good. Oh and regarding their macarons, they are not as good as Paulette's or anything I had in France. There was something wrong with the texture of them.. like they were too thick and grainy.
author: Henry W.

description: Very cute and professional. Always buy office birthday cakes here, staff are friendly and orders are always on time and correct.
author: J B.

description:
French Macarons are very tasty and the perfect consistency.  All flavors were true to the name.  Excellent.

The Carot Cupcake was delicous, moist and flavorful.  The Cream Cheese Frosting was not overly sweet and complimented the cup cake very well.  

All cookies are excellent.  

The ice-cream sandwich with the lemon flavored icecream between 2 Graham Crackers was very tasty.  The best ice-cream sandwich I have ever had. 

The Coconut Mousse Cake is yummy.  Cake is moist and the mousse is light and airy.  The shredded coconut topped it off perfectly.

Everything that I have had at Miette was delicious and yummy.  No complaints.  Now, if only it would come to the East Coast.
author: Eva W.

description:
French macaroons = yum and addicting.  Can't stop at one!

Cakes = awesome.  Gorgeous and delicious.

Service = friendly.

Quality stuff, decent portions, and just love this place!  Prices are moderate but just splurge, a little bit at a time, okay?

Oh...and they have coffee....:-P
author: Fannie S.

description: My first time at Miette and I loved it.  The shop is cutely decorated in pink and they have such friendly staffs.  I got a box of 6 macaroons in pistachio, chocolate lavender, and coffee flavor.  All the flavors were amazing.  The macaroons were super soft and tasty.  For a box of 6 macaroons it was about $10 which is normal.  They also have lemon tarts, cupcakes, cookies, cakes.  All the goodies you can think of.  This will be my go to place for macaroons!
author: Joyce L.

description:
3 1/2 stars for some desserts on the go.

sampled two flavors probably spelling this wrong but ehh sounding it out looks right haha. the coco crem rich and creamy and panaccitta also lite and creamy was excellent

on a hot day these desserts are the way to go. I recommend coming back during the farmers market for lunch on thursdays 

food *** 1/2 definite spot to hit up for some desserts
price $
service **** very helpful staff
ambiance *** small spot take everything togo
author: Clarence A.

description:
i died and went to macaron heaven when i had the hazelnut macaron from miette.  it is THAT good.

current flavors: chocolate, vanilla, hazelnut (!!), pistachio, rose geranium (i will vouch for this flavor, too), chocolate lavender, and grapefruit.

cupcakes are topped with smooth, light, buttery soft frosting that makes you want to melt right along with it.. at least for the carrot cupcake.

so sad to be back in seattle... =/
author: Christine Y.

description:
I love their packaging and branding! So cute!

Only got macarons because I'm a macaron fiend! :P

Hazelnut: This was one of my favorites. Reminded me a bit of Nutella but not overpowering like Nutella can be. 

Strawberry: Nommy, I love how light it tasted, fruity yet not overly sweet.

Chocolate: Did not like this one at all, way too sweet and the chocolate taste was too strong. 

Chocolate Lavender: I liked how I could taste the lavender but like the plain chocolate macaron this was way too sweet for my liking to the point where the lavender was barely tasted. 

Rose-Geranium: I love tasting the fragrance of roses in a small amount and with the tiny size of a macaron it delivers just enough rose flavor to my liking. NOMS.

Vanilla: This was another one of my faves, light and creamy. Yummy!

I really wanted to try the pistachio but they didn't have it that day. Sadface! I wish they had it because I really wanted to try it!

But my major gripe with their macarons are the graininess of their flour. I really don't like how grainy it makes the macarons. Renaud's Patisserie in Santa Barbara makes a better, smoother macaron.
author: Constance C.

description:
Miette, I love you so much you don't even know. 

Located inside the Ferry Building, Miette just oozes cuteness with their decor and friendly staff! I bought Graham Crackers and Gingersnaps for my coworkers back home (graham crackers... fav!) but my seester and I got macaroons to eat right then and there. Our favorite was hands down the Raspberry Macaroon (tip - it's seasonal!)

Can you please open up shop in Los Angeles?! I'd visit you forever!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Next time you are having dinner at your VP's house ... bring dessert from Mimette.  

My personal favorite is the Old Fashioned.  It's a chocolate cake with marshmallow icing topped with a cherry.  It sort of looks like a brown boob.

I haven't tried anything else yet cause every time I go there, I gravitate towards the boob.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I'm crazy about macarons.  Ever since I tried the macarons at Laduree in Paris, I've been on a hunt to find comparable ones in SF.  I've devoted serious time into deciding which macarons are better: Miette v. Chantal Guillon (formerly Paulette), and I've decided that Chantal Guillon takes the cake. 

Don't get me wrong. Miette's macarons are really good. They have the perfect macaron texture: delicate, crisp shell on the outside + gooey, almond sweetness on the inside.  Compared to the texture of Chantal Guillon macarons, the texture is a bit more rustic and slightly denser. However, I cannot tell the difference between the flavors.  I've tried all of Miette's flavors and they taste too similar to each other.

The store itself at the Ferry Building is really cute and saccharine sweet. The workers behind the counter look like they stepped out of a Martha's Stewart Living magazine.  Unfortunately, I feel like Miette is one of those places where you pay for the name and ambiance, but not for the items they make. I still drop by Miette for one macaron whenever I'm in the Ferry Building, but when I really want to be wowed by distintive macaron flavors, I go to Chantal Guillon.
author: Monelle A.

description:
While in pursuit of the 7x7 Magazine's Big Eat: 100 Things to Eat in San Francisco Before You Die list and the The Big Sweet SF: 50 Treats to Eat Before You Die, I decided to stop in at Miette and get the Ginger Snaps and the Old-fashioned chocolate cake with Italian meringue frosting, plus the Gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting. 

I took my haul back to work to share and everyone agreed that everything was delicious!  The ginger snaps are spicy and buttery.  The chocolate cake was good, but not the best I've ever had, but the meringue was absolutely fabulous, light and airy.  As for the gingerbread cupcake, it was super tasty and the cream cheese frosting was amazing.  I'm definitely a fan!

The only downside to this place is how slow the service is, although they are friendly and  helpful.
author: Crystal B.

description:
Their macarons are too sweet but good enough for my quick macaron fix.  I like the presentation.

Cons:  pricey!
author: Bayarea K.

description:
Their macaroons are sinful and delicious! 

Rose-geranium was described as "tasting like a rose" & she was spot-on! I loved it! Imagine the smile you get when you smell a really lovely rose...that's what this macaroon tastes like! Slightly chewy with a soft interior. I think I got some looks from passersby when I made my "OMG this is good" sound after taking a bite!

Pistachio was scrumptious too. Light nutty flavor w/ the same chewy/soft shell. 

Raspberry was my least liked flavor. I thought it would have the punch of flavor like Rose-Geranium but it didn't; I should have known that looking at the color of the filling (whitish red). The flavor is very mild but still a good macaroon. 

$5.25 for 3 macaroons. 

Next up: chocolate lavendar! And their cupcakes!! Yippeeee!!!
author: Marissa H.

description:
Another amazing establishment in the Ferry Building.  

You have to get the macaroons.  They are the best I have every had.  Soft and chewy with excellent flavor.  We went back twice just for the macaroons.  The sea salt caramels are amazing too.  I just wish I had tried more, but I was sugared out.
author: Carolyn W.

description:
Dee-lish-ee-oh-soh!

So I ordered this snowball cake from miette for the fam for Christmas - which of course meant we dove into it the moment we got it home.  It is super adorable - a perfect white dome coated in crystal sugar (see pic).  

My parents were underwhelmed, expecting it to be like the Hostess snacky cake they already know and love (and not the biggest fans of fondant).  I, on the other hand, think it is total yum - a white cake with a layer of chocolate cream in the middle, topped with a dome of whipped cream/marshmallow, draped with fondant, then topped with sugar - mmm!

Also, despite this one bump in the road, my parents have had other items from the patisserie that they've liked.  So everyone wins - including miette with a 5 star rating.
author: Allison B.

description:
I've had cupcakes from here twice. They're ok, but definitely not worth the exorbitant price! The frosting is good, but the cake is kind of dry. Not what I'd expect from a tiny $4 cupcake!
Their baked goods are beautiful, but way too expensive for the quality.
There are a lot of places that are better tasting , and not as expensive.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Definately a fan, definately...

I think I've tried most of their cakes and cupcakes ~~ just recently I tried the Old Fashioned and the new panna cotta desserts.  The marshmellow frosting is KILLER.  As for the panna cotta, I thought it tasted like Yoplait yogurt ... with a semi-panna cotta texture ... wasn't a big fan of that so I'll stick with their lip-smacking cupcakes!  The Princess Cake is teeth shattering--the fondant is devastating to my teeth and taste buds (too sugary for me...not a fan of fondant...just pretty to look @)  I LOVE the Scharffen Berger mini cakes ... just enough to satify the chocolate crave.  Last time I had the whole cake was at my previous job for lunch...and I was dying from food/chocolate coma.  

I HIGHLY recommend my new favorites: Old-fashioned cupcakes and the Scharffen Berger mini cakes.  I don't recommed the panna cotta.  They're a bit pricey but for good reasons.  Try it; everyone's doing it.
author: Kat C.

description: I love the macarons here! They are the best I've had so far; the flavors are very present and the texture is fabulous (crunchy shell, chewy middle). There are only a few different flavors, however, and they tend to be very classic flavors. I wish they would experiment with more exotic flavors as well.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
Everything about this place is cute, the store front in pink, the mini 6' cakes, the macarons in jars, the tiny cake stands. Love it! 

I've visited Miettes a couple times now and realized I hadn't submitted a review.

I bought a small 6' Tomboy cake for my friend for her birthday, the girls boxed it up nicely and gave me plates and everything to serve it with that evening. We didn't end up eating the whole cake so I nibbled on it for days before I had finished it. it was great up to 5 days after I'd purchased it. A left over slice, microwaved for 30 sec and the cake melted in your mouth, sooo good.

This place gets raved reviews for their macarons and I totally agree, to some extent. They're chewy cookies sandwiching a creamy filling.  I thought the vanilla flavor was the best, the filling tasted just like vanilla ice cream. I was disappointed by the chocolate lavender, still tasty but the lavender flavor didn't show through as well as I'd hoped.
author: Nicole L.

description:
$1.75 for one French macaron. Dang! Hella expensive! But they are delicious! The shell was nice and chewy....the filling was very creamy and melted in your mouth. I ended up buying 5 different flavors. Hazelnut, vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, and rose something [?]. They were all good. I could probably eat 15 of those in one sitting. 

Btw, they also grind their own almonds here (to make almond flour). I've been trying to look for a good recipe and found out  almond flour is one of the main ingredients in a French macaron. Just sayin.

4.5 stars. I still think the macarons from La Boulange taste better. =P
author: B B.

description:
Seriously, my most favorite bakery in the downtown area. I go during work, after work, and on weekends with friends in town. It's a show off spot in the Ferry Building, and it's a local fav. 

Vanilla Miette Macarons - hands down the only reason I'm here
Slice of Layered Chocolate Cake - freshest chocolate cake with a light cream between the layers. 

You'll thank me later, promise.
author: Monalisa M.

description:
the guy quoted me $3, for a bag of candy that was about the size of my palm, smaller then a baseball for reference. it is a simple type of candy, so the price, size and assuming taste sounded right.

the cashier Julie, rung me up and it was 6.50, I asked for a receipt and she printed several, which she crumpled and then printed me one that simply read French drop, $6.50.

since there were no transactions in between, it makes me wonder. but that thought was lost to this better be some good candy.

sadly it wasn't, tricked yet again

I've had some of their other sweets (in the jar, which if you bring back entitles you to a .50 discount) as well and wasn't impressed

what disappoints me is the whole experience I had, so I won't be back.. cos if the food was lacking but not downright awful (as this was), I would skip over writing a review..if I reviewed every place I've been to I would have quad triple digits next to my name.

there are so many places to spend my money on in sf, including chantal guillon over on Hayes, Fiona's sweetshoppe in fidi, jane on Fillmore...all highly recommend for taste and service

so sad since the store is cute, the concept quite nice..just taste doesn't match the price nor service..
author: Whitne Y.

description: I did not enjoy mackin' on the macaroons here. I had the coffee & chocolate macaroons and the flavors were bland and not very sweet. The macaroons are also on the smaller side.
author: Emily C.

description:
I went to the Ferry Building for Farmer Market Saturdays + to grab a quick lunch.  And instead of letting me get anything I went there for (veggies from the Farmer's Market or lunch), Miette LURED me in and I was trapped.  I bought a macaroon, and it was delicioussssss.  

Then I had lunch.  Then I went back to Miette and bought three more macaroons.  I'm such a pig, but a pig filled with delicious foods.  (Oh and I especially enjoy the pistachio ones....but they are all yummy)
author: Jessica C.

description: Cake is very dense and frosting too light for a buttercream. Definitely not my favorite place.
author: Vanessa L.

description: I love their cupcakes!!!  The frosting is not too sweet, which is perfect for me.
author: Lily T.

description:
This place has such a nice feel and look it (pink and girly). They have these really pretty cake pedastels that they sell at the store but it's pricy...i think $65 for a stand? too much. Besides the pricy  non food items they sell..i am even more disappointed in the cupcakes! 

I am soo disappointed with this place. The cupcakes were soo cute looking, however, the cupcakes does not taste as good as it looks. They were soo dry..i swear cake from a box are better then their cupcakes. And it's not like these little things were cheap either.
author: Cindy C.

description:
4 STARS just for their ginger snaps! Macaroons were too sweet for the price that they charged. I like Paulette's better out here in L.A..

This is my favorite spot in the ferry building as my husband "Johnny C" had mentioned.
author: Joy C.

description: I've only tried the macarons here. They have lots of cute pastries, which I will try in the future. But I was very drawn to the macarons. There are 6 or 7 different types that all look good and cute. I am in love with the pistachio macaron. It's chewy, soft, not too sweet, creamy, too small....wish they were all bigger so I could savor them longer. hehe  I will definitely come back here for more macaron goodness!
author: Liwei Y.

description:
Now THESE are cupcakes.  As someone who grew up in the Midwest, my expectations are pretty high when it comes to baked goods.  As far as cakes and cookies and pies are concerned, California makes me very sad.

Anyway, this place is a bright spot in a sea of bad cupcake joints.  The Italian meringue chocolate cupcake is easily one of the  best I've ever had.  The cake is moist and soft, with a ridiculously rich chocolate flavor, and the meringue frosting is unique and light and absolutely perfect with the deep chocolate flavor of the cake.  

Packaging is adorable, too, so if you have a girlfriend (or boyfriend) who enjoys cupcakes, grab 2 and let them package everything up in their cute boxes.  

The only downside is that it can be a bit of a wait (by cupcake shop standards) if you come on a farmer's market day.  Keep that in mind, though, and you should be fine.
author: Stefanie H.

description:
4.5 stars

Long story short: A patisserie with cookies, macarons, cakes and other confections in the beloved Ferry Building?  Of course I'm there!

Long story long: 

As most of you know, I'm a pastry chef.  One of the reasons being that I have a HUGE sweet tooth.  If it didn't contribute to weight gain, diabetes, and countless oral cavities, I would probably eat stuff like cookies and chocolate everyday.  And creme brulee.  And brownies.  Hell, lots of sweets.  I mean, how can you NOT love something that's edible and sweet?  And I'm not talking about little Bo sheep, which I had last night and was DELICIOUS.  But I digress.

With the Ferry Building being home to about 8 or 9 places on my food crawl list to potentially hit up, I jumped at the chance to add a couple of bakeries and patisseries to the list.  The store front itself is a little smaller than some of the other stores, of course when all you're selling is essentially a handful of different items, you don't need much space.  The display tables outside had an assortment of shortbread cookies of various flavors.  I picked up a bag of vanilla shortbread cookies and chocolate chip shortbread cookies, deciding to bring them to CAV later that evening.  I also picked up a vanilla and a chocolate macaron for myself.  I think the bags of cookies were $4-5 and the macarons were... $.75 each?  Basically, its not dirt cheap but isn't highway robbery either.  I would say the cuteness/price ratio is rather low.  Or high?  I think you know what I mean.

The woman behind the counter was really nice and super helpful.  I made my purchase and was on my way.

When I eventually left the Ferry Building, I finally dove into the macarons.  Oh man, they were so good.  I kind of wish I had gotten more, but I figure, this is just reason to go back next time I'm in SF.  And later that evening when we broke into the shortbread cookies at CAV, those were good too.  In fact, they were DEVOURED.  I think it was either Ligaya or Susan who attacked it once I mentioned it was from Miette.  Just saying.

So they apparently make cakes and stuff at their other locations.  I wonder how much those cost.

You know I will definitely be back.
author: Austin S.

description:
I stop going to the Ferry Building so often now but the last time I was there, I made sure to stop by for some macarons.

I am sad to report that they were not the Miette of yore. The price for a macaron had gone up by a quarter, which was totally no bid deal, but the size had also shrunk considerably!

To top it off, the shells had a mushy and dense texture. There was hoping that they had an off day but with all the competitions in town, they should have stepped up their game.
author: Cindy B.

description:
How cute!

Had their half off Award Winning Gingerbread cupcake!

Amazing by itself, even better at half price!

Must try!!!
author: Winè C.

description:
Update: 11/18/07

I forgot how good their chocolate cake is. I have raised them a star. I had a chocolate cupcake with coffee frosting. It was really good and the top did not fall off this time.

-----

Original review 3 stars:

Sweet chocolate dreams!

Miette has definitely got some amazing rich chocolate CAKE in those cupcakes. I was so shocked I had to take a nap after eating the cake part. I tried the Chocolate with Vanilla frosting cupcake.

I didn't like the frosting at all. First, it fell off when I licked it gently (see picture uploaded to this review). Then, it tasted like whip cream or cool whip with no sugar. I really didn't like it at all. I prefer sweet (makes you jumpy) frosting. This was kind of lardy and had the consistency of whipped butter. I really wanted to try the cream cheese frosting, but it only came with gingerbread cake and I don't like gingerbread.

I might give place another try sometime when I am in need of rich wet chocolate cake, but I am not so sure I would be willing to pay $3 again. One per store, I don't agree with all these cupcake stores charging $3+ for a single cupcake.

I make my own cupcakes and have had those local evil LA ones that start with an "S" too. 

I cake make frosting better than anyone!

Maybe.
author: Lorrie N.

description:
Fave: everything!

This is only my 4th 5-star review on Yelp out of nearly 70. Miette truly deserves it. They make excellent-looking cakes, although I haven't had one of their cakes myself.

Their cupcakes are superior, especially their gingerbread version. Another favorite is the chocolate cream on top of a chocolate cupcake. Oodles of great chocolate flavor but never anything too sweet. Miette owner Meg Ray really has a talent for turning desserts you think you know into something new with elegant, understated flavors. 

The macarons (don't dare call them macaroons!) have been mentioned by others and they really hit the spot. It's not easy to make good macarons; in fact, it may be the toughest dessert/bakery item in the French repertoire. Miette nails them with tasty cream and crisp, airy cookies. 

Another bonus is that Miette is able to ship normal cookies and macarons to your door! Fantastic service. Now you need not tramp up to SF to get your baked goods fix. Their cookies, especially the chocolate sable, is brilliant. The cookie is clearly high quality, made of really good subtle-tasting dark chocolate. Not too sweet, which is the problem with many chocolate cookies. The chocolate chip cookie, again a classic, gets reinvented with flavorful chocolate chips and soft, crumbly cookie around it. And at $5 for a dozen or so cookies, the price is very reasonable.  

Miette's cookies and macarons are worth ordering online, and it's all worth driving across the Bay Area for.
author: Aubrey C.

description:
I was disappointed to find the cupcakes (of various flavors) are only so-so here at Miette.  Although decorated quite beautifully, I am reminded of women who wear too much make-up...

The macarons are good and pretty close to what you might find in Paris.  I'm saving a star for the Scharffenberger mini chocolate cake.
author: Sherri C.

description:
Who needs food coloring? Miette's macarons are all natural and the taste and consistency of them are amazing. 
I always visit the one in the ferry building. The decor is cute and sweet. 
My favorite flavor is the pistachio and rose.
I always get macarons but sometimes I get the ice cream sandwiches. 
the best ones I've ever had. The creme fraiche ice cream is SO good. 
It has a sweet and sour taste to it and goes perfectly with the graham cracker cookie. 

Miette is definitely a bakery that I would recommend for people to try their first macaron at!
author: Jessica S.

description:
All I have to say is 5 simple words ....GINGERBREAD-CUPCAKE-CREAM-CHEESE-ICING!

This place has some yummy cupcakes  My friend had the vanilla with the lemon buttercream frosting and she decided that was going to be her wedding cake flavor.  Yeah that's right ... she has the cake .. just not the groom.  It's that yum!  

Down side ... the cupcake is small for the price ... $3.50 I think ... but the taste is there.
author: Stacy W.

description: Purchased the cheese cake and chocolate cake.  The chocolate was good but cheese cake was very strong of sour cream.  Could of been better.
author: Brandon A.

description:
SO.PINK.

The aesthetic of this store appeals to the little girl princess in me who always wanted a candyland-bubblegum 5th birthday party.  When I get past the awe of the overall look...I'm then dumbstruck by the confections on display.  The cakes, the cupcakes, the crackers, the chocolates, mmmmmmmm

....And my favorite by far, the macarons.  The first time I tried these were actually when I took my out-of-town friend to the ferry building before we went to watch Wicked.  We were stuffed from dinner, but decided to pack up 2 macarons each (1 pistachio, 1 hazelnut) for after the musical when we were hankering for a midnight snack.  It was a pretty hot day, and we ended up leaving the macarons in the car for a while, and I was afraid they would be ruined when I opened up the little packaging back at home.  But to our amazing delight, they were just DIVINE.  from the first bite, I was taken aback by the sheer happiness being experienced by my tastebuds.  The texture, the taste, everything was just perfect!  And this was when the macarons were not at optimal temperature settings! 

Now I go back whenever i can(that's saying a lot considering I'm not the biggest fan of sweets)...whether to this location or the one in the hayes valley--I even go WAY out of my way to get here, and treat myself to my favorite treat in the States.  Thank goodness I live in San Francisco, because otherwise, the cost of these macarons would be that of a plane ticket!!!
author: Jane K.

description: I came to Miette a little over a year ago, and this was one of the first bakeries I saw selling French macaroons.  Of course now they are a lot more popular.  This review is solely for their pistachio macaroons.  For $1.75 it is a one or two bite snack, but well worth it.  A lot of the time macaroons are filled with ganache, I love that they fill theirs with buttercream
author: Amy D.

description:
Cupcakes. 

Moist, delicious, flavorful cupcakes. With frosting that tastes like yum.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I'm such a sucker for fad food. 

A few years ago the cute little dots on top of every cupcake that Sprinkles produces had me crazy for those tiny little cupcakes.  A few weeks ago a visit to Sprinkles was less than satisfactory and it got me wondering if I was really just being sucked into all the hype.

And now, macaroons are the new cupcakes.  At least in my books. 

It all started with a short coverage in the Travel Channel featuring small UFO-shaped sweets in various colors - the soundtrack was what got me watching (it was the catchy tune of Bach's Invention No. 8), but after the five-minute schpiel, I couldn't help googling macaroons and finding out that Miette quite possibly sells the most famous macaroons in SF.

So off I went to their cute shop in the gourmet food mecca that is Ferry Building and picked one from each of the macaroon jars.  I'm a simple girl so my top three might well be the most boring flavors available but who cares - they are hazelnut, chocolate and vanilla.  Unlike cupcakes, macaroons take only two bites to consume and don't leave you feeling like you just downed a loaf of bread or a pint or Guinness.  Another advantage of its petite size is that it allows people with 'eyes-bigger-than-stomach' syndrome like me to hedge my bet with a number of different flavors instead of having to go all in with just one.   

So I'm a fan.  This might be one of the many posts about macaroons.
author: Ange L.

description:
Wow!!! During our trip to San Francisco we decided to try a few cupcakes from this little bakery shop at the Ferry Market. They looked very pretty and the packaging was cute and at the very least we could say we tried something new. Words cannot express the explosion of deliciousness that took place in my mouth! The cake itself was moist but firm. It didn't crumble and fall apart when I took a bite. The buttercream frosting was sweet but not too much so. It didn't leave that weird fatty film on the roof of your mouth that cheap buttercream knock-off frostings do. 

We found ourselves craving more as soon as we finished the first half-dozen we bought. We stopped by the shop on our way to the airport to satiate our cravings with some more delicious goodies. The carrot cake cupcake is the best I've ever tasted! Packed with yummy bits of carrot and currants and little coconut flakes all topped off with the best cream cheese buttercream frosting I've ever had the pleasure of tasting in my entire life! It may seem hard to beat that, but my personal favorite was the Old-Fashioned with Italian Meringue frosting. It was a moist chocolate cupcake that had just the right amount of richness. Topped with a fluffy cap of creamy meringue that reminded me of the ooey-gooey yumminess of a perfectly roasted marshmallow. Taking a bite of the sweet creation left little tufts of meringue on my lips and nose! So delicious!

If you have the opportunity to try any of the magical sweet delights from Miette, do so! You will not regret it!
author: Kaitee B.

description:
Hate me if you wish, but Miette just isn't as good as it gets for me.  Since 99.9% of the people I know LOVE Miette, I'm hoping that I'll still have friends after this review.

Cupcakes, okay.  Whatever.  I can whip up a pretty good batch of cupcakes, and the frosting just doesn't do it for me.  I do love buttercream frosting, but theirs tasted a bit off for some reason.  I'll admit that everything looks so cute and pretty, but when it ends up in my tummy, cute and pretty don't cut it.

$2.50 for a mediocre cupcake doesn't appeal to my sense or my wallet, and there's usually a line, even after the lunch hour.  I'll pass and go to Starbucks, where they have a surprisingly delicious red velvet cupcake.
author: Tori S.

description: Miette is a super cute little bakery located in the Ferry Building. They have cupcakes, macarons, fancy cakes, assorted chocolates, and more. Everything is a bit pricey here but it also ranges. I think the macarons and certain cakes are reasonable, especially for the presentation and quality, however some of the chocolate bar prices are outrageous. I think the cupcakes are just okay but I really like their hazelnut macarons and the buttermilk panna cotta. Overall it's a fun place for a treat every now and then and it's a good place if you need to bring a gift to someone's house or need a fancy birthday cake.
author: Alice J.

description: Such a cute storefront in the Ferry Building. The macaroons here are SO much better (i.e. less sweet) than Paulettes but comparatively small at $1.75 each. Tried their carrot cake with cream cheese frosting and unfortunately, it didn't win my vote as the frosting was gummy. Even though I like ginger candy, I wasn't a fan of their ginger snaps (#49 on 7x7). They had a very strong ginger flavor and were crunchy but hard. Maybe it's because I don't usually like ginger snaps. I'm not sure how much ginger snaps go for these days but I thought it was pricey at $7/box.
author: Tina T.

description:
Their rose macaroons are pure heaven. The rose taste is really soft as it lands on your tongue. It melts like silk before your dollars gone.... it's pretty expensive for sweet treats but consider macaroons in general are quite expensive, I won't mind spending my dollars once in awhile.

Their ginger snaps, which appeared on 7x7 list, are not that good. To be fair, I'm going to say that I'm not a fan of ginger usually (except in Chinese food). The ginger snaps are too ginger-y. They literally taste like ginger plus sugar. I had to drink a cup of water after the first bite. I couldn't finish the ginger snaps. The box was left almost untouched on my living room until I finally decided to throw them away. There goes my dollars.... But what to do when all my roommates (one is an avid dessert-eater) refused to eat it after they tried it?

Macaroons: 3.5*** (except for the rose macaroons)
Rose macaroons: 5*****
Ginger snaps: 1*
author: Cliff T.

description:
I saw a feature on the Food Network for Miette and was determined to try them. This review is based almost entirely on their amazing Parisian macarons (they're so addicting I refer to them as crack-aroons). These are not like macaroons filled with sugar and coconut but Parisian macarons-perfectly crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside with a delightful cream in the middle. (So much better than the one I had at Bouchon Bakery!) I have tried hazelnut, pistachio, rose, and vanilla and they are all delicious but hazelut is my favorite. At $1.50 a pop I'm glad the Ferry Building is a hike from my office, so I can limit myself to a few macarons per monthly visit.

I've heard complaints that some of their baked goods are too sweet, and they definitely are on the sweeter end. Their scones and madelines were a disappointment so I'm sticking to my macarons and maybe I'll try their cakes someday.
author: Lainy C.

description:
Can this place be any better?

Chocolate & Pistachio Macarons-  More please. I love macarons and these ones are at the top of the list.

Gingersnaps - So much ginger flavor, so much snap. Perfect for some holiday flavor.
author: Tawny A.

description:
The Rose Geranium Macaron was absolutely delicious, delicate, chewy and flavorful. This macaron tasted like my childhood and I ended up getting a second after I got off the ferry. 

Treat yourself!
author: Candy L.

description: Miette is definitely one of the cutest bakeries, hands down. It's all cutesy and pink everywhere. I had a moist and dense cupcake with not overly sweet frosting when I went last year, but the downside was that it was super small. It's definitely a great place to get a special treat while in the city!
author: Sarah S.

description:
So many places that specialize in cupcakes end up making a cute but disappointing product. Miette is the only place I know that exceeds my cupcake expectations: taste and beauty alike!

On my first trip to the Ferry Building, I was so taken by their gorgeous cakes that I snapped photos, but since I was heading to another engagement, I didn't have time to try anything. 

Months later, a co-worker brought in an assortment of cupcakes for a party at work... and now I am hooked. I brought lavender shortbread to a picnic. I brought a cupcake home to my husband last week, when he was having a bad day. I brought my visiting parents to the Ferry Building last weekend, and my mom inhaled a chocolate-and-berry cupcake. And last night, I brought a full-sized gingerbread cake to a friend's house for dinner. Needless to say, they were all amazing. 

I don't have a major sweet-tooth, so it takes a lot to impress me with dessert. Miette's cakes are as delicious as they are beautiful.

Edited to add: Very sad to learn they are closed on Mondays.
author: anita c.

description:
Happend to be in SF for a business meeting and ended up having some few hours to kill. Therefore, based on my business contacts' recommendation, I went to check out the ferry building for my first time.

Surprisingly, there're quite many unique and local/cute shops. I was attracted by this place with all pink and soft-colored decor with a modern twist in this ferry building! I got a pistachio macaroon and also bought chocolate, chocolate lavender and hazelnut macaroons for my friends in SF. I have to say that the pistachio macaroon might be the best I have tried so far! I am not a sweet/dessert person but this one really stood out and captured my heart! 

Most importantly, I got a bag of sea salt chocolate shortbreads/cookies home for my boyfriend. Oh, man, it was DELICIOUS! I wish they can consider opening a store in Los Angeles! I will definitely go and tell all my friends to visit! It was a great and unexpected discover for me and definitely look forward to going back again and trying more variety of their amazing sweets!
author: Cheryl L.

description:
Loved their macaroons, especially the rose flavored one. It was perfectly crunchy and chewy with the right amount of flavors. 

At $1.75 a pop, the price isn't too bad... of course, I'd rather spend money on desserts than something like... coffee :P
author: Tina S.

description:
I would've given this place one star, and I'll tell you why I give it two.

My mom spent a day in SF and bought me four cupcakes. Chocolate strawberry, old fashioned, gingerbread, and carrot.
The carrot was EXTREMELY greasy and soaked through the box it was put it. 
Even when I took it out and put it in another box, the grease still seeped through.
The old fashion cupcake was extremely dry.
The chocolate flavor was good, but the frosting was weird and the cake was too dry.
The strawberry cupcake consisted of a chocolate cupcake was wasn't as dry as the old fashioned cupcake. 
The gingerbread cupcake was decent, but the frosting was super sour and nasty.
I didn't even try the carrot, it was way too oily.

I would've given this place a one star, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt because my mom spent a day in SF and MAYBE the cupcakes need to be eaten fresh. But in my experience I could eat cupcakes two days old and it'll be fine in my opinion. It's been 8 hours since I ate this cupcake from when my mom bought it, so you be the judge.
author: Kathleen H.

description: Old fashioned chocolate cake with Italian meringue frosting is to die for! Especially around the holidays. As a San Francisco native, Miette is always at the top of my list when it comes to satisfying my gigantic sweet tooth. If you really want to go crazy this holiday season, loosen your belt a notch (or several) and check out these other sinfully sweet SF must-eats: http://www.travelsages.com/2013/12/16/snowmen-santa-and-seasonal-san-francisco-sweets/
author: Anna P.

description:
I have never had such a great macaroon! I had a strawberry, hazelnut, and pistachio with my bf. They were so delicious and fresh tasting. We just had tried another little bakery's, I don't even remember the name, they were eh and very small! 

I just bought the Miette cookbook.
author: Marisa H.

description:
Gingerbread cupcake. Yum. That is all. 

Oh... it was $3. Worth it? Mm... sort of.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
Okay, so I tried the gingerbread cupcake.  Is this really one of the top cupcakes in the country? C'moooooon!!  It was too dense for me.  And I wasn't totally a fan of the flavor.  I guess it doesn't help that it costs $3.25 for such a small cupcake.

Maybe I should try the macaroons that everyone's raving about.
author: Doreen M.

description:
GINGERBREAD CAKE, GINGERBREAD CAKE, GINGERBREAD CAKE!!!!

Dense, the right amount of ginger flavor, and barely sweet...just how I like my cakes.  A friend told me it was on some sort of Dessert u have to try list somewhere someplace...have no idea...but doesn't matter cuz now that I have tried, I can def say it's in my top 5 desserts.  If you don't feel like getting the whole cake, then try the cupcake version.  Equally to die for!

The macarons are good too.
author: C A.

description:
The cupcakes and macarons are really wonderful. There's other cookies and candies for folks young and old to enjoy.

My only criticism is their princess cake. The green cake is made with fondant instead of the standard marzipan for princess cake. That's a weird mistake to make.
author: Greg M.

description: Hazelnut and pistachio macarons!!  SO good!  $1.75 each, but so worth it!
author: Michele L.

description: You will have to fight your way through the Ferry Building hordes to reach this adorable, pastel haven of sugar, but it's worth it for their swoon-worthy salted caramels or macarons.
author: Meghan B.

description:
I will start off by saying that this isn't necessarily the cheapest bakery, but it isn't the most expensive either.  Slices of creatively and delicately decorated cake are about $5+ and cupcakes are about $3.

Now I have tried many a designer cupcake.  And by that I mean, Kara's, Sprinkles, Susiecakes, all those specialty cupcake stores.  The prices are similar all around, but the flavor of THESE cupcakes is superb!  The icing is not too sweet and the different icing flavors actually taste different.  Additionally, it's not just decorated cutely, the cupcakes actually TASTE good--I think that is sometimes rare.  I really love the carrot cake flavor!

They also have homemade shortbread cookies.  These shortbread cookies are not as dense as the typical type.  There are lots of flavors, peanut butter, lemon, chocolate, lavendar.  I've tried the lavendar, and if you're not one for the flavor, don't get these because the lavendar flavor is strong.  The chocolate with sea salt ones are really good.
author: Suzi F.

description:
Miette products are like pandas and hamsters: 
cute to look at, not fun to eat. 

Meager products and portions from relatively steep prices. You can find better macaroons in the city - Miette's are on the heavier side and supppper dense. However, they do have cute eco-friendly tote and paper bags.
author: Annie L.

description:
Wonderful macarons, especially the chocolate and chocolate-lavender flavors. I'd like to spend a week or three working behind the scenes in Miette's kitchen, just so I could perfect my technique. These are some of the best macarons I've had.

Plus, everything is packaged so nicely ... I don't mind paying a premium for their top-quality goodies. The gingerbread cookies, especially, are decadent and worth the splurge.
author: J. C.

description: Holy moly. Six bucks for six tiny marshmallows. Very expensive little drops of heaven.
author: Christina K.

description:
My sweet tooth craving hit me really hard today so I was on the lookout for a place with really good desserts. Out of all the stores in the Ferry Building Miette was one of the few that caught my eye; it's really cute and their desserts looked yummy. I was however not that impressed upon trying out a couple of their desserts.

Rose Geranium Macaron: I asked one of the girls working there which two of the four macarons (vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate and Rose Geranium) were the best. She suggested the Rose Geranium and hazelnut. I've never tried desserts infused with floral flavors so I tried the Rose Geranium macaron. Immediately after the first bite, I already didn't like it. I didn't like the rose geranium filling flavor but the texture and taste of the macaron itself was good. It wasn't too sweet and the macaron just crumbles in your mouth.

Hazelnut Macaron: This was much better than the Rose Geranium. The hazelnut filling wasn't too sweet. It was actually more on the bitter side. However, I wouldn't get this macaron again.

Carrot Cupcake: I didn't like it but it's probably because it wasn't sweet enough for me. I tend to like carrot cupcakes/cakes that are on the sweeter side. I thought that even carrot cupcakes/cakes you get from grocery stores like Safeway taste better. I thought that the cupcake itself was not moist/soft enough.

Chocolate Cupcake with Strawberry Buttercream: I didn't like this either. The chocolate cupcake itself was again on the more bitter side. Like the other cupcake I tried, it wasn't moist enough for me. I think their cupcakes are just like that? The strawberry buttercream on top didn't have a strong enough strawberry flavor either. I didn't like the consistency of the buttercream either--I felt like it just stayed in my throat for a long time cause of the rich buttery consistency.

I split everything I got with a friend. He said the cupcakes were pretty good and that he really liked the Rose Geranium macaron. Maybe it's just me. But I've been to a lot of cupcake places and Miette cupcakes just don't compare to the cupcakes I've had previously. It's a really cute place though.

Oh, I also thought the cupcakes were a bit overpriced. $3.25 or $3.75 for a cupcake. I can't remember.

Also, the girl working there recommends the Lavender Shortbread ($5 for a bag) and the Walnut Shortbread. I picked up the Lavender for a friend but I haven't tried it.
author: Mary D.

description: Miette is always a must-stop-and-buy-one-of-everything-I-can-afford spot when I'm in The City. Come early, especially on weekends; cupcakes usually sell out by the end of the day! Truly scrumptious; my favorite is the yellow cake with silky, buttery, chocolate frosting. Delectably decorated shop and sweets, and the service always comes with a smile! Still the classic cupcake shoppe!
author: Meagan P.

description:
definitely one of the best bakeries in the city. although I haven't been to the Oakland location.

their macaroons are great and they are fast to go since everytime I try to get them they're almost out.
The banana cream pie is definitely the best one I've had so far.  hubby liked it very much too!
author: Learnee L.

description:
Made me fall in love with cupcake all over again!!!

Perfect size, not too sweet, velvety butter cream icing, simple yet satisfies all my sweet cravings. 

I've seen many complicated cupcake recipes on shows like cupcake wars but I would always prefer the traditional chocolate with vanilla icing cupcake. 

Please open up another store in the Peninsula area.
author: Maggie C.

description:
Best shortbread cookies ever!!!! They may have been almond shortbread....

But don't put these in your purse to save them for later in the week...they will become crumbs. But DELICIOUS crumbs. Not that I ate a bag full of crumbs. Let's not talk about that.

If you're a shortbread fan, this cookie will rock your world.
author: Karen Z.

description:
Yummy yummy macaroons that melt in your mouth! The edges have a hint of crisp that give way to subtle yet wonderful flavor.

I go back meaning to try the cupcakes, and end up walking away with yummy macaroon...
author: Susan W.

description:
When I have cash to throw around I come for the macaroons, but it's hard not to also leave with a gingerbread and old fashioned cupcake. The sticky marshmallow meringue topping is a perfect match for the dense Scharffen Berger cake.

I like Kara's for vanilla and Susiecakes for red velvet, but when I crave a heavier chocolate cupcake I come to Miettte.
author: Amy D.

description:
All their sweets looked so good!  But I refrained from buying their cupcakes and brownies...trust me, I wanted one so bad.  I just didn't want to sabotage the efforts of my morning run.  So I opted for the scone ($0.75) and a chocolate macaroon ($1.50).  Both of which I carefully savored.  Though I think I liked the macaroon more, only because I'm more of a chocolate fan. 

Their cakes were small, but you definitely can tell it's quality stuff.  The next time I'm at the Ferry Building, I'll get a cupcake...even if it means running another extra mile or two.
author: Lisa C.

description:
When farmers market was still organic, and not some over-hyped and over-priced scene, I stopped by the lowly little Miette table. The brownies got my attention so I picked up a couple of pieces. Later that night I heard angels singing when I took a bite of the brownie followed by a big gulp of cold milk. I though I had died and gone to heaven! 

The following weekend I made my way to the Miette table. I did not see any brownies so I asked the easy-on-the-eye lady if she had any. She said that they could not perfect the recipe so they had decided not to make it anymore. Right then I knew that this was a business that I wanted to support for the rest of my life. There was a certain integrity in that statement that had me hooked.

I've been visiting the now fancy Miette shop at the over-hyped and over-priced farmers market on and off. Today I stopped by and picked up some macaroons. After I popped one in my mouth, I realized that the face might have changed but deep inside the same ingredients that made the angels sing still exists today. Can I say: "Heavenly Macaroons!".

Thank you Miette for making life worth living!!!
author: Reza E.

description:
One of my fav cupcake places in the city!  (The other is Kara's.). Their luscious buttercream cupcakes is a must if you love butter.  Excellent macarons too.

Horrid marshmallows tho.  They're very similar to the supermarket ones that come in a giant bag, except these cost much much more.  BF says they're like Peeps w/o the crunchy suggary outsides.
author: Miss K.

description:
I am a spoiled princess. 

We went to Miette before a 49ers game and my bf got me macarons, one in every flavor.  They were absolutely delicious and had wonderful texture.  So pillowy, chewy, and delicately flavored.  YUM!

I was so hungry sitting in traffic as we were leaving the stadium after the game that I devoured each macaron one by one in the car.

There were no more after our drive back to Folsom.

The staff was friendly and the storefront was very clean.  I love my Parisian macarons!
author: Joanne L.

description: First let me say I had WONDERFUL SERVICE! I was helped right away and the ladies were all very friendly. The shop is super cute and everything is yummy! I am a macaron girl. I love them and they don't sell any near my home. So I got a dozen (which gives you a extra of 13) all were chewy perfection!!!
