My favorite is the hazelnut because its like a Nutella Macaron...ummm can u say heaven!!!!!!! Also got the english toffee which was nice too.
author: Michelle L.

description:
This place was one of my favorites during my trip to Frisco!!! LOVED-LOVED-LOVED the chocolate wafers... I've actually ordered them and had them sent since my trip I loved them so much! 

I had a chocolate cupcake with a meringue on top. I took it across the way and got a yummy coffee (with the leaf in the foam) and it was a perfectly delightful treat. 

I also purchased several little treats to take home to my kids... the macaroons weren't our flavor BUT I think they were good. 

Their chocolate wafers were my favorite.

The staff was nice, helpful and welcoming. If I ever get the opportunity to go back to San Francisco I will go to Miette for sure!!!
author: Sharon M.

description:
French macarons.  Are.  $1.50 each.  Ten of these cost $15.00.  Ten.  
Ten macarons.  At $15.00.  They're cookies, right?  Made of flour, sugar, eggs, almonds and a creamy filling pressed in between.  

Excessive and obscene, yet so worth it.
author: Joc V.

description:
No matter what, I had to make a special stop by this patisserie to have some macarons. I'm glad that I did. It's a cute little place in the Ferry Building that serves all kinds of sweets. The day I was there, they had 4 flavors macarons: raspberry, apricots, vanilla and rose. I didn't like the rose, i guess it was too aromatic for me and the flavor was very odd. What do i do? I scrape out the rose cream and ate the cookie itself. it ain't cheap! My favorite of the four is the raspberry. 

I also couldn't leave without a chocolate eclair and that was divine. the cream was perfect, not too sweet and thick and you can't really go wrong when you baptized the entire eclair in chocolate. 

the service was nice and sweet. they did a good job packaging my 5 boxes of macarons for my plane trip home.
author: Karly G.

description:
This is my favorite place to get Macarons! I have tried other "macaroons" and by far these are the best!! I'm always happy when I eat them! 

I love that it's chewy in texture, sweet, and semi-crispy. I am seriously craving for these Parisian Macarons right now!  Wah~ My mouth is watering just thinking about them. 

I freaking love the hazelnut and pistachio flavors! I have also tried the vanilla, chocolate, rose geranium, and other ones that I can't seem to remember.  They have seasonal flavors that are interesting to try.  The price for one delicious goodness is a bit pricey at  $1.75, but it's totally worth it. I haven't tried anything else because I head straight to the macarons! 

Tip: nibble them macarons and savor them! or just pop it in your mouth and dance/sing cause it's just that good. Yum!
author: Helen C.

description:
Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaatttttt?

Pistacio Macaron (not macaroon).

That's all I have to say.
author: Amy O.

description:
Spouse brought home some chocolate wafers. 2 chocolate cupcakes and a  single chocolate cupcake that was covered in Sschaffer berger chocolate.

The chocolate wafers which  sound plain were very  moist and  buttery .

The mini cupcakes had vanilla buttercream  frosting on them which was light and savory not  like the buttercream that is more dense.

The cupcake I ate that  by myself because spouse did  not want any and I am glad of it. 

They are shaped like the old Hostess Snowballs but taste of course nothing like them.

If you have never had Sschaffer Berger chocolate before do yourself a favor and try one of these gems. Yummy.

I would get it all again :)

Only 3 stars since I  was not in the location itself and cannot rate cleanliness, atmosphere, friendliness. But I will be back in person to update,
author: Lost B.

description:
Dainty, delicious, devine!!! 

Miette first came into my life in the form of a little brown box in my roommates fridge. The box was sooo cute that I could not help myself, but to open it and see what was hiding inside. To my little heart's delight were carrot cupcakes! I begged my roommate for one and of course he saide yes. That was when it was LOVE at first bite and site! The carrot cake was moist and the cream cheese frosting was heavenly sweet.

I love Miette's so much that I decided to try their online ordering system to order a carrot cake. The carrot cake was $26 and was rather small, but totally worth it! I ordered the cake Thursday night and wanted to make sure I could pick it up on Saturday morning. The shop is rather busy, so you have to leave a voicemail. One of the workers returned my call and assured me that my cake would be ready for pick up first thing in the morning. The staff was super friendly and asked me if I wanted them to add sugar flowers for decoration. They wrapped the box in a white tie and placed it in a paper bag and I was good to go!

I highly recommend Miette's as it makes me feel like a little girl in a candy store!!!
author: Cellina B.

description:
My best friend brought me some of their french macarons from Miette to cheer me up. He took home four chocolate macarons, 2 hazelnuts and 2 pistachios. These are the best french macarons I've had, thus far! And believe me, I've had many in my day! 

I am a firm believer now. I'm definitely coming here for them! Can't wait til' my next visit to the Ferry Building!
author: Mika D.

description:
The Ferry Bldg is one of (if not the top) my favorite spots in SF, and I used to work across the street so I've frequented its stalls often...

A visit is never complete w/o a stop by miette to see what new macaron flavors they have out or if there's a cupcake worth splurging on.  Both those items are very good (I partic liked the carrot cupcake) and the little picnic sized "loaves" are also very cute (though pricey). 

The "hit" item I've purchased here before was probably the gingerbread cake.... well made, well spiced.. and adorably dressed with a cute frosting top. It made for a fantastic hostess gift.
author: Rachel M.

description:
My cupcake culinary adventure results....

Cups and Cakes Bakery 5
Love at First Bite 4.75
Mission Minis 4.15
Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company 4
Miette Patisserie 4
Cafe Madeleine 3.75
Leonidas Chocolates 3.5
Market Hall Bakery 3.25
Sibbys Cupcakery 3.25
Urban Bread 3
Cako Bakery 2.5
Bay to Breakers Cupcake Girls 2.1
Cupkates 2

Yellow cake with strawberry buttercream frosting was the best flavor at Miette.
author: Anna S.

description: If cookie monster knew how good their Chocolate Sable cookies are... it would be forever sold out.  Stop by before you leave the Ferry Building.  It's sweet, crunchy and salty.  You just have to try it.  It's $6 but it is sooooooooooooo worth it.  They also have delicious macaroons.
author: Margaret T.

description: Screams pink in here. Didn't get to try their cupcakes, but their macarons are good. Not the super light / fluffy kind, but more towards the chewy kind, mainly due to the breading in it. Pistachio and Hazelnut are the most popular. It was all right, glad I tried it, but probably won't come back unless I'm really craving macarons in the area.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Delicious pastries I really enjoyed the banana cream tart and the strawberry panna cotta.  The tart had a rich creamy banana flavor with a light bottom layer of chocolate  as a nice surprise. The panna cotta was smooth and creamy topped with real strawberrys. Devine!
author: Darin C.

description:
I am knocking stars and hoping it was just a one time bad experience.
I bought 4 macaroons for my mom when she was visiting, and all of them were stale and crumbling. Unfortunately, we did not find this out till we got home.

Hopefully that's not your new recipe Miette, because your chewy macaroons were my favorite, but not that day...and my mom got to sample your stale dry macaroons.

Will give you another shot, hopefully it will be a better experience...and then I will update stars.
author: Elektra T.

description:
Miette gingersnaps = very delicious; it deserves to be on the 7x7 list. Thin, crispy, buttery and spicy (gingery) without being overly sweet! It's so hard to resist eating the entire box all at once. 

Everything else? Only average. Yes, I have to admit everything looks absolutely gorgeous and tempting in that cute little store. In fact, that's how I ended up getting so many of their stuff (cakes, tarts, macarons.) Looks can be deceiving. 

In sum, their stuff is nothing special or mind-blowing. Examples? Their cheesecake is super dense and rich, but not necessarily cheese-flavor-wise. The chocolate truffle tart was bland....if you blindfolded me, I wouldn't have known what I was eating. Their macarons are super chewy. 

Not very recession-friendly, either.

One word: mediocre (except for their gingersnaps, which...I adore.)
author: Grace C.

description: Miette has some of the most beautiful cakes i've ever seen.  They are very pricey, sure. But you really get that wow factor-especially with the Tomboy cake. Brought it to my sister's Bday gathering and it got a very impressive response!
author: Nancy C.

description:
The perfect afternoon delight pick-me-up during the middle of a long work day! I come here when I'm stressed and want to reward myself. I've been a fan of their cupcakes since their inception, but lately I've been in macaroon heaven! I get 6 macaroons for $10.50, which isn't exactly cheap, but worth it considering how happy my taste buds get once I sink my teeth into that first bite. 

Miette has the best macaroons I have ever had! (so far anyway)

The macaroons are chewy, fresh, not too sweet, and they have that nice, flaky, irresistible consistency. I can't get enough!! I'm also such a sucker for their cute (and delicious) little pastries and tarts. Good thing the Ferry Building isn't right NEXT door to my office, otherwise I would be in trouble!
author: Jenny T.

description: Tried the macarons and they are just good, I specially  liked the grapefruit.
author: Marielisa V.

description:
I LOVE macarons. 

Pistachio is the best, followed by hazelnut, coffee, vanilla then chocolate. Who am I kidding? I love them all. Everything here has been delicious and the experience is made better by it's nearness to Blue Bottle. 

Also, macarons are gluten free! I eat gluten with wild abandon, but for those of you who can't- the macaron is for you.
author: Lauren Lynn L.

description: In order to satisfy a recent macaron craving, I decided to make the trek up to Miette, where I bought one of each flavor. To my disappointment, these were not nearly as tasty as the ones I last had in Paris. My main problem with Miette's macarons is that they didn't taste fresh. They also don't last - mine went stale a mere 3-4 hours after I initially bought them, despite keeping them in the box. None of the flavors particularly stood out to me. I wasn't a huge fan of the orange chocolate, and I thought the rose geranium was interesting. The rest of the flavors kind of blended together with each other in one, forgettable blur. They're also pricey for what you get, at almost $2 per (small) bite of macaron. I wouldn't rule out Miette completely (as macarons are always good - even stale ones), but I'm a bit surprised at the number of rave reviews they've gotten thus far.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I reviewed Miette 1 year ago and canned it after I moved here and made repeat visits to both the Ferry Building and the mother ship in Hayes Valley, because the original review was so inadequate in describing the utter baddass-ness of Miette.

I come here because like so many in SF, I am a macaron whore. I go to great lengths for the best ones. After a year of voracious marcaron consumption including, but not limited to Bouchon, Payard, Chantal Guillon (formerly Paulette), and Maison Laduree (yes, the MOTHER of all French Macarons, I know, still missing Pierre Herme though), I am surprised but certain that Miette's are the best (when they manage to get it right, I can't say they win in the consistency department, but when they get it right, they REALLY get it right). If you want pretty pastel colors, rainbows and ponies, these are not it, they don't use food coloring. They just simply taste great - crisp, moist and chewy, subtle and not too sweet. The variety is usually small, 4-5 at any one time - I've had choco, choco/orange, coffee, hazelnut, rose, raspberry, choco lavender, and pistachio, and they all rock, but I have dreams about floating on a pillow of their Vanilla, it's pretty damn perfect. 

Their ginger snaps are one of the 7x7 things to eat before you die - I'm not a ginger snap person, but it's probably the best one I've had, and they are HUGE. The cupcakes are respectable also - light, smooth frosting and generally moist (but not always, so maybe stick with the macarons). Plus they sell a variety of tasty foreign chocolate and candy bars that you can't get in most U.S. stores.

And don't even get me started about the store front. If you think the Ferry building has eye candy, the Hayes Valley store is like Willy Wonka meets Alice in Wonderland frolicking with the Easter Bunny. Everything is so flawless that they look like they can't be real, serious gift-giving wow factor.The people of Miette are definitely OCD (in the best way possible).
author: Snuffles B.

description:
I think I have had enough with the customer service at Miette Patisserie.  When walking in and buying cookies and premium candies that are not behind the counter, I am generally ignored.  Seems like everyday is a bad day with their staff.

Their consistent less than stellar customer service has scared me off permanently!  Nice job.
author: Janet H.

description:
The macaroons were horrible. Went to miette while I was on a vacation in sf. Looked up for a place to get one of my favorite desserts and found this bakery on yelp. If you have not had a macaroon before, please do not go here. The macaroons are less than decent. 
The macaroons are overly sweet and too cakey. The flavoring was awful but if you must, get the pistachio. It's the only one that I find edible. Please do not try the rose or the chocolate lavender macaroon. It's a waste of money and you will just be torturing your tastebuds. Unless you love to bite into potpourris then go ahead. such a disappointment. :(
author: Hannah N.

description:
I was very excited to come here first when I visited the Ferry Building for the first time, and I sure wasn't disappointed.

The little shop is so pretty and inviting. I love the beautiful pastels and the yummy little treats that adorned the shop. 

I ordered three different types of macarons: the Chocolate-Lavender, Rose Geranium, & Strawberry macarons. The Chocolate-Lavender had a very unique flavor that I had never tasted before. I loved the subtle lavender notes in the background mixed with the chocolate. The Rose Geranium was also very good and i loved the rose flavor. And the strawberry was also very good. All of the macarons were soooo delicious & divine! They were so buttery and the filling was to die for! I have NO complaints. I will definitely pick up some more the next time I visit :)

I also ordered the Gingerbread cupcake, which is their all-time best selling cupcake. I definitely enjoyed it, the cake was good, very moist and had a great distinct flavor. Although, I wasn't a big fan of the cream cheese frosting on top. It was overall a good cupcake, very different than your basic chocolate or vanilla.

I really loved visiting miette! It is THE cutest bakery ever. The shop is adorable, the staff is friendly, and the macarons are DIVINE! I will definitely visit again and try more new things.. and pickup a million more macarons!
author: Alejandra I.

description:
When life gets hard over here at 4 Embarcadero, I'm glad to know that Miette is a hop, skip, and jump away. I've tried a majority of the products here from their delightful macaroons to those exquisite little cakes. Their french macaroons are chewy, rich, and absolutely divine ($1.25/ea). 

I'm a little split on the cakes. I've tried some really tasty ones, but some have been a little heavy and dry for my taste. Either way all their desserts are very pretty looking. One qualm I have about the cakes is that they usually won't write on the cakes or customize it since they aren't baked in store. Cakes usually run around $30 for a small round that can feed around 5-8 people. I feel so lucky to work so close to so many delicious eateries!
author: Angela L.

description: Finally, tart competition for tartine's exquisite lemon tart. Miette's key lime meringue tart is sweetly sour and luscious with a soft yet elastic marshmallow meringue. Gotta give miette the thumb's up for the graham cracker crust, more flavorful than tartine's. Sure would like to be the judge in a miette vs tartine smackdown!
author: Kelly K.

description: Expensive but of course it would be, it's in the ferry building. Desserts are pretty delicious. Had their macaroons and strawberry cake which I was satisfy thoroughly with both. If they were better priced, I would give this place a better rating.  Definitely worth the experience still.
author: Carrie T.

description: The moment I laid eyes on this place, I knew I would love it already.  I came on a very busy Saturday afternoon, so I didn't really get to peruse as long or as much as I would have wanted to.  There was a long line (on top of a cranky toddler in tow), so I had to hurry and choose what i wanted to taste.  Boy, I wanted to get everything!  I ended up getting the hazelnut macaron, chocolate macaron and 2 of the creme fraiche ice cream sandwiches for the family and I to share.  Everything was spot on delicious!  The macarons totally melted in my mouth.  The hazelnut tasted much better than the chocolate one.  As for the ice cream sandwich, I was supposed to get one chocolate & one creme fraiche, but they were all sold out of the chocolate one.  Now I have an excuse to come back! hehe :)  The creme fraiche ice cream was sandwiched between two decadent graham crackers.  It wasn't overly sweet....it was perfect!  My 2 year old son LOVED the graham crackers alone over the ice cream!  I need to buy him a pack of those graham crackers next time.  overall, I enjoyed my first Miette Patisserie experience even though I was a bit rushed.  The decadent, delicious goodies totally made up for it.  I will be back for more...especially to try their cupcakes, cakes, panna cotta, gingersnap cookies and other pastries. (maybe not on a Saturday afternoon while the Farmer's Market is going on though.)
author: Sheila M.

description: Very cute little shop in the Ferry Building. Bought a batch of Gingersnap cookies and a chocolate orange and vanilla macaroon and both were yummy. Their items are a great treat to give to a friend or a host of a party. I wish they had a bigger selection of baked goods, but still uber cute.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I can't believe how long I've resisted stopping by Miette whenever I'm at the Ferry Bldg. Their desserts always look so perfectly pretty and of course full of sugar! After going to Boccalone, a sweet treat was exactly what we needed.

chocolate lavender macaroon ($1.50) - This was the one the salesgirl recommended. It had too strong of a lavender flavor compared to the chocolate but the texture was cakey/dense just the way I like it. It also wasn't overly sweet.

walnut brownie ($2.50) - Came in a pretty big, rectangular piece. It wasn't too decadent but was very moist with a ton of chopped walnuts on top. I'm a sucker for anything chocolate so I enjoyed it!

Still need to come back to try their ginger snaps!
author: Karen Y.

description: The desserts are really good.  I had the banana cream tart and my wife had the chocolate tart.  Definitely recommend stopping by.
author: Marky M.

description:
The 1st time I visited Miette, all of the stores were closing but it stayed open a few minutes longer.  I didn't buy anything, but at least I got to see the selection and appreciated the opportunity to get something.  Having gone back several times since, they have a wide variety of products for any preference: various shortbread cookies, gingersnaps, macaroons, cupcakes, chocolates, pies, as well as different sizes.  

The price point is pretty fair as gifts.  It's a great place to browse even if you don't plan to buy anything.  It gives you great ideas to make at home as well.
author: Jay N.

description:
Oaktown Miette!!! Woohoo. Love that it's open during the Sunday Farmer's Market in Jack London. Plenty of yummy deserts to choose from . Plus they have Macaroons! 

Kids love coming here!
author: Cindy F.

description: The hazelnut and pistachio macarons were pretty darn tasty but not much filling inside. The chocolate lavendar was interesting at first but I kinda liked it. The petite madeleine was a little too dense for me and the flavor was kind of funky, I didn't like this at all. Overall, pretty good macarons, but not the best I've had. I'd come again but wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Lei S.

description:
Yum-me!

I stopped by there on my long walk this afternoon for a pick me up because I've heard so much about this place from other cupcake reviews!  

I had the yellow cake with lemon frosting!  Very good! 

Unfortunately I big group of tourist just invaded the place so they were cleaned out and I only had yellow cake or carrot cake!  

So I guess I'll be FORCED to go back and try some of  the other flavors!  hehehhe
author: Monique T.

description:
Did you ever have one of those days where you wanted to dive head first into a big, fluffy pile of cupcakes and cookies and pies and croissants?

Well I have those days often.

Too often.  

So often that I have taken to diving into a small frozen yogurt with fresh fruit instead because if I didn't I would be the size of a small sea faring vessel and then people would look at me strange when I was walking down the street instead of sailing the seven seas.

However, when I just can't stare, disheartened by its blahness, into a half empty cup of froyo anymore, I head over to Miette and indulge in some expertly prepared sugary make-me-feel-better.  

The macaroons are insane.  Almost as good as Laduree on the Champs in gay Paris.  The cupcakes are equally fuck yea.  

However, the madeline, macaroon, lime tartlette, cupcake sandwich is the b-diggity (madelines, macaroons, lime tartlette and cupcakes all sold separately).

The above is a little creation I like to call the "Whoever said nothing tastes better than being thin is a damn liar".

Voila and enjoy!
author: Rachel G.

description:
My friend told me that they had very yummy macarons and boy was she right! They had around 6 flavors laying out...all of them sounded tasty, but honestly they didn't LOOK very good. I think if they made their macarons prettier looking, at least like those at cocola, it would have been even better. But it's not with the outside that counts right? Because they tasted SO GOOOD. I tried the rose flavor one and it was super delicious. Can't wait to come back to try the other flavors!

Downside: relatively pricey, small in size, and could look prettier.
author: Louisa L.

description:
Oh Miette...your pastries are so pretty, but I was really let down by your macarons.  I had been looking forward to trying them out forever, but unfortunately I vastly prefer those at Paulette in Beverly Hills (there's also now a branch of Paulette in SF!).  

Miette's macarons are made with roughly ground and unblanched almonds.  I thought that would create textural interest, but instead they made the macaron wafers too rich and gritty, in my opinion.  They were also far too sweet for me, and the ganache filling was more akin to whipped cream in texture than frosting - even a stickier jam-like filling would have been preferable.  The whipped cream-textured filling simply couldn't stand up to the heaviness of the cookie portion of the macarons.  The macarons were just way too sweet, rich and heavy for my taste.

Oh, also - the woman serving me at the counter was pretty snooty and provided very indifferent service.  She would barely look me in the eye.  I mean, it is the fancy-schmancy Ferry Building...but come on.  I appreciate smiles with my fancy French pastries.  :D
author: Sunny C.

description:
Cute little shop inside the Ferry Building.

Miette's ginger snaps are #49 on 7x7's 100 Things To Try list [2010]. I don't really care for ginger snaps to begin with but, I went by and they had ginger snaps all ready for the taking in plastic packages for $7.

I grabbed a pack.. was tempted to grab other packs of cookies but my attention was drawn to the case of mini cakes and cupcakes. I resisted. My eyes wandered to the jars of different flavored macaroons above the case and I gave in and thought oh, little macaroons won't hurt. Asked for a couple different flavors.. $1.75/each.

I didn't try anything until I got home.. and then I wished I had bought more. And those ginger snaps.. Wow. I've never had one like that. They're definitely worth a try.
author: O M G.

description:
Walking into the Miette Patisserie can brighten anyone's day.

In terms of cupcakes, I prefer other bakeries, however, I LOVE Miette's gingersnaps, graham crackers, and chocolate cracker/cookies....topped with a bit of salt. RIDICULOUS. I love to eat one or four as dessert.

Seriously, who knew a simple cracker-cookie could be SO DELICIOUS? Well, they are all simply divine.
author: Laura D.

description: Omg! This place has the absolute best french macaroons! The staff is fast and friendly too:-)
author: Danielle M.

description:
I was a little hesitant about trying the macarons because I'm pretty hard to please.  Trust me, after having Mitzy's macarons (itzybitzypatisserie--and yes, I know I write about them in nearly every review for macarons that I write) you will find it very difficult to find satisfactory macarons.  Since I haven't yet been to Paris, Mitzy's macs are the gold standard.  

Anyway, now to Miette.  Well, they were pretty damn good!  Since I have no complaints, four stars it is.  

For reference, here's my list of common macaron failures:
1. Too little filling--i.e. when it's all cookie and a sliver of creme/ganache.
2.  Jelly as a filling.  Please, please, spare me the trouble of biting into a raspberry macaron and getting a mouthful of jelly.  
3.  Air pockets in the cookie.  Anyone who is unfortunate enough to have sampled less than stellar macarons can likely relate.  Some places simply fail in having an overly moist inside of the cookie, creating a pocket of air between the inside and "shell."
4.  Overly dainty cookies.  Yes, I know cookies are made to be eaten, but as someone who likes to photograph food, a broken macaron is rather disappointing.
author: Gabrielle G.

description: Does the stuff look good?  Sure. Is it worth all the hype... hmmm... I'm not sure about that. I guess if you love french macarons, this place might be just 'the ticket'. The staff is friendly and the line moves along even if it looks a bit intimidating.
author: John H.

description:
Buttermilk Panna Cotta. $5. Get $1 back for returning bottle. Smooth, creamy, topped with strawberries. Looks like a little, but man, worth every penny.

Chocolate Pudding. Same price as above. Chocolate flavor is strong, smooth, and cool. Oh Hellz Yeah good.

See pics of cute little bottles above.
author: David G.

description: Had to try the gingersnaps... and I say thumbs up! A thin cookie that upon tasting starts with a wonderful caramelized sugar and finishes with a light gingerbread spice. It's hard to have just one.
author: Joel A.

description:
I saw Miette's gingersnaps as one of the 100 things to eat from 7X7's 2010 list.  I was never fond of gingersnaps until I tried some out of hunger on Thanksgiving.  It was some sort of generic gingersnap cookies but delicious nevertheless, so I thought maybe it's time to give Miette's gingersnaps a try.  

$7 for a cute little box of maybe twenty.  Any more expensive I might call it quit and go home and bake some cheap chocolate chip cookies myself, but $7 is acceptable, especially for Ferry Building price where across the aisle you can buy a tomato for $7.  

Anyway, it's worth the price.  Sugary, buttery, and spicy!  I don't know if it's something I NEED to eat before I die, but it's certainly good enough that I will buy again. 

Now I just need to start trying their other cute adorable pastries.
author: Candice B.

description:
This place is SO CUTE, but I have yet to really enjoy something they bake (versus the candy they sell). 

The cupcake was terrible - about 1/2 notch above Safeway. The cake was dry and the icing was unremarkable. Kara's is about 5 times better. If you don't like Kara's, maybe you'll like Miette. Perhaps they each cater to particular cupcake preferences... I like my cupcakes to be moist and the icing to be smooth & rich. 

When I asked the lady which cupcake was her fav, she looked like she was in physical pain talking to me. Lady, FAKE IT. You're charging $5 for a cupcake and I'm willing to pay it. BE NICE. SMILE. You work in the Ferry Building - can't you be a little friendly to the nice locals and curious tourists who spend money that keeps your shop open?

I'll walk by and smile, but I will not take out my wallet. Sad.

This place left a bad taste in my mouth - literally and figuratively. I'm deeming it the Slanted Door of bakeries: overrated, nicely decorated crap.
author: Shal J.

description:
Took just ONE bite of the Pistachio and Grapefruit macaroons ($1.75 each) today at Miette located within the Ferry Plaza and I was like...WOAH. Woah Woah WOAH!

Oh no...Feel Good Bakery in Alameda has a competitor when it comes to French Macaroons!!!

In just ONE bite I was blow away by the crisp chew surrounding the super delicate, rich cream. 

I had to text my foodie buddy immediately to give him the breaking news.

Insane.
author: Gail N.

description:
Im sorry, i cant hear you over all this nomnom action.  

Cupcakes are amazingly moist and delicious and they dont taste like your average cupcake.  I dont know what kind of mix they use, but i love it.  I can pretty much nomnom the fuck out of 6 in less than an hour.  Madeleines & brownies....nomnomnomnomnom.   Macarons are some of the best ive ever had.  Little pieces of heaven that are perfect for an on-the-go snack -these dont last very long either in my presence.  

Cakes, tarts and pies are almost too pretty to eat, but im guilty of having more than one slice.  The only minor thing i dont like is the fondant.  A little too thick and sugary for my taste.  But yeah, that still wont stop me from shoving forkfuls in my mouth.  

Prices might be a tad higher than you're use to, but its worth it.  IMO Miette is way better than other cupcake places in the city.  The sweets here make for great gifts, packaging is extremely cute.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.
author: Juv C.

description:
I didn't think it could happen in my lifetime but I have found a dessert place that I may actually have the willpower to turn down. That's a lot coming from a woman who doesn't believe something can be too sweet or too chocolate-y. 

This place isn't horrible but the combination of high cost and underwhelming desserts makes it unappealing to even the most strong-willed dessert fiends. I started off my last course of lunch with a vanilla macaron from Miette. The filling tastes just like unsalted butter. There was no vanilla taste to be found. Now I enjoy butter but not by its lonesome in dessert. I *gasped* tossed it out after two bites (I had a second bite just to make sure I didn't like it). That's $0.75 that I threw out (the entire thing was $1.50, which already is quite high for something the size of a blown up quarter). 

I then started in on the chocolate/PB cupcake ($3.50) and, again, met with disappointment. It wasn't bad like the macaron but it wasn't memorable. I've had similar from Safeway for much less money. On a separate occasion, I had the chocolate tart ($5). That was perhaps the best dessert I've had from this place, but the bar is quite low. I liked the crust of the tart but found the chocolate in the tart to be just too much. There was no other texture or flavor in addition to the chocolate. In essence, it was boring. 

I won't boycott Miette but I certainly won't make a special trip here (and brave the Ferry Building parking and crowd) just for this place. Oh and I should mention that on one of my visits, the employee had an attitude and was not helpful. I asked her what was her favorite that was chocolate and she basically listed everything that had chocolate in a blase tone. I needed help narrowing down the options, not being read the options.
author: Gwen L.

description: Their vanilla and pistachio macaroons left me speechless... orgasmic.
author: Anne T.

description: Ginger snaps have a nice surprise to them. I am usually not a fan of them because well I don't really like ginger except on sushi. Back to the point, it's on the 7 by 7 list so I had to give it a shot. I have to say it's good, not something I would crave but overall a good cookie. I like how when you first bite into it, its sweet with a hint of ginger but as you are chewing it some more the flavor of the ginger becomes stronger. The flavor of ginger does give your mouth a nice kick but not too hard.
author: Eve C.

description:
The cupcakes and packaging are so cute here. We went on a Saturday and since we just wanted some cupcakes, I didn't wanna look/pay for parking so bf went in and got some cupcakes while I drove around...I wanted to see the actual store and all the cakes! But oh well...anyways, I got a gingerbread cupcake and he got a vanilla one. I fell in love with mine! It was SO so so moist...some people might think it's TOO moist, but I loved it! And the frosting was the best. I liked the frosting so much. I stole a bite of the vanilla cupcake and it wasn't as moist, but it was still delicious. It tasted much different than any cupcake I've ever had...it was kinda like a mix between pound cake and cake cake, lol. I liked the frosting on the gingerbread one better, but it was still good.
I wanted to get more, but they're a bit pricey. $3.25 each :/ But it doesn't make me not wanna return :)
author: Christine C.

description:
Really pretty, but pricey.  What can you expect from the Ferry Building though? I had one of each of their macaroons and they were nice, but a little smaller and not as lovely as what I had at Bouchon in Yountville.  For the same price (or more?) I would have liked to see a larger serving, more outer shell flavor, and a more decadent filling.

The storefront and service was pleasant, and the decorations quite cute.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Overpriced and for no reason. Adorable cupcakes, but not as tasty. I was disappointed with their carrot cake cupcake. Cake was okay, but I didn't like the frosting for its taste or texture- too creamy and very soft. Gingersnaps were a little stale. Best thing I tried were the lemon shortbread cookies, but I wouldn't go out of my way to pick up a bag.
author: Sophia B.

description: I wish I lived in SF just for Miette! I am a cupcake addict and I live for Miette's cupcakes :) Just the site of the little shop is adorable and custey everything is pink and girly :) I did not know what to get, I wanted everything in the jars, in the case, on the shelves.... I decided on getting a mocha cupcake to go and enjoy at home. And I ENJOYED every bite! The cake is so moist and the mocha frosting is perfect :) Until we meet again Miette....
author: Katrina D.

description:
Located at the intersection of Cute and Petite, Miette's gravitational pull on me is often overwhelming.  I remember the very first dessert I tried here - a chocolate cupcake with fluffy sweet icing that was almost too beautiful to bite into.  Since then I've gone back many times and tried many of their little sweets - chocolate pot de creme, lemon panna cotta, lavender shortbread, pistachio macaroons to name a few - all the perfect size for indulgent snacking.  

The service here is always, ALWAYS pleasant.  Even during crowded times.  I love the care they take with packaging desserts to go - like gift wrapping it adds a pleasant dimension to the presentation.  To me it also shows how much they care about their product.  Definitely a winner here.
author: Eileen P.

description:
tried the ginger snaps today and OH-MY-GOD, they are good...

note to taster: if you don't like ginger...these are NOT the cookies for you...

two snaps for the ginger snaps at miette! 

YUM!!!!
author: Grace O.

description:
Why, why, WHY do I continue to purchase Miette cupcakes when I don't like any of them?  ANY of them??  It's like I forget or I'm masochistic or something.  UGH!

The cupcakes are very dense and heavy.  And the frostings all have no flavor.  And at $3 a cupcake, no thanks.  Definitely not my cup of tea.

What I do recommend here, however, are the graham crisps (although a container for maybe 15 crisps at $6 is maybe really not worth it), the macarons (if you don't mind paying $1.50 for something that will be devoured within seconds), and the banana cream tartlette (I think this was $6...this is yum, and you'll be surprised to find the inner crust is lined with chocolate!).

Minus one star for the lack of customer service.  The employees always have a blasé attitude about them and they are not particularly friendly.  C'mon, people, if you just faked it a little, I'm sure you could easily convince (trick) me to buy even more of your cupcakes I don't like!
author: Mel T.

description:
My friend was having a birthday party and as a small pee sent, I took here here to get a birthday cake. She picked out this princess style cake and even though I am not a fan of marzipan, I loved this one. It was moist and just sweet enough. Yum!

I also have bought this chocolate bomb with chocolate ganache and I can never remember its name, but it's to die for. It comes in individual and regular size and though it's a bit pricey, it's worth the money, every bite of it!
author: Yelena K.

description:
Amazing buttercream frosting, in both chocolate and vanilla.

The cupcake though, a little drier than I had hoped.  I think my cupcakes out of a box are more moist.

But for the atmosphere in the bakery, the wrapping, the look of the cupcake, and the frosting, I am sold.

Less calories if I don't eat the cupcake anyway.
author: Denise B.

description: Excellent work here, everything we had was very good.  I have a lot of respect for bakers, especially those with the patience and talent to produce at this high quality.
author: Steven H.

description: Super cute local bakery. Tried the rose & gardenia macarons. Sounds weird but seriously tasted like how I imagine an angel's halo might taste.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
MIETTE MADE ME FALL IN LOVE WITH MACARONS!

First off, i am biased. Miette introduced me to French Macarons (americanized coconut macaroons are spelled with 2 "o"s) and thats why they will always hold a small piece of my culinary heart. 

I've tried a few macarons outside of Miette but still feel that miette might be the best. The reason i can't give it 5 stars is because i can imagine it tasting better. I love the selection and taste and un-supersweetness but i do prefer it slightly more crunchy and less chewy...

I heard from wolfgang puck in "best thing i ever ate" that the macaron should be nice and crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside...and i guess it makes sense since its just a baked meringue so i am still searching for the 5 star macaron...
author: Simon L.

description: I need to try their cupcakes and pretty looking cakes because the macarons just did not do it for me.  I got the pistachio macaron and it was rather disappointing.  There was hardly any pistachio flavor and the ganache was melting off the cookie.  Not how a macaron is supposed to be.  :/
author: Linh V.

description:
Yay, another expensive organic bakery to review. Hey before you go and roll your eyes, hear me out. The desserts here are fantastic. You get your choice of pastries, cakes, miniature to full-sized tarts, cupcakes, macaroons, and even homemade candies here. And no, they are not cheap at all. However, these are some of the best desserts I have ever put in my mouth.

Their cases are lined with some of the most spectacular cakes, tarts, and desserts you have ever seen. By no means are they like what you would get from Charm City Cakes or anything, but the fact that they look homemade is what amazes me. They look so homey and they made me believe that the people who made these put a lot of love into making them look so brilliant.

The little buttermilk panna cottas were...well, little. I do have to say that they were delicious. The panna cotta itself was creamy. That's all you tasted. Wonderfully fresh cream and a little bit of vanilla. There was a slight tangy tone because of the buttermilk, but I liked it a lot. The fresh strawberries on top added some sweetness and it went PERFECTLY with the silky panna cotta. P.S. If you return the glass jar it came in, you get $1 back.

I got two vanilla cupcakes - one with a strawberry frosting and the other with a regular vanilla frosting with sprinkles. I didn't have one myself, but my cousin did tell me that they were so light. I hate it when cupcakes are heavy. They're supposed to be airy and should not take any effort to devour. 

The strawberry crème cake was our favorite. The cream in the cake was sweet but not sugary sweet. It was light and had the perfect amount of strawberry in it. The cake itself was light as air as well. The banana crème tart was good also. Plenty of whipped cream and a nice banana custard. The lemon tart (my choice) was so yummy. It makes your mouth pucker the way it's supposed to. The tart shell, which seemed to be made of some sort of wafer was very good. Overall...refreshing. That's what I liked about it. It was refreshing.

In all, I spent about $30 for just the items you have read about in this post - each dessert was about $3. I know it's not cheap and you probably think they are ripping you off, but considering how good the desserts tasted and how they use quality ingredients, it's all worth it. The employees of the store are very nice and pack everything with so much care - from lining the take-home boxes in pink tissue paper to using color coding stickers to indicate which of the items needed refrigeration. This place is so cute, and I will not hesitate to come back and have another buttermilk panna cotta.
author: Joanne B.

description:
So, I've bought stuff from this location quite a few times, but I'm always hesitant because they do not ever greet me, offer to help, nor smile.  

Cookies - nada to say about them, gave them in a gift basket
Cakes - the scharffen berger cake is really good and very pretty
Cupcakes - just ok, kara's are 100x better
Candies - nada to say, gave them in a gift basket
Macarons - ok, but go to paulette for the best macarons

In conclusion, nothing here is really worth getting except for the little Scharffen Berger cake and those cute candy bars from some lady (in different colors, but $8 each!)  

Service:  The women that work here are not very friendly or nice.  That has deterred me from buying stuff from them on various occasions.
author: F K.

description:
Gorgeous and simply delightful (both food and decor)!
We tried the vanilla cupcake w/ chocolate buttercream frosting and pistachio and chocolate orange macaroons. The cupcake tastes more like a pound cake and the frosting is very light and silky smooth (like the frosting on Asian cakes). They're a little small for $3.50, but I guess they can afford to charge this much at a place like the ferry building. I love the macaroons, which are perfectly bite-sized, though not worth the steep price. They're creamier and denser in flavor than the ones at Boudon. 
Yes, everything's cute and yummy, but that's about it. Nothing absolutely outstanding. But they've gotta be doing something right; people were buying macaroons as if they were bogo!
author: Hana J.

description:
I really wanted to love this place. But it was just okay. 
What we got: Old Fashioned cupcake, chocolate vanilla cupcake, lemon cupcake, an eclair, and 2 macarons (hazelnut and vanilla). 
M loved everything he tried, but he's a sugar fiend. I should have just ordered all Old-Fashioned cupcakes, those are definitely the best choice, yumyumYUM. The chocolate vanilla was just kind of... meh. No distinct chocolate flavors coming from the cupcake or vanilla from the icing... I think I have had better from a box. Macarons, loved that the almond was not pulverized to death, hated that (again) the "vanilla" was non-existent... Maybe they only flavor the creme in the middle and not the macarons themselves? The hazelnut was nutty, but again, not prominent. At 1.75/ea, the macarons aren't worth it. And skip the eclair. Just say no.
With the prices they have I would have hoped that they would have a higher caliber of ingredients and a distinct flavor profile, alas after all the great things I have heard about this place it just brought me disappointment.
Maybe the Hayes Valley location is better... I'll have to check it out next time I'm in that neighbor hood. And if I have a sweet itch next time I'm waiting for the ferry, I will stick with the Old-Fashioned cupcake.
author: Emily P.

description:
It's a good thing those macarons aren't available down where I live, because it would be lethal. I would buy an entire jar full of them, put it in a huge bowl, pour in a gallon of milk, get a gigantic spoon, and just eat all the macarons up like cereal. Wow, talk about one massive sugar rush. My head would explode.

Since my wife loves macarons and made it her mission to try every macaron in the entire world, we waited in line. We see jars of macarons lined up on top of the counter, and they didn't look like the macarons I was used to seeing. They look like cookies that should be around 75 cents each.

Instead, they were $1.50 a pop which is a lot for these little things. They better be good. We tried the vanilla, strawberry, and hazelnut flavors. I'm used to macarons that are more dry and bit more rough in texture. These were completely different, like little yo-yo shaped pastries of goodness. Sugary hardshell on the outside, while soft and chewy on the inside, they were delicious.
author: Dru C.

description: 4 stars based on the two desserts I got---extra star because they refund some of your money if you return the glass jar that the panna cotta came in.  Ordered the Buttermilk Panna Cotta and the Chocolate-Lavender Macaroons.  I thought both were excellent.  The macaroons were a bit heavier on the lavender flavor than the chocolate but I happen to like floral flavors, so that worked for me!  My sister didn't like it at all, so I guess it comes down to personal preference.  Sat outside of the Ferry Building and enjoyed the treats.  Then, returned the jar inside---good customer service, seamless transaction =)
author: Sherry T.

description:
Holy crap this place is amazing. If you ever decide to venture out to the Ferry Building, leave your diets and your budgets behind. Chances are, a taste of just one of Miette's desserts is going to get you hooked. 

I've never really been a fan of macaroons, but the macaroons at this place must have crack in them or something. The vanilla, chocolate orange, and hazelnut macaroons are incredible--crispy and crunchy on the outside, flavorful and spongy on the inside. But it's the grapefruit macaroon that is to-die-for: fluffy, light, and with the perfect tangy hint of grapefruit flavor. 

Other winning selections include the chocolate short bread cookies, the gingerbread cupcake and the strawberry chocolate cupcake. The cupcakes are especially moist and decadent. My sister got the apricot butter cream cupcake and loved it so much that she wouldn't even share with the rest of our family. Yes, apparently it was really THAT good.

My only real complaint is with the price. I feel like everything here is $1 more expensive than it should be, especially considering the wide variety of (less expensive) dessert shops in SF that rival Miette in terms of quality and selection. I also had a bite of a not-so-great banana cream tart that was the only real disappointment of all the desserts I've tried there.

As for the ambience, Miette is modest in size, yet full of charm. Staff members are generally very friendly and helpful, and all of the desserts here are presented very elegantly. 

The Ferry Building is generally known for being home to some of the city's finest cheese, bread, and wine shops. However, Miette ought not to be overlooked; it undoubtedly holds its own as one of SF's premiere dessert destinations.
author: Joseph F.

description: Everything they sell is so beautiful that I don't even want to touch it, not give them away.  I usually get things for others from here because I am not really into sweets, but if I am going to have something... Miette is the place.  My niece absolutely loves everything I get from here.  I have had some cupcakes, but those really aren't the best to me... I am a macaroons gal and theirs are pretty good.
author: Amelia M.

description:
i only had the macaroons because M. said this is her FAVORITE place

while the macas are on the sweet side....it's good nonetheless
it's for the genuine lover....no food coloring...no frills...no muss

will have to try the cake next time~
author: Donna S.

description: Everything here looks so decadent and beautiful. Everything. I got the macaroons here--chocolate lavender and hazelnut. Both were delicious but pretty standard. The texture is more dense but I like it that way. This place reminds me of looking at those beautiful china dolls on display where everything looks so pretty that you want to touch it..but can't
author: Diana Y.

description:
This is probably the most high-traffic bakery in the Ferry Building, possibly all of San Francisco, and rightfully so. I had never even heard of Miette before a recent visit to SF when I ventured inside the Ferry Building for the first time. There is something here for every taste and budget. You don't need to buy an entire cake or settle for just cupcakes. There is so much more going on in this little store! Although, they do have damn good cake! ;)

None of the famous cupcakes looked nor sounded especially exciting according to their descriptions but we did end up being baited by the gravitational pull of their scrumptious mini-ganache cakes. They are like mini individualized chocolate bombes generously robed in perfectly smooth chocolate ganache and adorned with a single pink baby sugar flower with tiny hexagonal design detailing on the yellow stigma. HOW CAN YOU JUST WALK AWAY FROM SOMETHING LIKE THAT? It would be like walking away from a destitute infant kitten peeled from its mother's teat and placed in the euthanasia unit of your local animal shelter. But without the added inconvenience of feeding, tending, and taking it in for shots each year.

We also nabbed a few extra goodies for the rode before leaving SF to get a good sampling of this place, which included a couple of chocolate-mandarin macarons (not to be confused w/ the coconut "macaroon") and two madeleines - one regular, one chocolate. I hate to say the madeleines were a bit disappointing, especially the chocolate one, which fell short of any remotely intense chocolate flavor and had an odd spiciness to it. Definitely don't expect it to taste anything like brownies, or even chocolate cake for that matter. The original madeleline, however, was much better than its chocolate counterpart. 

Seriously guys, the star of this baked goods show is the macaron! I expected my first macaron to taste like something akin to light puffed rice cookies with faint chocolate orange flavor but I had to try and see what all the fuss was about. Imagine my delight when I bit into what tasted like the fudgiest brownie of my life filled with thick chocolate orange fudge!!! They tasted nothing like they looked and instead were surprisingly extraordinary..."orgasmic" comes to mind! ;) But really, smuttiness aside, I have never tried anything like these. Their macarons are a must! I won't even bother with the cake next time, I'll just stock up on these lil' bad boys!
author: Cat L.

description:
Two words:

HAZELNUT MACARONS.

Actually, three more words:

OLD FASHIONED CUPCAKES.

Ok, I lied.  A few more words:

I love the Ferry Building, but it attracts a lot of tourists.  These tourists love to ooh and aah over the display cases, or like to block my view because they're taking photos of every cupcake and cookie.  It's quite annoying.  And I imagine that the never-ending crowds also affect the employees too, because there are many times I've come here and the girls behind the counter look like they're about to go postal.
author: Diane L.

description:
My FAVE !!! I just LOVE coming here. It's such a cutsey type of bakery that is ultra girlie and yes, good things come in small packages! The oh- so -good macarons!! I order the raspberry and chocolate all the time...the gingerbread cupcake and cheesecake frosting delish! As for the cakes,  Scharfenberger cake , PURE decadence.

As mentioned by Cys B's review, I did see this article in the magazine as well:
Things to Eat in San Francisco Before You Die list /The Big Sweet SF: 50 Treats to Eat Before You Die. I have some work to do!!!! whew! Will keep you posted!
author: Gladys B.

description:
This is a cute little bakery in the Ferry Building. Having a huge sweet tooth, I was really excited to try some treats from this adorable place, but I was pretty disappointed with what I got. 

I tried 3 types of macarons and the outer layer was really hard and kind of lumpy. The filling was practically non-existent. 

The little bags of (I assume homemade) marshmallows caught my eye as I stood at the cash register. I impulse bought them and for $4 a pop for just a few to a bag, it wasn't worth it. 

Bottom line: overpriced and not worth it.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Delicious macaroons. 

Below-average, dry cupcakes.

Consistently the rudest service in the city. I've been to Miette 6 or 7 times, and each time I am amazed by how surly and unpleasant the employees are.
author: SfMom O.

description:
My parents wish they were French.  They are not even remotely French but they desperately want to be.  I don't really understand why they have this strong urge. Perhaps its the food...or more specifically the dessert, they are quite nice.  My father has mastered the art of replicating the Pot De Crème, and frankly I have yet to taste anyone's that can rival his.  

This year for his birthday I contemplated baking him a cake, but given his abilities in this arena I knew my performance would be equal to a cake purchased at Safeway, and I like my dad so he deserves better than that.   As I flagrantly strolled through the Ferry Building I happened upon and adorable Patisserie with pink decor and big glass jars filled with homemade taffy.  Immediately I was pulled to the glass counter filled with Pot de Crème.  I bought all of them, in addition to some Truffle Tarts and a small Scharffen Berger Cake. When I phoned my mother to tell her about my purchases, she dashed my happy mood.

"But Rosie!  You know they won't be as good as his.  He isn't going to like them.  You bought how many?"

Sheepishly I brought out my tray Pot de Crèmes, Truffle Tarts and the small  Scharffen Berger Cake from Miette. I held my breath as he took a bite...as I watched the smile spread across his face I let out a sigh of relief .  He ate every single Pot de Crème, sharing only spoonfuls with my mother.  At the end of the evening there was not a crumb left on our dessert tray.  

"Where is this Miette?"  He asked as we ushered them out the door.  I guess my mom was wrong.
author: Rosie C.

description:
Oh my god, although pricey, their Parisian macaroons were SOOOOO GOOD!! I tried 3 different flavors and they all were delicious, but the pistachio one stuck out the most for me as ultra delicious. I seriously want to go back here and just buy a dozen and scarf my face. 

My friends bought some cupcakes and the lemon tartlett. I didn't get to try them but they sure did look yummy. 

I'll definitely come back here in the future.
author: Christine R.

description:
I've been searching high and low for one of my favorite desserts ever, the lemon tart. 

To me, the lemon tart is a test - when you bring the lemon tart close to your mouth, you should be able to inhale the light scent of lemons, see the gooey, but glazed lemon filling. That first bite, when your teeth hits the filling, it's soft and tangy, but as you bite down, the tart is perfectly baked with a crunch to it. The best lemon tarts will enable you to not only finish an entire one on your own, but crave a second one without suffering from any sort of sweetness overload. The filling is a work of art, to perfect the balance of sweet and tangy is something that causes many lemon tarts to meet their downfall. The crust, cannot, at any point be neglected, it has to be a perfect blend to make the perfect flaky but crunchy crust. 

Miette's lemon tart was definitely impressive, meeting my harsh critique and leaving me very satisfied. However, their peanut butter cookies were weak, hence the 4 star.
author: Cindy C.

description: Went here on recommendation of a friend. Place is a high-end boutique bakery. Very good eats! I would invite all who have a sweet tooth. They have a plethora of great delights!
author: Hamés H.

description:
we got a few macarons because i fell in love with macarons a couple of years ago at paulette's (now called lette's).

we tried the pistachio, rose, chocolate lavender, and regular chocolate. the texture was grainy and the flavor was just ok. our favorite one was the rose. 

these macarons did nothing for me. they weren't like little pieces of heaven like paulettes were.
author: heather l.

description: Pretty good desserts. I know people love their macaroons but not a huge fan of macaroons in general so I wasn't a huge fan of theirs when I tried it. I had their cupcakes and cakes and those were delicious. I knocked them down 1 star because they are so over priced, not just the ferry building location but this bakery is just so much more expensive than others.
author: Armina A.

description: We came here after hogs island since we saw it in the 7x7 magazine "50 best sweet eats on sf before you die." I ordered 2 old fashion chocolate cupcakes with Italian merigue. It tastes like a hostess cupcake but not as sweet. Texture was good and moist.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I ordered Miette's French macarons for the dessert bar at my wedding, and these were such a hit! Brianne w/Miette was great to work with, and I was impressed how smoothly everything went. Guests loved the macarons, and they were a great compliment to other dessert bar items. Thanks, Miette!
author: Bee H.

description:
The taste of organic fruits are especially pronounced compared to to regular fruits. Organic fruits are fresher and sweeter and you can taste the difference. But, I can't say that desserts made with organic products necessarily taste better. I can't tell the difference and altho' Miette uses organic ingredients, the choc cupcake with vanilla butter cream for $3 didn't taste any better than most places. The cupcake was tasty and moist but I'm not a fan of butter cream even if theirs tasted OK. It was a tiny cupcake offering 3-4 bites max or 1 bite for a large mouth bass. 

Even tastier was the chocolate eclair with a creamy custard filling. The chocolate Madeline (75 cents) was dry and didn't have much of a chocolatey flavor.  They have tarts and cakes which were about $24 -$30 for a 6 in cake (it looks smaller than that).  8 in cakes/tarts are special order and run $35-$50.  They have choc cakes, vanilla cake w/lemon buttercream, Princess cake, bittersweet cake/marshmellow topping, gingerbread cake, NY style cheesecake, Scharffen Berger cake (all chocolate), yellow cake/choc frosting, 4 layered choc cake, lemon tart, lime tart, banana cream tart.
Not sure I'd try their goods again, but maybe a macaroon in the future.  They have 3 stores:  Ferry Bldg, Octavia Blvd and Chestnut St.
author: Ry T.

description:
OMG.  It's like a piece of HEAVEN!   Let me tell you...after going to France a few months ago and having a few Pierre Herme marcarons, everything pales in comparison in the states!  That is...until you go to Miette!

I was a little skeptical about how good they really could be...especially since I just had some from Cocola's @ Santana Row and literally made a sour face once I popped it in my mouth.  

Miette's version comes REALLY close to being just as good as a Pierre Herme.  The only other thing I ordered here was the gingerbread cupcake.  Pretty good...but I probably will stick to the macarons for sure!
author: Natalie P.

description: boring... cutsey. same thing after how many years? time for an update.. too barbie doll.
author: Amanda J.

description: Miette will always be my favorite place to get macarons! Docked them one star because the macarons are getting ridiculously expensive. They used to be $1.50 a pop, but they've now raised the price to $1.75! And yes, that's per macaron! My personal faves are the pistachio, hazelnut, and rose. Trust me, it's worth it!
author: Audrey T.

description:
I'm somewhat of an ice cream sandwich connoisseur, and theirs are the best! It's the thin wafer cookies that make it. Highly recommended!

Their macaroons are aight. My favorite macaroons are still the huge fleur de sel ones at Lemonade in LA.
author: Gina Q.

description: I'm a little obsessed with the Miette chocolate sable cookies.  I haven't really tried much else (not true, I bought the boyfriend one of the ice cream sandwiches for our V-Day challenge this year) but I always go back to this.  I love them so much that I have the cookbook and have tried to replicate them.  Key word, tried.  I can't quite get them the say way.  I will continue to try....until then you will find me here scooping up the sables and scarfing them down.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
Hazelnut macaroon is awesome.
Chocolate lavender was good too.
author: L B.

description: I don't often get cupcakes that aren't on the chocolate spectrum.  But I just couldn't pass up the gingerbread cupcake.  It was more moist than a Florida summer day.  And that frosting was the perfect punch of sugar, but without the gut trembling.  I deduct one star simply because these are the smallest over 3 dollar cupcakes I have ever encountered.  That said, I would like one right now!
author: Jeremy G.

description: The display of candy and deserts was ok. I missed a few good things that I could have purchased.
author: Anya P.

description:
Macaroons hmmm .... the first time ive ever tried macaroons, i hated it! I thought it tasted like diet food and Lord only knows how I hate substitute sweeteners.   

After a beautiful trip around the bay on the Hornblower Brunch Cruise (thanks Goldstar!) the SO and I decide to take a walk along the Embarcadero. We end up walking into the farmers market and then right into the Ferry bldg. So we came across Miette and I immediately eyeball a bunch of chocolate cakes and cookies. 

My initial reaction- get the chocolate cake... then i realize its to messy to walk and eat with sooo i gave in to the macaroons. 

chocolate/orange- yes yes.. i am a fan 
vanilla- thank you Miette for converting me over
hazel nut- yumo 

each of the delicious treats were very satisfying. They weren't over chewy or rock hard to bite into. Flavors were equally balanced and didnt put me into a sugar coma.
author: Trisha C.

description: Another 7x7 item, I came here for the ginger snaps. They were pretty pricey, but they had so much ginger flavor! Be warned though, they are kind of thick and hard, so it may hurt your teeth to bite into them at first. I did like the ginger snaps, but I just feel I've had better ones before. This cookie was just a lot of ginger flavor packed together, but not so much with the complexity of other flavor tones mixed in.
author: Melody L.

description: LOVE THEIR CAKES AND CUPCAKES. I first got introduced to Miette when one of my girlfriends got her birthday cake here...chocolate with strawberry buttercream. I had a small slice but it was heaven in my mouth. The cake is SUPER rich which I usually don't like, but the cake was so well complemented by the light buttercream that it made for an amazing combo. I hate stiff hard frosting that makes me feel like I'm eating lard. The frosting at miette is really amazing...it's so fluffy and airy that it fools you into thinking "Oh this can't be that fattening...it's just air!" (The cake is a different story.) I recently came back and got a vanilla cupcake with strawberry buttercream. It was also really good, although chocolate is better. In fact, I think that the chocolate with strawberry frosting is my favorite cupcake in the world. Sprinkles red velvet is a close second, but with that I have to wipe half the frosting off before even taking the first bite. I haven't tried any of miette's other goods but if you are every near the ferry building, pop into this charming store and grab a cupcake while you stroll along the rest of the embarcadero.
author: Joyce H.

description: I got the chocolate cupcake with italian mirengue... Sorely disappointed. The batter was either mixed poorly or the chocolate was burned... Waste of $3.50
author: Katherine S.

description: My wife always has to make a stop here when we are at the Ferry Building.  They have really good pastries, even I enjoy and I don't have that big of a sweet tooth.  Their pot de creme is one of my faves and their eclairs.
author: Gordon C.

description:
When that day comes, will I feel ginger? bread cake balanced sweet, cream cheese frosting?  Or will I burn dark? chocolate cake, heavy truffle cream ganache?  Will I settle plain yellow? middle-child cake, dark chocolate edge bite?  Or will I linger bittersweet? chocolate cake, ironic airy marshmallow top?  

I.     Will.

Rather,

*I do.*

Congratulations P!
author: Natasha S.

description:
3.5 stars.
3 stars including the service.  At such a cute place, I would want nice & friendly people helping me out.  The lady who helped me when I came to pick up my cake was anything but that.  Somebody must have had a bad day.  I waited there and was not asked if I could be helped.  In fact, when I did, the lady seemed irritated when I broke up her conversation with her co-worker when I said "excuse me" to get her attention.  She did not seem to handle my cake with care either, thank goodness the cake was super sturdy. 

FOOD:
The Princess Cake I ordered here for my sister's birthday was SOO GOOD!  Thinking about it already makes my mouth salivate!  5 Stars for the Princess Cake alone.  The tomboy cake was pretty good also.  The cake was very dense, but the cream was just perfect.  I have a huuuge sweet tooth, but even so, the macaroons were just a tad too sweet.  The old fashioned cupcakes?  It was good, but nothing to fawn over (Sprinkles still make the best ones in CA).
Nonetheless, the presentation of all these goodies were so dainty and cute!  They're sooo gorgeous, I'm afraid to eat them and ruin the beauty of them. hahaha =D

AMBIANCE:
A very cute and dainty little place in the Ferry Building.  I love it!  It makes me feel like I'm in a grown-up dollhouse kitchen. =)  

PRICE:
More on the pricey side.  The princess cake is definitely a splurge, but worth it since it's so delicious and just an occasional thing.  The macaroons were $1.75 each.  It cost $30 for the 6inch princess cake.
author: Lisa Z.

description: What a dainty french little patisserie!  This is the place to get the best Macarons in San Francisco.  I've also had their candy confections and the old fashioned cake.  Soooooo good!  I recommend that you stop by at their shop on your Farmer's Market trip in the Embarcadero :)
author: Kristina A.

description: We tried the vanilla cupcake and the icing was very creamy. It complimented the rest of the cupcake well as it was a bit drier than the other cupcakes I like to eat. We also had this half ball of cake covered in fondant.  It was also a bit on the dry side (for me) but was very chocolatey! We arrived later in the day and it looked like the choices were a bit slim. Maybe if I had tried something more exotic flavored I may have liked it more?
author: Janet E.

description:
I was here this past Sunday and I had to get an old fashioned cupcake. That is all I ever get here and everytime they taste better and better. :)
They are to die for.
author: Adriana M.

description: I've been so used to eating macaroons that were so small that when I stumbled on this place, I didn't really notice how big the macaroons were until I started eating.  That said, the orange chocolate and vanilla macaroons were so rich and so good that I regret buying only one of each.  I should have grabbed more.  Mannnn.... :(
author: Ren L.

description:
I'm a packaging junkie. If it looks cute, I kinda want it. 

Everything at Miette is not just cute, it's painfully adorable. 

I've only had their macarons but they're so delicious that I don't see myself steering away from them. I think that compared to Laduree of Parisian fame, which everyone obsesses over, they're damn good. My favorite is the hazelnut one. 

They also have a bunch of candy for sale - mostly candy that is next-to-impossible to find in the US. They sell one of my favorites - Carambar - it's in yellow packaging with red type. If you're a caramel fan, I highly recommend it.
author: Alli J.

description: I came across Miette while visiting San Francisco and I loved it. I appreciate the look and feel of the shop but most importantly how impeccable the desserts looked and tasted. I tried the chocolate pot and also a few of their macarons. I like some of the unique flavors like the grapefruit and the hazelnut and pistachio. This is a must stop for dessert lovers or gift givers.
author: emely j.

description: Other than Ladurée's, I'd have to say, this is probably one of the best macaroons I've had here in the Bay Area.  Especially loved the pistachio macaroon's.  Great texture to the cookie and filling wasn't too sweet.  It wasn't a artificial green either!
author: Teresa C.

description: My favorite cupcakes are the chocolate with chocolate ganache ones. The other's are just okay. The Schaffenberger cake was too rich and too dry.
author: Debbie J.

description: Fantastic. Miette Patisserie offers high-quality sweet treats and confections. Located in the Ferry Building, it's easily my favorite little bake shop in the Embarcadero area, if not one of my favorites in San Francisco. They make amazing macarons (still prefer Paulette, but these guys come pretty close). The chocolate-orange is absolutely divine. Perfectly crisp on the outside, delicate and slightly chewy on the inside, with bold chocolate orange flavor and a very creamy center. The pistachio and the Parisian vanilla were also quite good. Their cupcakes are moist and tasty and their prices are not too expensive. Word on the street is, they make a mean ice cream sandwich. I'll definitely have to try that next time.
author: Frances L.

description:
If you appreciate form over substance, then Miette is the place for you.  The creations here are beautiful.  Unfortunately, their taste doesn't live up to the appearance - except the macaroons, which are good if that's your treat of choice..  

The cupcakes have pleasant cake, but the frosting is awful. The "butter cream" frosting has no hint of butter.  It tastes like the whipped Crisco nonsense you get at cheap grocery store bakeries -- not particularly sweet, just greasy.  It boggles my mind why bakeries think that they can get away with awful frosting just because the underlying cake can past muster!  And it infuriates me when butter cream isn't butter cream at all. There's simply no excuse, particularly at $3.75 per cupcake!

If you want a pretty macaroon, go here.  If you want any other confection, go elsewhere.  For cupcakes, stick with Kara's in the Marina!
author: Meg K.

description: Everything I have had here (multiple tastings of each flavor of macaroon, a chocolate cake, cupcakes) has been excellent and the prices are very good :-)
author: Zachary S.

description:
It is always great to visit my hometown, San Francisco especially when there are new foods to try since I left about 7 years ago. My sister told me about Miette's macarons so of course since we were at the Ferry Building, I had to try it.

First off, I already love the the traditional coconut macarons but now the macarons at Miette's are my favorite. Even though it is about half the size of the traditional ones and at the same price of the traditional ones, I will still get them when I go back.

The macarons here are like the size of half dollars and it looks like a mini cookie with a cream filling inside. The outter layer has a soft texture with an almond like taste and the center is filled with the flavors you choose. I believe I saw six types of flavors. Since they were $1.50 a pop, I had to choose wisely. I picked hazelnut, vanilla and strawberry. I started with the hazelnut, then strawberry and vanilla. Even though I love hazelnut, my favorite is the vanilla although they all are equally GREAT!.

Since they don't have those down here, I will settle back to the traditional ones until I go back to SF again.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Heard so much about this place so that's was one of the first places I went to when I got to SF.  The big rave was the chocolate cake with the Italian buttercream not a fan of chocolate cake so I got the white cake with strawberry buttercream.  I loved it, the cake was moist and light.  The buttercream was just the right sweetness and a bit tangy which I like.  I'm only here in time to visit so I'll have to come back again when I come back.
author: Nekiba M.

description:
Every Saturday morning I pass by Miette after I've done my responsible shopping (arugula, avocados, peaches, etc.) and check the cash I have left.  If I have three bucks two Rose Geranium Macarons are MINE.  They are my favorite cookie on earth (well, ones that I cannot make no matter how hard I've tried).  

I'm not allowed to make Miette a first stop because I'd end up with a Princess Cake or dozens of Rose Geranium Macarons and nothing else to eat for the rest of the week.  Which might not be so bad...
author: Monica L.

description: Everything is so cuteeeeeeeee! Precious, precious desserts, nicely wrapped and elegantly displayed on trays. I bought the best brownie ever here and although it was a little more $ than I wanted to ever spend on a little brownie, it was worth it. And I would NOT hesitate to make the same decision again!
author: Natalie C.

description:
Everything is so cute!  On top of that, their cookies and other sweets are so yummy!  My favorites are the ginger snaps, which has a zingy ginger bite to them and are made thin in the shape of a flower.  They also make graham cracker and chocolate cookies the same way!  

They also offer french macaroons in a variety of flavors ranging from the classics (vanilla and hazelnut) to more interesting (lavender, rose).  In the glass display, they have a bunch of cute cupcakes and pastries.  They're perfect as a birthday or just-because gift.
author: Nina L.

description: I was a little disappointed when i try their macarons because they were overly sweet. Yes I know it suppose to be sweet but this one was too sweet. I try the chocolate lavender and pistachio and they were so sweet that u don't get the flavor of either taste. I have try it all over the world and this doesn't even come close. FAIL!!
author: John N.

description: This review is for the macarons. They're very good. They're not like traditional macarons (for which Bouchon wins); they're quite cakey but still taste great.
author: Akash K.

description:
While their shortbread cookies are good, their service at the Ferry Bldg is dismal.  I've been to this location several times and each time found the young women behind the cases cold and not terribly forthcoming in help or information about the items in the cases.
Maybe this is their take on French hauteur?
Anyway, lots of other places in town with equally good or better offerings without the attitude.
author: Cee V.

description:
After going on a food marathon with one of my friends visiting from Socal...we decided what better way to end the food binge than with dessert!!  Of course after passing by Miette early in our adventure, we just had to come back an try these SUPER ENTICING treats!

The pistachio macaron was DELICIOUS...way better than the strawberry one. The texture of the outside cookie was also chewy and somewhat grainy. But the weird combination was actually really good! Especially compared to their opera cake. Don't be fooled by it's pretty looks, with a little silver bead in the middle. The small, square piece of cake was too overpowered by the chocolate and peanut butter. 

I definitely want to come back to try some more. And maybe even get a dozen pistachio macarons! They were just SOOOO FREAKIN GOOD!!
author: Kristen C.

description: I had a friend gift me cookies from this place. How delicious are these..the Lavender shortbread cookies..The most delicious cookie ever! The scent of lavender and the flavor as you bite the cookie..they are the best!I am a huge lavender fan and have never eaten anything lavender and so glad to eat these...I felt these cookies are soo calming too:-) If you love lavender like me these are a MUST try!
author: Latha K.

description:
MUST try their macarOns!!!!!!!!!!!!! i finally tried it for the first time today and OMG it was to die for!

why $1.50 though??? i wish it wasn't so expensive. i had the pistachio one. mmmm it just wasn't enough! why why why!
author: Rosalynn D.

description: Their French macarons are pretty tasty. Not the best (partial to the bakery on Fillmore) but thankfully expensive enough to keep me from buying them by the handful and stuffing my face (I have a problem with sweets).
author: Jeanine I.

description:
OH THANK YOU YELPERS THANK YOU!!!!!

OMG.  the macarons OMG!!!   (not macaroons).   i really do not know how i can exaggerate enough how good it was.

i've had the lil pots before and they were okay, it was nothing to yelp about.  But i went back and tried the macarons fellow yelpers been raving about ..and my golly am i glad.

around 4 pm, only the pistachio macarons were left.  bought two.. had one...indulge on the second one... and came back for 10 more!!! 
if the leftover pistachios were good, i cant imagine the other flavors that were sold out.

now i must go back to try the other flavors!!!

oh thank you again yelpers.  thankyou!!!
author: Joanne H.

description:
I'm always really excited when I see a place that has Parisian macarons, so I always have to buy a bunch. However, these are only so-so. The chocolate macaron was basically a Trader Joe's brownie bite. The chocolate orange macaron tasted like the chocolate macaron (AKA a Trader Joe's brownie bite). 

However, the rose geranium and hazelnut macarons were pretty good! The rose geranium was not as rose-y/perfume-y as rose flavored things can get & had a really delicate flavor. As for hazelnut, well, you usually can't go wrong with hazelnut.
