I had lemon and my friend had vanilla - they're a slightly heavier texture than macaroons from Laduree (my favorite patisserie in Paris), but not in a bad way - a little richer, a little nuttier, and satisfying in its own way. The macaroon offerings include vanilla, chocolate, coffee, lemon and hazelnut. If they ever make green tea, pistachio or fleur de sel caramel, I will buy out the entire inventory. Every day.

My friend, visiting from out of town, asked me: so, what's your idea of a perfect date in San Francisco? Well a perrrrfect date would include picking me up in a jet, flying me to Paris and taking me to Laduree. Or,  the guy could just start the night by bringing me a box of macaroons, and everything that followed would just be gravy.
author: Deb I.

description:
perfectly baked goods

delicate decorations

decadent flavors and textures

The macaroons are crisp and light on the outside and chewy and goo-ey on the inside!

They make candies as well but I have not had the pleasure of trying them.
author: Edi B.

description:
the panna cotte w/ strawberries was nice comes in a small glass jar and if you bring it back they will give you a dollar.

ok from the looks of it the cakes look really good, cute place too

now their cupcakes is something i have to say something, they are OK maybe its jus the batch i had I dont know, it was really just OK...kind of dry and eh i dont know....Karas Cupcakes has really changed my view on cupcakes and this place jus didnt meet up to par for me...

so 4 stars for the cute cake designs, the little pig candles they had, the tastey panna cotte in the cute jar...
author: phillip w.

description:
HAVE YOU HAD THEIR PARISIAN MACARONS??? The cupcakes - ok, yeah, they're good.  But their French macarons are a little piece of heaven, right here in our Ferry Building. They really are! 

Every time I have one, I swear that a little angel is smiling down on me. And then I want to skip down the hallway and share them with everyone around. If you see a crazy girl forcing her bag of Miette macarons on people someday, you'll know that's me.
author: jenn h.

description:
GREAT pastries and packaging but AWFUL attitude and prices.

I've been here a few times to get cupcakes and macarons, but everytime the people working the counter have been indifferent and rude. 

Yesterday my friend bought three cupcakes and gave the clerk a credit card, and she said, do you have any cash, and she said no. And she was like, SIIGHHH... okay fine, but next time remember we have a 10 dollar minimum (her 3 cupcakes came out to $9). And my friend said, oh sorry.. and I said, well I have cash you can borrow. And the clerk said, NO, I already swiped it, next time you can speak up earlier okay?

Never going back again. Considering I also paid $9 for 3 cupcakes she should be a little nicer.
author: ting b.

description: THE BEST macarons I've ever had! Pistachio all the way! love that icy sensation in my mouth with every bite.
author: M C.

description:
Everything looks beautiful here; it appears as though the owners took inspiration from Versailles during the time of Marie Antoinette (trendy cliche, I know, but they have it right down even to the candied violets for sale). I adore the chocolate French macarons.

However, the cakes and cupcakes don't taste quite as good as they look. While all their frostings are delicious, the cakes themselves tend towards being sort of dry and crumbly. I did buy a gingerbread cake for Thanksgiving which was tasty, but really not worth $25.

Also, a PSA to all of you Yelpers: places like Miette, which say they have a $10 credit card minimum, **CANNOT** be held to this. It's a breach of contract with the credit card companies, and they can be reported for it. They are obligated to take the card even for a $0.25 purchase. This annoys me because the merchants know this and still try to pull it on customers.
author: Optimus Prime G.

description: Everything I've gotten here is delicious, but the gingerbread cupcake in particular is absolutely divine!  It's super moist and the cream cheese frosting is the perfect sweetness.  Mmmm, I basically have to get one of these cupcakes whenever I enter the Ferry Building now!  I believe the cupcake was highlighted in America's top ten by the Food Network, and rightly so.  Actually, come to think of it, I should look up what the others were!
author: Rachana S.

description: I work right across the street from the Ferry Building and am always tempted by the treats at Miette!  Their macarons are delicious although the price is a little steep ($1.75/each).  The cupcakes are to die for and reasonable at $3.25.  They have a great selection of individual and large desserts.  The presentation is probably half of what sucks me in.
author: Dominique K.

description: this review is a no-brainer: delicious, beautiful cakes, and they usually have whole cakes ready for pickup, although if you have a special order, you have to call two whole days before pickup. HIGHLY recommend if you're looking to spend a little more for something other than a costco sheet cake!
author: Torrpedo T.

description:
I love my friends. And they must love me, because one of them got me a beautiful chocolate layered cake from Miette.

After looking on the website, I found out the cake is a Tomboy. Well, hot damn, no wonder I liked it so much, I'm kinda a tomboy myself! Dense deep chocolate layers with buttercream in-between. So rich and so delicious. I had no idea it would taste better than it looked--like a high-end whoopie pie but better.

I have been here before and bought some cookies that were fine, but didn't have any "wow". I would give them 5 stars if the people behind the counter were warmer.
author: Kat H.

description:
I have to have these cupcakes I have been hearing about for my B-day!  Scharffen Berger chocolate Parisian cupcakes...... Can you say Heaven sent!!  Damn they are going to be good.  Will update upon tasting.....

Update: 02/21...
The cupcakes were everything I thought they would be!!!  Good and chocolatey... The buttercream frosting was soo creamy!!  They were a hit with my friends.  I even tried an eclair too while I was picking up my cupcakes.  One of the best I have ever had!
author: Alli F.

description:
Miette Patisserie chronicles Part 3 in the saga "Stephanie Takes Over the Ferry Building, One Bourgeois Boutique at a Time." In Part 2 we had Acme Bakery http://www.yelp.com/biz/acme-bread-company-san-francisco-2#hrid:4Kfi2ysg01dAQrwXeGuoMw but now what do we say about Miette?

I've had desserts from Miette a total of 3 times. I feel this gives me the ability to write an honest review with taste, atmosphere and price taken into account.

Occasion  1: Mary brings back rose geranium meringues to the office. They were light, subtle, not overly sweet, and just the right crispness. However, I found out later this tiny bag of meringues was $3.50 for something that was AT MOST 1 egg white for the entire bag of MAYBE 20 tiny meringues. Holy crap.

Occasion 2: There are cupcakes in the office from Miette, also courtesy of Mary. I found the cake a bit dry and the frosting crusty at room temperature, alluding to the fact that it's either made from shortening or with too much sugar. I discovered on my trip today that those cupcakes were $3 something each for a sub-par cupcake. I'll pay a little extra for a cake from Love at First Bite, http://www.yelp.com/biz/love-at-first-bite-berkeley#hrid:B31Z6FVW1zAzOVhcSZisog
but not from here...

Occasion 3 (today): Passed by Miette and payed 75 cents for a madeline. It was soft, light and cake-like (so many are more of a cookie texture). I must say, it was a nice dessert for my meal at Acme, and it was almost worth the 75 cents... almost.

Overall: overpriced and overrated. Cute packaging and nice atmosphere, but not worth the money. Only reason they get 3 stars instead of 2 is because the madelines are actually very good, and the desserts are presented very nicely. Would not pay for something from here again, but would accept if freely given.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
The cupcake-o-phile finally arrives at Miette.

What beautiful pastries and cupcakes.  The chocolate buttercream frosting atop my vanilla cupcake looked like perfection.  A perfect slice of heaven....about to enter my mouth. 

Alas, disappointment.  The frosting was o.k. from a chocolate/consistency standpoint.  But the vanilla cake was totally not what I expected.  Lots of air bubbles, and though I tasted butter it was DRY.

My cupcake was not worth $3.  :-(
author: Jane A.

description:
I don't get why Miette's gingersnaps are on the list of 100 things to eat in SF. They're okay and all, but I've had several other items from Miette (oink) and the gingersnaps are not anywhere close to being the most awesome thing they have.

My vote for #1 most awesome thing at Miette:

The rose geranium Parisian macaroons.

TO.DIE.FOR.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
THE best cupcakes in the city. After reading and article on cupcakes in NY, I decide to do a cupcake tour of SF and I decided these are the BEST in SF.

small but packed with sweetness. pricey at $3 each. But beautiful. pastel color scheme.

b/c they are organic they don't last more than a day. so don't plan on keeping them around too long. I always buy in groups of 6 b/c they are so addictive!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
My friend told me about this place about a year & a half ago. Ever since then I've been hooked! This is my favorite spot to go to in the ferry building. All the treats & sweets are just as delicious as they look. 

I love all the Parisian macaroons (especially hazelnut, pistachio, & coffee). I love the banana creme tart, the cupcakes, and the gingerbread cake! This place is a little pricey, but hey it's San Francisco and I definitely think it's worth it!
author: Krystel M.

description:
We tried the cupcakes and macarons. Not that great for the price. The cupcakes and macarons are super tiny for the price. Paid $3 for a cupcake and $1.50 for the macaron. The cupcake icing was way too sweet and the cake part was dry. 

Th packaging was cute though. Loved the takeout boxes and the bag that they put the macaron in. 

I noticed that the cakes that they had were very small for what they were charging for them. I still think that Schubert's on Clement has the best cakes and prices. 

I kind of expected that this place might not be that great b/c they lost in the food network callenge and the judges commented that their cakes were dry and just fell apart. But I felt that I should still give them a shot anyways.
author: Cupcake s.

description: I had the pistachio, vanilla, and chocolate macarons. All so good! My favorite is probably the pistachio. The macarons have good consistency and so yummy! I took off one star because I had cupcakes here a while ago and didnt like it too much, maybe I'll give their cupcakes another try.
author: A L.

description: Tried a bunch of things here from the macrons to the princess cake and variety of cupcakes they have. Nothing really my favorite or stands out to me, but its nice to have from time to time. The prices are pretty high out here. I like their customer service skills. They're very friendly and knowledgeable. If only they sold red velvets I would come here more often, but when ever i get to take my lunch break and hang out at the ferry building its either do i want a pastrie, gelato next door, or a coffee. So sad. lol
author: Jeff C.

description: When you walk past this place inside the Ferry Building you are drawn here by the wonderfully decorated cupcakes they have here.  And if you were like me you would be completely drawn to them to the point of ditching your diet and buy one of those yummy calorie-filled grenades.  Look further and you will see that the have a wonderful selection of other baked goods.  I got myself a few macarons instead, they were GOOD but after just had eaten the one's from Buchon less than a week earlier this place was a step down from the famed establishment.  But nonetheless this place screams eat me, and you should because it its all good here.
author: Tom Y.

description:
I haven't gotten a chance to try the cake yet, but the macarons and the shortbread are the best I have had so far!  Too bad that I always kill them right away as I keep shopping around in Ferry building (with a cup of coffee from peets or lulu petite in the other hand). 

"I remember spending $10 at miette five minutes ago, but where did my sweets go?"  I always wonder. "My fat ass!  that's right."
author: Vivian H.

description:
I really want to like this place. It's adorable in all those cute fluffy pastel ways that make a place adorable. I was a big fan of their cupcakes.

However, I had a really bad experience with ordering cakes for someone's birthday. The ordering part wasn't so hard, and they do make you pay for your order ahead of time. I specified what I wanted, said when I was going to pick it up (Saturday morning) and was looking forward to bringing them along for a birthday brunch.

The reality was much different. There was a long line on Saturday morning of people waiting to get served. I tried to side-step directly to the register only to have one of the counter people snarl at me to "get in line." Okay. Fine. I waited in line. But the surly waitstaff decided to punish me by ignoring me when it was my turn.

I finally got someone's attention and specified I was there to pick up two cakes. She told me I had to have ordered them ahead of time. I produced my receipt. She went to fetch the cakes. And then asked how I was going to pay for them. I said, there shouldn't be a balance, there's a Visa receipt attached to the order receipt. She disagreed. It took a few minutes to convince her that the $100 for both cakes was already taken care of.

So I took the cakes along to the restaurant, and they were served after the meal. And they were AWFUL. They were only an approximation of the chocolate and lemon cake I had ordered. When I called the bakery and asked about my order, I was told rather tartly that they don't do special orders: they make certain items, and my order was approximated in that they decided which items best fit my specifications. Why didn't they tell me that in the first place? The cakes themselves were dense like sugared concrete and slightly less edible. I felt terrible for the birthday girl and everyone else at the brunch. These miserable expensive cakes weren't worth the flour and sugar that went into them.

Do yourself a favor. Try them at least once, but count on them for nothing.
author: Ingrid J.

description:
J says: cutest cake shop in the neighborhood. The packaging is really pretty and the cupcakes have a lovely fluffy texture.  The macarons are nice and chewy and they have great flavors to boot.

K says: I like the old-fashioned cupcakes, with a heavenly dollop of marshmallowy fluff on top. I wish I could dislocate my jaw so I could get the whole thing in at once.
author: Jen Ken H.

description: Macaroons are good. I tried the chocolate orange, grapefruit and hazelnut today.  The chocolate pot de creme was not bad either.
author: Moko R.

description: located inside the sf ferry building. Miette is a cute little candy/bakery boutique. I bought the cutest little animal shaped candles here. they have lollipops and even marshmellow sticks. I havent tried any of their pastries, but their candy is very good.
author: Serena L.

description:
Cute and classy, in that oh-so-French way.  Tasty little sweet bites.  Pretty packaging ... each of my selections was wrapped in a wax-paper envelope and sealed with a Miette sticker.  

We tried the mini scones which were quite rich, the madeleines, which seemed a bit sticky, and the hazelnut macaroons, which were DE-lish!  $8.50 for an assortment of tastes which made for a great dessert for 4 after a late lunch at Hog Island.
author: jill j.

description:
Man, I don't know how I managed to give Miette any less than 5 stars.  I finally managed to make it back to this store earlier than normal, which means that I actually got my choice of macaroon and cupcake flavors.  I decided on the strawberry, hazelnut, and pistachio macaroons- all of which were phenomenal.  The macaroons were a teensy bit too sweet and soft, but that may have been due to the heat of the day.  

As for my cupcake, I was a tad taken aback that they cost $3 each, but man, it was worth it.  I decided on the chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting, which was yummers.  The chocolate cake was incredibly moist and flavorful, while the frosting had a lovely, light strawberry flavor.  The frosting was also a very good texture- fairly light, without that overly buttery/shortening texture that can coat the back of your throat. 

Miette is definitely going to be a must-stop place anytime I go to the Ferry Building.  I only hope that the next time I happen to go back, it will be early like it was today, so that I can get my choice of their products.
author: Angela H.

description: Exceptional macaroons, and super cute store with lots of goodies.  A little bit pricey, though, but people still buy everything, so why not?
author: Jenna L.

description:
macaroons, cupcakes, lemon tea cake. 

This place has come up and redeemed itself from my scarring experience. The workers are nice, and take good care in making each box special. 

I wish they had some vegan items though.
author: Brenda H.

description:
HOW THE HELL DID I MISS THIS ONE? 

Ive seen it on Food Network, Travel Channel, and while walking through the Ferry building ....but GOD WHY?!!! WHY HAVE I NEVER STOPPED HERE?!! Let me break the heavenly goodness down for you... 

Macaroons: OMG...the MACAROONS! Karlo and I decided to get one of each of these little hamburger looking pillows: hazelnut, pistachio, chocolate, and vanilla (in order of deliciousness). These are Parisian Macaroons y'all...no coconut. Egg whites, ground almonds, sugar, and probably crack. Crispy on the edges and a soft meringue chewy center (like the texture of a brownie) sandwiching a layer of ganache/cream...depending on which you order. I had to literally HIDE these in the bag and tuck them under the back seat to avoid a fight breaking out for them in the car between the bf and I.  Dish out the $1.50 for it....dude...dish out $9 for all 6 flavors. IT IS SO WORTH IT! 

Caramel Panna Cotta: This smooth, thick, and caramel infused cream even had a toasty/nutty taste of the caramel. It is PERFECT panna cotta.  If you have never had it, get it here.  The amount they give you is small but perfect for the intensity of the cream and flavor.  The little jar that it came in just topped off the overall presentation. Miette sure knows how to play to off the eyes! 

Old Fashioned Cupcakes: How could I resist a chocolate cupcake with a cloud of frosting sitting a top?!! It really isn't even frosting, more like marshmallow goo that is super light, thick, and fluffy. It was a perfect compliment to the moist, spongey yet dense, dark chocolaty cake (not to mention it was sitting in my fridge 1 1/2 days after purchasing....wow....quality!)  It has that little bitter taste from the bittersweet im sure...it is a perfect compliment to each bite!...BTW the red thing on top is a candied peanut!

Yes, Miette is a bit pricey but they're French pastries!! You'll get over it once you stick one of this delicious concoctions in your mouth! Did I mention their bags are super cute? Lol...sorry...but a girl does notice things like that! Love it!!
author: Tammy H.

description:
Everything here is so darned cute. A tiny shop in a hip ferry building with lots of bright little packages of sweets, it's too much! I came here with a friend in search of macarons and we were well rewarded! I ordered a hazelnut macaron and my friend ordered vanilla. My macaron was creamy inside, soft and crumbly on the outside. It was a perfect amount of sweet and the perfect size - macarons are meant to be enjoyed in dainty bites I think!

Next time will order more things - there are so many cute things there!
author: Katherine P.

description:
Maybe I will try something else from here, but I am a huge cupcake lover and went with that and it really kind of sucked.

The workers were not helpful and seemed annoyed even though they weren't busy at all. The cake itself was OK, but nothing stood out and I really didn't even want to finish it. The staff suggested a vanilla cupcake with vanilla frosting. The frosting SUCKED. WTF is up with bay area bakeries and whipped cream tasting frosting? It was another cool whip tasting topped cupcake. FAIL in my book. 

I'd be willing to try something else but will skip the cupcakes :/
author: Chase S.

description:
My wife LOVES this place. She will be upset, but let her write her own review. HahaHa.
If it were up to me, I would give Miette 2.5 stars. 3 for the taste, and 2 for the prices and small serving sizes. I just don't get the affair people have with this bakery. I remember seeing the owner once on some cooking contest on TV. She came in last place. Hmmm... 
I prefer the bakery at Andronico's in Walnut Creek, or Whole Foods anywhere. They do have nice bitter chocolate brownies though!
author: Johnny O.

description:
If i could satisfy my appetite for chocolate cake or any other sweets here, just by looking at them, or be tricked into believing that expensive pastries must be good like the kinda good ive never had before, then i woud've rated this place 5 stars - Because its definately got the look, presentation and 3 dollar cupcakes and $30- 7in princess cake to prove it.

But after giving this place several chances i'm resorting to a very disaponting 3 stars. I really wanted to like this place. The presentation is amazing - thats where all my 3 stars are going to. 

As for the cakes here - 
chocolate cake: I've definately had MUCH MUCH BETTER. infact, cake mix from william sonoma that i made had much better results than the chocolate cake here. 

Princess cake: I've had better and cheaper at Schuberts on Clement street in SF. 

Cupcakes: same as the chocolate cakes batter.

So while i dont have any major complaints about the sweets here, I'm not going to recommend this place to anybody either. The cakes are too dry - a huge minus when texture on cake is EVERYTHING. i cant even say anything special about how it tastes. 

But if you're throwing a party or want to impress somone get stuff here becuase the presentation is just ADORABLE, and it makes you feel good when you bring one of these cakes as your gift. So i think 3 stars is fair rating. This is my way of saying, this place is so overrated but understandably so....
author: Mai T.

description:
Five stars for:

gingerbread cake. (leaves a crazy stain on the plate it's so moist.)

lime tartlet. (lemon's good too, but the lime is where it's at!)

banana cream tartlet. (delicate, not too sweet.)

old-fashioned cupcake. (chocolatey and marshmallowey and just the right size.)

and the fifth star is just for sweet, adorable Caitlin herself.
author: Teal H.

description:
As I write this, I am actually a bit flushed with excitement.  This patisserie can do no wrong.  

The Tomboy Cake is the perfect ratio of buttercream icing to cake (Three layers of chocolate cake filled with vanilla buttercream.)

The Parisian macarons dissolve in your mouth like communion wafers --- Delicious.

Recently had the chocolate pot de creme in the cute, recyclable glass portion-control containers.  Great!

I used to be a Citizen Cake fan but Miette is definitely an UPGRADE *****.
author: Dakar D.

description:
Ohhhh boy, going to lay down the gauntlet and say their cupcakes taste far too much like a brick of wheat flour and are parsimoniously flavored, at best.  I grew up on organic, when it wasn't so hip or tasty (shudder!) - try Boulange and tell me (for the price) Miette couldn't produce a more refined cake flour and not be such a flavor tease. There was more flavor in the description - f.w.w. not an over-flavor type, less *can* be more...

But wait -- their presentation is magical, love the O.C.D.ness & austere proportions and 50's era lines of the cakes and other items.  The stand @ FBM is visual perfection, so what gives?

Just to be fair I will spotlight what they *do* make that passes muster:

* Lavender scented, hand-crafted caramels? Yay! Salty attitude, Boo!
* Assorted Shortbreads?  Yummy!  Shortness with customers?  Stale!
* Panna Cotta, in its own tiny keep-able glass jar, heavenly! What?

Overall, this place has an untoward prima-donna attitude, though it has a few #1 hits worth singing about.  But, plenty of people just rave about them, so, go see for yourself. I still recommend it to folks because they do offer something unique and innovative, just not likely to go back, my$elf, unless someone else wants to go.

Two Stars Deducted:   Princess Cake ... without .. marzipan?  was told "we use fondant bc organic marzipan is too expensive". uh not necessarily so - Schubert's charges more for a much smaller (tastier) cake.  & then, **no** almond flavoring in the fondant (eww, chalky!) ?? 

LOL, waaay too much poetic license to still call it a Princess Cake.  More of a lady-in-waiting cake, really.
author: Herb C.

description: I'm a big fan of macarons and I know a good place when I try it. This place is alright, the macarons aren't really flavorful(unless that's how you like em) but not me. I like to taste each and every flavor.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
After delicious lunch at Delica rf-1, we made our way to Miette!  My favorite dessert spot.  

The shop is so cute and the presentation is amazing.  If you want a sweet pick me up, just come here and you won't be disappointed.  Macarons are the best!  Enthusiastic customer service!
author: Alenna S.

description:
Where should I start?

Chocolate Sable had deep good chocolate flavor, they were crispy, buttery and light.
The macarons were awesome, we had the pistachios, and coffee beans.  They were very light and flavorfull.
The chocolate tart was excellent!  Buttery, crisp crust with deep dark chocolate filling - definitely made this chocoholic girl very happy.

The only thing about this place: have to come early as items are sold out quickly.
author: Ivy S.

description:
Pretentious staff, overpriced, but delicious! 

The girls were engaged in a private conservation regarding a dress displayed on a laptop behind the counter. No welcome and no friendly smiles. Ahem, can I place my order? If I am going to pay exorbitant high prices, you can at least provide good customer service. 

The macrons were a chewy deliciousness @ 1.50 each. Also purchased a chocolate tart and @ 5.00 each it was just okay. Taste just like the ones at Safeway. 

I've tried their madelines in a past visit and they were also delicious.
author: Diza I.

description: Very cute and deliciouis looking cakes, cupcakes, and other pastries.  Their cupcakes are moist and topped with very, very rich buttercream.  If you take it to go they pack your cupcake up in a little Chinese take-out style box.  Perfect if you're on the go and want to snack on it later.
author: Jennifer A.

description: I came here for the gingersnaps on the "list" I thought they were good, never been a huge fan of ginger snaps. All though I think they would work well for an ice cream sandwich with Chai ice cream between them. I also got the banana creme tart. That was amazing, a must buy!
author: Alison M.

description: Beautiful baked goods with an amazing flavor! We ordered the Scharffenberger chocolate cakes and some macarons...all were perfect! Their caramels are perfectly chewy (like caramel should be). Just a tip for people who like paper straws...the pack of 150 was 6.95 (you buy them online usually for 7.50 for 150! Definitely have some fun inedible goodies as well...cards, etc. (The cookbook is awesome!)
author: Charity H.

description: I bought the absolutely most beautiful, single most delicious Valentine cake EVER at Miette.  All the women (and even one straight guy) in the office were cooing and fussing over it like it was a newborn.  I am not kidding you it was a stunning baked good, all pink heart-shaped ganache with a sparkling sugar coat.  Beneath that lay raspberry-soaked spongecake, a layer of raspberry jam, and whipped cream. *whimper*   Mind you, it was not at all cheap but my sweetie and I thought it was worth every penny.  Thank you, Miette, for baking me the perfect Valentine to give to my one and only.
author: Kerrinski S.

description: I am in love with the Ferry Building and love seeing this super cute patisserie. All the desserts are beautifully displayed and packaged in the cutest containers. With that said, I was terribly disappointed with the macarons. I was surprised to see that their macarons weren't the usual brightly colored ones. They were more tan with brown specks, but I took this to suggest that perhaps they were more organic and the others were dyed with food coloring. The disappointment was not from the appearance, but rather when I took the first bite. The brown specks were grainy and ruined the wonderful chewiness that is associated with macarons. The filling was also bland and none of the strawberry flavor came through. I'll be admiring the patisserie items from afar the next time I'm in the Ferry Building. Maybe it's just better to look at rather than taste. Let's hope that it was just a bad macaron batch.
author: Diana H.

description: Definitely the best macaroons in San Fran. I ate them so fast my boyfriend turned around and I had crumbs on my face. :) Also, I really recommend their lavender cookies. They are so yummy with green tea or by them self.
author: Ruth K.

description:
Ya everyone loves the cupcakes, but here's a review for some of their other items. The scharfenberger burger cake thingy, was good. Nice and chocolatey. The chocolate truffle tart was ok, the chocolate was bitter. Which usually would be fine, except that it wasn't very smooth like the inside of a truffle should be. The tart crust was nice and flaky though. The lime meringue tart was good, the lime part was tart. The meringue was a marshmallow and may be too much if you don't have a big sweet tooth. Again, the crust was good. 

Maybe my expectations were too high from all the hype. The items I had this time were average. The prices are fine to me, definitely not the most I've ever paid for dessert. Maybe you should stick to the cupcakes...
author: The Sock S.

description:
What a great place to stop after a yummy lunch at the Ferry building.  My assistant and I picked up some various cookies before heading back to work.  We didnt even make it to the car before we had opened up the packages and were trying each others flavors.

The lavender shortbread is so delicious, light and airy and the perfect compliment to my lunch.

My assistant got the peanut butter and they were sooooo creamy!

So worth a stop, if there is a line just wait....it is worth it!

cheers!
author: Alicia K.

description: How cute is this place? Very cute I must say. The only issue I have with Miette is deciding what I want to purchase. Everything looks scrumptious as well as cute cute! The brownies are to DIE FOR! When I consumed the last bite I almost wanted to cry. The cupcakes are delish as well but I am not a fan of the frosting. I had the gingerbread cupcake which transported me back to my grandmother's kitchen. No visit to the Ferry building is complete without a stop by Miette!
author: Cicely W.

description: Finally made it in to Miette to try the cupcake today. Had the chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting $3. Somehow, I still prefer Citizen Cupcake's which is more moist. The one at Miette seemed a lil dry today, perhaps it's end of day?
author: Yan M.

description: Bad day at work, coupled with boredom, and no lines at the patisserie, I stopped and splurged.  I got a Chocolate Parisian Macaron and a Chocolate Fleur de Sel... both were EXCELLENT!  The Fleur de Sel just melted in you mouth in a yummy goodness, and the macaron is better than the ones in the bakery section of your grocery store (I heart coconut, but that ain't right).  I also purchased a Gingerbread Cupcake with Cream Cheese frosting for a co-worker's birthday.  I hope it was as good as my chocolate goodies!
author: San D.

description:
It was really hard to decide what to buy here.  Everything looked great and oh so cute!  I was really tempted to buy one of their cake stands, but alas, I opted for a macaron!  I've seen a recipe for these Parisian delights recently and made a mental note to maybe try making it myself one of these days since I've never had one!  

I have heard that they are very time consuming to make and most times hard to perfect.  And after trying the vanilla, pistachio AND raspberry all in a row, I've decided that I'd rather buy it than make it!  Though it was a little pricey ($1.50 for each), it was totally worth it!  (And it saved me time!)
author: Marvy A.

description:
I favor these macarons over Bouchon's.  Bouchon's are supposed to be really good, but I guess those who've said this apparently haven't had macarons a la Miette.  I prefer classic vanilla with vanilla cream, not that I've tried any other type, but I don't like to take chances considering the price of each.

Mmmm, I crave thinking about it.
author: Theresa M.

description: they have the best creme fraiche ice cream sandwich ever!
author: Rachel C.

description:
If I ever have a pastry store, it'll look and smell and taste EXACTLY like Miette. 

I love getting the pound cakes. Five times as big as the one-serving desserts, same price, and just as good :D
author: Lori H.

description:
Their cupcakes sell themselves very well.  Like all other yelpers, I agree that the store is nice and quaint, the products well decorated, and prices a little expensive.  Here's what I got:

1.  Chocolate cupcake with strawberry cream cheese icing:  This is a heavy chocolate cupcake and you will taste the ingredients.  Absolutely heavenly for the chocolate lovers out there.  I'm glad to report that it was moist.

2.  Gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese icing:  An unexpected winnner and the flavor I will be choosing for my next visit.  It is also heavy but it's moist and just heavenly and I am *no* gingerbread fan.

3.  Vanilla cupcake with cream cheese icing:  Dry and a disappointment.  A bit of a surprise, given that it the two other cupcakes were great.

I'd give it 4 stars, but I had to take 1 star away for service, which may have been compromised by insufficient staff.

I know it was raining that day and the Ferry Bldg was packed full of people.  I know that the line for the shop was long and you've been standing all day.  I know the number of cupcakes on display is dropping to dangerously low levels.  I know that busting your chops at a bakery for the whole day is not fun.  BUT, please try to smile when you see equally tired out customers lining up.  Please try to answer questions with something more than "Well, it's a gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese."  (I can read.)  Please try to be as nice and pleasant as the rest of the store decoration.  Be consistent and that's just a humble customer's request. 

I will still come back for more cupcakes, but I really am not looking forward to interacting with the frowny people at the counter.
author: Ginni S.

description:
I finally found the courage to try their cupcakes.  I walk by the bakery time and again during lunch and I want to buy one of the delicate looking cupcakes but I never did.  Finally, I had to buy not one but two cupcakes and a pudding for the side. 

After finally trying it out for myself, sadly I have to say...I was not impressed.  I have to admit the ginger cupcake was interesting and had a little kick but somehow, I expected something more.  The presentation of the cupcake and the packaging gave it a little "wow" factor however.
author: Jen L.

description:
My favorite items from Miette are:

1. Chocolate Scharffenberger cake (REALLY DEEP CHOCOLATE FLAVOR!!!!!)
2. Chocolate Brownie w/ walnuts

I've tried the other stuff too:

Panna Cotta (this was pretty good)
Pot du Chocolat (not a fan, but better than Boulette's Larder for sure)
Various cupcakes (just ok)
Chocolate chip cookies (i like my cookies chewy, these are crispy)
French Macarons (i like that they don't use that weird dye, good)
Raspberry Mousse cake (very good)
Chocolate Opera Cake (not so much, there are some hard chunks mixed in the cream filling, could be cacao nibs...?)
Eclair (No!)

Everything is pretty good in terms of taste and very beautiful in terms of looks, but I always fall back to my 2 favorites...(Trust me, I've tried all the brownies and chocolate cakes from the various Ferry Building vendors and Miette has the best period.)

On a side note...

One time I ordered a large sized Scharffenberger cake over the phone for a party I was going to, but when I arrived 15 minutes later, they realized that they accidentally gave it away to someone else, and it was unfortunately the last one.  They were really nice about it.  They packed up all of the remaining baby Scharffenbergers and a full box of different cupcakes and only charged me the price of the 1 large cake.  That was really nice and sweet of them.  This place has good service.
author: Burrito M.

description: Super yummy macarons! I only wish they had more variety down here at the ferry building but, I will visit their store front and see what else they have!
author: Dominique C.

description:
It was pretty good when it first started there(base on the ratio of price/quality/quantity).  These days, it's going down the hill somewhat.  But don't get me wrong.  It still have some good baked cakes or cupcakes.  It's just that some of the very best cake is no longer available.  I guess it's not "economical" for them to make them any more?  And they are switching to simpler ways or cheaper ingredients (not sure though)?  Will I return?  Well, may be once a year or when there is an occasion/event that calls for a good cake to celebrate.  Otherwise, there are still many alternatives where Quality/Quantity to price (QQ/P) ratio is higher. 

so i took a star down there.  And the other star taken away from them is the sub par service.  Yes, they are quite busy.  I consider myself a patient customer.  But I don't, and no customer, deserve a snobby service attitude, regardless of how bad the day was.  And 3 star is absolutely fair.
author: F L.

description:
I don't really have a sweet tooth and I am very picky about eating the dessert I like. 

One day, I was still new in the neighborhood and my friend introduced me to Miette. I understand that I have not tried Magnolia Cupcakes yet, but Miette cupcakes blows my mind right away.

Modesty: The store is just a corner with a 1950s well decorated touch that has this little cute details of a small ceramic cake saucer, totally Vintage, just the way I like it.

Honesty: The cupcake looks adorable, nicely decorated and taste super duper delicious.

Crafty: They also offer other cakes, and they can give you the small round Chocolate Cake with ribbon wrap around it.

Eco-friendly: They use the finest, freshest ingredients available in this planet and everything they use is from local , family owned farms and organically produced.

Thanks to my friend Auvy, therefore I know Miette!
author: Inne S.

description:
Miette's shop at the Ferry building is a small affair with a variety of candies and pastries.   There's a mix of imported and local candy.  Their pastries are gluten-free and organic.  

I tried the macarons only, which were $1.50.  I got two of each of the six flavors.  There's strawberry, hazelnut, chocolate, vanilla, another chocolate variety, and pistachio.  They have a grainy texture which I'm not a huge fan of.  The flavors are also very delicate.  It took effort to tell what was what because they all tasted pretty similar.  The chocolate, of course, was obvious.  

They have cute packaging, but as far as the macarons go, I'd rather go to Paulette.
author: Christine L.

description: Strawberry flavored frosting on chocolate cupcakes?? I'd tap that.
author: Price L.

description: Woah, did I just eat 1 piece of cardboard? But I thought I just bought an overpriced rose flavored macaron. =(
author: Erica B.

description: This is my favorite patisserie in the city, so you can imagine how disappointed I was today, when I got the last piece of the coconut mousse cake only to have it be dried out.  I was sooooo bummed!  This is not the norm for this place.
author: Maureen R.

description:
I came in really expecting to get those cupcakes. But for 3.75, I backed out. Instead I got a macaron for 1.50. This place is too pricy. I was unhappy with my pistachio macaron. I would prefer not to have buttercream as my filling. 

I miss my dollar macarons in new york from almondine bakery.
author: Candice A.

description:
I'm not a dessert lover, so if I tell you it tastes good, then take that to the bank, baby. Don't eat sugar just for the sake of sugar - it's dull.

These folks really take pride in what they're doing and it shows in every bite. It's why you have to go early to get a good selection of treats and cakes or end up going home empty-handed.

It's even organic - thanks Miette!
author: Rene D.

description: One of the best French Pastries I have ever tasted. Portion control, variety, and presentation are great. Must visit for a treat and gift.
author: Aung W.

description:
The $3 cupcakes just didn't do it for me. I tried both the vanilla and chocolate ones. They were pretty but the buttercream frosting was tasteless and waxy.  The cake parts were very dense and weren't tasty to me. Nothing about these cupcakes were even close to making me say "wow, these are good". I know this place is the fave SF cupcake place for a couple of friends so was sorely disappointed.

Bottom line: Their cupcakes definitely were some of the least tasty and most expensive I've ever had. Perhaps others may love them, but I definitely didn't. My faves are still Sibby's, Noe Valley Bakery, and Love at First Bite.  To their credit, their place is cute and service was nice.
author: Jim C.

description:
walking to the ballpark....oo the embarcadero center..oo macarons here!
lets go!

found it! hmmmm 1.75.....ok i wanna try flavors......got almost one of each....sweet....soft.......ehhhhh i dunno. wasn't all that special. i think i like paulette's flavors better. but at least i tried it!
author: Christine M.

description:
Miette makes the most beautiful treats.  You pay for the beauty, true, but I didn't even know pastries so perfect existed.  

My favorite little indulgence?  the $1.50 macaroons (rose and hibiscus are the best).  Probably the cheapest thing there but so delicate and delicious!
author: Alyssa W.

description: The brownies here are amazing! Seriously they were perfectly crispy on the edges and nice and soft and dense on the inside. The ambiance is nice and the line moves fast even though I went on farmers market Saturday. Friendly and cute staff is a plus too.
author: Sundeep G.

description:
Absolutely divine.  I got a gorgeous princess cake for a friends baby shower... impossibly light white cake and rasberry filling covered with perfectly spherical pastel green fondant icing.  Its too beautiful too eat, and then you take a bite and its too good not to eat.  The Scharffenberger cake is impossibly chocolate-y and will just make you shiver with happiness.  They are crazy expensive, but when a room full of people ooohs and aaahs for hours over the cake... 

The regular stuff is good too... bagged cookies, lemon tarts, mini Scharffenberger cakes, cupcakes... and those are just as adorable. :)
author: Ananda Z.

description:
If your New Year's resolution is to drop a few pounds, don't go here because their goodies are hard to resist.  But if you don't mind a little indulgence here and there then come on over. 

Their cupcakes are to die for!
author: Dy R.

description: The desserts here are awesome!!!  The ice cream sandwiches are so refreshingly awesome and the macaroons are so tasty that I keep on coming back here to buy more.  Every time I'm here, I always buy two boxes.  Definitely one of my favourite places to stop in whenever I'm in San Francisco.  Highly recommend this place for people who love little dessert delicacies.
author: Travelling E.

description:
Call me jaded..."Hi Jaded!!"

I ordered a chocolate strawberry cupcake and a banana creme tartlet to share with my BF - I was so excited to sit down with my Blue Bottle macchiato and just indulge...

I was a bit let down =(

Perhaps I had built it up too much, or maybe I was just swooning too much from the absolutely perfect cup of coffee that accompanied my dessert...

Whatever it was, I found the cupcake to be bland and the tartlet to be...well, not very banana-like. 

It was as if they forgot the flavor. The cake part of the cupcake was FABULOUS!! Moist, tender, and the perfect hint of chocolate, but I was really looking forward to the strawberry frosting to set it off. No luck.

The banana tartlet was still delicious, with it's perfect crust and hint of chocolate - but I was missing the banana flavor. Booo =(

Good, but not 'knock-my-socks-off-rock-my-world-oralgasm" good. And when I splurge on dessert, I want it to *satisfy*
author: Christy L.

description: The Chocolate Cream Layer Cake and Gingerbread Cupcakes are the best ever.  Best place to grab dessert after a lunch in the Ferry Building, or a mid-afternoon pick-me-up from your stressful job downtown!
author: tara w.

description: Hello my delicious Miette and your wonderful gingersnaps, your chewy rose geranium macaron, and your friendly atmosphere.. 4 stars for your awesomeness... and a recommendation to all who come. :) I'm such a little piggy- this was stop 3/12 for a http://www.battledish.com #dishcrawl... oink! So good though... so good.
author: Tracy L.

description: tried the pistachio and rose macarons. delightfully tasty and light! not too sweet, but full flavored. price is not too bad for what i've seen at other places around SF.
author: Carol C.

description:
Have always loved this cute bakery.  Absolutely loved the scharffenberger cakes, and the lemon tea cakes, and the parisian macaroons.  My friends sent me a scharffenberger cake for my birthday, and then my coworkers sent the old-fashioned cupcakes when I was in the hospital (thank you all... sigh).   Food always taste better when they are sooooo pretty (no such thing as too pretty to eat... the prettier, the more I want to eat the food).  Would definitely be visiting this place more often.  

My only gripe is the parking (especially since the parking adjacent to the Ferry Plaza is temporarily closed).  But, that doesn't stop me from taking BART in and walking a few blocks (which I should be doing anyway).
author: Derek S.

description:
I was on the edge of giving this place a 4, but what kept me from tipping the scale was the banana cream tart and cupcakes.  Although their macaroons are very well done, their tarts and cupcakes just weren't that great.  If you've had the banana cream tart at Tartine or a cupcake at Sprinkle's, you'll know that the tarts and cupcakes at miette just don't compare.  

The chocolate cupcake with the meringue was on the dry side and fancy ingredients or not, a bad cupcake is a bad cupcake.  Screwing up a cupcake at a patisserie is just blasphemous.  The banana cream tart I had at Miette was simply chopped up bananas on bed of custard that tasted like a whole lot of nothing.  I haven't had the opportunity to try any of their larger cakes yet, but would like to.  

However, I have to say that what keeps me coming back is their macaroons.  If you like Nutella, you'll like their hazelnut macaroons.  I've tried all their macaroons and trust me when I say they are ALL good.  I know that some may not be partial to the "exotic" flavors of lavender or grapefruit, but you gotta try everything once right?
author: Serena S.

description:
This is perhaps my favorite place in the Ferry Building. The pretty cakes that greet you from behind the glass counter are so perfect that you almost won't want to eat them -- but only almost.

The cupcakes are perfect for a quick snack or individual desserts. A word of warning, though: while they're certainly delicious, they do tend to be a little dry. Definitely eat them the same day of purchase; if you leave them in your fridge they'll be stale and hard by the next day.

Best recommendation: the mini Scharffen Berger cake. It's decadent and just a little too much for one person to eat alone, but it doesn't matter because you won't want to share.
author: Jase W.

description:
Three words:  Lavender Chocolate Macaroons.
A buck fifty and one of these heavenly little morsels can be yours.  I give them points for the beautifully displayed cakes, pies, cupcakes and brownies.  Service is friendly and efficient but they could throw my macaroon at me for all I care,  I am utterly enthralled with the lavender chocolate medley.
author: Celeste A.

description:
I have to admit that I'm smitten with Miette. Maybe the cakes aren't the absolute most amazing thing on the planet, but they aren't anywhere near as bad as that 1* review claims. But then again, they didn't pick either the Old Fashioned or Gingerbread Cupcake to try. And by saying the icing was hard, they clearly didn't let it temper to a more desirable serving temperature, oh poor, poor soul.

The Macaroons are just as good as the ones I reviewed for Miette's Hayes Valley spot. (Go figure.) They do have a wider selection of the other baked goodies. Pot De Creme is tasty... bring the jar back to reclaim you deposit.

Just wish they had a few more candy options... or at least a psychic stock person to tailor towards my tastes.

The staff is very cool and fun to chat with.

Woo-hoo! Now I can't wait until tomorrow when I can swing by for another fix!
author: Ryan F.

description:
Who likes Ginger (part 1):  me.

Ginger cupcake, with gorgeous buttercreme icing (?), is a stunner.  If you're bored whilst waiting at the Ferry Building for touring visitors or stalled Farmers Market shoppers -- grab one.  

Note, cupcake form can also be shaped in the form of full birthday cakes as well -- if desperate.
author: James D.

description:
Tried both the choc-orange and the lemon scone.  $1 each.....which might be a bit overpriced,  but for a quick tasty treat,  they hit the spot. 

Haven't tried the cupcakes,  but have heard raves about them......
author: Pete D.

description:
If you find yourself in the Ferry Building, heck, if you find yourself on Embarcadero street, be sure to make a visit to Miette. You won't miss it...it's PINK!

I want to back up everyone who loves their macaroons. They are definitely the star of the bakery. I especially like the ones with hazelnut. Mmmm. Don't be afraid to try their lemony macaroons if you don't like tart/sour flavors b/c they keep it subtle. 

It's one of the places I visit every time I'm in SF. I wonder if I could save myself the flight and make the macaroons myself in my kitchen. ;)
author: Yulree C.

description: Really good macarons! I wish there was a bit more variety, or at least some more creative flavors, but these babies are pretty solid anyway!
author: Eeeeestar T.

description: Overall, a good place for cakes and such.  Macaroons are very popular, and I've enjoyed many of them, especially pistachio.  The other day, I picked up a Scharffenberger cake for a birthday cake, and boy, did it not disappoint.  Truly concentrated chocolate, yet not too sweet.   Cupcakes were the only disappointment, though.  Pretty, but something was not working.
author: Peter L.

description:
This bakery gets five stars for having the coolest refrigerators and having adorable macaroons and cakes.
The scharffenberger cake is my personal  favorite.
author: Hanui C.

description: I have been on a mission for about a month now for the best french macarons and when I finally tried Miette, I knew this was a match made in dessert heaven.  Granted, I've only had macarons at 3 different places, but still...after coming here, Miette set the standard.  I tried the Hazelnut (my favorite!!!), Pistachio, Strawberry (my second favorite), Rose, and Vanilla.  All were really good, but I had my obvious favorites.  These are the biggest I've ever had and they have the best texture.  Crunchy outside cookies parts but still chewy and the creme fillings are so full of flavor.  They're so worth the price.  These little bundles help when I'm having a bad day.  I'm so happy I found my favorites...they definitely set the bar
author: Leah A.

description: I usually don't like cupcakes because they're too fluffy and it feels like I'm eating air.  BUT their gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting was very very good, especially with a cup of drip coffee from Blue Bottle ;)
author: Erin L.

description:
If you would ever like to experience the sensation of the earth stopping on its axis, try a cupcake from Miette.  I ordered a chocolate cupcake with coffee frosting, and as I drew it towards my lips, everything around me slowed down, and like some trippy scene from Willy Wonka.  Suddenly it was just me and the cupcake flying hand in hand over sugar dusted meadows and fields of candied flowers, occasionally dipping our fingers in a river of chocolate.

I finished it, and the world sped up again.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I like Miette a lot. It's a cute layout and has a good selection. It's not the best around and its a little pricey but its good.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Mostly reviewing their French macaroons...

Ever since I returned from a lovely trip to France, I've been suffering sporadic pangs of French macaroon cravings. 

Decided to pick up a box from Miette Cakes today and I'm quite satisfied. They are slightly chewier/more moist than the ones I had in France though. Therefore I am still searching high and low in SF for THE PLACE to get French macaroons. But at $1.50 each, I wouldn't hesitate to buy one (or half a dozen) the next time I am in the Ferry Building.

Otherwise, this is a cute little shop with really tasty (and pricey) cakes too.
author: Cindy P.

description:
Ok, like they need another positive review, but the Lime Meringue Tart is THE BEST DESSERT I HAVE EVER HAD (or as good as).

Period.
author: R.P. N.

description:
It's such a charming little shop with delicious looking AND tasting pastries.  It's also organic cuz I guess we bay area crazies refuse to buy anything not marked organic in big red glaring letters.  

Check out their cupcakes and get frosting all over your nose, so worth it.
author: Shyam P.

description:
I love the Parisian macaroons here.  Chewy with a nice thin crust, and not too sweet.  It's the best present you could give your mouth.

However, it's an expensive gift.  (or expensive 5 gifts, since I can't eat just one).

For those who haven't had the pleasure of tasting a Parisian macaroon, these are NOT coconut confections.  Parisian macaroons are made with almond flour, so if you thought, "I don't like coconut" and passed up the macaroons, go back and try one of these right away!
author: Diana C.

description:
All their confections are great!
The gingerbread cupcake is the standout-but still among many other great flavors.  
Be sure to check out their candies.  Odd sounding treats like lavender marshmallows and honeycomb are great.  They also have a cute assortment of cake stands and china.
I really appreciate the fact that they make Princess cake WITHOUT marzipan.  They use fondant instead.  Scandinavian girls love Princeseta!
author: Natalie R.

description: mmm that hazelnut macaron was delicious.  now i wonder how the other flavors taste, there are so many.  the macaron was soft and melted in my mouth with a rich, but light hazelnut flavor which made it just right.
author: Kent H.

description: PERFECTION. Gorgeous pastel decorations, candy galore, adorable packaged cookies and treats, and ohhhhh the cupcakes. I love to give these goodies as little gifts and I equally love to treat myself to them! The macarons are amazing. Light, sweet, and creamy ... writing about it makes me want to have one! My personal favorite cupcake is the gingerbread. Try one, seriously. The brownies are also delightful. Dense chocolate, yet unbelievably smooth. A great way to brighten someone's day and an even better way to hug yourself in yummy baked goodness.
author: Candid K.

description:
Yum, yum, yum. I love the fantastic confections from this Ferry building bakery.  Delicious tid-bits of tasty tantalizing treats! 

An insignificant detail that makes me smile are the cute, light green toile patterned shades over the vent system, Why? Because I made them.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Everything in that spit polished case looks delicious but I gotta tell you only one other cupcake in my life has been as disappointing (see: citizen cupcake). 

Specifically, it was super dry. Like, the best I could do was run down the street to dunk my head in the salt water and make my salivary glands start working again.

It's good for display but not so great in the mouth, you know.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Miette isn't so bad.

Had the opportunity to try the Lemon Debutante cake during a 
good-bye party. Can I say it was good,tasty and I repeat good again.This is coming from someone who doesn't have a crave for sweets.However, this cake was creamy,yummy and quite delicious with a lemon taste.

I am willing to come here to taste more of the pastries and cookies.
author: Dani D.

description:
Lived in Japan for like 3.5 years and that country is filled with dessert cafes and tabhoudai (all you can eat) cake and ice cream shops. Got sick of desserts coming back until i came across Miette. Make a man fall in love with desserts again. A bit pricey for a cupcake but maybe its the price tag that gets my mind thinking, "It has to taste great, dammit!"

I'll pretty much eat/try anything that is sold behind the counter at this place, especially the chocolate and yellow cake cupcakes. Gym membership and new running shoes had to be subcribed to and bought due to the sugary goodness Miette provides...Yay! Im a fan.
author: Nick V.

description: This place serves perfection by the ounce or by the pound! I am in love with the grapefruit Parisian macarons, the lime meringue tart, and the abundantly-frosted super-yummy cupcakes. You honestly cannot go wrong here - everything is a real treat!
author: Bridget W.

description:
I have literally tasted every single cake, brownie, panna cotta, cupcake, whatever else, that Miette has ever made.  And this is one of my most favorite bakeries in SF.  It is also one of my favorite places to stop off for a "treat" after yoga or an especially hard session of cardio.  I know, you think I'm defeating the purpose of working out, but hey, I have a system.  :)

What I love about Miette is that their cakes are not too sweet.  And everything is cute and petite.  If you buy a Miette cake for someone, whether it's for a dinner party or for your mom on her birthday, that person will never look unhappy.  I guess some people might say that their cakes are too simple, but I find that charming.  

So, go!  Go try their brownies!  Or their cupcakes!  And cakes!
author: SpaAddict K.

description:
We came upon this dainty little patisserie one Tuesday morning after having enjoyed the farmer's market outside of the Ferry Building. I was greeted by what seemed to be a cheery girl who kindly asked what I wanted. Everything looked mouth-watering so I decided to try two of each of their goodies: mini scharffen berger cake, coffee-flavored cupcakes, gingerbread cupcakes, and two other flavors which I cannot remember at this time. I also ordered two each of their wonderful, light and airy, not to mention fantastic Parisian macaroons.  I couldn't wait to get home to try them all.

The most memorable experience that I had at this place was the customer service. The girl behind the counter who seemed friendly at first glance was nothing but a front. I caught her rolling her eyes as she turned away from me to get a box then quickly flashed a smile as she faced me again. She did this several times as I placed my order.  It was as if I was making her work too hard placing my cupcakes, cakes, and macaroons in the box. All I can say is what a RUDE ass! They need to train their sales people with some customer service, class, and tact.

In the end, despite the fact that I did enjoy my lovely treats, I don't think I will ever come back here again just to dodge their horrible sales service. NO cupcake or cake is THAT good to be treated so badly.
author: Candy C.

description:
Yummy cupcakes!  Very cute store with a variety of teacakes and cookies.  I tried the chocolate cupcake with vanilla cream frosting.  The cake itself was moist; the frosting light, smooth, and buttery.  I love, love the frosting.

Very expensive for a teeny tiny cupcake, but just try it!
author: Elaine Z.

description:
I purchase two chocolate macarons and the mini Scharffen Berger cake for a total of $8. 

the chocolate macarons were as everyone has described them to be chewy and chocolatey and smooth.  even my parents liked them! 

i just bit into the scharffen berger cake and it was like taking a bite of chocolatey heaven. CHOCOLATEY HEAVEN.

it just may be my salvation in these dark dark times. heck, it could even make eliot spitzer feel better.
author: Natalie C.

description: I have been wanting to come here for a long time. Today was the day. Lots of good stuff, settled for a small Chocolate tart. Wow.......was it good!
author: Don F.

description:
I always told myself I'd try something other than the macaroons and I did. I tried the cupcakes and I wasn't a huge fan. The chocolate with the marshmallow frosting - that was pretty good. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend the cupcakes.

The macaroons are a-ma-zing. These aren't the macaroons that you can buy at the grocery store. These are straight up french macaroons and everytime I have one, it's like tasting a little piece of heaven. The hazelnut macaroons are my favorite with the chocolate a close second. Indulge and get a 6-pack. You won't be sorry.
author: Mariel G.

description: Too pretentious and overpriced for my taste.  There are several French bakeries in the Twin Cities that make beautiful pastries and desserts with rich flavors and textures, plus have a relaxing vibe and friendly service.  Service here is too rushed - staff could use a little more patience.  Miette succeeds in creating a gorgeous bakery case, but the flavors leave something to be desired.
author: Alison T.

description:
Booo. I am not sure if the quality of the macarons have declined or if I am just no longer satisfied with Miette's macarons because I've now had better from several difference places. I tried them once a few years ago and thought they were great. Went back today and found them to be extremely disappointing. 

They're ok, I guess. because it would be hard to make them taste bad (except for the rose one, the rose flavor was way too strong). But the flavors just seemed off, despite the fact that they were all very sweet. The flavors are either too strong (like the rose) or too bland. I ordered one of each and, later, couldn't pick out some of the flavors. Rose was obvious, I am pretty sure which was the chocolate lavender (but might not have been able to identify the lavender if I hadn't known it was there), plain chocolate and the raspberry, but the other ones...no idea. 

They were also too cakey or something. Just not the delicate experience they should be. Honestly, I felt like they were just mass produced crap for people who have never had a really good macaron.

Also, what is up with the crappy customer service? It was like this before and I thought maybe things would have improved. Hire some people who are friendly, please, and stop staffing your store with rude and awkward people.
author: K B.

description: Pricey for what you get but delicious.  I got the ginger snaps.  Buttery, sweet, and ginger spicy at the same time.  It's amazing if you break it up and eat it with ice cream.
author: Matthew P.

description:
The best way to describe this place is in one statement invented and credited to Sloane, Melanie, and Jayna....

" Triple C's"..... we frequent this place for the macarons.  Vanilla to be precise.  Triple C's as we invented= crispy, chewy, creamy (forward) is = to creamy, chewy, crispy ( backward). 

Whichever way you choose to eat it, it's all scrumptious. 

I bought a plethora, if you will, of the vanilla macarons to share. As sharing is caring. I distributed amongst my coworkers and friends throughout the day.  After having dinner at Nola's in Palo Alto, I wanted to surprise my Palo Alto natives with a "TREAT".  

I prewarned my friends and said,

 " look, this is the most DELICIOUS dessert I've ever had, yet so tiny.  Though looks may be deceiving, I warn you.  Please savor each bite and handle with care"  

So, one of my friends picked one out of the cute white box with the pastel label " miette" and then started to untwist the cookie like it was an OREO!!!!!!!!!


ME:
" WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING!!!! DON'T DO THAT!!!"  obviously, she's never had one.  Don't treat them like the "other cookies" !!!! 

Earlier at work I gave one to a coworker. For some reason I get a kick out of watching people eat these.... so I observed as he found his surprise at his desk on a pastel yellow napkin I used to enhance the presentation.  He took a bite and " mmmmm... this is good..."  

My response:  " yah!!! better be... they're a dollar fifty each!!!"  ... he took another bite and said " WOW!!!! this is REALLLLLLLLLY GOOOOOOOD" as if me stating the price enhanced the flavor....

Bottom line is, Miette is as dainty as toddlers in their white/ pastel Easter Sunday apparel and as cute as a newly bathed fluffy puppy.  

I highly recommend the macarons, Vanilla preferred and I just had the yellow cake cupcake with Lemon zest frosting. Very light, decadent and full of flavor.... *sigh*
author: Genevieve J.

description:
Oh lord... OH LORD!!!

Delicious. Fantastic. Brilliant. And not only that but visually appealing to boot!

Brought a box of them back to the office after lunch earlier this week and they were such a hit I think I could be up for a promotion!

:-p
author: Geoff W.

description:
PEOPLE, this is serious. I need a lemon tart now! Can I leave work early to go get one? PPPPPleeeeease? 
No. I will instead salivate over photos and then go home to make my own. Lemon tarts/squares/bars are cheap to make but theirs are so pretty and dainty and MAGNIFICENT. 

Their macarons are killer too. Rose Geranium is my favorite. I replicate them well. I could go home and make those too but they take a lot of work... that's why they are $1.75. I know, I've made them. Almonds are not cheap either. One of those puppies is plenty. Don't get me wrong, I could eat a dozen but one is usually enough.
author: Elsa E.

description:
I find the pastries good but they're "NOT TO DIE FOR".  The cupcakes are dense and buttercreams are just so so......I'm not trying to be a snob but I guess I'm comparing this to pastries from LaDuree or Fauchon. 
I guess these cupcakes are comfort food/desserts turned into a brand called miette.....the store ambience that makes you feel like a little girl excited about the tea party....
  OK....snap out of it...three stars for the macarons and the gingerbread cupcake. The rest you can buy at costco.......no ambience but price is great and the cupcakes are comparable to miette.
author: girl e.

description: As I was wandering around the Ferry Building for the first time, Miette Patisserie kept catching my eye. Everything is SO CUTE! But also very expensive. Tempting as the cupcakes looked, they were dinky, yet cost the same amount as a big Sprinkles cupcake ($3.25), so I passed. I couldn't resist trying their macarons though ($1.75 each). The price is a little steep, but I find that their macarons are slightly bigger than at most places. I got two--hazelnut and rose geranium--and they were amazing! The hazelnut macaron had a chocolatey center and tasted like a Ferrero Rocher (but way more heavenly). The rose geranium macaron had JUST the right amount of floral flavor without tasting like a mouthful of perfume. Best of all, neither was sickeningly sweet. Can't wait to get my hands on more!!!
author: Vicky C.

description:
Just like everything else in the Ferry Building: pricey but really good.  If you like gingersnaps then try them here.  They are worth trying once, but I won't ever spend that much on cookies to take home regularly.  

If you work downtown it's a nice little afternoon break to go to Blue Bottle for some coffee and maybe a macaroon Miette.   Just today this girl in my office got a carrot cake and they gave it to her in this pink box with string and a sticker so if you have to bring something as a gift to dinner or brunch or something then this is a great spot because you know it will be good and they do present everything well (as they should for the price).
author: Brian L.

description: I was lucky enough to work for a company that loved to splurge on employee birthdays. We were treated to a Miette cake or cupcake platter almost once a month, and it was great! They have a great mix of traditional cakes like strawberry shortcake and some funkier creations like their cupcakes and macarons. Pricey but worth it once in a while.
author: Mallory M.

description:
Miette has the cutest little storefront in the ferry building. It took me a while before I managed to visit during open hours, but even closed the bakery radiates cute.

On my quest to eat as many cupcakes as possible, I came across Miette. I figured that these cupcakes would be so-so, as they seem to specialize in general baked goods and not the cupcakes I hold so dear. Boy, was I wrong. The cupcakes I ate were the cutest cupcakes ever. And they were delicious! We sampled the gingerbread, chocolate with marshmellow frosting, chocolate with strawberry frosting, and plain chocolate with vanilla frosting. The chocolate cake is very dense and chocolate-y, and the frosting is superb - not too sweet or overly powdered sugar-y, with amazing flavor, particularly in the strawberry cupcake. I love that they use all organic ingredients as well.
author: Julie H.

description: Cute place.  I thought their macaroons were pretty good...not nearly as sweet as other ones I've had, but I see that a lot of reviews still thought they were too sweet.  Their texture was good: crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  I also had an ice cream sandwich...pretty good too. but nothing wow.  I'm not usually a pastry/dessert kinda person, but I think my friends would really like it, so I'd come here to get it for them...
author: Jimmy W.

description:
Hazelnut, pistachio macaroons...try them all one bite is not enough. I'm craving one right now.

The macaroons are scrumptious. Pretty store and nice packaging*
author: Ann M.

description: We walked by here before eating lunch, and the case looked pretty full of sweet yummies... but when we came back after lunch, everything was gone!  We did however manage to get $50 worth of pastries to go... lol... We got the creme de pot, a banana tarlette, slice of chocolate and creme cake,  and a bunch of madelines and macaroons and other cookies... they were quite delicious, a little dry because it is organic but still very good.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Honestly, I did my best to behave in a civilized manner, but I nearly knocked my date down when he said he didn't want anything sweet...I could scarcely keep myself from pressing my face against the glass cases.  

THERE WERE CUPCAKES!!!!!!  

I don't mean just any ol' cupcake, but a petite, pretty chocolate cupcake with lavender frosting that was taller than the cake itself.  

I LOVE FROSTING....LOTS OF FROSTING!  

It looked divine...that is until I saw the large glass jars on top of the cases that were filled with macarons.  

I WAS PERPLEXED!

Yes, and the counter person was of no help.  I asked which treat received the most ecstatic response from customers.  She said both are wildly popular.  I went from perplexed to stunned.  

CUPCAKE OR MACARON...I'M GOING TO HAVE TO CHOOSE ONE!

I'm going to have to choose between all that lavender frosting and what appeared to be authentic French macarons.   Which would be best?  Would the macarons taste as good as the ones I so dearly love in Paris?  What if the frosting was not to my liking?  

I MADE A MANAGEMENT DECISION...

I ordered two of the macarons....chocolate raspberry and orange lavender...and they WERE as good as the macarons I savor each day I'm in Paris.  At least I think they were good...I nearly inhaled them in a fit of sheer ecstasy....I call it a foodgasm.  My date stood there with his mouth agape.  I didn't mean to....it just sort of "happened"....but I paid for them first! : )

I will yelp about the cupcakes on my next visit.......VERY SOON!
author: s r.

description:
I LOVE THEIR MACARONS!!  My boss got them for me once and I've been addicted to them since.  I've never had macarons elsewhere so I don't have anything to compare them to but I can't imagine better tasting ones.  Biting into one is akin to biting into a glazed Krispy Kreme donut (and boy do I love those!), except 100x better because they're chewy!  So whenever I go to the Ferry Building, I have to stop by Miette for some to satisfy my cravings.  (By the way, they're still $1.50 each so I'm not sure why everyone else is saying they're $1.75.)

I just found out today that they rotate the flavors of their macarons every few months!  The last few times they had: pistachio, vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate, coffee, raspberry and lemon.  Today's flavors: pistachio, vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate, rose germanium, chocolate orange and one other flavor I can't remember right now.  That reminds me, I wish they would color code their macarons or figure out some way to differentiate between the flavors.  Of course, I always buy one (or a few of each) and it's so hard to figure out which flavor is which until you bite into them.

Anyway, I also tried their Gingerbread Cupcake with cream cheese frosting  ($3) today.  The cake itself was super moist and perfectly spiced...I think it's the best ginger spiced cake I've ever had.  The cream cheese frosting was kind of gross by itself but it was just perfect with the cupcake.  The only complaint I have is that the cupcake had way too much frosting, which I don't like.  Other than that, it was delicious.

A lot of people are complaining about the price of their goodies but I don't think it's too outrageously priced.  If I can spend over $2 on a piece of chocolate from Cocoa Bella, then the macarons from Miette are definitely a steal for $1.50 ;)
author: Katelynn L.

description:
I am in a deep, dark love affair with the pistachio macaron.  Please, do not disturb me when I am indulging in one.  You couldn't possibly understand what I am experiencing unless you've tasted the seductive goodness for yourself.

p.s. the ferry building is great place for lunch.
author: Laura H.

description:
I have only had their macaroons and almond nougat -- I really loved the almond nougat -- add it to my list of things I will buy on every trip to the ferry building......fleur de sel caramels, olive oil and white wine vinegar, etc......

I made the mistake of only buying 2 pieces of almond nougat -- but I emailed them asking about getting some more (it was not listed on the website) -- they promptly replied and asked for my phone number and called me to take my order. Very nice and personable.....
author: Tom D.

description:
You know how Cookie Monster can't maow down on cookies all the time anymore because it's, like, setting a bad example for all of the children? Well, he's really depressed because like me, he has a massive sweet tooth that cannot be satisfied by things like fruit or baked good not enriched with maximum sugar quantities. 

And this brings me to my review of Miette. It is the perfect bakery for those who are not sugar craving maniacs such as myself and Cookie Monster, hence the plethora of 4 and 5 star reviews. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with this place- it's just not exactly to my liking. 

There are a million cutsey mccuterson bakeries floating around these days, so I think one can afford to be picky. The buttercream frosting here was meh, and the crumb on the cake was not delicate enough. I've had better.

I'm still on Team Magnolia.
author: Katie H.

description: French Macaroons! They offer a wide array of flavors. The only one we did not order was rose, per another frequent customer. The macaroons were of the perfect consistency, though a tad overly sweet. I want to go back for more sweets!
author: Angie Q.

description:
1. LOVE the pretty paper bags.
2. Love the pretty cakes...that ACTUALLY TASTE GOOD!! 
3. Nice Staff (sweet and accommodating to this indecisive b.day gal)

-- actually sweet enough to take out the cakes for me to get a closer look, so i could pick out which one i wanted for my birthday :) 

-- even showed me how the wording would appear on the cake

-- very happily accommodated my request for to cancel an earlier request for "wordings" on my cake. and ok-ed yet another request for a couple more little colorful flowers atop my cake :) they really seem like they WANTED me to have a pretty cake and a HAPPY birthday! 

Got a Lemon Debunte -- really lemony. i'm not sharing :P after my party left, i decided left over cake is gonna be my breakfast and after-dinner treat for the next few days.... 
(on retrospec, good thing i stuffed my guests with FOOD so they had little room for cake....YEH!! more for me :P ) 
i'm heading back for the mini-chocolate ones [they were so hot that the people ahead of me in the line bought them all!! :( ...]
author: Purple B.

description:
I have only eaten a single item from this establishment as most of my trips to the Ferry Building are lunchtime visits from the office and I am a recovering sugar addict who on occasions falls off the wagon.

After a disappointing sandwich from Lulu Petite I needed consolation and I bolted straight to the first den of confectionery I could find.  I ignored the cookies, the cupcakes and the madelines and picked a single Vanilla Macaroon from the naughty glass jar perched atop the counter.

$1.50 is a small price to pay for sheer sugary seduction, the macaroon was soft and filled with a delighful, subtle vanilla pastry cream resplendent with flecks of vanilla bean running through it and the surrounding 'roon was nothing short of magical.  When dining at Gordon Ramsay's seminal triple starred Royal Hospital Road the petit fours served at the end of the meal usually feature a macaroon or two and these were better even than those.

I assume the proprietor of Miette is French because the deftness of hand in evidence is genetically impossible to replicate if you are not of the Gallic gene pool.  Impossible.
author: Tony S.

description:
Miette is genius. They obviously know their consumer well, and are experts in both eye candy and sugary indulgences. I don't bake much, but I lust after their vintage-inspired glass cake stands. I'm not really a candy fiend, but somehow find myself drooling over their caramels with sea salt, delicately wrapped in wax paper. I don't like macaroons, but in those giant apothecary jars they are scrumptious happy pills.
