I usually avoid anything pink, but walking past their storefront I cannot help but swoon and revel in the joyous girlyness that is Miette. 

Miette does funny things to me and makes me feel all warm and fuzzy. It's a curse and a blessing that I live far away in Cincinnati, but twice I have had to prematurely tear myself away from the perfection to catch a flight back home. But not without proudly displaying my new pink paper bag of airy, crunchy, chewy, sweet pieces of heaven. oh, somebody help me!
author: Ada K.

description:
This little shop is so clean and cute..pink and white! Their macarons are SO good! The macaron cookies come in nutty or chocolate flavors; I haven't seen the fruity ones yet. The macaron cookies are so chewy and not air-ry like other places I'd tried. Their filling is rich in whatever flavor you order. My favorite one is the hazelnut one.

Their cupcakes are okay, but not particularly unique. The cake is moist, but the cream is too thick and to oily for me.  

It's a little hard to find parking sometimes, but I would definitely go back again and again just for their macarons!
author: Mandy C.

description: Their macaroons are great I recently picked some up as a present and they had a passion fruit flavor which I hadn't tried before. It was delightful and they are great for sharing you can get a dozen and try different flavors. I'm sure they would make a great addition to any day party or event.
author: Maria M.

description: OMG, anything chocolate from Miette is orgasmically delicious. They use super-high quality chocolate and nothing is overwhelmingly sweet -- just perfection. I dream of their chocolate sables and pots de creme. Walnut shortbread: a little piece of heaven. It's a routine stop after the salty tasty pig parts place.
author: Karen N.

description:
this is where i fell in love...

WITH MACAROONS!!!

i stumbled upon this gem by mistake...whenever i'm around or here for the farmer's market.. i always get some of their macaroons before i leave.. they are really good... i'm still waiting to be in the mood for the panna cotta.. but so far my favs are the hazelnut, vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate french macaroons

note to the baker/creater: THANK YOU.. i love your creations.. keep up the awesome work
author: KK M.

description:
I'm addicted to their macarons. Chewy on the inside and outside with creamy filling. They can get overly sweet when I eat more than 2. I think that's a good thing because it stops me from buying a ton and getting fat.

I wish it were easier to differentiate between flavors. All the flavors look exactly the same so when the sales clerk placed all the macarons in one bag, I couldn't tell which one was hazelnut and which one was pistachio. The differences in taste is also very subtle.
author: Jane C.

description: Super cute store in the Ferry Building with a bunch of yummy things I want to buy.  If only everything wasn't so expensive!  We got a pack of 6 small marshmallows for $5.  The sweet fluffy pillows or sugary air tasted too similar to a bag of marshmallows you would find at your local grocer.  Their French macaroons looked tasty but unimaginative.  We bought one of each flavor and came to find out when we got home that it was near impossible to tell which was which.  Usually you can say, "the red one is the raspberry flavor", but these were all beige with cream colored filling.  Can you say, BORING?  Give me some food coloring, please! haha
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Since I was in the Ferry Building today, and I ADORE French macarons, I had to stop and check out Miette, since I've been told that macarons are what they are known for.  The shop is so cute, and their presentation of everything is impeccable!  Everything looked so good that hubby and I were so tempted to take home one of each item that they had.

But we exercised restraint and stuck to trying some of their macarons.  Had both the pistachio and the hazelnut.  They were fresh and tender, but yet, struck me as just "meh."  They were too sweet for my taste, and the sugary-ness actually over-powered the subtle flavors of the cookies.  In fact, hubby had initially thought they had accidentally given us chocolate macarons instead of the hazelnut, because the nuttiness was too understated.  It would have been nice if the cookies had a little more "pop" taste-wise.  But for just $1.75 each, it was still a worthwhile investment.  It just wasn't the best I've ever had.
author: Jane Y.

description: high rating for super girly fem decorations, good macarons, chocolate pudding and super adorable cakes ... a little expensive but I get it.  I mostly go here to get a dose of cuteness don't really buy anything unfortunately.
author: Arcelia G.

description:
Absolutely beautiful pasteries and desserts. I love walking by to just peak at these dainty treats. The gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting was so wonderful I almost teared up when it was gone. 

The cupcakes are very expensive ($4 each), but it is a great way to treat yourself and feel almost as pretty as your cupcake.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I had high hopes...

I wanted to try the gingersnaps and macarons.  I didn't want a whole box of gingersnaps though...just one...so i ended up not getting it

I bought 5 macarons - vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut, strawberry, and one more...forget which.  I ate the vanilla and hazelnut.  The 2 stars are for the flavor - not too sweet, and not artificial-tasting.  

However, the texture is disapointing.  They're too mushy!  My favorite macarons are Macaron Cafe in NYC - either they're getting it wrong, or Miette is.  Either way, I like the one's at Macaron Cafe better - lighter and chewier.  The ones at miette are way too soft and dense, and they feel a lot heavier.  I'm so sad I got too excited and bought  5 :(

Sigh.  I went to La Boulange and Chantal Guillon today too...none of them lived up to my expectations.

The macarons are very good-sized though.  That's the one plus.  I need to try the gingersnaps one day
author: Katie L.

description:
we got the Scharffen Berger, and banana cream pie.

i have to say they are such fine cakes, and it was worth every penny.
author: Danielle A.

description: Wow, I was REALLY disappointed with their cake. Miette has the most wonderful cupcakes, but their cake was dry and hard as a rock. I even followed the instructions to let it set for 3 hours to warm to room temperature. If I had made this cake in home economics, I would have failed the class.
author: Mark H.

description: Miette is still Miette. My "perfect" description still applies two years later. Fantastic. The rose geranium macaroons remain my favorite.
author: Jason R.

description: I always walk by this place until the lady wanted cupcakes.  So we got cupcakes.  She was scarfing 1 out of the 2 bought down and she asked me if I wanted it.  I said "No"  She then took a bite and force fed me a bit of the other cupcake.  Can i say "son of a b****" I should've had that one to myself.  These cupcakes here are B-O-M-B!!!!!  Delicious!  As I've made my way back here, I've eaten the macaroons!  They're made correctly and they tasted great!
author: Limzer L.

description: I love this place and each time I have to get a cuppie and French Macaroon cookies.  I can't resist.
author: Donna Y.

description: Come here to experience the ultimate macaron!  These little bad boys are super delicious, but comes with one hefty price tag...$1.50 a piece!  Their chocolate madeleines are just decent in comparison to the macarons. The bags of peanut butter cookies are all right and at $5 it isn't too terribly expensive in comparison to the rest of their items.
author: Lisa R.

description: My sweet tooth is in love with Miette's lavender shortbread cookies.
author: Angie C.

description: This place is a bit pricey but I'll forgive that as they are in a high profile location and just want to make money of them tourists. Anyway, I love the scones here and the little Old fashioned cupcakes. I haven't tried 1anything else, but when I do get a higher paying job I may be back!
author: Petra S.

description: You know, this hurts. This place is as charming as all get out, but...I bought a lemon cake for my SIL's birthday. Cost me $50. Boy was my MIL impressed! My niece was graduating, so i decided to make a cake for her....a very different cake so the experience would be very different. I made a chocolate cake from a mix and added half a package of diet pudding. Well, my chocolate cake was a hit. The lemon Miette cake was grainy and weird. Was just OK. And guy, I'm no Sarah Lee. My niece's friends ate that chocolate cake like they were starving to death. The Miette cake just sat there. I actually felt sorry for it.
author: Suzanne R.

description: Chocolate lavender macaron was amazing! Love the lavender shortbread too!
author: Brenda H.

description:
I have bought one thing at this place and it was so cute and fantastic, I wish I could come here more often.  

I got the old fashioned (I think that is what it was called) cake.  A chocolate cake, with marshmallow frosting and a cherry on top.  That's all folks.  Simple but to die for.

ciao ciao.
author: Michael C.

description: This is a prime example of wishing the Top 100 list didn't ruin a food for me.  It's like with all the hype;there's just no way expectations can be met.  The first time my girlfriend bought a pack of the gingersnaps and they were stale.  Ding.  I came to purchase a pack myself, hoping for amazing.  I thought the gingersnaps were good but not Top 100 worthy.  The packaging and storefront is indeed cute and chic.  Perhaps, I should veer off the list and try something else.
author: erika n.

description:
Too much anticipation was built up, after I saw the pictures on their website. The cakes look as good and elegant as they seem on the website

Their macaroons are heavenly! Never before I've eaten such fresh and tender macaroons

We also went for the MIni Scharffen Berger Cake. That was just OK. The cake was crumbly, although the exterior covering was authentic Scharffen Berger

A nice way to finish a meal, after devouring the cheese sandwich from Acme
author: Manish P.

description:
This place in overall presentation was enough to attract me to this cute bakery. 

I tried the Caramel Panna Cotta and the Eclair. The panna cotta was enough to give this patisserie shop a 5 star. It was very creamy, light, and in a big enough proportion to not be bored of the dessert. You pay $4 for the panna cotta, if you ate it there, you can give them back a jar, and get refunded $1, which was kinda odd. They should probably consider having a package that cost less, which will bring the overall price down instead of the cute little glass jar. The Eclair was disappointing. The filling was delicious, very light, and at a good balance for the sweetness. I did not, however, like the choux pastry was not as crispy nor as light and crunchy as i liked. The chocolate was also not all that smooth. 

Overall, if you enjoy very cute dessert packaged in pastel pink and blues, you will love this place.
author: Linda L.

description:
delicious and adorable! didn't try any cupcakes... and i've never had macaroons before... BUT
the hazelnut macaroon was amazing. the creme fraiche scone was fantastic. and the panna cotta was incredible! 

i def recommend trying the panna cotta - smooth, creamy, not too sweet, and topped with delicious fresh strawberries. mmmmmmmmmm! it's $4, but you get $1 back when you return the jar. yummy!
author: Aletheia W.

description:
Let me just say that if your ever in the mood for french pasteries, this is the perfect place. The strawberry macaroon is simply amazing. The light and crisp almond meringue cookies binded with rich cream make for the most perfect bite. 

Definitely an excuse to visit the ferry building in SF!
author: Javeria K.

description: Holy moly macaron-y. The pistachio macaron is moan-inducingly delicious. I will have to put Miette on my Must-Taste list for my next trip up to SF to try the other goodies.
author: Amy L.

description: A colleague bought a birthday cake from Miette a few months back.  I thought it was good, but a bit dry and overpriced for the quality.  I've been here a few times and bought a few macarons, cupcakes, Madeleines and ginger cookies.  The Macarons & Madeleines are pretty good, but the cup cake is also a bit on the dry side.  Ginger cookies were good, but not really extraordinary.  On the whole, it's a pretty place.  The decor is a touch too feminine, but I'm probably not their target audience.  It has a  cute exterior, but the quality is not in line with the presentation and appearance, especially for the price.
author: Paul K.

description:
I've bought mini cakes here for special occasions. This is far and away the nicest bakery downtown, and the organic ingredients fit in with the whole Ferry Building foodie vibe.

The clerks are always friendly, even if the prices aren't as friendly.
author: Timothy O.

description:
I'm gonna give Miette Cakes another chance, right now they can have three stars.

I had a similar experience to Arnold G., I got a yellow cupcake with chocolate frosting. While the buttercake was somewhat dry, the chocolate icing was the best I've ever had. I even cleaned out the leftover icing mess in the box it came in.
author: kate r.

description:
I tried the Parisian macaroons based on a friend's suggestion and now I'm addicted. The chocolate orange flavor is to die for and the size is a perfect little sweet snack. 

Haven't tried anything else because I can't get past those Parisian macaroons!
author: Lee H.

description:
Having worked near Miette for a couple of years now, I've been in on numerous occasions. I love their macaroons (just perfectly chewy), their scones (little bites, so there's little guilt involved), and their shortbread (not too buttery). In all of my purchases, however, my absolute favorite has been the raspberry princess cake (chocolate cake with the most wonderful raspberry filling/frosting) I got for my birthday two years ago. It was the very last week for raspberries--I love that they keep to seasonal ingredients--so I got the last cake they made with them that year, but the whole thing was delicious!

The only thing I dislike about Miette is the prices. I know they use really good ingredients, but I find it really hard to shell out the money required for just a few little macaroons or a bag of shortbread. Still, everything is so tasty that I am willing to splurge on occasion.
author: Katie I.

description:
It was here I discovered that past my cupcake obsession I have a sweet tooth.

First the cupcake.  I ordered the Old Fashioned.  A chocolate cupcake with Italian meringue.  FANTASTIC.  

Their caramel popcorn and meringues were so good too.  Makes me wish I could Ferry Building it everyday.
author: Katie F.

description: These pastries are a little expensive, but you have to try the cookies in the huge jars. They are so awesome and sometimes they run out so you have to get there quick! I haven't had the cupcakes, but i heard that they are pretty good.
author: Garrett L.

description: I think this place is over rated.  The macaroons were SO small for $1.75!  I definitely like Bouchon Bakery better.   And a little too sweet for me.  We also bought the scharffen berger cake and that was very bla for me.  The shop is for sure super cute.
author: Piggy S.

description: I love you Miette Patisserie! A small stand inside the ferry building but holds enough goodies to make your heart and tummy happy.  My fave macaron place yet.  Please open shop in SoCal.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Unbelievable Pistachio Cookies! I've only been here a few times, these are the best cookies I have ever had in my life.

The term 'melt in your mouth' was derived from this cookie. 

This is a great little pastry shop in the Ferry Building, and while I have only purchased this cookie, I would highly recommend visting this establishment at least once.

Their cakes look remarkable and they have a great selection of other pasties, but do be prepared to pay a little more than usual.
author: Mike K.

description:
It's all about the Macaroons at this place.  Where else can you get these delicious goodness!  It is a treat at $1.50 a bite, but it's well worth every ounce of it. 

They also offer a very nice packaging for a box of them.  Get a box of these and a bottle of wine and you've got a great gift for the next dinner party you're attending.  Let me know when I should invite you over  ;)
author: Helen C.

description: i had been searching for macaroons forever and was finally in the city so i decided to stop here. The vanilla macaroon was delicious, i wish i had bought a whole box. I also got the yellow cupcake with the best strawberry frosting i've ever had. BUT the cake was chewy and blah, it was almost as if the cake was old and had been soaked with a syrup to stay "fresh" I'd only go back for macaroons!
author: Amanda T.

description: can't go wrong with any of the macaroons.. at $1.75 that's a steal! if you can only pick 1 flavor (heaven forbid) get the rose-geranium!
author: Jen C.

description:
The ingredients they use here are so good for you that it's BAD.  Not bad meaning bad, but bad meaning GOOD! Run DMC

Every trip I make out to the ferry building, I have to find out if they have the caramel pot de creme in stock.  It normally sells out on the weekends.  You get this little jar when you buy it and it reminds me of a custard my mom used to make.  Everything here is pretty good, it just depends on your taste.  Be careful with the Macaroons to go because they get crushed pretty easily.
author: Jason A.

description:
Every time I visit SF, this cute little French patisserie is a MUST for me.  Their lovely Macaroons (please, please don't butcher the pronunciation!) are always such a treat - I even bring them back to NY as gifts to my dear friends and family.

Last time, I tried their Banana Cream Tart and leisurely enjoyed it outside with the Bay Bridge before me.  Had a chat with a pleasant gentleman from NYC who also lived in SF.  I can't tell you how much all this reminiscing is upsetting me.

Oh Miette...
author: Claire Y.

description:
Aww aren't they cute.  The prettiest little cakes this side of the Mississippi.  My friend Steven K was kind enough to get a gingerbread cake from Miette for my birthday.  It was lovely and had decadent cream cheese frosting. So moist, so Delicious.  Another cake to try is the lemon debutante.  Even if you aren't usually a fan of lemon sweets, this is the cake to convert you.  

The shop itself, located in the ferry building, is just as cute as the cakes.  On the other hand, the girls who work there are not so sweet.  I just want some sugar high Stepford wife with rosy cheeks to be standing behind the cheerful tiny cakes.  Last time I stopped in to pick up a sweet cake the girls were a little bitter. It confused me.  Sweet cakes, bitter cake workers?  I don't get it.  Maybe they could hire some oompa loompas.
author: Alexis M.

description: Whenever I am in town, I make sure to bring home a box of macarons and fleur de sel caramels.  Everything about this place makes me happy. Everything.
author: Hannah B.

description: The Italian Meringue is my favorite on anything! I brought home the Lime Tart for desert with the BF and now I have to bring it home on a regular basis.  Its a bit pricey and the line can be very long but it always puts a smile on my face after the first bite!
author: Noelle B.

description:
Miette...would really love to give you 5 stars.  Your macarons are divine and chocolate wafers and graham crackers are perfect in every way.

HOWEVER......please do something about the attitudes of your girls behind the counter.  Most of them act as if they hate working there.  Why would you hate the place?  It's so sweet!  So c'mon Miette girls, crack a smile, engage in a little conversation with the customers, and take those damn sticks out of your a$$es!  It's a shame that a place that has such delicious goodies can have girls with such bitchy attitudes.  

And owners of Miette....you guys really should read through the Yelp reviews and do something about your staff.  Still love your pistachio and hazelnut macarons though!
author: JDC S.

description:
Very tasty, very pretty but a little overpriced. 

The pot de creme is really spectacular and the cute little pot they put it in is an added plus.  Of course you can return it for a $1 refund, but why?
author: H. Q.

description:
I'm such a sucker for a pretty little cupcake.  It's hard to make up your mind what to buy.  ( especially if you're on a budget )  I have to say, it was not their cupcakes *taste wise* that impressed me.  I found their chocolate cupcake with vanilla butter cream frosting to be really none of the above... vanilla-y, buttery, or creamy.  It basically just tasted like heavy cream with some sprinkles on top... not what I expected.  I also bought one of their old fashion cupcakes, which was much more palatable, but not out of this world.   All of their cakes were so precious looking though... I really wanted to try them all.    
Definitely what is worth another trip back were their Fleur de Sel caramels.  OMG  2.DIE.4. !!!    I wish I had bought more than 2......
My mouth just started salivating just thinking about  those salty-sweet treats  :(  this is torture.
author: Laurin A.

description:
FERRY PLAZA FRUGAL:  Then, there are those freakin' macaroons!  At  $1.50 a pop this Paris on the cheap.  Snatch a sample coffee at Peet's if you've got the skills.  Compared to the macaroons at Boulange which are incredible, too, Miette wins for aesthetics.  The macaroons are perfectly round, cookies have a nice, puffy rise and the filling is spread generously and evenly.  I hope they stay consistent.  Incredible flavours abound.  My favs:  pistachio, choco-orange, vanilla, lemon.  Like sweet air!

This place gets FIVE stars because it was one of the FIRST times since I graduated grade school that my mom actually enjoyed a gift I gave her.  HELLO?  It was the lemon shortbread.  If you have a mom like my mom-- perfectionist, indulgent, VIRGO-- this is the way to go.  

I haven't tried the cupcakes, cake or the pudding pot with the cool bulb glass that you get to keep (for an extra $1?), but they look quite inviting.  Not quite as economical though as the macaroons.

They also get five stars for their marketing and design.  The unassuming little patisserie with the pale pink shopping bags.  And, I hate pink most of the time, but how could they have gone any other way?  The precision of each item.  From the paper chosen to wrap the caramels to the perfectly centered cherry on top of the "old-fashioned" cake and cupcake tells me there's some passionate, masterminding (VIRGO?) mother-of-all behind the breathtaking scenes.
author: E L.

description:
Their cakes are pretty,  like a Martha Stewart cover come to life.  
But they didn't taste very good - we bought the Old Fashioned chocolate cake as an Easter dinner hostess gift - everyone ooed and ahhed because it's really super duper cute - but it was kind of dry and not very chocolatey.  Nobody finished their slice.
author: Robyn C.

description:
Eh. Everything is super cute but it was super disappointing. 

I have been wanting a cupcake from Miette for quite a while but I never felt like I deserved a $3 cupcake. Until today. I think that it was the sunshine on my skin and the thrill of wearing summer whites after Labor Day.

I live life in the fast lane. 

SO, I picked the chocolate raspberry because pink and brown are really pretty together and there was a little white candy daisy on top that matched my dress. Okay, barf at how girlie this is but this is how I really felt. I'm still riding the hormone high of the cycle. 

The frosting was nice and smooth but the raspberry flavor was muted. There was only a faint aroma of raspberry that would have been missed if not for the pinky frosting. The cake was light and fluffy and chocolately but there was a strange after taste that felt chemical-like in my mouth. Maybe chemical-ly isn't the right. How about artificial?

Two stars for the super cute store front and presentation.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I love this place!  

It's my "must stop" when I visit the Ferry Building.  Even though I've never had their cakes, I love to look at the petite-ness.  A must get are their macroons.  They always have a variety of flavors and are simply divine!
author: Juliana T.

description:
My friend and I split a banana cream tartlette and a lime meringue tartlette. I can't really describe them, but they were fluffy, creamy, and oh so tasty. THEY WERE HEAVEN. But, the madeleines.. not so much.

 I will try the macaroons and cupcakes next time. We were gonna go with cupcakes, but the selection didn't look that.. special.

EDIT
stick with the tartlettes, they're the best..
author: C. Z.

description:
this is such a cute store. Everything is in pastel colors - cute and chic. Visually it seems like the store that would curb your sweet tooth addition and desert cravings right? wrong...

I was sadly disappointed when my much raved about old fashioned cupcake was rather dry and low on the chocolate-y flavor. I hate to say this but I would rather have cake mix.  The cupcake looked gorgeous and cute in its petite take out box with a pink sticker. So pretty it looked like one of those fake plastic replicas you see in the Japanese stores. Sadly, thats what it tastes like.

Co-worker also tried to pot de creme which I tried a spoonful of. Plastic-y taste there too. came in a cute little 'miette' glass pot which you can return for a $1.

1 star for being such an adorable cute store.
author: Scarlet S.

description:
First time I've been here today.  I'm a pig and I'm going to get fatter because of this (worth it)

1 - Vanilla macaroon - crispy thin layer and chewy inside DELICIOUS!!
1 - Chocolate macaroon - same as above and even more DELICIOUS!!

1 - Mini something something - forgot the name but its like a half a chocolate cupcake call covered in chocolate - not that great, kinda dry.

2 pieces of their homemade caramels - if you like something sweet and salty these are ok.  I got the 2 pieces free for sampling.

Looks like they do well since half of the stuff there was all gone!

Macaroons are #1
author: Victoria R.

description:
$3. That's all it costs to enter food heaven.

These cupcakes are the best I've ever eaten in my life. I embarass myself when I get a tasty treat from here.

I also tried the macaroons ($1.50 apiece) - the strawberry and the chocolate lavender. They were bready, soft, and scrumptious, but I'd wish I'd spent my money on the cupcake instead.

Their icing is AMAZING. And the cake is so moist.

They're just the right size - though they seem small.
author: elaine m.

description:
I walked by today and once I located the cupcake section, I started drooling. It looked soooo good AND it knew my name. I had to try one - after all, I need a nice dessert to go with my lunch.

Meh. The cupcake was good but I've certainly had better at other places. I had one of the chocolate ones - not the original. For now, it's 3 stars. I will come back and try to let another cupcake win my heart so we'll see.
author: Barney M.

description:
oh good god.

the girls were soooo nice & friendly and steered us into lots of goodness.

the pistachio french macaroon is killer.
also we loved the vanilla cream on chocolate cupcake.
we also got that ganache chocolate dome cake with the fancy name i forgot....crazy good. who can resist this place?

great goods & superb service. 
kudos.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: Since it was on my list of 100 things to try before I die, I just had to stop by Miette and try their ginger snaps. They were crisp and rich, but it did feel like I was eating a stick of butter. There was not that big of ginger flavor, which is unfortunate as I love ginger. I don't know if I would get them again, but I would like to come back and try their cupcakes.
author: Jan Z.

description: Miette is fantastic. The bumblebee and lemon curd cake are delicious. The mocha chocolate cupcake, the "Hostess"-like cupcake, and the decadent Scharfenberger cake are also tasty highlights. The gingerbread cake, though popular, is not that interesting; and the strawberry cake is not spectacular. I'd opt for the aforementioned treats.
author: Chris T.

description:
4 stars for quality, flavor, concept, and creativity.

  I am a savory in lieu of  sweets kinda girl so keep that in mind for this review. My friend loves a good cupcake so I decided to surprise her with some from Miette. I'm a sucker for places that exude an artistic quality and Miette fits that bill to a T.  I chose 3 cupcakes which were, lemon, chocolate raspberry, and gingerbread I believe. I also got a rose macaroon which was divine. The cupcakes themselves were moist and not offensively sweet to my sensitive palate. My only complaint, and I know I'm in the vast minority here, I think there was too much frosting. I wound up scooping about half of it off and throwing it away. A travesty in many people's mind I'm sure. While I'm not an expert on sweets or cupcakes, Miette definitely deserves 4 stars for quality, concept, creativity, and flavor.
author: chelsea b.

description: Lamest review ever, but seriously, everything is good here...from the shortbread bookies to the evil Scharffenberger molton cake.  I order cupcakes for my firm here, and they are always appreciated - good quality ingredients.
author: Rayna A.

description: My favorite bakery in the City.  First time I ever tasted a french macarroon was at the Miette counter.  They're chewy, delicious morsels from heaven.  My other fav sweet treats are:  the gingerbread cupcakes w/ cream cheese frosting, the banana tart, buttermilk panna cotta, and the princess cake.  I love that they take the time to make all of their desserts so beautiful and still taste incredibly good.
author: Lauren S.

description:
The Old Fashion Cupcake is so... cute! Its dark chocolate cake, not too sweet, with a pillow of white boiled frosting and a cherry red candy covered peanut on top. The frosting is nothing like I've ever tasted. I must make a friend here to learn this recipe. It has the lightness of Cool Whip and slightly sticky like a melted marshmallow. 

I've also tried the macaroons, walnut cookies, and candied almonds - all are excellent and I have a hard time getting my hands on the almonds; they are always sold out by the time I get there. 

Here's a tidbit and the reason I remembered I had to post about Miette: 
I was watching The Food Network on Saturday where they had a Cupcake Challenge in 2005. I was bored so I watched and to my surprise the owner of Miette was in the contest making her perfect little Old Fashion's!!! How cool is that, their cupcakes are so good they are selected to be in one of those challenges!
author: CW K.

description:
although i loved the pistachio macaroon i had, maybe it was because i ordered JUST ONE that i got this "look" from the lady that helped me out.  maybe i'm interpreting it wrong, but she kind of glanced at my mom, who was admiring the pastries, like we didn't belong there.

well, EXCUSE us for wearing sweats and dressing down at the ferry building and WHO CARES if i'm just getting ONE?  i just stuffed my face at a nearby restaurant and i am extremely full.  well EXCUSE ME!  let me just hop into my BEEMER and drive off!  

i'm sure there are a lot of other places in the city where i can get a macaroon just as good without discrimination...
author: Christine P.

description:
Adorable packaging and location, but way over priced for what it is. I've only had the macarons so I can't speak for the other baked goods, but I bought 4 of them (at $1.50 each, ouch!) of 4 different flavors and I just ate them and can't tell any of the flavors apart! I know one of them was the rosewater flavor and figured I would definitely be able to pick that one out, but I couldn't. And one of them was stale!!! 

The woman working behind the counter was also pretty rude. I know the Ferry Building can be kind of crazy on a weekend, but no need to be rude to someone paying $1.50 for a stale cookie.

bummer :( the cupcakes looked delicious, maybe I'll try one of those next time.
author: Kathryn A.

description: My dad was in SF a few weeks ago and I asked him to bring me home some macarons... still delicious! I spoke with someone on the phone and told her I wanted 3 of each flavor and she put them into a box so they wouldn't be crushed on the flight home! My cousins from Taiwan said they were so expensive in Taiwan they've never bought them and were super excited when my dad bought a few for them to try. I think I've got them addicted to this place now too.
author: Esther L.

description:
Miette makes my favorite cupcakes, and by cupcakes I mean exquisite gifts from God.  

Start off with an old fashioned cupcake: dense and chocolatey, this is NOT one of those made-from-a-mix desserts you just want to lick the frosting off of.  Speaking of frosting, though, this one's got a heaping mound of the buttercream variety, garnished simply with a red hot candy.  Then, just when you think life can't get any better, take a bite of Miette's fabulous gingerbread cupcake.  Don't be fooled by its small stature and simple adornment!  This little confection is a spicy-sweet suckerpunch made from dark stout beer, molasses, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon and cardamom, and finally topped with an unbelievably buttery cream cheese frosting.

Miette's Parisian macarons provide an equally delicious contrast to their cupcakes: thin layers of delicate filling sandwiched between two light-as-a-cloud miniature cookies, all glazed and available in several flavors (hazelnut being the best, in my opinion). 

Fortunately for all hungry San Franciscans, this Ferry Building bakery lives up to it's 55-review hype.  Do yourself a favor and sample a few of their rich, organic treats.
author: Karin H.

description:
Great organic pastries if a little pricey. But since I only get things as a treat, not a big deal. The cupcakes are cute and tasty. The other items that I would recommend are the French macaroons and the shortbreads especially lemon.

***3.7.07 I have to also say that the graham cracker cookies are fantastic. Not too sweet and has a nice crunch.
author: cyndi L.

description:
I don't know whether to give 2 or 3 stars!  

The macarons are delightful.  I have loved every flavor I've tried.  4 stars.

The cupcakes were dry and tasted day old.  I took one bite & threw out the rest.  Please don't freeze then serve this kind of cake, Miette! Minus 1 Star.

The icky cupcake made me afraid to buy a larger cake.  Star-neutral.

But I go back for the macarons, and I guess they get 3 stars.  I can't talk myself into 2 for a place I'll go back to.
author: Bruce S.

description:
If you haven't been able to have a bite of a Miette sublime treat, put your laptop away, shut off your pc and get immediately to the Ferry Building.  Do not pass go, do not collect $200 dollars. Tell Meg thank you from Brian for creating desserts that will wow, even a non sweet tooth person.

oh, get a cupcake.
author: Brian G.

description:
Going to keep this one short and simple: Perfect location, perfect cupcake. 

My vote for best cupcake in the city goes to Miette's Gingerbread, found in my favorite place in the city - the Ferry Building.
author: Erika C.

description:
Come here for the french macaroons, not the cupcakes.

Cupcakes are just okay; pretty to look at but too greasy for me.
author: Deanna K.

description:
Every boy need a place he can go when he needs out of the dog house...

The cupcakes are so delicious and yummy - there perfect with a tall glass of milk. So- if you find your self in trouble with your love one- head on down too Miette for a lovers treat.
author: swys -.

description:
Fist of all, this little bakery is so cute that I just want to live here.  I want my kitchen to look like this little shop!

I have had 2 things at this bakery as I do a pretty good job at not letting myself go overboard and eat the whole place up every time I walk by.  

1. Cupcakes: I brought some cupcakes to a small bday party and everyone loved them.  There was vanilla, chocolate, and gingerbread.  They were all really really good.  Soft, moist, sweet, the frosting was creamy and just the right amount of sweetness, not crazy sugary like some places.  The frosting just complimented the cupcake really well.

2. French Macaroons: not to sound snobby, but the last time I had macaroons like this was at this patisserie in Paris where we had to stand in line for 40 minutes.  These are so yummy!  Slightly crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside, and the flavors are so good.  I've had chocolate orange, vanilla, lavender, pistachio, but I really don't think you can go wrong.  I take the BART from the Embarcadero station so sometimes when I've been good, I treat myself to a couple macaroons for the ride home.
author: Doris L.

description: Buttermilk panna cotta + chocolate pot de creme come in a perfect small glass jar serving.  Chocolate and lavender compete with each other in the chocolate-lavender macaron.  Cupcakes have too much (strawberry) buttercream frosting to eat before you can get to the actual chocolate gingerbread cake.  I recommend the vanilla macaron.  The cashier was nice enough to offer us free samples of pistachio and rose macarons from a rejected order.
author: Ai M.

description:
Love this place! It's a bit expensive, but when you're in a touritsy mood at Embarcadero, definitely check this place out and get yourself one macaroon - that will tease you and you won't be able to help yourself but to go for a second!

They have excellent cupcakes as well. They're very soft and moist, and the portion is not too big (this may not be a plus for some people, but I can only take so much cupcake at once).  There are not that many desserts that leave me with a feeling of "that was worth the calorie" - well, this place is definitely one of the few!!!
author: Lindsey O.

description:
They have my husband's dollar on their wall because it was the first one they earned!!

He loves their chocolate flourless cake but it's way too rich for me. We both ADORE the chocolate & butterscotch pots de creme. I don't think I've tried anything else.

They're really great about taking special event orders and keeping it in their fridge until you come for pick-up.

And they have some really cute ceramics -- serving plates, cake stands, and so forth.
author: Marina N.

description:
I've been here several times but each time I always get the macroons. This time I give it three stars for the macaroons. I tried the rose petal, lavender and hazelnut. I thought it was a little bit on the moist side.    

I tried try the cupcakes next time.  

Cute decor.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
It's all about its MACARONS. Try every flavor in each jar. They have the perfect dose of sweetness and creaminess. Only after trying these will you truly understand why Nora from Henrik Ibsen's A Doll House was so obsessed with macaroons.

The LEMON TART was okay. The store didn't have any fruit tarts (which are my favorite) so I thought I would give this a try, but I wouldn't get it again. It was too sour but sugary at the same time.

I also tried the yellow strawberry CUPCAKE, which tasted not any better than the ones from Safeway.

The line was super long, probably because I visited on a Sunday afternoon, but from the perspective of a recent college graduate with a business major, this store has a very poor operational management - the two cashiers were doing everything from answering questions about the pastries to gift wrapping boxes. Come on now.
author: Kelly G.

description: hmm I just dont remember anything special about this place. sorry
author: Hellbilly M.

description:
This is where you fall in love with the Macaron. I felt like I died and had gone to heaven. When I bit into their pistachio macaron I felt my knees buckle and I had to stomp my feet so I wouldn't fall. LOL. I know... but it isn't an exaggeration. That was what really happened. They are about $1.50 for one which widened my eyes when I saw that but it was definitely worth it. I'm glad I live in Stockton or all my money would go to those damn macarons...

I had their cupcakes, chocolate on chocolate, chocolate on vanilla, vanilla on vanilla and vanilla on chocolate. The chocolate frosting kind of tasted like Nutella but it had a smooth mousse-like texture so it melted in your mouth. The cake however was kind of like cornbread but good flavor. They were good but I wish there was more variety when I went there. 

I didn't know they were an organic patisserie until months after I went there. I was surprised because something that delicious had to have some kind of artificial aid.

The service is very friendly. I babbled on to a girl about how I drove all the way from Stockton and she conversed with me until they closed. She was very helpful, I just wish I got her name...

Their prices are steep but well worth it. I'll be back to try more of their pastries.
author: Kelly F.

description: They have a gingerbread cupcake, so I ordered it. The cake itself was moist and flavorful, simply fantastic, but that's half the battle. The frosting just threw me off. I would have been happy with a simple cream cheese or even better, cinnamon buttercream frosting, but this was too tangy and did not complement the holiday spice going on in the cake below. But I can't hate too much, it was a great cake.
author: Eric T.

description:
their cupcakes are very good. I like that they are not huge!!!! 

I didn't get to try anything else they had (cookies, macarons etc).... but their cupcakes are very good!!!

give em' a try!
author: James O.

description:
My husband and I got married last year and we were thinking long and hard where to get our anniversay cake.  We stumbled upon the cute chocolate heart shape cake that Miette has for V-Day and were so excited to try it.  After reading so many great reviews on Yelp, the Scharffenberger chocolate cake just had to be good, right?  WRONG.

We spend Saturday morning at Farmers shopping, eating and finally went to pick up our pre-ordered cake.  Excited to try it so we went home.  Took some pictures, cut it and thought...wow, this cake is really dense.  We took a bite.... and IT WAS SO DRY.  The cake was so dry that it tasted like it was made at least 3-4 days ago.   I know we pre-ordered but I don't expect the cake to be made until the morning of.   This was the worst cake we've had in our life.  And I love desserts.  For $35, we could have bought a better tasting cake from Safeway.   We offered some to my nephew who loves chocolate and he took a bit and didn't want anymore.  DISAPPOINTING.
author: Pam N.

description: Thanks to my pal, Janice C., I got to taste the ginger snaps from Miette (gotta love that Janice C.  always lookin' out for fellow foodies).  I have to say, they aren't really exceptional as far as ginger snaps go.  I mean, I liked them because I'm a big fan of ginger snaps, but, i know I might catch some flack for this one, I think the Nabisco ginger snaps are better than these!  These do have a nice gingery-ness to them that leaves a little tingle on your tongue, but I like them to have a little more sweetness to them.  Plus, for $6.50, I can get two boxes of Nabisco ginger snaps and probably some milk to boot.  Miette doesn't lose any stars, but I'll just stick to the macarons when I go there.
author: Eileen H.

description:
Oh, the salted caramel! Unbelievably good. Crack for the candy loving crowd.

 I don't live in San Fran so I am going to have to order some online now that I am officially addicted.
author: Carmel B.

description: I love this little sweets shop. Best macarons ever (had the pistachio). Do not get just one.
author: Ashley H.

description: So what if it's a little bit pricey, its all definitely worth it! Everything here looked amazing, I got the chocolate wafers and a few other little goodies, enjoyed every bit of it!
author: Ciara A.

description:
DROOOOOOL.......

Three dollar cupcakes never tasted better or disappeared faster, especially the gingerbread ones with icing that feels like a giant cloud in your mouth.

A little $, but so worth it.
author: Angela C.

description:
"French macarons . . . try eating just one!" 

Agreed. They melt in your mouth.
author: Erin H.

description:
I was very disappointed by the cupcakes.  I am a cupcake whore and my tum-tum shows that I have the cred...anyway, the frosting was meh - flavorless and crumbly (gross) and the cake was very blah.  Not sweet enough for my tastebuds.  

If you are a fan of very sweet & delicious cupcakes, go elsewhere.
author: Emily W.

description:
Miette is a very cute and sweet shop tucked away in the Ferry Building.  The cupcakes are good, but not overly impressive.  I do like the mini pot of panna cotta / mini pot of creme --
Still, this place is cute, and it packages its products in light pink paper bags -- and even that bag will put a smile on anyone's face!
author: Rose W.

description:
Oh, Miette, I love you so...

I only wish you weren't so popular so I could have as many pistachio macarons and lime meringue tarts I can possibly fit into my belly. Your fleur de sel caramels are good, too. How are your cakes?I need to try them...maybe Mother's Day would be a good time to sample one! I'm going to your website now. Bye!
author: Nini G.

description:
OH. MY. GOODNESS. 

Miette's pastries are so very good. My absolute favorite is the cocoa cookies that come in a bag of like 12. They are rich and just perfectly sweet without being cloying. Second would be the Lavender shortbread cookies and then the taffies. I haven"t tried their cakes, because I already covet the cookies, I am afraid of eating an entire cake by myself.
author: Lora C.

description: The gingerbread cupcake is the BEST. That's the one I always go back to, definitely try it!
author: HELEN K.

description: Go for cupcakes, sandwich ice cream, macaroon. So far the desserts I got from Miette were very satisfying.
author: Elena L.

description: lemon.shortbread. although they say miette is famous for its ginger snaps, which are always on the 100 things to try before you die in sf list, i cannot get over their lemon shortbread. i know there are like 4 sticks of butter per bag, but i canNOT stop eating them. the indiv lemon tarts are a special treat, and ohhh my goodness, whenever i get there early enough to score a lime tart, my week is MADE! the store itself is absolutely gorgeous - everything my 8 yr old self wanted in a bedroom: pretty pastels, delicate victorian decor, and candycandycandycandyyyy! even their newly published cookbook is cutesie - scalloped pages! i cannot get enough of miette, and am so glad i no longer work a block away - it took me 6 weeks to get rid of those extra 5 lbs!!!
author: annie n.

description:
I have gone out of my way to find reasons to buy cakes from Miette, they're that good. Below are three of my recommendations:

The gingerbread has a perfect balance of spices and sweetness. The frosting was absolutely delectable and not slathered on like you can find at other bakeries.

I'm not a big fan of chocolate (yes, I know, it's odd), but the chocolate layer cake here is worth making an exception. Once again, the cake isn't too sweet and is fairly moist. I think the frosting adds an extra element of...delight. 

My favorite cake, or tart, I should say, is the banana cream. If you call yourself a fan of banana cream desserts, you absolutely must try this tart. Seriously, it's very good.

The prices are a bit much and the cakes a bit small, but I think it's worth the organic ingredients and the overall design of the cakes. Every time I have brought a cake to a party or an event, every one has immensely enjoyed eating a slice.
author: Mary L.

description: You can get the best tasting cupcakes at Miette.  You must try the strawberry & chocolate ones!  They are so good, I get excited every time I think it.  Yes, it's that serious.  The macaroons . . . Oooh the strawberry macaroons, why do they have to be so good!?!  I agree, everything in this shop is on the pricey side . . .  i looked at the price of the chocolate bars and I was like YIKES!  . . .  but definitely give it a try, Miette!s will not let you down.
author: elle c.

description: My girlfriend got me the macaroon cookies there and I was amazed!  It was not good.......it was DELICIOUS!  I didn't expect anything from it, but glad I had one!
author: Joseph C.

description: Best. Macarons. Ever. I liked them better than the ones from the world famous Laduree in Paris, if that says anything. My favorites are the ones with rose in them. Everything is super-cute too!
author: Morgan L.

description: I want the works, I want the whole works, presents and prizes and sweets and surprises in all shapes and sizes, don't care how I want it now!
author: Alex H.

description: Their Traditional Italian Chocolate Cake with Meringue frosting was our first item we tried on the 7x7.com list of 50 sweets to eat in SF before you die. And from all 3 of our opinions, this was not to die for. We liked the cream on top but the cake was just ok. So while it was not horrible it was not special enough for us to make another trip for it.
author: Mona Lisa M.

description: We visited this bakery last year, and the desserts were amazing.  I don't remember the name of one particular dessert, which was a chocolate mousse cake with a ganache on the outside.  This dessert was unforgettable.  I still think about it every once in awhile, but I can't remember the name.  Wow.....so yummy!
author: Yralla L.

description:
Everything in the display case is so adorably presented, I wish I could take one of each item home. I would go broke and double my weight if I tried it, but it's just that tempting.

On the downside, the items are a bit pricey, but the great presentation, the fact that they use all-organic ingredients, and the taste/freshness of the goods all make up for it (plus, they have to pay that Ferry Building rent somehow, right?).

Try the chocolate cream layer cake for pure, dense, indulgent chocolate overload.
author: chocovore s.

description:
One word: macaroons.  

They certainly are pricey at $1.50/each; however, Miette offers the best I've had in SF.  

It's been ages since I've had anything else from the shop (although previous experience with other items didn't wow me due to cost/quality analysis), so I've starred based on what I think they do best. :)
author: Jesse H.

description:
Oh Miette how I LUUUUVVVV you...let me count the ways....when its rainy, or I need a sugar injection...or its busy at work, I jaunt the block and a half from my office to grab these tasteeee treats!  

This is the best sugar injection in the FiDi.

From the amazing carrot cake with cream cheese frosting...to the lemon shortbread cookies...the oatmeal choco chip cookies...the cherry thumbprint cookies...the itsy bitsy pots of chocolat topped by cream in their own petite container....the macaroons...even the jars of preserves are fantastique! (my fav is the strawberry w/meyer lemon preserve)I lUUUUVVVV them all, and even the pretty pink packaging seals the deal....

Nothing has ever disappointed me at Miette. Keep up the great work gals!!!
author: Nickee M.

description:
Disclosure:  I am not a sweet tooth and I love this place.

My big peeves about desserts in general is that they get to fancy (too many elements) or they cannot master the most basic (average chocolate cake usually with average chocolate frosting).  That said, they get it right here.

My two personal favorites are the Old Fashioned Cake and the French Macaroons (macarons).  They are well constructed and the ingredients are top notch.  You can taste all the elements without having to mask them with other things to make them fancy.

Most cakes today especially get heavy handed with frosting to mask what the cake tastes like.  I like the distinct flavor pairings of both.  They should compliment each other not overwhelm.  

This is my non-stop flight to Paris when I need my fix for macarons and coffee.  Everytime I see the Miette bags coming out of the Ferry building it makes me a little anxious my "supply will be cut off". These are quietly addicting even for the non sweet tooth. 

Enjoy!
author: Holly J.

description:
I just love cupcakes! It is a childhood thing, but seems that cupcake is getting a lot of attention for the past couple of years.  You see name like 'Sprinkles', popping up....

I have yet to try Sprinkles, but last week when I saw cupcakes at Miette, my eyes lit up. So pretty, so very cute. BUT wait, it is $3 per tiny cake. Litterally I ate $3 in two bites. Ouch!

First one was the ginger carrot cake kind - so moist, and so yummy. The second one was the most popular one - traditional chocolate - but it is a little on the gluey side, not so good.

Well, i like it but not that much that i would go back again. A little too expensive, and a little too gluey! But everything else looks very presentable and cute! Again, cute!

FYI, Sprinkles is coming to the Bay Area this summer. (Shhh...it is going to be at Stanford Mall, Palo Alto). I can't wait...
author: kelly n.

description:
Oh my sweet jemima.  *drool*

That's all I have to say.

Oh, and the staff is very nice and helpful.  Much better than their pretentious next door neighbor, Ciao Bella Gelato.
author: Christine C.

description: The cupcakes here are really really good.  They are better than Kara's cupcakes.  Yummy creamy frosting!
author: J B.

description:
This is not a cafe. This is purely a sugar-addict's drive-by. You can find any variation of treats behind the glass, from chocolate cookies to grapefruit cream cakes. My personal favorites are the princess cake and the French macarons in all sorts of tempting flavors.


 I'd skip the cupcakes, which are cost prohibitive and not nearly as delicious as the other treats in the case. Try the rose merengues or the butterscotch pots-de-creme, if you're lucky enough to catch them with a batch. They sell them rarely and sell out quickly.
author: sfKristina

description:
I can't separate my overall state from the actual experience of the place so for me Miette will always be bittersweet.


 The cupcakes are so INCREDIBLY rich, you probably won't EVER want to eat more than one. I love chocolate more than most, but this is too much. Then again, it wasn't one of those sugary sweet days, so maybe on a different day they would have been perfect.


 Definitely try it.
author: lizok

description:
Oh, this place is good. Very good. Their cakes are wonderful. A girlfriend of mine sent me a yellow cake with chocolate icing for my birthday by courier - what a treat! 

I've also ordered the apricot cake before with lady fingers, apricots and sponge cake. Sigh...it is one of the best things I've ever eaten. 

The cupcakes are ok. The cookies are wonderful for brunches and teas with your friends. 

Also, the store in Hayes Valley can be rented out for baby showers or kids birthdays. I looked into it when I was throwing a baby shower but it was too pricey for me - and I ended up having the baby shower at the Ritz Carlton because it was [brace yourself] cheaper than Miette.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Yes it is beautiful. Yes they put a lot of effort into styling and packaging, but I don't feel that the product can stand for itself. I think this would be a great place to buy a gift for a friend, but if you are on the search for the creme de la creme pastry, keep searching.
author: Lauren D.

description: I'm gonna try again. After all the excitement about Miette, I was surprised the opera cake was average. The cupcake we tried was also average. Both were very beautiful to look at and the service was friendly so I'll have to try this again on another day.
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Yum Yum Yum. The Ferry building outpost of Miette is super convenient. They have such tasty, high quality macaroons. Fun flavors like pistachio, coffee, chocolate lavender. I love the chewy inside and crispy outside. Go get your sugar fix at Miette! They also have candies, cupcakes, cakes, cookies, etc.
author: Ka C.

description:
#49 of 100 on 7x7's The Big Eat SF: Ginger snaps at Miette
http://bit.ly/1VmqYA

Cupcakes are so 2000-and-late. What's in are macaroons! And this place does it exquisitely.

Miette is a perfect little patisserie for the ferry building. Expensive, gourmet desserts that would go nicely as a gift or something for you to indulge on yourself. Their packaging would go front-page on the dieline blog - even the signs noting the different foods have a very personal touch to them. Okay, but that's presentation - what about taste?

I've ordered their macaroons before and they are worth every penny. I don't think I could ever come close to making them as sweet and yummy as Miette does.

I came here for ginger snaps today and while I wasn't blown away on first bite, over time, the ginger snaps grew on me. The package ($7 for 12 ginger snaps) was a bit pricey for me, but they were fresh, had a thorough amount of ginger, and were extremely crisp. There are other cookies they make and of course the macaroons, so I'd come back for the macaroons instead of the snaps.
author: Reid Y.

description: only tried the gingersnaps.  They were nice and buttery but actually a little too sweet for me (and I love sweet...)
author: Xue H.

description: It seems like I'm always coming late to the food fad parties. I just had my first French Macaron last week. My friend was telling me about how great they are and that she had some at the Ferry Building so I had to try them out for myself. Miette Patisserie is an adorable shop in the Ferry Building over by the gelato shop and Blue Bottle Coffee. The macarons were inside jars by the cashier. Compared to others I have seen, these seem smaller in size. I decided on chocolate, pistachio and vanilla. There isn't really a dedicated space for eating your macarons in the Ferry Building so I took mine outside and across the way to Justin Herman Plaza. I sat there and watched people walking and skateboarding and eating concrete while others drove off towards the Bay Bridge. I couldn't tell the difference between the pistachio and the vanilla but I loved them both. I didn't like the chocolate much.  These are a great little treat to accent both good days and bad. Eat them slowly and enjoy them fully.
author: Daisy S.

description: Oh my!  Just bought a few nibbles for an afternoon snack treat - a chocolate orange meringue and a single wrapped chocolate caramel.  Both were delicious in taste and texture!  I have been dreaming of the meringue...I really wish I had bought more!
author: Gwen G.

description:
I'm very picky when it comes to cupcakes. If it's not Sprinkles cupcakes, I don't eat it.

BUT! Miette's cupcakes are so delicious! I think last time I went here I actually bought one of each of their cupcakes. haha.

Their old-fashioned cupcake - the best! :)
author: Daphne L.

description:
Thank you Miette!  You've got it down...quality ingredients, simple, elegant cakes and cookies, PLUS great design -- from the mini storefront, to the gift boxes, decorating, packaging, and photography.  Well done.  

The sables are my favorite.  Especially the chocolate ones.  Excellent sweet/salt balance.  Perfection.  Just try to make it down to Peet's without openning the bag.
author: Amy A.

description:
For special occasions, Miette's incredibly beautiful cakes do the trick.
They do gorgeous scripty sugar handwriting, so be sure to have your happy birthday message added to the top of the cake. The small diameter cake, though it serves 6-8 people, looks kind of tiny on a buffet table, so order ahead and get the larger cake. The customer service is very, very good. 

The Scharffen Berger chocolate cake is dense, dark-chocolately and delicious, with a not-too-sweet chocolate ganache covering. It's a really sophisticated version of chocolate cake-- the opposite of, say, a Hostess Cupcake. 

The Princess cake is so pretty it hurts, but it doesn't taste all that great. 
Based on the description, I really wanted to try it, so for a friend's recent birthday I got this, plus the Scharffen Berger cake. There was a very thin layer of some delicious raspberry substance, and  I thought it could have been thicker, because it was the only part of the cake that wasn't super-duper sweet. The lovely green white chocolate fondant icing was thick, sticky and, in my opinion, too sweet, and just sweet-- not complex tasting at all.

Miette's gingerbread cake and lemon tart  are the most delicious things they offer. The gingerbread cake is dense, moist, dark, gingery, and topped with cream cheese frosting... yum. The lemon filling in the tart is smooth, tangy and delicious, and the crust is flaky, buttery and perfect! 

Try the little Parisian macarons, too. They're crisp, light, chewy and yummy... my mom loves them so much that I mail order them to her for Mothers Day, and when I need to apologize to her. And if you like the Parisian macarons at Miette, then you should also try the pignoles at Dianda's Italian American Bakery on Mission St. (The pignoles have the crisp-chewy almondy deliciousness of Miette's macarons, but are even more toothsome, plus they're sprinkled with pine nuts!)
author: Dani Y.

description:
Wifey's Review:

I have tried their Parisian Macaroons, and they are delicious.  It is the perfect combination of sweet, chewy, and fresh.  I always buy at least 2 when we go.  Their cupcakes are better than Kara's Cupcakes by a long shot!  Miette's cupcakes are always moist, light, and fresh. I have tried the Vanilla Butter Cream frosting on yellow cake and their Raspberry Butter Cream on dense chocolate cake.  Both are so, so good.  You can't go wrong with any of the frosting and cake combinations.    Very cute store and very pretty pastries!
author: Mr. and Mrs. L.

description:
Amazing cakes as cute as buttons and great Parisian macarons. Always get admiring looks. I prefer their macarons to La Boulange de Polk because they have a denser chew. And so far their cakes are better than Tartine. *gasp*

Mini Scones (creame fraiche, chocolate): nice light touch, more crumbly than cakey 

Gingerbread-my other favorite cake next to Old Fashioned and the sweet cream cheese frosting is perfect 

Old Fashioned Chocolate- classic standby (dense not too sweet) with italian meringue and cherry on top

Scharfen Berger Chocolate- I prefer the Old Fashioned, this one is a richer fancier cake for a special occasion

Banana Cream Tart- good not great

Key Lime Tart- mehh too sweet and the meringue topping just doesn't as nicely on this
author: Hyan K.

description: Macaroons, cupcakes, english toffee, I could go on and on. Delicious! The cutest packaging which make great gifts! The staff is friendly and helpful when trying to make a difficult choice! :)
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Miette.
I recommend the cakes for a special birthday or the cupcakes to treat yourself for a job well done.  The macaroons are divine, and I recommend pairing them with a nice hot latte from blue bottle on a saturday morning.  Their attention to detail, their craft of baking, and the presentation is far superior to other bakeries in the city.  The cake pedestals are a great gift idea for cupcake enthusists!!!  My favorite is the ginger cupcake with creamcheese frosting.
author: Jenn H.

description: Strange flavors, that strawberry vanilla cupcake. I am not sure if the frosting was supposed to taste sour or if it was bad. $3.00 a cupcake, and there was no "wow" factor at all here. They did come in a cute little box with handles and a nice little label, it looked pretty. It just wasn't that good to me. The texture of the cake was stale and sponge-like. I also ordered a chocolate Madelaine, which was better than the cupcake.
author: Adria D.

description: I have been a bit disappointed on our most recent visits. The cupcakes seem smaller and now cost $0.25 more (everyone is hurting I know, I know) but the quality also seems to have suffered a bit. The cake on the chocolate cupcake was dry and there is less frosting. Overall still a wonderful place but not as spectacular as they once were.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: Miette has bad service and puny macarons - kind of like the last guy I dated before I became a lesbian.
author: Anastasia B.

description: As many of you who follow me know, I judge cupcakes based on frosting, and this place takes the cupcake!!!!! I had a chocolate cupcake with vanilla buttercream and it was amazing! The frosting was not too fatty, and not too sweet but just amazingly right! I will need to return to try more perfection in confection!!
author: John W.

description: Miette did our wedding favors and they were a huge hit! The macaroons are incredible!! They hand packaged each favor and made them look so lovely and perfect. They were very easy to work with - we were really pleased with the entire experience and most importantly our guests adored the macaroons :)
author: Natalia M.

description: Such a cute place! The vanilla cupcake is delicious, and the staff is super friendly! Great to bring on the ferry as a snack/dessert or bring some home across the bay, it never got easier!
author: Courtney M.

description:
Sweets for the sweet
* Yummy organic treats
* Top picks: Parisian macarons, gingerbread cupcakes, thumbprints and when in season, chocolate cupcakes with strawberry cream frosting - deeelish!
* Retro-pink accents and accessories
* Wonderful staff and pastry chefs with great hearts
* Swing by during the annual Valentine's event and Jeff will decorate your Miette mini-Scharffenberger cake w/a message to your sweetie
author: susan f.

description:
Macaroons.  Oh, the macaroons.  Chewy and fluffy in all the right places.  Who would have thought rose geranium could taste so good?  Pistachio!  Hazelnut!  Yum.  And they keep them in large brain jars, which just makes me giggle.

I haven't tried anything else here.  Haven't needed to.  The macaroons are enough keep me coming back for more.  The people who work there are really friendly too.

Minus one star due to the massive willpower required to stay away from this place for the good of my thighs.  Really, it's dangerous.  But oh so good.  A worthy treat.
author: Guesty G.

description:
I got a cake from here for my birthday.  The princess cake to be exact.  It was some of the best cake I've ever had.  And perfect for a small group. Definately a bakery I would try again.

Can't speak for how easy order/pick-up was since I didn't deal with that.
author: Je N.

description:
I grabbed the Chocolate Chocolate cupcake to go as a nice indulgence along the coast. Now for the analysis-

The butter cream- fabulous, although I do think it was a bit too sweet on my part. I prefer my cupcakes more bitter-sweet rather that sweet. However, the consistency was great, and if I was a (super) sweet toothed person, I'd totally dig it.
The cake- definitely not dry. However, I just realized that it is very possible for cake to be too moist. It was so moist that it was clumpy. Now, I personally would prefer a clumpy-ish cupcake rather than a dry one, but it does not fully tickle my fancy.
The "look"- so I totally fell for the fondant daisy. It was adorable (brings back memories from back home). I was totally diggin' it.

In all, it wasn't a "bad" cupcake (which does exist!); however my taste buds will not allow my fingers to give it a full five stars. I'm a picky eater when it comes to my pastries. :)
author: Monica F.

description: Granted my review is based on the macaroons alone, but wow. I've never had anything like them. Truly amazing little bites of heaven. The next time I'm in San francisco this will be one of my first stops. Try the rose germanium for a unique treat.
author: Katie D.

description: I'm giving them 3.5 stars, but rounding up.  Their croissants are very good.  I've had better, but this place is definitely above average.  It's also in an area where I would love to see more little shops like this one, so show them some love!
author: Jessica J.

description: One of the best bakeries on the west coast hands down people. Eat there sweets, make your mouth happy.
author: gino a.

description: As good as any bakery gets.  Macarons - chewy fabulousness, cupcakes - fresh and full of flavor, panna cotta - perfectly smooth.  I go here every time I visit the Ferry Building.  The macarons are definitely my favorite.
author: Christa T.

description: A chocolate tart, dense and rich inside a flaky crust, all wrapped up in shiny pink packaging. Crayola-colored macaroons. Petite cookies, cute little cupcakes and delicate scones. If you want sweet treats that make you feel full-on girl, this is your spot.
author: Brittney G.

description:
Miette. Miette. Mmmiette.

Oh the banana tart dessert --- and oh, the macaroons, mmm.  And the cupcakes. Ah!

I could never go through the Ferry Building without stopping to get something sweet here.  

Miette. Miette. Mmmmiette.
author: Robin S.

description:
Every so often I walk over to Miette and pick up 4 cupcakes and a lemon tart.  I always select:
- Gingerbread 
- Italian meringue
- Yellow with apricot buttercream
- classic Chocolate

I then cut them each into four lovely little bites and share them with my co-workers.  It is such a lovely little mouthful treat.  The gingerbread is far and away my favorite.

But lately I have been getting a lemon tart that is just for myself.  Absolutely perfect tart.  The crust every time I have purchased it is clearly baked within 24 hours, as it is crisp and buttery.  Tart crusts can so quickly become soggy when filled with a curd.  And that bring me to the filling, it is so yummy...that perfect balance between tart, buttery and sweet.  I recommend Miette whole heartedly.
author: Michie S.

description: it was before mealtime but i decided to snatch the last earl grey ice cream sandwich, otherwise i knew it would be gone by the time i circled back. overall, i'd get it again. it wasn't overly sweet, had a strong earl grey taste. can't really comment on much else though.
author: Ann B.

description: Oh boy do I love this gorgeous little sweet shop and their cupcakes & macaroons.  The chocolate cupcakes with the marshmallow fluff topping are my favorite cupcakes anywhere.  So pretty and so delicious.  I have sampled all the macaroon flavors and they're all very good, but I really have to recommend the pistachio, it's pretty much the best most decadent little three bites you could put in your mouth.
author: Emily T.

description: In my walk to Blue Bottle, however, I did pass in front of Miette and the smiling lady behind the counter actually asked me if I wanted a sample - given their awful service on my last visit I must admit I was shocked.  Stepping closer I asked her what I was being handed and she told me a Rose Geranium Macaron.  Biting into the crispy exterior and sensing the wonderfully moist and fragrant interior I must admit I was amply pleased - this was a VERY good Macaron.  Adequately impressed I decided to give in and make a purchase, buying another Rose Geranium as well as a Pistachio Macaron and a "Classic" Cupcake.  While the Pistachio didn't quite hold up to the superb flowered cookie, it was actually quite good and nearly on par with my favorite Pistachio Macaron ever at Pistachia Vera in Columbus.  The cupcake, on the other hand, didn't fare so well in that while the cake was quite moist and delicious in texture, the frosting was actually quite gummy and bland - as though there was simply too much xanthan or guar gum and too little liquid.
author: Michael U.

description: My husband surprised me and our daughter with a box of macarons and cupcakes from here the other night. So good! I'll definitely make a stop myself when I'm nearby.
author: Angie L.

description: Ice cream sandwiches are super tasty! The seasonal ones are awesome, they introduce a new one every month. I really liked the malted chocolate ice cream on the chocolate cookie.
author: eric m.

description: Love the macaroons but I must say I haven't bought a single one since the price went up to $1.75 a piece.  I do miss them so....
author: Elena F.

description: nice people, not at all pretentious, delicious baked goods, very vegan friendly, rotflmaowtf.
author: Laura B.

description: What a nicely decorated adorable little shop Miette's has going on in the Ferry Building. The display of sweet treats is a feast for the eye. I couldn't help but order what they are widely known for-French Macarons. The "rose" just tasted like cream filling to me. The "pistachio" was my favorite and was very nutty indeed! The "grapefruit" had a bare hint of citrus but not enough for my palette. The macarons did not really evoke a colorful display as I'm used to when seeing these delectable treats. Perhaps that's Miette's way of setting themselves apart.
author: Allison M.

description: So I had never tried a macaroon before going to Miette yesterday.  They always looked sort of dry and unappetizing to me.  But looks indeed can be deceiving.  I don't have anything to compare Miette's macaroons to, but boy, were they good!  They were soft and chewy and a little sticky, sort of like eating a toasted marshmallow.  And they come in all kinds of fun flavors, like pistachio, chocolate orange, and hazelnut.
author: Jenny R.

description:
The latest hottest thing on Yelp is to use ALL CAPS and lots of words with high shock value to attract more votes.  But I'm just not willing to whore myself out to Yelp just to get a little more exposure for my lame ass reviews.  I have too much pride and self-esteem to pander to the lowest common denominator like that.  I just wanted to say that before I started this review.  Thanks.

This CUPCAKE SHOP is good, but not all its CRACKed up to be.  I'm only going to comment on three specific items because it looks like this place has been well-covered by Yelp.  First, the POT d'CREME.  This was uneXXXpectedly divine.  I thought it would just be like CHOCOLATE PUDDING, but it was far more dense with sublime CHOCOLATE FLAVOR and more SILKY than your average PUDDING cup.  And the cute little glASS cup inscribed with "Miette" is yours to take home.  That's HOT.  Next, the peaNUT BUTTer COOKIES.  These come nEATly packed in a PLASTIC WRAPPER.  These were not that awesome though, and were not BURSTING with special peaNUT BUTTer flavor like my own homemade p-NUT BUTTer cookies.  The SECRET SAUCE of good peaNUT BUTTer COOKIES is DUMPing in a SIXTEEN oz. bag of peaNUT BUTTer chips into the DOugh.  Much richer and CREAMIER that way.  The COOKIES' mediocrity did not stop me from SUCKING them all up last night as I LAY on the cOUCH in my UNDERWEAR.

Finally, I had to pick up a CREME DOUCHE scone.  These are just little square scones that they sell for 50 cents each.  I was expecting this to be sublime, but no.  It was just an ordinary scone, not MOIST, kind of dry in fact, and with a lemon zest flavor that didn't appeal to me.

This place's best ASSet is its awesome Ferry Building location and CUTE PACKAGE-ing.

SEX.
author: Rick H.

description:
i used to like this place but their customer service needs to improve. the ladies that work there are not friendly and don't even smile, rather they give you attitude which takes away from the cute pastry shop feel with the usual friend sweet bakers....they need a major attitude check.

the macaroons are alright, i've had better.. they are to heavy imo and aren't even like the legit ones from paris. i like the ones from la boulnge better.

on the other hand, i do like their coconut cream cake and lime tarte. i haven't  really been back after the last horrible customer service experience tho.
author: Carbon C.

description: Super ice cream sandwiches--with creme fraiche ice cream and perfect graham cracker cookies. Yay for Miette!
author: Sarah W.

description:
grump. grump. grump.

Today sure does suck! I'm tired and wish people would just leave me alone!! 

grump!

Me: Can I get a vanilla macaron and a madeleine?!
Hot Girl: $2.25. 
Me: $10 min for credit card purchases?! grrr...

Puts macaron in mouth, lightly crumbles then melts... So buttery, sooo delicate...

SUDDENLY A RAINBOW SHOOTS THROUGH THE ROOM UPON WHICH SNOW WHITE UNICORNS ENCIRCLE. SUNLIGHT EXUDES FROM MY PORES AS MY EYES ROLL BACK AND INSTANT GRATIFICATION COLLIDES WITH MY PRESENCE.

And I'm arrested for lewd conduct, why?!

Oh right... the madeleine...
author: Keane L.

description: I was disappointed.  I bought the gingersnaps on 7x7's list, and, quite frankly, I can make better ginger cookies.  These were not all that gingery!  I like a spicy kick to mine, and these were lacking.  And at 6.50 for 12  (maybe 15?) very thin gingersnaps, I feel they were overpriced as well.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
i reserve the right to judge you personally as to whether or not you like this bakery.  sorry, but i'm southern, ergo i'd judge you on way less either way. (i.e. wearing white after labor day, if you do your own hair, what kind of mayonnaise you use... you know, all that is good and holy)

miette offers up quite possibly the best cupcake i've ever eaten in my almost 30 years, the gingerbread with cream cheese icing, and this is coming from a serious baker, like as a child i actually blew out my easy bake oven from use and it had to be replaced.  not to mention i've had a kitchen aid mixer on my christmas list since i was 10 years old.  the macaroons rival that of laduree in paris, the handmade caramels have a texture as if they were made fresh that day and melt in your mouth like little salty, sweet pats of expensive butter.  the panna cotta is my new favorite, so far i've only tried (devoured) the strawberry and the caramel both of which are the most luscious, rich dirty little confections i've had the thrill of ingesting.  seriously people, you cannot  make this shit up, this place is the stuff that fill my food porn dreams at night.

if you hate on miette my guess is that you probably also have reviews like:

birth of my first born child
categories: babies, life events

two stars, this was just o.k. for me.  took nine months of waiting, only to come out dirty and needing assistance.

too expensive, could of adopted one from namibia for half of the medical bills and maternity clothing costs incurred.

don't need to do this again.
author: Jessie J.

description: I'm getting pretty annoyed with bakeries where it's only about how things look. I appreciate the aesthetics of this place. Everything is absolutely beautiful. But the flavors just aren't there at all. A complete waste of calories. Go to Mazetti's bakery instead.
author: Shona S.

description:
Delicious chocolate cupcakes.  The frosting is just perfect - not too sweet and light.  The cake is sooooo moist.  

The chocolate shortbread is buttery and tasty.  The macaroons are just okay though but I'm not a big fan of macaroons unless they are from Pix Patisserie in Oregon.
author: S. K.

description: I absolutely love their organic macaroons! Perfectly crispy, chewy, and flavorful all in one bite. On my recent trip to SF, I bought about two dozen and ate them within a two day period.
