Knocked off one star because of the price. They are a bit above the average $1.50-$1.75 each piece. They're $1.85 a piece but totally worth it if you have a couple of dollars to spare (:
author: Katie F.

description:
Heard all the good reviews about this place and decided to have my husband get some cupcakes.  Since they only had chocolate and vanilla cupcakes left, he decided to get one of each but unfortunately, weren't good at all!  My husband had the choice to go to another vendor or here and unfortunately, he chose Miette.  When he brought the cupcakes home to me, I looked at it and said to myself, "I could've made it myself and add rainbow colored sprinkles just like they did".  After tasting each one, I was even more disappointed and upset. Will never return to Miette for their chocolate and vanilla cupcakes.  

Definitely not worth $3.25 per cupcake!
author: Cher A.

description: Grapefruit + Cream + Cake = These are just THREE of my FAVorite things, even better together here. So good you should never, ever take the last one, especially if you see me at the Ferry Bldg.
author: Andy R.

description: oh, Miette, how do I love thee!   I am addicted to their macaroons, their short bread cookies and I love everything I have tried there.  LOVE it!  And I take my cookies and cupcakes very seriously, they are like a blood sport to me!   I will gladly throw down $1.75 for a cookie that tastes like a bite of heaven but I have noticed that the last 2 times I have purchased the macaroons, they seemed smaller.  If that is the "new" size then I will probably stick to a dozen instead of 3 dozen per visit!
author: Moxie H.

description: I really enjoyed the service I received from the Miette staff. Yesterday i called and ordered cupcakes, cookies, etc. to be delivered to our business and they arrived 15 minutes early and everything in perfect order. It was pretty simple placing the order, and the food was delicious! I'll definitely order from there again.
author: Laura B.

description:
This was the first stop on our Cupcake Tour of SF on Saturday.  At $3.25 per cupcake, my wife and I decided to share one because everyone knows that the first bite is for flavor and than the rest is to fill you up!  

We were really looking for something exotic, like Orange Cardamom, Lemon and Ginger, or Mocha Heath, but we did not find that here today.  Instead, it looked like they had all the standards: chocolate with a chocolate frosting, vanilla with a vanilla frosting, and spice cake with a cream cheese frostng and always the enticing but deadly red velvet with a cream cheese frosting.  Since my wife won't touch a red velvet, we settled on the Old Fashioned, because it had an Italian Meringue frosting.

The Old-Fasioned, was a chocolate cupcake, most and tender but completely plain, no fun frosting in the middle or anything, and the vanilla Italian Meringue was very sweet.  Of course I was expecting that and I enjoyed it, but my wife said it was too sweet for her. Win some, lose some.  

They probably have better things they offer in the form of cakes, and sort, but this rating is only for a cupcake.  At $3.25 each we probably won't be sampling them again.
author: Han N.

description: Just to let you know this place makes me MOAN OUT LOUD it's so damned good.  Luscious is the word for their stuff.  The cupcakes, macaroons, cakes and the adorable packaging that's so sweet and dainty.  It all makes makes the place one foodgasm extravaganza.  Mmmhhmmm........
author: Ke-Bear Z.

description: This place is so cute and appeals to sweet lovers like me!  My favorite treat is a macaron and unfortunately they kinda suck here.  They don't conform to the traditional parisian macaron, as the shells are lumpy with almond bits.  The flavors are okay, but there is never much of a selection.  I don't go here for macarons, but I love their selection of wrapped candies!
author: Carolyn D.

description: i went here to try the ginger snaps and macarons. the ginger snaps are supposed to be amazing, but they were too gingery for me. not exactly what i expected, and pretty pricey. i tried the chocolate lavender, pistachio, hazelnut macarons, and they tasted fresh with delicious flavor. these are the showcase here, not the snaps! 4 for macarons, 3 for snaps.
author: sherrie n.

description: Review is for the cupcakes only.  Granted, they arent known for cupcakes.  But, they offer them.  I got the vanilla one.  The frosting was more butter than vanilla buttercream.  The frosting had no flavor, was bland and hard.  The cake was dense, dry and tasted like nothing.  Ick.  By far the worst cupcake I' ve had.  Those Entemann ones you get at Safeway are better.
author: Caroline I.

description:
Blaasted sweet tooth.  The macaroons are ah-mazing, I got the Rose Geranium, and love fun flavors like that! I m sure hazelnut or others just as good.  Ladies were helpful and even let me sample a few of the violet candies to help me make a choice.  I also sampled chocolate from Maison Bouche that they have there! How cute to give these cheerfully colorful bars as a gift. 
Great place to browse and would love to visit other locations!  Very decadent and fun!
author: Marie K.

description: Over-designed. Under-engineered. I want to like Miette, really. But unfortunately the only thing likeable is the visual appeal. The madeleines are not as good as Donsuemor's. The eclairs are so-so. The macaroons are stiff and disappointing. The cookies are good for people who like crunchy versus chewy. There's something weird in the ingredients because there's always an aftertaste that leaves my tongue numb similar to a kind of reaction to certain fruit acids.
author: Trixie J.

description: Rose Geranium Macaroon!   I've never had a french macaroon with buttercream frosting.  Now it's all I can think about!  Really really fantastic.
author: Mary B.

description:
When I saw this adorable little bakery I took off running towards it. If I could re-create what a bakery would look like out of my dreams it would be Miette. I love the whole girly old fashioned vibe this place outs out. I picked up 4 of their chocolate bars that had gorgeous wrappers, I don't even like chocolate. 
I bought 4 macaroons, but enjoyed none of them because someone else ate them. I did get a yellow strawberry cupcake, the chocolate mousse in the little jar, and a panna cotta in a tiny jar. It was delicious. 
 A lot of paper waste happens here between the individual boxes and all the. Pink tissue paper. 
The treats were a little on the pricey side but someones got to pay for all this cuteness and attention to detail. I can't wait to come back in July.
author: KM I.

description: Macaroons are delicious and remind me of the ones we had in Paris.  Also, the chocolate tart is rich and creamy.  Everything in the store is so beautifully packaged, too.
author: Hello K.

description: Overpriced and snooty customer service!  Despite all the hype and colorful decorations, the cakes and cupcakes are VERY dry and not flavorful.  Sometimes people think a sweet frosting would save the cake, but it's not true -it's got to be the entire package. The cake itself must be soft and moist, while the frosting should be sweet enough to compliment the cake.  I prefer Shubert's Bakery or Donsuemor's over Miette any day.  This company needs to improve their cake recipe and train their employees to treat customers with less attitude and more patience.
author: Daria i.

description: Have tried cakes, cupcakes, cookies - all are amazing. This is my favorite spot to get treats for my friends and co-workers.
author: Christina B.

description:
you remind me of  a designer impostor fragrance:  pretty and exciting like the real Parisian pastry, cept not as affordable nor as complex.

a miette (crumb in French) is all you could realistically afford here... seriously, why does anything French-ish in the US require a 300% mark-up?
author: G Z.

description: I absolutely love their gingersnaps! I also got some macaroons(hazelnut, lemon, and one other flavor I cant remember), sadly I must not have the taste buds to taste the differences because they all tasted the same to me. But who cares, they were still delicious! If I had more money I would be here everyday, for now it will be a nice little treat once in a while.
author: Nancy L.

description:
3.5 star.  the desserts here look so beautiful, so perfect.  everything is immaculate.
chose the seasonal macarons -- chocolate lavender and rose
i guess that's what eating potpourri is like...
i think you might be better off getting the hazelnut and pistachio
texture is more solid (rather than the melty kind)
for the cupcakes, i didn't really care for the yellow cake and strawberry frosting as i thought i would
the gingerbread with cream cheese frosting was excellent
again cake texture is more solid than airy.
everything here is picture perfect: 5 stars for appearance!
author: Rob C.

description: So I was early for work and decided to come and try out their cakes. There wasn't a lot that caught my eyes so I just went with the chocolate cream cake. It was good but nothing special. I would say it's pretty expensive though. I also bought a bag of peanut butter cookies. Those were really good but was also expensive for a bag of cookies ($5). Maybe if I was really craving sweets while at work I would come back.
author: Juliane N.

description: I've walked by here so many times and finally had to try a cupcake today:  chocolate with vanilla buttercream.  The frosting was just okay -- I would have liked a little more vanilla and a little more sugar.  But the cake part was excellent -- rich and moist and full of chocolatey goodness.  I'll definitely have to try the gingerbread cupcake -- that was my first instinct, and I probably should have gone with it.
author: Nat K.

description: This location doesn't impress much like it's Hayes Valley counterpar. I had a chocolate cupcake and it just wasn't right - the frosting and cake felt like two separate items because the frosting could be easily picked off. The cake itself was dry. They also run out of selections fast. Macarons are always a hit, though.
author: Jonas T.

description: Is probably one of my favorite bakeries up in SF...one of the main reasons why I always stop by the Ferry Building whenever I'm up in SF.  The macarons are a MUST!!! =)   A bit expensive ($1.50 each) but soooo worth it!!  Now I'm on a mission to go find a recipe and make them myself...hopefully they come out just as good!! =)
author: Vanessa L.

description: This place is cute down to the pink bags with cakes on them.  Everything here makes me want to eat it.  The graham crackers are so sweet they are more like cookies.  Butter cookies.  One time walking by here and I was inspired to throw a tea party.  It is wonderful to stare dreamily at the exquisite desserts.  They are also well priced for that decadent affair.
author: apple r.

description: Can you believe it took me until this Thanksgiving to pay homage to Miette for the first time - and I work about two blocks away?  Wow, I really need to make up for lost time.  Fortunately for me Miette doesn't look like it's going anywhere.  For my indoctrination I chose a gingerbread cake with cream cheese icing.  The lovely gals behind the counter put a pink sugar flower on it and wrapped it up in a pretty pink box, just 4 me.  It was the hit of my Thanksgiving dinner, and left the Marie Callendar's pumpkin pie my parents' brought over sitting unloved on the sideboard.  Poor pumpkin pie!
author: .Hon H.

description: I've probably searched all of San Francisco for the perfect cupcake and Miette's comes pretty damn close. Presentation was perfect and so cute!! The frosting was more creamy than sugary unlike most cupcake places. The ginger cupcake's cake part was moist but I wish it had been a bit more of a cake consistency - lighter and fluffier. All in all I was very pleased. :)
author: Sharon G.

description: Miette is mediocre.  One thing they sell that is yummy every time is their mini banana cream pie.  I have bought several of their cupcakes because they always look so good, but they are always dry and flavorless.  I do like their macaroons.  Another time I bought an eclaire and the pastry was overcooked or burnt.  As I walked to the trash can to toss away my barely-touched pastry, my mom said, "Don't throw that away!  Let me have it!"  I obliged.  She took one bite and said, "This is burnt!" and walked over to the trash can....
author: Kandi K.

description:
I came here with a friend on a stroll through the Ferry Plaza.  We were hooked instantly by Miette's cutesiness.  The confections are almost adorable enough to sell themselves by appearance alone.  Case in point, I was very, very close to getting the little pot of panna cotta with strawberries just because of its little glass container embossed with "miette."  Madness!  I don't even like things along the texture of pudding, mousses, etc.  In the end I bought a chocolate cupcake with raspberry buttercream, and a rose geranium macaron.  The cupcake was very fresh - the cake was moist and the frosting was creamy and suprisingly light.  The macaron was lovely too - it didn't smell a thing like a rose but every bite filled my mouth with floral flavor.  The only thing I question about their macarons is the filling - more like a whipped cream than the paste I'm used to seeing sandwiched in a macaron.  

4 stars because things are a little pricier than I'd like, but for a patisserie using organic ingredients, it's really not so bad.
author: Jenny S.

description: Cute macaroons but I had the worst service here.  All I wanted to do was buy my mom a couple of macaroons (chocolate lavender and pistachio), and because I was on my bike, I asked for a paper box to keep them un-squished for my ride home.  The woman who was serving me gave me such attitude that my friends who were just spectating wanted to CAB.  What a horrible encounter.  Maybe she was having an off day.  Maybe I was too sensitive.  Whatever.  All I wanted was macaroons in a box and it cost $3 and a sour experience.
author: Lydia W.

description: I happened to walk pass this bakery and noticed all the baked delights. I was in the mood for chocolate Madeleines. They were delicious, plump and moist. They were 75 cents each, which is expensive but definitely worth it. The Scharffenberger mini chocolate cake looked really good, at $5 it's a steal. The regular sized cake was $30. My friend was looking at the coconut cake but they had run out of slices for the day. This place has a small selection of cupcakes (yellow cake with chocolate frosting - yum yum).  There were jars full of macaroons - how can I resist not coming back for more goodies.
author: Candace F.

description: Bernadette recommended the cupcakes, so I checked it out.  There are lots of interesting pastries here, including my favorite style of brownie.  My first purchase was a ginger cupcake, and yes, it was good!  The cashier was happy and smiled the whole time I was there.
author: David D.

description: One taste of Miette's macarons and I've become a traitor.  Before we met, my macaron palette was devoted only to La Provence Patisserie (in Beverly Hills, CA).  One bite of a raspberry macaron from Miette and you will never go elsewhere (well...maybe France...nowhere else in the States, at least). Tiny and pricey, but worth each bite, as it's laden with real raspberry puree.  I actually really like the chocolate lavender, but I also love anything lavender.  The hazelnut was also delicious, but really, love at first bite goes to the raspberry.  My boyfriend was so enamored, we bought two and he quickly rushed back for 6 more and a brownie.  The store front in the Ferry building is so pretty that you can't help but stop to smile and admire how beautiful all the desserts look. To our tastebud's delight, they are also so scrumptious -- not too sweet, just the perfect amount of richness. Oh how I long to see you soon, little Miette macaron...
author: Taya V.

description: I think it was love at first bite! Their princess cake is to die for, love, love, love! It's so pretty you'd wanna think twice about digging in but once you do, you won't regret. Expensive, yes. delicious, absolutely.
author: meL Z.

description:
So every once in a while I leave the great city I live in to go to another great city, San Francisco, and since I discovered the Ferry Building, I haven't made a trip out there without going...

...but this last trip was my first time sampling the deliciousness that can be found at Miette Patisserie. My dad chose the madelines (which I did not eat, because I'm trying to watch my waistline), as well as a raspberry creme cake, of which I had half a slice. Half a slice was more than enough, though, although I wish I'd not shared it with anyone...I remember the flavor of the delicious, sweet, creamy cake...and will be back next time I am in the area to try some of the other things that Miette has to offer....
author: erica s.

description: Of course the counter person insisted that these were the BEST Macarons ever and indeed they were NOT.  Hard, chewy and extremely dry.  Such I disappointment!!!
author: Michael W.

description:
their classic cupcakes are so good that i kept the cute little white box it came in and took hits off the smell for the rest of the week.

don't overlook their brownies either. UPDATE: got their organic "bumble bee" birthday cake and cake-hating birthday boy devored it in a night.
author: Chelsea B.

description: I've never had the cupcakes here but I ordered two cakes for a friend's birthday.  The chocolate cake was forgettable but the gingerbread cake was SOOO good.  It was moist and yummy.  And the frosting wasn't too sweet either.  Prices are a little steep (~$30 a cake that feeds like 5-7) and the store was cute.
author: Peggy W.

description: Everything is so freaking cute and French-looking!  My friend and I each had a cupcake (chocolate - mine had strawberry buttercream frosting, hers vanilla); raspberry thumbprints ; and walnut shortbread.  The cookies were buttery delish delights, they piled on that frosting like it was going outta style, and everything was so adorably packaged.  Enough already! Mon dieu!
author: M. H.

description:
Update: 06-Feb-2007
Well, now I've been around the block and no one else can do it like you, so Miette, I'd love you 10-stars if I could. Sorry I ever doubted you! Your Macarone's are unbelieveable, too, but I will be forever loyal to your perfectly perfect brownie -- no one else has your touch!
p.s. i've been notified, yes there's some coffee in there!
---
They make my *favorite* brownies ever, and as my butt can attest, I've indulged in a -wide- variety of brownies in my lifetime. ha ha. Before Miette, I assumed brownies had to be dense, fudgy anvils to be satisfying, but the quality of Miette's ingredients and their adept baking ensure a powerful, chocolate experience with a moist interior. A friend noted a slight coffee flavor, but I'm guessing that's the freshness of their cacao. Anyone know for sure? They also pander to brownie dilettantes with a walnut-contaminated variety, but real connoisseurs will know to beeline for the unadulterated version. Bon appetit!

(Only 4 stars for now because I haven't tried anything else.. can't seem to get past those brownies.)
author: Surely I Am C.

description: walked passed this place many times but never really wanted to buy anything because everything seemed so overpriced. but finally tried their macaroons. though they're $1.75, they're totally worth it! it's a little different from other macaroons in that they're a bit cakier but it's def really good. i really liked the pistachio and i think it's worth trying!
author: Joyce B.

description: I'm eating miette's english toffee with dark chocolate and almonds as I write this.  The balance of sweet and salty and creamy and crunchy and nutty is just amazing. I have also had their shortbread cookies, their bergamot salt caramels, their pecan tart etc. etc. every time, everything is delicious. And the packaging is super cute.
author: cecilia g.

description: tasted a few macarons: chocolate lavender, pistachio, and (my favorite) rose geranium.  soft, chewy, and extremely flavorful.  also had a nice chocolate wafer-malted ice cream sandwich.  saw a lot of mouth-watering cakes and tarts which i would've tried except for my overstuffed stomach.  until next time....
author: Randy D.

description: Super cute place, love the chocolate cupcakes with marshmallow topping (though I wouldn't say overall that their cupcakes are of NY caliber) and the macarons are frippin' "i could eat these all day" fabulous.
author: Kiki R.

description: These organic little picture perfect cupcakes are DELICIOUS!  A bit over priced but if you want something sweet (but not overly) to satisfy your sweet tooth craving, then Miette's cupcakes are the way to go!
author: Melissa M.

description: Yummers! This is purely based on the gingersnap cookies. They were indeed pretty good. Sugary, buttery, potent ginger flavor. Yum.
author: Carol L.

description:
best macaroons ever! their chocolate chip cookies are pretty good too. and they come in cute pink bags.

my roommate brings them home after work in boxes and we eat them 5 or 6 in one go. i like hazelnut and vanilla. i think they're $1.50 each.

so what. don't judge. there's nothing wrong with paying for happiness.
author: Jessica W.

description: I came here to get their french macaroons. I believe I got the coffee one and the one with the nut. It was good but after a while it got kind of sweet. I thought that it would've been bigger, but actually the diameter is not that far from a regular size lollipop. The banana bread was very good but it cost about $3 and it was very small. I don't really mind it being expensive because it is made with organic and local ingredients. Their cakes look sô good. I also got their scone. chocolate and orange. It was very good.
author: Janet Z.

description: Over-rated cupcakes, under-rated macarons.  These little treasures are the ultimate sandwich cookie, perhaps even more enjoyable than alfajores from Citizen Cake.  My favorite is pistachio.
author: Kevin G.

description: Desserts were good. Free wedding cake tasting. However, follow-through on the actual order never fully completed. Had to go elsewhere. They seem to be overwhelmed.
author: Jennifer C.

description: To be honest I wasn't impressed. I ordered a chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting. The cake was doughy and the frosting had no flavor.I also ordered some macaroons which were good but for 1.50 a pop and olny slightly large than a 50 cent piece. I was disappointed. They also have 10 dollar min. on check cards so bring cash or order a lot.
author: Sharon M.

description: There's a difference between overpriced and ridiculously overpriced sweets. This place falls under the ridiculously priced category. Don't get me wrong, everything was making my mouth water, but the items were really small for what they were charging. Even the cupcakes were teeny tiny, but well over $3. I tried the macarons...very small and mediocre. The price was not justified.
author: Kristen R.

description: the old fashioned cupcakes are so yummy!! :D i finished it in two bites
author: Anh P.

description: Although the macaroons are good, the cupcakes are dry and tasteless! They only have 3 flavors, none of which were very good! The icing on the old-fashioned cupcake was divine, but the cake was dry...you're better off making a boxed cake mix at home or saving your money for when you're in Beverly Hills to make a special trip over to Sprinkles Cupcakes!
author: Erin R.

description: Awesome cupcakes and cakes. Very moist and chocolaty. Whatever that marshmallow topping they have on the classic cupcake is so unique, and I love the ganache cake.
author: Corinthia C.

description: i dream about miette's macarons. they are pricey but i love that they don't use food coloring, their almond flour isn't ground as finely as at other places, and they're filled with perfect buttercream filling! none of that yucky sweet jelly crap. you won't find flavors like passion fruit, sea salt caramel, or earl grey here.. but hands down it blows paulette's, boulange, bottega louie and so far all the other places i've tried in la out of the water. I make macarons at home but sometimes im super lazy so i'd rather just buy a few to satisfy my craving.. definitely hard to do after trying miette. The cookie is perfectly chewy on the inside with a perfectly crisp shell and perfectly sweetened buttercream filling...just perfection in bite size form!
author: Julie S.

description: Customer service at Miette is fab-u-lous.  I've started taking walks during my lunchbreak now to get some air and exercise and frequently walk over to the Ferry Building.  Every time I walk by Miette there's a crazy line.  So last week I walked by and there was only one person in line so I hopped into line and perused the goods.  The cupcakes look soo good, but I can't bring myself to spend $3.00 on just one.  Especially since I couldn't decide which one I wanted to try.  I ended up getting some macaroons (I love French macaroons!!!).  I got 2 hazelnut, 2 vanilla, and 2 pistachio.  Brought them home and they were a hit.  My 3 year old nephew LOVED the pistachio macaroon.  Or as he called it - mustachio.  At $1.50 each, they cost the same as the ones at Boulangerie on Pine and just as good.
author: Kris L.

description:
mmm...  Macarons!!!!  Vanilla with chocolate filling!!!!!!  Chocolate with chocolate filling!!!!!!  They're soooooooo good!  aiyee!!!!

zzzz...  my sugar high is wearing off.
author: Andrew C.

description: Balloons Equal Fun decided to make an appearance at the Ferry Building today. The Founder (Brian) decided to stop by Miette and bring me something wonderful. I suggested anything gingerbread and what we shared was fresh ginger heaven. The gingerbread cake was moist and bursting with ginger goodness. I have a really bad cold right now and it was the perfect thing to make me feel warm and happy inside.
author: Sherie R.

description:
update: the chocolate cream layer cake... it's dark chocolate and wow... it's good. the cake is soft and moist and goes very well with a glass of chardonney (yes, office birthday, again)

i frequently purchase their peanut butter cookies because they're just the right amound of sweetness... mmm... and their macarons... well they are to die for! i love them all! 

i recently ahd their old fashioned cake - chocolate cake with marshmallow creme. wow...! we actually fed our entire office with a small six inch cake. there were 15 of us i think. but... mm mm mm mm mm. so good.

despite everything being so yummy, it's quite expensive. 12 macarons cost sixteen bucks!

personal fave: peanut butter cookies
author: Mei N.

description: Dang, yo, where do y'all get off makin' macaroons taste so good? You are my first stop in SF when I come to town. I'll take a dozen just for my 'friends' and then in the privacy of the bathroom scarf 'em all down. Those macaroons...so addictive, and so good.
author: Lindley E.

description: One of the reasons why I love going to the Ferry Buiding is because of this place.  I'm sure it's all been said before but Miette is Screamin!  Some of my favorites are the pistachio, rose and hazelnuts macarons, walnut brownies and banana tart.  It can be pricey but you won't regret it.  They accept credit cards but only over a $10 amount (i think) so don't forget the mulah $.
author: Michelle D.

description: Beautiful pastries and desserts, though overpriced. Everything looks adorable and is packaged so cute. I tried 3 flavors of the macaroons(vanilla,pistachio,raspberry) and was surprised of how much I loved them. They were so wonderfully chewy and the filling was super creamy and smooth. Each one packed a nice punch of flavor. Much more than you would expect. I loved these so much! They are very sweet though which I wasn't expecting, so you can't eat too many. Next I tried the gingerbread cupcake since it was touted as being one of their most popular ones. It was a tasty cupcake, but honestly it tasted more like a pumpkin cake than gingerbread. I wish it would have had more ginger taste. The cream cheese frosting however was delicious! Lastly, I had a slice of the raspberry creme cake. This was delicious, but nothing too crazy special. The white cake was moist and the raspberry creme was delicately flavored and nice and light. The whipped cream on top was super fresh and light tasting as well. I liked this a lot because the whole cake wasn't too sweet overall. I liked Miette, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
the vintage cake stands, abundance of pastel pink, and pouffy puffs of frosting on perfectly round cupcakes all make miette so irresistable. the lovely display of adorable cakes and confections are bound to elicit squeals of "awww!" from all sorts of sugar crazed beings, i.e. me.

all these decadent treats are presented well, and for that they get 5 stars. tastewise, i would have to say, the confections are above average, but nothing extraordinary...so go ahead, pick up a pretty cupcake, cookie, and a bag of candy for later too....
author: helen l.

description: This place is good! I just wish that they had more choices of cake. I often want to buy a single slice of cake but either they are always out or they don't offer that many types of cakes. I always enjoy a cupcake from there!
author: susan c.

description: When I feel like gourmet chocolate cookies, I take a little break from work and walk over here to the Ferry Building.  I go to Miette exclusively to get the chocolate Sables.  These are chocolate butter cookies with a little bit of sea salt.  Something different, but I like it!.  It's $5 a pack, but worth every penny.  Yummy!
author: Lucky M.

description:
I liked cupcakes before they were cool.  I don't understand how they ever could have been anything but cool.  I mean, if you don't like cake or just aren't a dessert person generally, that's one thing.  But if you like cake, how can cupcakes not be even better?  They are portable.  They are the right size so you can buy one portion at a time.  Everyone can have their own flavor and no one gets the piece that is all frosting and no cake.  Cupcakes:  timeless, ageless, wonderful.

Okay.  The people at Miette are super nice, which comes as a bit of a surprise given how hip the place seems.  And Miette's cupcakes are so gorgeous it's like walking into a Wayne Thiebaud painting -- a longtime fantasy, natch.  Sadly, they just don't taste that great.  They are light and fluffy and very fresh.  But they are just kind of flavorless.  I want to love the Old-Fashioned Cupcake in particular (the way that I love the Signature Cupcake at Citizen Cake) but I just need more cupcakey goodness under that pretty exterior.

It's not that I can't be swayed by externalities.  Take the pot de creme for example.  It comes in an adorable little glass jar that you get to keep!  I love it.  Do I really care what the pot de creme tastes like?  Not really.  But actually, it's pretty good.
author: Rachel J.

description: I love Miette for uber cute and girlie cakes.  Perfect for a special girlfriend's birthday.  The princess cake is divine as is the lemon debutante.  Kinda pricey but well worth it for the occasion.
author: Cassie B.

description: This must be hit or miss with so many mixed reviews.  I rarely rate bakeries this low but the only things decent here are the pricey macaroons!
author: K H.

description: So I did a guided half day culinary tour when I was in San Fran - It was way fun...one of our stops was Miette Patisserie - I am just in love... they have these little french macaroons like nothing I have had before (and I take my sugar very seriously) some of the flavors are  lavender, hazelnut , grapefruit, chocolate and rose geranium.  I especially liked the rose germanium that I just called to have some 2ND day shipped to the East Coast....
author: Kate C.

description: The chocolate cupcakes are divine, simply amazing. The buttercream frosting is rich and not too overpowering. Organic makes such a huge difference. The bakery delivery service however is too iffy...I had ordered cupcakes for a surprise birthday and they delivered them a day early. Miette credited our account but it created a huge hastle because the guest of honor was home for the delivery!
author: Monika S.

description:
The first time I went to Miette was several years ago when a friend asked me to pick up brownies for her when I was in San Fran. I got one for myself, naturally, and it was spectacular. Perhaps the best brownie I've ever had.

After being tasked with sampling macarons, Miette was the first place I hit, with images of the aforementioned brownie still fresh in my mind years later.

Their chocolate macaron was good, but like so many other chocolate macarons, although it tasted good, it was really more of a macaron shaped brownie than a true macaron. No shell, real dense, a little sticky... again the makings of a wonderful brownie, but not quite what I was looking for.

The rose geranium macaron on the other hand was very nice. Egg shell like crust, light, slightly chewy but not sticky, good rose flavor, could have been brighter, but still very good. The almond macaron was pretty standard, but decent standard not bad standard.

The staff was rather useless, but I try to avoid including such things in my food reviews.
author: Catch X.

description: I've only had two things from Miette: the chocolate truffle tartlette & the macaroons.  Both are incredible.  The tartlette is made of rich, dark chocolate that absolutely melts in your mouth.  It's heavenly.  The hazlenut macaroons are by far my favorite, although their other flavors are equally as delicious.  I developed a serious appreciation for macaroons after a trip to Paris, and Miette's are so delicious.  Prices are a little steep for what you get, but it's the ferry building and the treats are well worth it.
author: Jenna H.

description: on the pricy side, $3/cupcake, but I adore the gingerbread cupcake. it's moist, with yummy frosting :D
author: Sherry H.

description:
I had been eying the cupcakes at meitte for months, especially the chocolate one with the marsh mellow frosting. After seeing the cupcake cake challenge on food network  i had to go and just try it.
I was surprised the judges were right. the cake itself  was dry and crumbly.  the marsh mellow on top was  not very spectacular either it tasted like they scooped it right out of a marshmallow jar  and placed it neatly  on top. 
I will go back to give it another chance and try one of the macaroons. i hear there really good and the customer service was great.
author: akasha s.

description:
i laave a patisserie that's good for you, but doesn't sacrifice quality! :) and miette have proved that it is possible! ... i laave the macaroons FOR SURE! i mean someone is stupid IF they dont go to miette for their macaroons..... the rose flavored, pistachios, chocolate, vanilla.. YUMMMMMMMMMMM! and then their carrot cake i laave, their scarffen berger cake too, ..and OMGGGGGGGGg their grapefruit cake.. TO DIIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE.. ughhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.. i want that for my next birthday! ........ it has a nougat bottom, and very tangy grapefruit filling sandwiched on a spongy cake! YUMMMMMM.. im in a miette orgy ! AHAHAHAH ;D

deffo the best! :D
author: Marc K.

description: Their macarons are delicious!  My mom ordered a variety of all their flavors and had them delivered to us as a Christmas gift.  They arrived beautifully packaged, with ice packs and lots of cushioning to keep them in pristine shape.  All of them were delicious.  The pistachio-flavored macaron's filling was particularly creamy and indulgent.  The cookie parts of the macarons had an excellent texture.  The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because I've experienced Laduree macarons before and would have to reserve five stars for those because their flavors are so outstanding.  But Miette macarons come pretty close - on par in texture, I think, but just a little less flavorful.  Miette may be the best you can get in the Bay Area!
author: Cardinal S.

description: I was drawn by how pretty all the cakes were.  However, I didn't want to buy a $3 cupcake because the last time I bought a $3 cupcake I was severely disappointed.  (No love for Cakelove...)  I did try their creme fresh scone, orange chocolate scone, and both their vanilla madeliene and chocolate madeliene.  They were all delicious!  I'm not a scone person, but now I'm craving them!  I'll have to try their cupcake next time.  If they are anything like the other treats then $3 would be a small price to pay for such goodness.
author: Becky T.

description: I love how everything is organic here :)  Macaroons are amazing, best I've had in my life... strangely similar to the ones at the Sunday brunch at Navio at the Half Moon Bay Ritz Carlton... maybe they're the same.  I love how everything is decorated here, so cute!  Carrot cake was very yummy.  Cakes are very rich but ooooh so good.
author: Joanne L.

description: Another gem in a sea of gems at the Ferry Building. We always stop by and get some macaroons. This past time I tried a banana cream tart and a pot de creme. All delicious. I am not a big fan of Scharfenberger chocolate but I do appreciate the well made pastries here.
author: Johnny J.

description: I've only had the lime tart here, but it was exquisite - albeit a little pricey.  Tasty and very fresh (don't you just hate stale pastry?).  I'll definitely be trying more of their treats the next time I'm at the Ferry Building.
author: DD B.

description:
How can you not love this place? Little pedestal stands surround the adorable desserts in this shop.

The best cake is the berger cake which has truffle ganache! dont be folled by the size of the cakes, one bite is equivalent to 20 bites!
author: Fat L.

description: This little french style bakery is one of the highlights of the Ferry Building.  Really well made goodies, beautifully displayed and packaged, and it feels very French/Euro.  The owner of another famous cupcake place in the city noted that their stuff was "over priced for what it is" but I didn't think that was true.  A great place for an after-lunch treat or a beautiful bite-sized cupcake to take home to someone special.  The picture book of pastries on the back counter has some of the best baked-goods photographs I've ever seen.
author: Brent F.

description: Considering I already have a fondness for cupcakes and little cute things this is just another cute little thing to love.  My mom got me a cake here for my bday.  I don't want to eat it 'cause it's so cute.  For this reason I can't comment on the taste yet...only on it's looks.  But the cover is always way better than the actual book anyways.
author: Lauren S.

description: Delicious! Cute!  I'm always going to come here for a birthday cake next time, forget the hunt downtown for better value, the quality more than makes up for the lack in quantity.  Better to call ahead of time if you know in advance....we ended up with the last unwanted cake and even that was incredible.  The presentation alone is outstanding but wait til you take a bite....it's the same amazingness and goodness.
author: Debbie Y.

description: I've been dreaming about their lovely french macaroons lately. So fresh, light, crispy and chewy.  Oh how I wish I could go there right now.
author: Alice R.

description: *SIGH*  Such great little cookies, the walnut shortbread is yummy.  Reminds me of shortbread cookies from Hawaii.  The rose geranium macaroon wasn't like anything I've tasted before....simple and delicate.  We came kind of late in the day and they ran of a lot of their cupcakes and cookies.
author: Marsh-Silog P.

description:
I have recently visited the other Miette( the candy store) and I decided to try out the bakery. I have never been in the Ferry Building before so I was impressed by all of the other eating options before I even got to Miette!
Anyways their location isn't as big as I pictured but it sure is cute. There were greeting cards, candles, individually wrapped cookie bags (chocoloate chip was almost all gone!) and behind the glass counter they had cupcakes, cookies, and other yummy looking cakes. The cakes were adorable and were mostly $30 or under.
The cupcakes were also very cute and looked sweet for only $3.
I ended up buying a chocolate and plain madeline and also a vanilla macaroon (?). The madelines tasted more like a "bread" to me but were satisfying and sweet.
The macaroon was very good though and had a nice sweet flavor to it.
I would definitely return here in the future, perhaps to buy a cake or try out some of their other goods.
author: Miss H K.

description:
I've never bought anything here that I've disliked.  And of all the dessert places I've been to in San Francisco, this place has more of my favorites than any other. 
The old fashioned cupcake is just delicious, as is the lime meringue tart, the candied almonds, the gingersnaps, the macaroons....
I could go on, but I won't.  If you've never tried anything from Miette, I suggest one tiny macaroon. And if you get hooked, there are plenty more items to choose from.
author: A J.

description: bought the cupcakes for a work bday party today....phenomenal.  Gingerbread with Cream Cheese frosting.  what else could you ask for?   adorable gift items available there too.  no time to look, but will be checking out more of miette next time I am in the Ferry Bldg
author: Tracy M.

description: Yummy French macarons without traveling to Paris, however overall it's a little sweeter than the real thing the other side of the Atlantic ocean.
author: J S.

description:
macaroons, wish that we had bought more. creamy, chewy, yet light all at the same time. awesome flavors though the hazelnut won out for best all around and pistachio came in last..

the coconut cream cake was also very good but not extraordinary

unfortunately, the ginger snaps were rockhard and tasted old and stale.
author: Tom L.

description: Instead of getting me a big, fancy engagement ring, my boyfriend should just place a Miette rose geranium macaron in a blue velvet box and call it a day.
author: Courtney B.

description: I always come here for the delicious pastries.  It's the highlight of the Ferry Building.  The friendly staff is diligent about explaining how the pastries should be served (i.e. store chilled, but remove from the chill chest two hours before service or at room temperature until served, etc.).  I've been admonished (and denied product) for confessing that I would serve a Princess Cake the following day rather than later that evening.  Instead, they special ordered a cake for me to pick up on the following day.  I've never been disappointed by anything.  But I'd especially recommend the Princess Cake, the hand-made macaroons, and the ginger bread cake.
author: QuodE D.

description: I can't get enough of their heavenly french macaroons... they're sweet, little chewy clouds of happiness. Way better than drugs or alcohol. Have also tried their Ginger Snaps and Ginger Bread Cupcakes--all super delicious.
author: S K.

description: Best place to buy Pot in San Francisco!  The experience is even better if you can rustle up a friend to share in the delights.  The selection, while somewhat spartan, is delectably refreshing and gives a smooth, mild boost.  I prefer the pot de creme / butterscotch myself... but as an open-minded fella would not cross my spoons if offered the chocolate.  I keep telling myself that one of these days I *will* succumb to the macaroons, but darn it those pots are good.
author: Jim W.

description: The only thing that I can add - so glad that I live in L.A. and it is just too crazy  to even contemplate flying to S.F. just to indulge in their cupcakes. The winner of the cupcake wars, hands down. Only Joan's on Third in L.A. comes remotely close.
author: Carla B.

description:
one time i was really craving for cupcakes.  really really craving for cupcakes.  so i went to miette to satisfy my craving.  got 3 cupcakes of different flavors since i couldn't decide what to get and besides, i can probably finish one of their cupcakes in 2 bites. 

i was disappointed. the cupcakes were dry. i thought it was just the plain cupcake that i first tried so i ate the chocolate cupcake- no luck. and then the chocolate strawberry cupcake- still no luck.

maybe my expectations were just too high...you can't blame me since the review on this place is pretty good. plus their prices are steep and i was expecting to get what i paid for.

would probably would not go back again. although i've been wanting to try their pot de creme. and i've heard their macaroons are awesome.

and oh, i'm not too thrilled with the snotty people at the counter.
author: J S.

description: I love patisseries. I love bakeries. I love French things. Miette's was ok. My main objection is il est trop cher. $1.50 for a macaron is a bit much. The Boyfriend said that he was a bit shocked at the price but after trying one, might be willing to pay it in the future. The macarons are very rich and thick but I still think it's a bit much, price-wise. I've been to Laduree in Paris (oh heavens!) and the macarons were much better there. I don't like things to be too sweet and the richness of Miette's was a bit overwhelming. The Parents came to town and the Mother excitedly pounced on a packet of what looked like marshmallows. I was sorely disappointed. Give me a Kraft Jet-Puffed Marshmallow over a Miette one any day. As for macarons, I'd rather pay $1.95 for a La Provence Patisserie one (mm, lavender).
author: Christine P.

description: I have been on the search for the perfect cupcake in San Francisco and I almost found it at Miette.  The chocolate cupcake was moist and had an intense chocolate taste.  It was topped off with a strawberry buttercream which was delicate and not too sweet.  Their Parisian macarons are what will keep me going back for more.   The rose geranium macaron was chewy and had a slight hint of rose & geranium in the filling...Mmm.  It was my first time having one of these and they were so yummy.
author: Monica L.

description: A favorite bakery based on their delicious bite-sized cookies (the chocolate are amazing) and their very Parisian macarons (try the pistachio!).   I haven't tried their cakes save for the basic chocolate cupcake (also wonderful!) but that's next on my list and I very much doubt my rating will change!
author: N. M.

description: The cupcakes are very beautiful, but they are very expensive and don't taste nearly as good as those at Kara's Cupcakes, Cups and Cakes Bakery, or That Takes the Cake.  Take the extra effort and head out to one of the three other bakeries - well worth the effort and much yummier!
author: Bruges L.

description:
Loved the lemon tart!  The shell was perfectly crunchy while still being flavorful.  The lemon curd was a delight...tart and sweet and still creamy (though personally I would've liked it to be just a tad more tart, I like my lemon curd to be really tart).  I did not like the small 'miette" paper tag that was placed in the middle of my tart to display the bakery's name.  When I removed it my fingers had to dig into my tart some and the paper took some of my lemon curd upon removal :(

I also tried the French Macaroons which I did not enjoy (and it should definitely be noted these are my favorite cookies ever!)  I found them to be a tad but too dry and I didn't enjoy the added texture.

Overall a great place.  Not only is the Ferry Building one of my new favorite places in SF, when I got to my hotel that night I looked up Miette on Babel Fish only to learn in is French for 'Crumb'.  That is sooooo freakin' cute!!!!
author: Shannon Z.

description: I was going to give 4 stars but due to the cashier's attitude, I cannot give 4 stars. I happened to have tried Miette's ginger cookie & I fell in love with it ! So gingerly! As it I'm eating ginger! I love cookies that has the strong real ingredient taste to it. I picked out some other cookies & the ginger cookie. At the counter, I realized that I left my wallet in my car so I had to go & get it. The cashier had no response when I said, I'll come right back with my wallet. I guess she wasn't too happy that I wasn't able to pay right at that moment. She wasn't friendly at all. But the cookies are awesome!! I gotta try their cake at another location! - They might be friendlier?
author: Sunny K.

description:
I'm a fan of Miette's.

Love their mini-cupcakes, especially the chocolate cake w/raspberry frosting -- which unfortunately is seasonal, & not available in the fall/winter. Luckily I had one a few weeks ago, not realizing the pending deadline! I recently tried a chocolate cake/chocolate frosting cupcake & found it enjoyable as well. Moist cake, yummy frosting that is not too sweet. Best to eat them right away or at room temperature...I mistakenly refridgerated one once & it hardened the frosting, & took away from the enjoyment of the cupcake.

A friend & I recently tried their Parisienne macaroons (which I never would have tried, since I don't like traditional coconut macaroons) & was delighted at the experience. Made w/almond meal, it's like a combination of a cookie & a brownie...chewy, crunchy texture with interesting flavors including the creamy middle of some. I am now a fan of these & will buy them again. A little pricey given the size, at $1.50 per, but a nice treat once & a while.
author: D L.

description: Usually delicious?  Yes, but when I ordered a Gingerbread birthday cake what we received had been frozen, was dry and just not good.  When I sent them an email to let them know they were not up to their usual good cakes I didn't get a response.  Well, I guess I did get a response, they just don't care anymore!  BEWARE
author: Joyce K.

description: I dreamt of Miette last night. Wrapped in a warm blanket of buttercream frosting - a veil of candied roses to floss. Into a vat of banana cream I flew! But atop a spongy bed of yellow cake insead I fell. A millions gingerbread hands upon my empty tummy rubbed; a treat! Tart after tart, cookies to cake, all tied up with a double-sided satin bow. A dream, I think. A dream of Miette... my love.
author: Katelin H.

description: The 5 stars is specifically for the macaroons...they are to die for!  Super moist and soft in the middle but slight crunch on the outer shell...yum!  All the flavors are great but the hazelnut is still my favorite.  Tried the cupcakes once and not so great...Kara's cupcakes by far is still my favorite!!
author: Tina L.

description: Much better than Citizen Cake - and organic too, for about the same price. I too, now love the gingerbread cupcake... and wow, talk about eye candy!
author: Anika K.

description: Their stuff is just too cute!  I picked up two of their cupcakes: 1) the old fashioned, 2) hmmm...  can't remember what the other one was.  Maybe a plain ol' vanilla one?  Anyhoo...  I didn't care for them anyway.  The flavor and texture of the cupcakes were bland and dry, respectively.  The only interesting about them was the marshmellowy  icing on the old fashioned cupcake.
author: Christine T.

description: After unsuccessfully getting a couple pan epi's from the Acme Bread Co. (sold out! I should have known!) I walked on over to get another cupcake from Miette. I gave the yellow cake with vanilla buttercream a try, and immediately after taking a bite I wish I had just stuck with the chocolate cake. It was just as moist, but too plain for me! Now I know.
author: S. D.

description: I did not know the Wayne Theibaud connection..... but theirs is certainly some of the most appealing graphic design/store design that I have ever been sucked into. I had a cookie there & it was definitely more beautiful than it was tasty. I prefer messy desserts.
author: Olivia S.

description:
****2/14/08 Update************
Came back today b/c I realized they have macarons.  They actually have perfected the method that the Parisians made.  They are absolutely delicious.  They have vanilla, chocolate, grapefruit, vanilla and jasmine.  But I believe they rotate out some of the ones as seasonal.. I will def. be back to try their other flavors.  Now I gotta try their other items.  The macarons have instilled trust for me for this bakery.  
*****************************
Everything looks good and pricey.  I tried the elcair and it's the best eclair that i've had for the longest time.  Maybe it's the location, or maybe they are supposed to be really good, but the pricing is high.  Maybe that's how much you really pay for good dessert?  Their Sharffen Berger creme pot was $5, but Absinthe sells the same thing for about $8 and it's helluva bigger pot.  I'm not saying that they are not good, just pricey, but give it a try when you're in the area.  

Good quality desserts are hard to find and you can tell that they are good when they don't load it with tons of sugar.  You can separate the taste in your mouth.  The eclair had three, the creme, the chocolate and the bread itself.  Temperature was kept perfect as well.  Not too cold so that it makes the bread all hard nor too warm so that the chocolate is melting.  Like i said, quality.  But do you want to pay the price?? That's for each individual to answer.
author: AhLin C.

description: bought 3 types of macarons today:  rose geranium, vanilla and strawberry.  i do admit that they are quite pricey ($1.50/each), but they are still worth a try.  the rose geranium one is quite good, and you can actually "taste" the scent of the flowers.  quite amazing.  i've also tried their lemon tarts before - and they are quite delicious (and i have tasted quite a few lemon tarts from all over the place).
author: andy w.

description: so what's not to like about Miette?? i'm in love with the macaroons, thanks to my bf! they have a cute little location inside of the ferry building. you can not just walk by this place, you must stop by to get something! my mom loves this place too.. and she's very lucky, she works down the street! she can stop by any time!
author: Eileen Q.

description: Miette has the best macaroons around. they have just the right amount of crunch balanced with spongy squish. the flavors are spot on, and i love that everything is organic. i have to admit, the only other thing of their's i've had is the carrot cake...and it's still about the macaroons.
author: sarah C.

description: I had read about this bakery in the magazine and was had expeted the cupcakes to be better than safeway cupcakes.  I tasted the ginger and chocolate cupcakes and was so suprised at how much they tasted like the cheap few days old cupcakes at luckys or safeway.  they weren't  moist as i expected.  the frosting was so thick and too sweet.  for 3 dollars a piece, they are definitely not worth it.  i think all their money goes into the pretty boxes and bags.  don't wast your money or time.
author: Melanie G.

description: It's the only place I can find the little colorful French-style macaroons. They aren't nearly as divine as La Duree, but they'll do for now.
author: Alotta F.

description:
I love Miette, and i can understand why people love Miette as well:
(1)  Their French Macaroons:  truly authentic, brings me back to all the Paris bakeries I raided while I was there.  I especially enjoy their Hazelnut flavored French Macaroons.  Pricey, I know, but sometimes when you need a treat, one macaroon is all you need.
(2)  Gingersnaps:  I can understand why this made the "100 things to try in SF before you die" list.  It's spicy, gingery, buttery, crispy, and light.  $6 a tin ain't half bad considering it might last you a few days (or in my case, 36 hours, ha ha)
(3) Chocolate cupcake with the white icing & red hot on top:  i forgot the name of the cupcake, but i do remember what it looks like.  It's the one with the super-smooth white frosting on top.  The taste: divine.  Gotta try it.
(4) Chocolate Tart:  It tastes like a chocolate terrine, but a bit smoother, with hazelnut flavor (and maybe hazelnuts?  haven't had it in a while, but it had made quite an impression the last time i had it, which was 5 years ago).  not too sweet, but definitely pretty chocolately rich.
author: Laura C.

description: Bumble Bee CAKE.. so yummy, the perfect birthday cake if you ask me... Just had mine last week and then there is the lavendar shortbread, such happiness.  Really is there anything better? Such a special place....
author: Joy C.

description: Cupcakes... That's all I've got to say. I come to the Ferry Building for Miette's cupcakes. It's the only place I can get chocolate cupcakes with a marshmallow topping. Delicious! They also have the cutest cakes for birthdays too! I took off a star because sometimes the buttercream on the frosting of the other cupcake flavors are a bit heavy and flavoriess.
author: Elisa M.

description:
one word: macarons

i keep buying boxes of them with good intentions to gift them to friends back in the east bay. they're usually gone by treasure island.

if you ever receive one from me consider yourself hella lucky. and assume that i already ate at least five of them before i offered you one.
author: Angie S.

description: The girls at the counter here are so sweet and nice, it's impossible to keep from stopping in after a Ferry Building lunch for an Old Fashioned cupcake. (East coasters who miss marshmallow Fluff will love this.) Everything I've ever had here is wonderful; the only thing that was a little overpriced were the parisian macaroon cookies.
author: Shannon R.

description: Got one of their Tomboy cakes a layered chocolate cake with fresh strawberry butter cream.  Man was it good.  We had a birthday party at the office and 1/2 the cake fed 6 people.  Top notch baking, top notch ingredients and top notch taste!  Rich Rich Rich!!!  Loved it!!
author: Ron T.

description:
miette, i recommend you with caution to all of the ladies who were asking me where i got the lovely cupcakes for my mom's birthday celebration.  

i was on a small budget, but i wanted your darling cupcakes so badly for the party that i splurged.  i went down to the ferry building with my cupcake stand to visit you, to make sure the cupcakes would fit and that i could arrange the correct pickup time.  i was concerned - my party was in the east bay, would the cupcakes melt on a hot july day?

we discussed the party and agreed that i should pick them up chilled.  i would keep them cool in the car and all would be grand.  i gave you my credit card.  

imagine my disappointment/frustration on party day, when i pickedup my 35 cupcakes, and you tell me frankly that you have lost my order?  that my cupcakes are room temperature, but that's good, that's how they should be served?  

i stopped on the way to the party for a cooler and ice, but they were already melted.  you see, it was a warm day in the city, and likely warmer than room temperature in the ferry building.  

i saved most of them, but they were melty and gooey on my cupcake stand.  the guests did not notice, they were delicious - but given the splurge i was very upset, especially with how the situation was handled.  you offered no discount, no coupon, and only a frank "im sorry" to my pre-party spirit. 

again, i recommend you with caution.
author: Kristin K.

description: HOLY CUPCAKES!!!  This is my favorite place to satisfy my sweetooth downtown.  The gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting is my absolute favorite, but the others are wonderful as well...and the macaroons bring you right to Paris.  Attention nice single boys...this is the way to a woman's heart...mine anyway:)
author: Sarah D.

description: If I died and were reincarnated, I'd like to come back as a Miette macaroon.   It'd be a short life but ultimately very delicious and one not wasted.
author: Gary L.

description:
This place has the best service I have found in a bakery!! I ordered cupcakes for a work event and they turned out fabulous!! I ended up ordering only a day ahead and they were still able to take my order, no problem. When I was ordering over the phone the sales person made a mistake running my card, but was so apologetic and sincere, it didn't even bother me.

The pick up day arrived and I was soo ready for cupcakes!! I headed over to the store, had practically no wait time, not at all what I was expecting during lunch hour. They were neatly boxed and ready to go as soon as I got to the register. The sales lady that had taken my order actually took care of me in person too, and she still apologized for the confusion!! Even if I hadn't LOVED the cupcakes, I would have still given a great review, just because of this small detail, which not many places have anymore.

Now for the cupcakes...I'm speechless, they were fantastic!! I ordered an assortment, no one had any idea what any flavor was until they bit into it, but there were definitely no complaints!! I also ordered a macaroon...wow...they are scrumpcious!! Can't wait to go again!!
author: Jess B.

description: I thought that the Parisien macaroons where my favorite until someone brought ginger cupcakes to work.  I am now a cupcake convert.
author: Nellie L.

description: Miette, my sweet love, you are pink cupcake joyous rapture. I crush you so hard.
author: Caroline E.

description:
how have i not reviewed miette yet?!

well, if you have ever wanted delicious organic pastries and the like, this is your spot.  oh, and if you like fatty, delicious buttercream, this is your spot, too.

try the chocolate cupcake with coffee flavored (by blue bottle) buttercream; it's to die for!
author: Jill k.

description:
Best CAKE I have ever eaten! We got the Lemon Debutante for a co-worker's birthday. It was so yummy.... moist, light, and great amount of lemon to compliment the cake.

Definitely recommend
author: Susan L.

description: A cute little shop with awesome cupcakes and macarons. A bit pricey but it's worth the splurge. I had their gingerbread cupcake and their chocolate raspberry cupcake. Both were very moist and delicious. The frosting on the gingerbread cupcake is made of cream cheese and is very tasty. The little flower on top of the cupcake is a cute detail. The macarons were quite good but the cupcakes were much better. Even the pink paper bag that comes with the order is cute with flowers all over.
author: Mimy P.

description:
oh so cute, those cookies in the jars!  

Stop here when you're browsing the ferry building and enjoy a sweet treat!
author: Angie C.

description: The rose geranium macaroons are out of this world.  I like to buy a couple during my lunch breaks for a quick little treat and for good stress relief when my tyrant of a boss gets on my last nerve.
author: Andrea U.

description:
cute 'lil store with sooooo many perfectly-cutsy-dreamy cakes, tarts, cupcakes, cookies!!!!!!!!!!!

i went for their 'lil heavenly parisian macaroons..........chocolate, hazelnut & coffee...............tried to fit 4 nibbles into a macaroon to savor the taste, experience the ever so slight hint of crispness on the initial contact, the utter moistness & divine flavor that takes you into a sheer blissful moment of mm--mm---mmmmmm moaning goodness!!!!!!!  this lil macaroon is my crack-at-the-moment!!!!!

jennifer l's review of their cupcakes has inpired me to get some (i want to be there too 'just me & the cupcake, hand in hand, flying over sugar dusted meadows & fields of candied flowers, dipping my fingers in a river of chocolate')..............so next time will need to add cupcakes on top of my macaroons!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Cindi N.

description: 1.75 for macarons. Had the rose geranium which tasted like rose petals. Hazelnut was good too, I think the filling was nutella.
author: Shep T.

description: The Old-Fashion and Scharffen Berger are always favorites of mine. Place is pricey but it is a cake boutique afterall. I'd pass on the Tomboys. They were still decent but not worth the price. The shortbread cookies was a bit ordinary.
author: Alan L.

description:
Oh my! I liked Laura b's review personally but I am a bit surprised by the personal responses on the site it is getting. I thought the whole point of places like the Ferry building was to surreptitiously sneak a peek at their reviews on Yelp, quietly fume to themselves on the bad ones and then just go on? Oh well!

I really like Miette. My first experience with it was when of my  exco worker brought in a bag of macaroons with him, upon which I ate 6, not knowing they were $1.50 each. He must be very polite because he never said anything. I later ventured over to the Ferry Building to pick up some more of these bad boys for myself (pistachio and hazelnut) and thus discovered the loveliness that is Miette. Other favs include their caramels and of course their cupcakes, although I wonder if I'm one of the few people who cannot stand to eat ALL the frosting (although I always eat all the sprinkles). A nice place to grab a litle treat after lunch/din at the Ferry Building, sit down outside and people watch on a nice sunny day. Again I must recommend the macaroons, I've never had better except for Laduree and they don't ship here so Miette it is.
author: Veronica F.

description: I finally made it to Mietta to try their famous $3 cupcakes...I must say I wasn't impressed.  The cupcakes are quite small for the price BUT if they were SUPER amazing that would be acceptable, sadly, they weren't amazing but rather average.  Yes they were moist and not too sweet but again, I didn't quite get the WOW factor....their presentation was quite simple and nice but again....no WOW factor there....maybe I should't have order the chocolate with strawberry creme frosting?  I actually ended up throwing away half the frosting.
author: Mel S.

description: Amazing cakes.  I was on the search for cakes to serve as centerpieces for my wedding, so I had the fun task of trying most bakeries in SF (Miette, Citizen Cake, Tartine, etc.)  We needed to find great cakes that could sit out for a few hours, and found it in their Scharffen Berger chocolate cake and their gingerbread cake.  Both really most, decadent, but no overpowering, etc.  They make those in smaller individual size portions, so I'd highly recommend you try it.
author: Salena C.

description: This place is hella bomb!  Everything is delicious!  I definitely recommend treating yourself!
author: Shaun W.

description: I had my first ever macaron at Miette, and was extremely dissappointed.  It was too sweet for my taste and there wasn't enough filling.  Originally, I had thought that maybe this was what macaron supposed to taste like...until...I tasted the macarons at Bouchon Bakery and loved them.  It then dawned on me that Miette's macarons are just not up to par.
author: lani h.

description: The world seems like such a better place when you have a box of Miette's divine chocolate cupcakes with marshmallow frosting.
author: Pamela B.

description:
Working near Embarcadero lends you many "food" options... craving something sweet I decided to try out Miette's Patisserie. The place was so adorable and sweet I was satisfied looking at it alone. The Parisian Macarons were sinful and I recommend the hazelnut one ;P The Gingerbread cupcake is a little heavenly present. 

I bought a package of peanut butter and walnut shortbread cookies for the office and the consensus was that they were "soo good and cute"

YAY for cuteness
author: Lena L.

description: Macarons are delicious.  The chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting was good - the cake part was amazing, but the frosting could have had a tad more strawberry flavor to balance the strength of the chocolate.  The ginger cupcake would probably make a better muffin - the cake part was delicious, but the cream cheese frosting was too intense and too voluminous ... maybe something less overwhelming would be a better fit for that particular treat.  Grapefruit candy was really yummy.  Old fashioned cupcake was also pretty delicious.  Still think the macarons are my favorite though.
author: Kristen H.

description: To be honest, I'm not the biggest macaroon fan - always thought of them as some weird futuristic dessert for a post-apocalyptic world.  However, a friend recommended this place as being "as good as Paris".  The macaroon did have a nice crunch and the filling was rich.  But it didn't blow me away and had that strange artificial taste that's turned me away from macaroons in the past.  I'm probably just weird.
author: Jeremy C.

description: This is one of the cutest bakeries I've ever seen. I dream about the amazing gingerbread cupcakes with cream-cheese frosting. And that they are made with organic ingredients makes me feel slightly better about eating them!
author: Bridget S.

description: Macarons are the things to get here. Nice thin crust with a chewy, melt-in-your-mouth interior, my tongue does little jumping jacks in my mouth as I eat these. So delicious. Every time at the Ferry Building, I must get a few macarons to go.
author: Linda L.

description: Their macaroons aren't the best or worst i've had, their in the middle. However, when I went to buy my macaroons there was a long line and now that I think about it, waiting in the long line was totally not worth it. I tried the hazelnut macaroon and another macaroon flavored and named after a flower. It wasn't amazingly delicious so I can't seem to recall the exact name.
author: Lynne T.

description:
Came here for dessert after lunch at the Slanted Door. Originally I was only gonna get 2 macaroons at $1.50 each. But turns out they only take card for orders over $10, so I got a banana cream tart, and also charged M.'s Schraffen-Berger chocolate bombe to my card. At $5 per bombe/tart, it was pretty steep, but I've been known to pay exorbitant prices for good dessert (neither my waistline nor my wallet is very happy with me). 

DESSERT:
BANANA CREAM TART
I thought it was just gonna be banana custard and whipped cream, but nooo, there was a layer of chocolate on the bottom, on top of this delicious shortbread crust. It was really tasty. Not overly sweet, nor too rich tasting, but enough of both to give a nice mouth feel and to make me want another one right away. And the chocolate-banana combo is just classic. 

SCHRAFFEN-BERGER CHOCOLATE BOMBE
Chocolate dome cake covered with bittersweet chocolate ganache - it was rich and decadent.  The chocolate cake wasn't as dense as I expected (or dreaded) and together with the smooth ganache came just shy of being overpowering. I really like that their products aren't too sweet, just enough to make them taste good while still preserving the natural flavor of the ingredients. And extra points for using a local chocolate :)

GERANIUM ROSE  MACAROON and PISTACHIO VANILLA MACAROON
Texture-wise, not my favorite but still good. The flavor of the geranium rose is great. 

OVERALL: Cute place located in the Ferry Market, many varieties of macaroons, great cakes and tarts immaculately presented. They have also succumbed to the $3 cupcake fad, but since Love at First Bite, I'm refusing to shell out $3 for cupcakes...and instead will spend $5 on a little tart. Yea I don't make much sense.
author: Irene L.

description: Miette is such an adorable little bakery, and their macarons are amazing!
author: Peach C.

description: I only had the cupcakes, which were light and airy, with frosting that was not sickeningly sweet.  Believe me, the cupcakes were good, but I have had better locally.  If I ever go back to Miette I will sample the other pastries on the menu.  I think my rating will improve after tasting more of the goodies.
author: Suzanne F.

description: Get the ever changing ice cream sandwiches.  Firm ice cream on crunchy cookies - SO delicious.
author: Danielle B.

description: Their chocolate cake is to die for. I'll eat it all day, thanks. Scharffen Berger chocolate was definitely the way to go.
author: Ellie P.

description: $1.50 for world's best 'macaroons', although I'd say the chewy yet flaky texture and delicate presentation of a sandwich cookie should not be labeled with a name; I've never had anything quite like it before! Now four of my favorite things are in the ferry building-the other three being Slanted Door imperial rolls, Taylor's sweet potater fries, and Tsar Nicolai's caviar!
author: Kim G.

description: It's a little bit expensive, and when I came here the service wasn't so great.  Maybe the person before us gave them a hard time, cause they seemed pretty pissed off.  Anyway, we tried a couple of the macaroons here, $1.50 a pop.  We also had a $5 pot de creme, which was like a really thick, rich pudding.  You can give them the pot back for a dollar, but I opted to keep the glass jar.  As you can see, it's pretty easy to rack up a large bill here, which is probably a good thing for moderation's sake.
author: Tony L.

description:
So yes, it's pricey. But so worth it...!!!
On our way to Mendocino we stopped at the Ferry Building to load up on good stuff for our little beach picnic. I decided to get an eclair for dessert.  It must have been a call from above - from the patissier heaven if there is one, and it'd better should be. I am French and frankly Miette's eclair was the best I have had in my entire life. The chocolate frosting was rich, thick and very flavorful. I mean it tasted like chocolate - and not like some kind of colored-sugar you too often find in bakeries in France. The crust was close to perfection - a perfect balance of chewy and crusty, great texture. And the filling....well...you'll have to find out by yourself. As we say in the "eclair country" - "le petit Jesus en culotte de velours" (baby Jesus in velvet underwear...don't ask)
It was so overwhelming that I had to go back on my last day to get another one and share it with my man.
Thank you Miette!
author: Aurore L.

description: For all those people who actually like Citizen Cake and Citizen Cupcake, these are what real cupcakes taste like. I love the variety of frostings, so I can avoid those that are too sweet. And as many others have mentioned Parisian macaroons are unlike any other dessert pastry; I like to stop by and grab a few for later, but they pretty much never make it home. It only gets four starts because it is not my favorite dessert place in the Ferry building, but is by far my favorite cupcake place.
author: Midori G.

description: I've had all the differnet types of macaroons at miette and love them all.  They are all made perfectly and are always in stock.  They are slightly overpriced though for what you get.  Service is great. Not sure anyone gets anything else at Miette other than macaroons.
author: Paul C.

description:
This was my first experience at Miette it was....ok.

Cupcakes:

I first had the yellow cake with vanilla buttercream frosting and it was delicious. The frosting was the best frosting I've ever had, it was fresh and not at all thick and overwhelming like most frostings. The cake itself was good but I felt like it lacked in flavor....

Then I had the chocolate cake with vanilla buttercream frosting. Again, the frosting was delicious, best ever! The cake itself was way too chocolatey, and I love chocolate but It was surprisingly too powerful in flavor, I couldn't finish the cake too strong.... My brother got the same one and couldn't finish the cake because it was too intense, he agreed that the frosting was the best! 

Lastly, I got the packaged $5 walnut cookies. First off I don't know if they are meant to be like this but they are salty. They still taste good and they have a nice buttery flavor. Great with milk or tea or by themselves, downside is that they are salty. I gave one to my brother and he immediately said "they're salty", and then I gave one to my sister and she immediately said "why are they salty?" We just agreed that that's just how they are but nonetheless they are still tasty, just a bit salty...

Overall from what I've had at this place I give it three out of five stars.
I wish I would have tried their macaroons although I was in a hurry to go and forgot to get some...next time though.
author: Jack F.

description: Mmm...I went here for the first time today.  I had an old fashioned cupcake--chocolate with some sort of marshmallow goop on top.  Really moist and yummy.
author: Katie S.

description: One word- precious...and not the Lord of the Rings "Preeeeeeecccccciouuuus"- although if you took away my old Fashioned cupcake, I'd probably beat you with a stick too.  I went on a slight Miette overload today- I joyfully picked out out the aforementioned cupcake, a lemon pound cake, raspberry thumbprint cookies, and a perfect madeleine. I've had a bite of each and each was perfect, gorgeous deliciousness. Amazing stuff.
author: Noelle Q.

description: I've had Miette cakes on several occassions. My work likes to get them for people's bdays. They are really top notch. I had the chocolate cake once and boy is it rich!!!! But phenomenal.  The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of the prices - high. I mean, it does all come down to flour doesn't it??
author: Anna S.

description: I have heard so many wonderful things about mietta, finally getting to go there today felt like a blessing.  During my first experience at the Saturday farmer's market, I knew that I had to make sure to try one of their cupcakes.  Choosing the chocolate cupcake with raspberry buttercream frosting was tough - they all looked so very tasty.  I fully enjoyed the flavor, though the raspberry was a bit stronger than I was expecting.  Still, I am now a loyal customer - I shall make sure to get all celebration cakes from them (especially for my birthday in June, hint hint).
author: Victoria K.

description:
awww their cakes and other treats are so cute~
i bought a little carrotcake today, i can't wait to eat it!! :D

they have some ceramic/glass cake platters for sale too... i didn't actually look at them much... just from a distance, but this one tourist man bought 2 of them and his total was $200 something, so i'm assuming they're handmade/hand painted... they were pretty though.

i also like their black licorice puppies, whatever they're called... though they're a little too sweet.  i do prefer a saltier black licorice.
author: charlotte s.

description: Not too much to add to the many great reviews already up here. Best cupcakes in SF - just big enough to satisfy a sweet tooth.  Great stop after hitting the ferry building farmers market.
author: Bart C.

description:
gentlemen, i have found the secret. notice that 9 out of 10 miette yelpers have y-chromosome deficiency syndrome. 
CHICKS DIG CUPCAKES!

last week my nyc-based cupcake loving favorite friend and teresa n. found ourselves at the ferry building.  after much female debate and little to no male opinion we walked away with a gingerbread cupcake.  being the gentleman that i am, i carried the lovely pink wrapper-ed cake while we headed to grab a drink.

i was immediately approached by a b-e-a-utiful blonde who flashed me a gorgeous smile and said in the sweetest voice  "hi, where did you get that cupcake?" now, i am certainly not fluent in "woman" but i'm pretty sure that translates to "I WANT YOU(r cupcake) NOW!!!".  there you have it, guys.  if you want to be surrounded by beautiful women:  miette.
