p.s.  i could tell from the gingerbread cupcake that their carrot cake is probably pretty good too, but i'm not sure that one has the pheromones in it.
author: Steven C.

description: Once I peered in the display case, I had to wonder if I died and gone to heaven.
author: Royce L.

description: the macaroons are so good. so fresh. and so much better than the ones at bottega louie in la. it was like a party in my mouth.
author: Shameemah M.

description: They have the cutest displays that makes everything look extra yummy, tempting me to take it all home.  But I look at the prices and I realize I can make my own cupcakes or tarts and end up with a dozen instead of a couple.  So I go home and make my own cute cupcakes and cookies.  Because, really, sweet little treats should be something you can afford with a couple of crumpled singles and some change in your pocket when the impulse hits you.  I'm in the wrong business is what it is.
author: maiko h.

description: I absolutely adore their french macaroons!  I'm so in love with it, I even gave a set of each of the six macaroons to my friends for Christmas.  I haven't quite found any place that has it as good as the ones in Paris.  It's an added bonus that the bakery is organic and that they use Scharffen Berger chocolate - I'm not sure if it makes all the difference but I think it does in the quality.  Definitely a must if you're in the Ferry Building.
author: Lorraine D.

description: I love Miette.  Everything is organic and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients.  The desserts are even displayed and packaged elegantly.  Their Parisian Macarons are absolutely to die for.  Though they're a bit pricey at $1.50 a pop, the chewy crunchy texture makes them extremely addictive and well-worth the $$$.  I love the chocolate variety, but the vanilla and hazelnut are excellent too.  However, I don't really care for the cupcakes.  The frosting is too thick and sweet.  Whenever I'm in the Ferry Building (which is much too often), I make it a point to stop at Miette.
author: Saw T.

description: I made it to the Miette organic bakery in SF in search of Miette-obelia to give my daughter.  My sensibilities are still smarting from their $30 t-shirts, and I was positively underwhelmed by the $4 cupcakes.  Still, I got Miette some cool stuff, and the ladies there loaded me up with stickers, bags, and Ribbon with Miette all over them.
author: Zach T.

description: Cupcakes  - Pretty to look at, but seriously, who *needs* that much frosting/icing?  If you like dense cupcakes, then Miette's the place for you.  But frankly, I don't so I'll keep searching for my cupcake heaven.
author: Anonymouse C.

description:
I'm going to have to give Miette 3 stars for their cupcakes. I tried their chocolate with the mocha buttercream and found the crumb to be a little too dense, and the buttercream to be wayyyy too melty and soft. 

I would say these trail behind Citizen Cake's.
author: Jovi C.

description: They've got GREAT chocolate shortbread cookies. So buttery it feels like it melts in your mouth. They put in the perfect amount chocolate with a hint of salt...so you don't get sick of eating so many sweets! Their chocolate "hostess" cupcakes are yummy too - it's a great play on the American classic with the frosting in the middle. I'm not a big macaroon fan so I can't comment on those...except that they're pretty. I'm still waiting for someone to buy me one of their exquisite cakes :-)
author: Nina R.

description:
scharffen berger cake is the cake to die for!

(and the mini version is so adorable!) 
the cake is not too sweet. truffle ganache was perfect. smooth. but not too moist. it's pack with chocolate flavor. *YUM*

and i love their lime meringue tart and banana cream tart. 

speaking of Macaron - i enjoy the hazelnuts ALOT! :)  

it's not cheap. but i think it's worth to pamper yourself with a delicious pastry after a long day at work. it's my anti-depression therapy. haha!
author: Michelle L.

description: After having lunch at the Farmer's Market, I needed to satisfy my sweet tooth and headed to this cute patisserie inside of the Ferry Building. The mini jars of caramel panna cotta in the bakery case immediately caught my eye. Soo cute. About $4 a jar with a $1 refund if you return the jar after consumption. The panna cotta definitely hit the spot - super creamy and delicious. There were a lot other yummy looking items, the next time I stop by the Ferry Building, I will definitely be back to try more. Maybe the chocolate pot de creme....
author: Daphne R.

description: My friend and I were walking through the Ferry Building when we decided to get dessert. OK....I've read some comments about the staff being unattentive but that couldn't have been farther from the truth in my experience. They were super friendly and eager to give us their recommendations. I had a brownie with walnuts and it was amazing. Perfect texture....I would highly recommend this place although it can get somewhat expensive especially if you're ordering a cake.
author: Barbara O.

description: OMG! I love this place. Thank goodness I don't work across the street anymore... I'm fat enough as it is. Organic and YUMMY! I love the shortbread cookies, the Parisian cookies, the ginger cake, scones, everything!!!
author: Dana B.

description: Never thought there'd be a place dedicated almost entirely to cupcakes, but this is it.  Nonetheless, it's very good.
author: Rohit G.

description:
Revised (06/01/07): after trying out Cocola and Pamplemousse Patisserir & Cafe, Miette's macarons are by far the best out of all three.

After researching for the best macarons in town, I've decided to give my first to Miette Cakes in the Ferry Building.  In addition to the macarons (hazelnut, vanilla, and pistacio) I bought, I also got a chocolate pot de creme.  First off with the chocolate pot de creme, it completely paled in comparison with the earl grey pot de creme from Bouchon in Napa.  Miette's one just didn't have the right consistency.  It tasted like a diluted chocolate mousse.  So not worth the $5 bucks!

On the other hand, the macarons tasted good.  The cookies were chewy and moist and the cream filling wasn't too thick.  Until I try out a few other macarons from other patisseries, I would recommend it to my friends.  One thing I think Miette can improve on is their packaging.  The store is nicely decorated but when I asked for a bag to take my goodies with me, I was offered a brown bag! yes, a brown bag that kids would use to bring their lunch to school! And not to mention, the pot de creme was placed in a chinese to go style container! Also, unlike the macarons I know of that the cookies and filling are the same flavor (for example, red cookies and filling for raspberry, green cookies and filling for pistachio, white cookies and filling for vanilla, etc...), Miette's macarons have the same flavor (I believe) cookies for all the various creme fillings.  Since the sales placed all my macarons in one small bag, I couldn't tell apart from the vanilla macaron and pistacio macaron.  Obviously, the only one that I can tell apart is the hazelnut because the filling was dark brown.  Perhaps Miette can produce their signature stickers with the flavor imprinted on it and the sales can place each macaron in a tiny individual bag and sealed with the sticker, that way, the macaron is nicely presented to the customers with no mistake on which flavor they are trying out.

Two stars for the macarons.
author: Shirley H.

description: I love Miette purely for the Lavender Shortbread Cookies. They are gorgeous and fragrant and drive me wild. My perfect ccokie. All the other goodies there are just icing on the cake. My husband is a big fan of the walnut shortbread cookes, they have salt on them and nuts. But I am all about the lavender.
author: tara s.

description: The hype surrounding this place has been off the hook.  Honestly, I can say the best thing about it is the displays and packaging.  As far as the taste??? I would say don't bother forking out the dough (no pun intended) for one of these.  Instead, go to Delessio and get a bunch of mini cupcakes that have incredible flavor.  And the people are nicer at Delessio too! :0)
author: Suzanne L.

description:
their macaroons are delightful. pretty shop and friendly service. 

my boyfriend bought me a lemon tart and gingerbread cake for my birthday and they both did not disappoint. they are a little pricey but worth it. cute packaging and presentation.
author: michella s.

description:
Wonderful macaroons (I tried the pistachio and hazelnut)!!

The carrot cake is great too, with perfect cream cheese frosting and cake filled the perfect mix of nuts and dough. 

Old-Fashioned Cupcake had a unique meringue marshmallowy frosting, which matched well with the moist cake! But, the red decor drop on the top didn't really taste like much (still don't know what it is).

Besides, the packaging is so cute and cheerful!
author: Emily H.

description: I'm giving 5 stars only for the French macaroons. My favorite are the the vanilla, pistachio, and the grapefruit. They are soft and crumbly. The are pretty expensive though. $1.50 each.
author: Diana S.

description: Just their chocolate pots de creme is worth the five star rating.  This place is not cheap but so worth it.  When we went, we only got the chocolate pots de creme and a few macaroons, which were both really good.  The shop itself is really cute and girly with their pink decor and the friendly staff working the counter.  I wanted to buy everything I saw but I refrained myself.  One of the best things about Miette is the cute packaging they use and they let you use your credit card!
author: Mei L.

description: By chance, we were at the Ferry Building for lunch and I decided to try their cupcake.  I had the chocolate with vanilia buttercream frosting.  And.... nothing.  Still like Kara's better. AND I had to spend at least $10 to use my atm card.  The cake was a little dry and I felt there was too much frosting to cupcake ratio.
author: Mare C.

description: The rose geranium macaron was really a burst of flavor and fragrant. Also tried the pot de creme and it was not too bad either and comes in a cute lil glass jar which gives you a $1 refund when you return miette the jar. Overall, I was not superwhelmed by miette but I'll give the rest of their lovely treats another chance next time
author: Topazskye L.

description: Such delicious  gingerbread cupcakes.  I love their apothecary jars full of salty caramels, and chocolate caramels..... so flavorful and the perfect chewiness.
author: sharon m.

description:
in the rare occasion i decide to take a saturday off, my first order to business is always to check out the ferry building's farmers market. i've walked by miette a few times and ogled the lovely looking creations they have to offer, but today was the first time i got to taste one. 

oh. my. god. 

the macaroons are as good as it gets. fluffy, soft, heaven flavored. the peanut butter cookies are the perfect combination of crumbly and moist. i also picked up a creme fraiche scone but truth be told, i was not totally blown away. i mean, it was damn good, but the scone crown still belongs to bake sale betty's in Oakland. but this was a deserving second, for sure. this is really a 4.75 star review, but yelp wont let me do that, so i'll have to give them four stars. but really, aside from the scone (which was really quite good, its just that bake sale betty's has ruined me) it was totally five stars. 

the prices are totally reasonable, the staff was friendly and the line moved quickly. 

now i'm going to slip into a happy little sugar coma...
author: Meta K.

description: This patisserie is my favorite in the city. I love the cupcakes (the old fashioned is my favorite, followed by the gingerbread) and the macaroons are delightful.
author: E J.

description: HEAVENLY!!! This is one of the best best best (other than sprinkles cupcakes) places to savor a delicious cupcake or vanilla waffer cookies or chocolate mousse cake or  vanilla cake the list does on! Yes I think I've tried mostly everything. Its pricey but who can resist their heavenly cookies in their cute pink bags!! Their cakes melt in your mouth. The icing is sweet but not irritating sweet. Its perfect! Everyone must try this place!
author: Lovecandy G.

description:
i love miette, handsdown the best place for cakes and cupcakes in SF! the cakes are moist and the buttercream bursts with freshness and flavor. everything is so elegant and cute at the same time! their  strawberry buttercream is simply heavenly! i get myself a cupcake when i feel depressed or when i feel like i deserve something nice. Miette never fails to brightne up my day! 

you know there's a lot of love in what they do because they care to use the local, organic and sustainable ingredient whenever possible! 

miette inspired me to take up baking as a hobby and now that i've tried doing it myself, i have even more appreciation for Miette because i know it's not easy to make fine baked goods.
author: Amy W.

description: Chocolate shortbread cookies. With just a hint of salt that keeps you coming back for cookie after cookie after cookie...until you feel sick. Oh, the pounds this place has added to me. My only complaint is that I've gone on a few occasions and not seen these cookies. Which I'm viewing as a blessing in disguise....
author: erik l.

description: You said it Sarah, yummy! Phew, I can not finish this chocolate heaven that sits in front of me right now. I'll have to save some for later (darn) :)
author: Jewel N.

description: As someone who tends to lick the frosting off a cupcake and leave the rest, I will say this: I ate my entire Miette cupcake. I will also say that I have had better cupcakes, more than once. If you want a richer, denser, more rewarding cupcake, try Icing on the Cake bakery in Los Gatos.
author: Kathleen B.

description: The presentation of the confections and cakes at this Ferry Bldg. stop is right in line with the rest of the place: decadence and fine food artistry.  The cakes are simplistic in color, shape, and decoration; appearing like mini paintings in the bakery window.  I have only sampled the traditional French style macarons, chocolate, vanilla and pistashio.  The little cookies have the most astonishing texture, it  has a slightly crisp outer shell which turns into a cloud as you bite into it.  Combined is the heavenly cream in the middle (indicative of the flavor selected).  The pistachio is my favorite of these three flavors.  I am dying to try more of the various offerings of this beautiful bakery.
author: Amy H.

description: I loved the parisians and the old fashioned cupcake. Kind of pricey, though the look and taste of the desserts are amazing!
author: Margaret W.

description: Luverly.   Wish I could roll into the city more often to get my fix.  Very Sharffenberger-y.
author: Erika B.

description: I've never seen graham crackers that looked so divine.  Everything is picture perfect and adorable.  The macaroons are sugary sweet and perfect with a hot caffeinated treat, soft and creamy inside, so yummy.  dreamy.  The caramel pot was awesome - it comes in a little glass, mini honey pot shaped jar with foamed whip cream on top that looks like cappuccino foam.  I'm in love.
author: Today Y.

description: I've been a fan of Miette for quite some time. The lime tartlet and buttermilk panna cotta are my absolute favorites. If you're headed to the Ferry Building it's a must to swing by. Although I'd steer clear of the chocolate cupcakes, they tend to be a bit chalky.
author: Angela K.

description: Everything is so beautiful presented.  The cupcakes are wonderfully light and not overly sweet.  The only thing holding me back is justifying spending $3 for a cupcake.
author: J I.

description: Delicious cupcakes and cakes.  On the pricey side though.  Good if you feel like splurging.  Oh, and their macaroons (the pistachio and the hazelnut) are the bomb!
author: Jones D.

description: I love the Ferry Building and this is just one more reason why!  Cupcakes which are tough- are fabulous!  And they little bags of flavored cookies for $5- that are so yummy.  The camels are amazing- basically pick your poison.
author: lauren h.

description: The cakes are wonderfully rich and the perfect size.  And not too sweet.  Great service, to boot.
author: K W.

description: I thoroughly savored and enjoyed the gingerbread cupcake, the hazlenut macaroon, the chocolate macaroon and oooohh the chocolate pot thing.
author: Hollita P.

description: I'm hooked on their french macaroons....their Rose Geranium ones and then their strawberry ones.  But I could get VERY fat with those rose geranium ones if I lived in SF.  They were honestly so good, I'm seriously contemplating ordering them and possibly having them shipped to me in So Cali.  Their macaroon's are less almondy and softer in texture and oooh so delicious!
author: Angie K.

description: Gingerbread Cupcakes worth elbowing though the people glazed to the display cases. Don't bother getting them wrapped nicely in a little pink box ... they won't make it home!
author: Ashton E.

description:
I wanted something sweet after a long run on the waterfront. I rarely go browsing in the ferry building but I had some time to kill. I stopped at this cakery place and picked out the rasperry cream w/ chocolate cake and cinnamon gingerbread cupcake. I picked up 2 cause I thought my husband would like one!
Be warned, $3/cupcake and they take a minimum charge of $10 for debit/credit cards. Of course I dont carry cash with me when I run, but I did have my card. There was no sign stating mimimum purchase for credit card purchases. I told the lady who was helping me I only had my debit card, but I can get cash if she pointed me to one. Boy, for someone who works at the ferry building for who knows how long...she didn't know any atms around. But she was kind enough to make my $6 purchase an exception.
After I left there, just a a few yards away was a Bofa ATM!  okay I thought that was just dumb, on my part and hers!
author: Mauling W.

description: This place has such pretty things that I was compelled to try something.  So I went with a cupcake but unfortunately I didn't like it.  The frosting was not sweet, it tasted like whipped butter, I could feel my artery clogging right then and there.  Maybe I need to try something else because the other things look appealing and there has to be something good there.
author: La C.

description: The pistachio macaroon cookies are my favorite right up there with the gingerbread cupcake.  It could be the ingredients, or maybe the way they've displayed their decadent treats?  Whatever it is...I can't stop coming here.  On a beautiful day in the city nothing beats strolling into the ferry building and walking out with the little white and pink bag filled with their goodies!
author: D C.

description: Great cookies and they can turn the ordinary into something extraordinary. For example, try their graham crackers which are made with organic wheat flour and brown sugar. Cupcakes are so-so, but cakes and cookies are to die for.  Any bakery baking organically and that tastes this good is 5 stars. Expensive but worth it.
author: Yaz J.

description:
5 well deserved stars even though I havent actually been here...my roommates just bring home their incredible macaroons in the pretty pink miette packages tied with ribbons, and I love them for it.  

You must try the lavender, rose and hazelnut!
author: Shilpa G.

description: The lady who helped me is very friendly.  I bought a chocolate cake and a banana cream tart.  The chocolate cake is just average but the banana cream tart is awesome.  I also like their cute, pink package.  Very nice.... :)
author: Mei M.

description:
Writing a review about the terrible sugarcupcake joint in Beverly Hills reminded me of Miette. Here's my story:

I wanted to show my appreciation to my wonderful boyfriend who paid my rent for a while. (yes, with a cupcake.)

So I walked over to Miette and bought the MOST BEAUTIFUL chocolate cupcake with white frosting and a red candy thing on top, straight out of a Japanese cute and cuddly anime of sorts with rainbows, butterflies and neon purple unicorns flying around me as I walked back to his studio. I swear I heard music too.

That terrible sugarcupcake place in Beverly Hills has a survey of where their next shop should open. SF is one of the candidates. I voted for New York as many times as I could. SF has Miette.
author: Tell Y.

description: Yum, yum, yum!!!  Their little graham crackers are wonderful with a tall glass of milk as is one of their delicious little cupcakes, the gingerbread one is quite lovely.  I ordered one of their cakes for a friend's birthday which was amazing too!  The cake was so beautiful that it almost didn't look real.  This is a wonderful little bakery right in one of my favorite places, the ferry building.  A perfect treat for someone you care about or just for yourself!
author: Steven K.

description: The help behind the counter act as if they were performing acts of charity selling you a flippin' cupcake, but damn those parisian macaroons. i think they are laced with crack...
author: Joe C.

description: The cupcakes are the cutest cupcakes that I've ever seen.  Unfortunately, they're also awful.  The cake is dry and flavorless, the frosting tastes fake and too sweet, ugh, they're just horrible.  It's a waste of a good cupcake, and a waste of the $3+ that they cost.  They get two stars from me, though, because the mini scones are very tasty, and the macarons are good, but the cupcakes look so seductive and are just not worth it.
author: Jasmine G.

description: Bought 3 cakes for a Bridal Shower-Coconut Cake, The BumbleBee and the Tomboy.  All 3 cakes were soooo cute & pretty but the Coconut Cake was by far the hit of the shower.  It was so amazingly good-it was funny there were people @ the shower that were like "I don't like coconut" but tried a bite of someone else's cake and then wanted a piece of their own.  The BumbleBee and Tomboy were good but the Coconut Cake was friggin' amazing.  Yummmmm!
author: Francis M.

description: A bit expensive, but I simply can't resist the parisian macaroons. The pistachio, rose, and vanilla are my favorites. They also have seasonal flavors like apricot and raspberry. Had a cupcake once, which was delicious too!
author: Carolyn C.

description: I'm giving this place 4.5 stars. We got a lemon tartlette, the choco truffle one and the naner cream pie. Also i bought two bags of cookies to take to work tomorrow. we shall see how those are. But the lemon tart was perfectly sour! My only complaint was that the naner cream pie didn't have enough naners in them! and a bit too much whipped cream. oh and i didn't try a macaron cuz they were a bit more pricey.
author: Yummy P.

description:
The few times I have been to SF in the last year this is one place I HAVE to go! They have one of the best macarons besides Laduree in Paris. I also like their chocolate shortbread cookies. Best of all, their staff are awesome. 
I just ordered some cupcakes via phone for a birthday and the people their were so patient and kind. They even called me back several times to confirm the order and delivery. 
Their cupcakes are very pretty and also very delicious! If you go to the Ferry building, I definitely recommend visiting here!!
author: Benny S.

description:
The only things I've had here are the macarons.

I don't love the chocolate and chocolate-variations (I'm not the least bit anti-chocolate, there's just something about the texture that seems off), but all the others make my knees weak. Rose Geranium is probably my favorite, but the Pistachio's great, and I was very pleasantly surprised by the Strawberry (the only strawberry-flavored things I like are, well, strawberries).

It's hard for me to walk past without buying one of each.

I'd love to try one of their cakes someday, but I content myself with just admiring them from a distance.
author: Nicole A.

description: The ginger cupcakes are to die for. Mind blowing, expensive but worth every bite.
author: Nancy H.

description: Undoubtedly one of the most visually pleasing nooks at the Ferry Building. Their cakes are so darling and everything in there is super cute! However.... I don't find their cakes worth the calories. Noe Vally bakery has this place licked. The cakes are dense and fudgy - yet somehow dry. I was disappointed. I have heard though that the French macaroons are fantastic - I have yet to try. I'll give it 3 stars because it so cute though!
author: All About Town ..

description: If you're a total slut for all things flaky, buttery or covered in frosting, then Miette is your corner.  Please note that these pastries are not for the Oh-Let's-Just-Grab-A-Cake-From-The-Supermarket types.  Serious fans of carefully made and beautifully presented tarts, cakes and shortbread cookies will be overwhelmed by the quality and selection of items available.  Treasures to be shared with only your best of mates.
author: Christina T.

description: So many choices, what to choose what to choose - well I choose alot and everything was ok, but nothing knocked my socks off. I was especially looking forward to my old-fashioned cupcake (devils food with meringue frosting and candy coated peanut to top it all off) - I must say I was dissapointed to see my cupcake crumble in my hand, I would much rather have just eaten the meringue frosting (delish). Although the setup and overall look of the place is adorable, I am a fan of the classic milk glass cake plates, I still left a bit dissapointed :(
author: Jessica K.

description: I work near the Ferry building and have been to Miette many times.  I mainly go there for their pistachio macarons (excellent!) and will at times get a cupcake.  I've also had some of their cakes at the occasional office party.  Their cakes always seem to be a little dry.  I'm not sure if the cakes are consistently baked daily or day old cakes as they seem to be in the same glass case day after day.
author: lucy ..

description:
Had a Bumblebee cake for my directors bday.  it was ok.  the cake was moist but not as fluffy as I'd expected.  overall the cake was really sweet, a little too sweet for me.  

I'll need to edit this review when I try the macarons.
author: Chris F.

description: I have to give it a 5-stars.  They have the best cupcakes ever.  The cake part is very moist, not dried up like other places.  I didn't know they closed early at 6PM.  After dinner I came back to purchase another cupcake, but they were closed.  Next time when I visit SF again.
author: Mike C.

description:
I love everything about this place:  the color scheme; the packaging; the tasty butter cookies; and the consistently wonderful customer service from Devon and the other new hires.  

This place is a real gem!
author: Marianne L.

description: I Looooooove chocolate..and this place makes one of my favorite chocolate cakes...the Scharffen Berger.  Their moist chocolate cake is covered with rich bittersweet truffle ganache...mmmmmm just the right dose of yummy sweetness.
author: Sunday R.

description: the macaroons are the bomb.  crispy but chewy, light but dense, flavorful but not overpowering.  the hazlenut one is the best.  is it the best macaroon in the city?  i dont know.  but its certainly a delightful treat.
author: Junglist S.

description: how could anyone resist stopping and looking around when walking by miettes? first off, this place is adorable with light pastel colors and a feeling of being in a storybook kitchen. the things here are pricey but well worth it. i've only tried the french macarons and specialty chocolate bars, so ill focus on the macarons for now and update as i venture out [i usually plan on being adventurous, but the macarons are just so freaking good]. they're more chewy and less flakey than what most macarons typically are, but they're still absolutely heavenly. i love the coffee, rose, and chocolate flavors the most. there's just the right ratio of cookie to cream, and every bite is just oozing with flavor and a lovely fragrance. if you're not going to eat all of them at once [props to you for your self control], just throw them in the refrigerator when you get home and take them out to soften a bit before eating. they hold their texture and flavor well even after being stored for a day or two.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Gingerbread cupcake was really tasty and moist. The frosty was really good, not too sweet. Was really cute, too
author: lynn s.

description:
to me, miette's is a steal ... for $2/cupcake, you can't make me any more happier ... 

for the longest time i've only ventured out to kara's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/karas-cupcakes-san-francisco#hrid:fTBzW8yc4Kun6ofUwf7ACA) since it's literally a few steps from where i live, but today, i decided to go for a walk on the embarcadero, and made a quick stop to the ferry building and couldn't resist ... come on. for $2? and to cure a sweet fix? 

sry kara, miette rules!

i'm happy.
author: Jennifer S.

description: good icing, dry cake. love the packaging, dry cake. very nice people. but still dry cake. add some oil to that mix for God's sake.
author: rachel p.

description: Cute little store front inside the Ferry Building. I LOVE their macaroons. I know macaroons are all the craze these days, but I haven't had ones better than here. Well, with the exception of Boule in LA, but I think they closed. Pricey but totally worth it.
author: Nancy W.

description: i love frosting, ok? if i could just get the frosting and no cake. i'd be SET. i was drooling big time when i saw the miette cupcake with a generous white puff on top. ok. two words: boiled frosting. i guess i met a frosting i didn't like. all egged out. BLEAUGGH now i know... all is not what it appears in the frosty world. just gimme the sugar and the butter and i'll go back to my corner
author: a w.

description: i tried both the banana creme and the scharffen berger chocolate truffle tartlettes.. they were both good but i think i need to try more things like the cupcakes and the macaroons to make a better decision.
author: Nancy L.

description: Now, I don't know anyone with as an uncontrollable sweet tooth as I --- I can put them down like a food whore at a pie eating contest.  Miette is a good place to go for some satisfaction. And I use the word "some" purposefully here. The macaroons are way better than a macaroon is thought to be capable of being, the chocolate cake with ganache frosting is delicious --- to look at and consume. The cupcakes and the poundcakes are surprisingly terrible! Both dense and tasteless. I tried to rescue the lemon pound cake by letting it soak in some lemon cello when I got home, but alas, even this could not save it. The frosting on the cupcake was about as tasteful as Crisco. I was seriously dumbfounded that they could get pretty much every other dessert so right --- and do these simple steadfast treats so wrong. I am quite a fan though, as the macaroons alone are enough to get me to frequent this adorable storefront.
author: Katie W.

description: i dream about their macarons!!!  light and chewy with just the right amount of sweet.  strawberry, vanilla and/or hazelnut..i don't give an F, i'll take whatever i can get.  [everything else looks lovely as well...but for now i can only review the macarons.]
author: Niki M.

description: This place looks exactly like the cute patisseries I would encounter in France on (what seemed like) every street.  BUY THEIR MACAROONS!  Where else can you get DELICIOUS authentic French macaroons other than France?  Here!  Marie Antoinette cookies at their finest =)
author: Blushed M.

description: wow. so good. we had an office b-day party recently and the people who bought the cakes were raving about how amazing this place was. right, i thought. well, they are. the ginger cake with cream cheese frosting was by far everyone's favorite. the chocolate tomgirl cake (that's what it's called, apparently) had amazingly rich (if a bit dry) chocolate cake sandwiched between layers of buttercream with the texture of butter. superb.
author: Kiki B.

description: How do you get half stars?  I really wanted to put 2 1/2 stars.  But I'll grudgingly spot them 3 stars for the organic approach.  Anyhoo, I guess I'm going to end up being one of the few voices of dissent when it comes to Miette.  No biggie, certainly isn't the first time.  I have been disappointed with everything I have ever purchased here.  I dig the organic bakery aspect and the woman who helped me today was very nice and personable.  I love to bake and I have always walked away from here thinking that I could recreate what I just bought just as well and it would taste better.  This picnicker cake I bought is DRY!!!  I've anted up the money for their cupcakes and the macaroons (which btw is misspelled on the sign in the jar).  Plus I have issues with the cost.  I work right by here and I really have to want it for me to hand over my hard earned cash (hello PMS!).  Maybe that's what my next career move should be, to ditch the corporate world and start making and selling my own creations (organically of course) and give Mi-icke a run for their money.  Perhaps I'm going on off days but I have yet to see what all the hoo-ha is about.  I don't get it.   If someone can convince me otherwise, I'll pay for their overpriced treat.
author: Nicole B.

description: Finally a place that has decent macarons! I tried the chocolate and strawberry one, although small- both had the chewy interior and crispy crust.
author: Retired B.

description: why would anyone pay 1.50 for a macaroon the size of an oreo?  how about 3 bucks for a cupcake half the size of a normal cupckae?  because they're DELICIOUS!!!!!  organic whatever blah blah blah.  all i know is that everything i've gotten at this place has been awesome.  i love the chocolate cupcakes with coffee frosting and the pistachio macaroons.  buy more than one because i promise you, you'll shed a tear when you realize that your treat is all gone.
author: Thom Y.

description: mmmmm....cupcakes. nice cute little place to pick up sweets. you gotta try their lemon caramels! they sound kinda weird, but they're gooood!
author: Pippi L.

description: why is this place soooooooooooo cute???  i make up special occasions just so i can buy their gorgeous cakes. oh, it's monday, let's celebrate with a cake from la miette.  i cannot cannot go to the ferry building or even in the vicinity of the ferry building without purchasing at least 3 of their french macaroons.  i cut down from buying all the flavors.  not to be missed.
author: Angela N.

description: it's just so cutesy here that how can you not love it. after eating oysters at hog island, I was craving a yummy cupcake. their displays are beautifully arranged and everything is just so cutesy! i ordered a $3 ginger cupcake and my friend got a vanilla with buttercreme. they come to-go in a nice little take-out box with handle. too bad they don't have their cutesy pink shopping bags anymore (they are just plain white now). the gingercupcake was very much a gingerbread flavor. the icing was cream cheese creamy. yum!! fyi they only take credit cards with a $10 purchase. eat up!
author: Natalie S.

description:
it's expensive. their stuff tastes ok. definitely not terrible. visually whimsy and pretty. sometimes you eat with your eyes. 

my favourite is their walnut sable. it's perfect. i'll pass the cupcakes etc and go straight for the crispier munchies. 

do note that they are situated at the ferry market plaza building. do not even think about going there on saturday. it's touristy hell.
author: lalitha v.

description:
3 words.....old fashioned chocolate cupcakes. oh wait that would be 4 words?  but still, holy friggin' molely!
rich moist chocolate cake, marshmallow whipped cream frosting & a red hot. The only way to a womans heart, or at least one way.
author: t f.

description: Miette has turned out to be the best bakery for a cake-jones thus far. I've been on the hunt, and frankly, nothing has satisfied my sweet tooth in this department since I've been roaming around San Francisco, and the bay. Their yellow cake (in the form of cup) was moist, mildly sweet, a touch crumbly, and quite satisfying. Their decadent slice of chocolate cake had layers upon layers of fluffy whipped cream (Straus), dense melty fudgyingess, and spongey moist cake, speckled with nibs of Scharffenberger cocoa (which I could have done without, but wasn't a deal breaker). I know, you're asking, "but Shannon, then, why the four stars," and I would tell you, kind inquisitor, that while their cake was outrageous, their buttercream frosting was of the dense BUTTER and less cream variety. For me, if I can't lick it it ain't frosting. Regardless, if you can get into the Ferry building and to the front of their often crowded line, it's worth it.
author: Shannon F.

description: FRENCH MACAROONS!!!!!! One bite of the pistachio macaroon and I can die happy.
author: Fresca T.

description: Miette is one of the places I MUST visit when I'm in SF. Maybe I have an emotional attachment to it since it was the first place I ever tried macarons, but their macarons really are wonderful! I've gone hunting for macaron around LA, OC, and NY and I still think Miette is one of the best. My favorite is the hazelnut macaron, followed closely by the rose. My friend also ordered their banana cream pie and it was delicious!
author: Suzane L.

description: As a self-proclaimed sweets expert - I love this place.  I will even drive *way* out of my way for birthdays to go and pick up one of their perfect (~6") cakes.  The cupcakes, the macroons, the ginger cookies, chocolate tarts ... all delicious.
author: Julie D.

description: I am addicted to their vanilla macarons.  Minus 1/2 star for giving me a chocolate-orange (YUCK) instead of a chocolate and minus 1/2 star because they didn't separate the one pistachio from the eight vanillas.  They all looked the same.
author: Melissa H.

description: To start, the rose geranium macaroon is my FAVORITE cookie in the whole wide world. I have never had such a good cookie in my life, and my mom is a pastry chef and is amazing at cookies... so that's saying a lot. When ever i go to Miette's I always get a dozen rose geranium, and a dozen assorted. I also love the Scharffen Berger cake, it was amazing!!! I really like the taffy in the assorted flavors too. I have always wanted a Miette birthday party, with the adorable candles, a princess cake, and of course the macaroons!
author: Meghan M.

description: 5 stars based simply on the yumminess of the Chocolate Parisian Macaroon.  I can't wait to have another.
author: Ashley Q.

description: I love everything in this store! The pistachio macaron is a must try, bit expensive $1.50 each but you will not be dissapointed. The people that works in this store are super friendly. I'm sure to be back again.
author: P S.

description: i have never been a big fan of shortbread cookies, but miette has converted me. each and every bite is a little miette of heaven. i'll have to diet for a week and go try the cupcakes now. i don't think i've tried anything here that wasn't absolutely sinful and delicious!!
author: joyce l.

description: cupcakes are where it's at! this place has 'em, and they're tres delicious. in fact, they're so good, i have often taken time out of my day to reflect on them...kind of  like what i'm doing now..
author: eve l.

description: the cakes and yummy treats here are delicious!  i bought several individual cakes for a birthday and it was absolutely divine.  fresh and moist lots of flavor!
author: Jaclyn L.

description: really yummy parisan macaroons.  i've had the chocolate, hazelnut, chocolate with lavendar, and rasberry.  all very yummy!  $1.50 each!  yes, i know it's crazy, but they're so good!  very cute store, with cupcakes, cakes, and cookies.  very cute and pretty things here...
author: D W.

description: Their hazelnut macaroons are to die for!  I still remember the first time I took a bit into one of those morsels of happiness!
author: Chris M.

description: I didn't try the macaroons here although, I wish I did. When I was there I didn't know that's what they were known for. I just fell in love with the decore and all of their lovely pastries. I ended up leaving with two cute little bags of cookies, choc chip and lemon shortbread. Both were sooo good! My husband and I loved them.  I will definitely be back to try some macaroons and I'm curious to try their cupcakes.
author: RoxyGirl T.

description: pricey but oh the satisfaction! culinary orgasm at its finest.
author: l v.

description: I give them credit for being an organic bakery.  But their pastries are comparable to say the Bay Boulangerie chain (which is cheaper).  They both have the same style of macaroon (Bay has more choices even).  I do like their tom boy cupcakes when I can find them (yellow cake w/choc buttercream) though.  Some of their pastries can be dry.
author: danielle b.

description: the chocolate/marshmallow cupcakes are to die for, and they have great pastries all around.  the price tag is worth it.
author: marie m.

description: In terms of presentation Miette is flawless.  Their cakes and pastries are beautiful unfortunately the flavor and texture fall flat.  I find this extremely disappointing because I know they have a commitment to using organic and high quality ingredients.  My first time at Miette I had one of the adorable cupcakes.  When it was dry and flavorless I assumed it must be a fluke.  Months later I shared a few of their Madelines with a friend and was similarly disappointed. Recently I needed to order cakes for an office party, and since Miette is nearby and I was using the company card I thought I'd give them one last chance to redeem themselves.  I ordered four cakes:  Gingerbread, a Lemon Debutante, a Bumblebee, and a Tomboy cake with seasonal strawberry buttercream.  Although every person who walked into the room immediately commented on how beautiful the cakes were, I have to say only the Gingerbread, which is, according to the menu, their "all-time best selling cake" would be worth returning to.  The other cakes were dense and dry and completely unremarkable.  I find it extremely disappointing that a business with such a beautiful aesthetic and great philosophy would not go all the way and actually create an awesome product.
author: Leti R.

description: organic pastries.  overpriced but so worth it.  their french macaroons are sooooo good especially the pistachio ones.
author: kulas a.

description: If you need exceptionally decadent cupcakes or cakes, this is hands down the place to go.
author: Amanda H.

description: I should first say that am generally pretty resentful of $3 cupcakes.  Most of the time, they just can't live up to the hype.  The gingerbread cupcake that I had after lunch at the Ferry Building was pretty frickin' good though.  Very tasty and super moist.  The cream cheese frosting was not the usual super sweet kind either.  Mmmmm delicious!
author: Michelle Y.

description: OMG... quite possibly the best macaroons I've ever had!  So moist and decadent.... and probably very sinful.  Can't wait to go back for some more!!!
author: Mochi L.

description: i'm a sucker for $3 cupcakes. just can't resist them. miette's are very tasty, and their packaging is so cute! my favorite is the ginger cupcake with cream frosting, even if the frosting gets stuck on the roof of my mouth. the little french macaroons are good too! from the outside, they look like crispy wafers, but they're actually soft as pillows with a creamy filling.
author: Patricia S.

description: apricot yellow cupcake. so moist, so yummy, so light and airy. the chocolate cupcakes were a bit rich for me but whenever I get the yellow cupcakes i end up eating three of six.
author: Diane M.

description: I had a pistachio macaron and was thinking about it for weeks.  Then I tried a raspberry macaron and it was equally delicious.  Great place for dessert on the go.
author: Onki K.

description: Great chocolate sable cookies and chocolate cupcakes. I love this little place. It's cute and even kind of French if you squint.
author: Lane B.

description: it was an important event..... THE EVENT of the century. the pressure was on. last week my girlfriend melissa and i celebrated our birthdays together by throwing a huge joint birthday bash. we invited all of our favorite friends so we wanted things to go well.... in the planning stages we both agreed on our (2) top priorities. we wanted the perfect venue-- and a truly decadent cake to serve our friends. well, we found the venue immediately..... but only after some extensive research did we finally find Miette Cakes.(thanks to Yelp)  we poured over the pictures on the website trying to find the best one.... too many choices, we got nervous. we started to sweat. the room got dizzy..... we finally chose the 3 layer cake with vanilla buttercream frosting. unfortunately (or fortunately!) we had so many of our friends show up we didn't have enough cake for everyone. the good news is, after a few drinks most people forgot about the cake...... we were really worried there would be a bar riot or food fight or something over it. i mean, you never know..... anyway, all turned out great. michelle and melissa were satisfied, the birds started singing, rainbows appeared and they had an awesome birthday party....... all was good in the world that night. if you want an impressive cake to serve at your next special occasion, go straight to Miette and don't pass GO. once you get a taste you'll know what i mean. mmmm.
author: Michelle I.

description: More than once, I've found myself flying through the Ferry Building during busy weekend or holiday shopping only to suddenly brake, almost supernaturally. Waiiiiit, here's Miette. Adorned with confections, pastries, cakes, and other dulcet treats, her charms overpower and yes, you must stop. Waiting patiently while others seek staff recommendations and make their purchase, you think, "is it really a good idea to get both the plain AND walnut shortbreads. maybe i can give this to so-and-so as a stocking stuffer (knowing full well it may not last until the next night)." When the interminable minute of waiting finally ends, you find yourself hypnotically asking about one of the glorious cakes in the glass case in front of you, which moments ago you thought were way out of the realm of possible purchases. As you carry away your new bag, the clamor and rush of shoppers around you seem to drift away with the promise of a confectionary affair to remember.
author: Geo G.

description: not the same as magnolia or buttercup in NYC, but pretty damn good.  i feel like their cupcakes have shrunk since over time though!  the gingerbread cupcake with cream cheese frosting is delish!
author: noone n.
